1.content:
King Emeril has summoned some of the kingdom's greatest heroes to combat the dark forces that infest the land. He offers the reward of money and perhaps the hand in marriage of one of his children to anyone who proves worthy. King Emeril's rule has been long, prosperous and just, but his enemies are many.

The North holds the fearsome barbarian hordes who are being gathered by some unseen force. To the east lie the dread swamps where rumors of dark rituals and great evils being preformed have reached the ears of the King. Far to the west resides the wizard Dreze who has grown land hungry and even now his forces are heading towards the Kingdom of Dar. While in the south unspeakable abominations have been spotted by those few who have escaped them. Many dangers will cross your path to fight these and other evils but will you come away from unscathed? Assuming of course you come back at all. I wish you good luck and fortune on your journey.

Who are you to risk all hero?
1.title: Heroes Needed

11.content:
Many who saw Sir Garrett would think he had always been the rich and powerful noble that presented itself in the gleaming silver armor, but he had known much hardship as a child orphaned by fearsome monsters killing all his relatives who had been over to celebrate a wedding. He had managed to escape but the scenes still filled him with a rage that he only controlled with the discipline he received by the knighthood. The Order of the Silver Griffin had taken the orphaned Garrett into their care and trained him and he had repaid them by slaying so much evil the King granted him a noble title and full knighthood.

Money meant very little to the newly minted Sir Garrett but that changed when he met the Princess Fina who was the daughter of King Emeril. A penniless noble might have been fine if he came from a long noble line but he was a former peasant and the King made it clear he wasn't good enough for his daughter, so Sir Garrett dedicated himself to gaining the money and prestige to be able to marry him. The only thing that preserved his quest was the fact Princess Fina loved him. She frequently talked of eloping with him and if it wasn't for the vows to his order Sir Garrett would have taken her up on the offer but he couldn't betray the trust of the men and women who loved and raised him.

King Emeril had promised Sir Garrett the hand of Princess Fina if he eliminated the threat in the dread swamp and Sir Garrett promised he would. Life had changed greatly since his childhood but living with someone he loved once again still sounded wonderful.
11.title: Sir Garrett Noble Paladin of the Order of Silve...

111.content:
Princess Fina had accepted Sir Garrett’s request to see her before he left on the quest. A knock on the door produced a quick response to enter the room, and the sight he saw shocked him. Before him stood the beautiful blonde princess with her hair tied behind her head wearing a light suit of elven chainmail preparing to go out to do battle.

“What are you doing!?!” Sir Garrett sputtered.

Princess Fina smiled at his shock, “I am getting ready to head out with you. Father has been sending you on suicidal missions with no assistance, and I am not about to lose my fiancée when we are, so close to getting married because I was too afraid to help him with his troubles.”

“I have the training to handle the risks you don’t!” Sir Garrett explained.

“I have been training with the captain of the guard and with Arimas I have been learning the magical arts. I know I am not as good as you yet but I can be of great help to you. You can’t tell me an extra pair of eyes wouldn’t help you.”

“I was thinking of taking along my squire as back up.”

“Wonderful, I’ve always enjoyed his company and the extra hand will make lighter work for the two of us.”

“My choices are to make my squire unhappy, you unhappy or both. I guess I have no options other than taking the both of you with me. So, how shall we precede, my lovely lady?” Sir Garrett smiled weakly.

Princess Fina gave Sir Garrett a light kiss which caused him to blush, “That is why I love you, because you know how to treat a lady. I think we should . . .”
111.title: Visit Princess Fina before leaving

1111.content:
“A boat trip sounds splendid,” Sir Garrett responded. “Hide your insignias of your royal lineage because we will have enough trouble without dealing with any potential assassin or kidnappers. I will collect my squire and you can make the boat arrangements.”

Sir Garrett didn’t take long to collect his squire who was thrilled to be invited on the quest. The Princess bought passage aboard a public transport because it would help provide anonymity she said but Sir Garrett suspected she wanted to live among some of the commoners who she never had contact with. Albert, Sir Garrett’s squire, had discovered the life of a sailor was not for him as he spent most of the voyage at the edge of the boat in various stages of illness.

The paladin was disappointed he wasn’t able to have much alone time with Fina but the happiness he saw on her face as she talked as a normal person instead of having to put on the airs of nobility made him smile. Sir Garrett kept busy by checking their gears to make sure it was all there and properly stored for the journey, so they wouldn’t have to make any more stops then necessary. The rocking of the boat had little effect on the veteran traveler and he moved swiftly about his work.

It took longer by boat to arrive at the swamp then it would have by land but the travel would be easier and safer for the less experienced travelers like the Princess and his squire, but the time passed swiftly and it wasn’t long before they arrived in Port Crane. Port Crane was a small trade village that dealt mostly in manufactured goods with the lizard men. It would be the last civilization before the dangers of the swamps.

“We have been invited to stay at the Nelson’s farm before we head into the swamp,” Fina smiled. “Where do you think we should stay?”
1111.title: let's take a boat.

11111.content:
The Nelson farm stood at the edge of the swamp with sprawling emerald green pastures with animals meandering through the grass. Several large well kept barns circled a farmhouse painted a bright red. It looked inviting to the companions and they were glad they had chosen to stay here.

“Welcome to our home and enjoy the bounty of our home,” Mr. Nelson escorted them to beautiful layout of meats and cheeses on the back porch.

The meats and cheeses were a welcome change from the normal travel fare of dehydrated meats and tough bread. They even had wonderfully creamy glasses of milk to wash down the food. It didn’t take long for them to fill up on the tasty snack food.

“We are so glad you could come here,” Mrs. Nelson smiled. “We have been looking for some new animals for our farm. I am afraid the young man here will have to give up his manhood as well. You don’t need many male animals on the farm.”

“What are you talking about?” Sir Garrett started to reach for his sword but pain dropped him to his knees.

The three companions felt an unbearable heat and began to strip themselves naked no longer caring who saw their nude bodies. They we beginning to transform.

A loud snort drew the attention the cows from their chewing and they saw a large bull moving towards them with amorous attentions. Garrett could tell the other animal was larger but he was determined to not lose his mates. Even as an animal he felt an attachment to the females that went beyond the instincts of an animal.

He felt a flash of a human life calling to him as he locked horns with his rival. It was a distraction to the combat but it fought to be heard, there was something he was forgetting. Garrett had been a champion of the divine and his services were still needed. A powerful head butt from the other bull sent him to the ground. 1111111.title: A Contender Approaches the Ladies

11111111.content:
He needed to give up the field of battle to the animal because the bull was an animal and he was a human being. Sir Garrett backed away from the bull who snorted at him in victory but he ignored it as he fought the urge to continue the combat. He watched in anger and frustration as the large bull started to move towards the cows to claim his prize. Both the animal and human inside of him were angered by the sight his companions being mounted but the celestial voice told him to stay where he was. Cries of mating reached his ears as the others were mated but he didn’t move to stop it.

Sir Garrett cried to the heavens his anger and frustration and something above heard him as a pillar of light enveloped him. As the light faded from the sky he stood on his two feet once more, a man. A man with very real anger that even naked he raced to the people who had transformed them. A farm spotted him and held up a pitchfork to stop him but the man didn’t have the training he did. He slapped aside the farm implement and slammed his fist into the throat of the man crushing the passageway for oxygen. The paladin grabbed the pitchfork and entered the house leaving the man trying to grasp for breath that would never come.

Mrs. Nelson screamed in terror as she saw furious warrior enter her home armed and looking than a little ready to inflict serious harm. Mr. Nelson entered and was surprised to see Sir Garrett but he responded quickly as a spell started to form on his lips. The spell died on his lip as soon as it started as he spat out blood, it was very distracting for spell casting to have a pitchfork jammed into his chest. Sir. Garrett grabbed a butcher knife and shoved Mrs. Nelson to the wall and leaned in close to emphasize how much larger and more powerful he was than her. The fear of the death was clear in her eyes and he was glad his threat had been made clear to her.

“I need you to change my companions back into humans,” Sir Garrett growled.

“I don’t know how,” Mrs. Nelson whispered, afraid to be telling the paladin what he didn’t want to hear. “I only mix potions to transform people into animals, we have never tried to change anyone back.”

“Do you even think about the lives you take and ruin? For what? A slight increase in profit you rob people of their entire future. I have spent most of my life fighting the monsters that prey on humans and to find my future nearly destroyed by one of the people I am trying to protect.”

“I’m sorry,” Mrs. Nelson tearfully pleaded.

“I usually slay the creatures that kill humans so what should I do with you? Perhaps I should give you some of your own product so you can see if you like being animal or I could kill you right here and now and end any future lives you might ruin. If I let you go what guarantee do I have that you won’t start this up somewhere else.”

She was scared of what her fate might be and didn’t know how or if she could alter things in her favor. Mrs. Nelson didn’t have any weapons and no magic that she could use to defend herself against the paladin. There was no chance that he would be willing to take something from her after what she and her husband had done to him so she had little chance of slipping him more potion. She had tried crying but he seemed very unmoved by her tears so the only real hope is that more of the workers would arrive and be able to overpower him. She would have to try and delay for more time if she could.

“My husband forced me to do it,” she begged for mercy. “He was a sick man who took a perverse pleasure in the transformation of others. I couldn’t get away from him, he threatened to do the same to me.”
11111111.title: Back away from the fight

111111111.content:
Sir Garrett grabbed a potion from the cupboard as he held the woman tightly. Fear filled the woman’s eyes as the lip was flipped off the top of the potion and approached her lips. She struggled against his powerful grip but his grip tightened on her throat forcing her mouth open as she gasped for air. The sweet liquid poured down Mrs. Nelson’s throat when the bottle was pressed past her lips.

“Now we will see if you really don’t have the cure,” Sir Garrett released his grip.

The woman tried to cough up the potion but she didn’t have any success. She felt the heat of the transformation calling for her to remove her clothing. Her feet carried her up the stairs to her bedroom, shedding clothing as she ran leaving a trail for the paladin to follow.

She had been certain that the paladin wouldn’t kill her as long as she didn’t attack him but she had never suspected he would force her to take some of her own medicine. The alchemist had been hoping to get the upper hand on the warrior of the forces of good but she was being forced to take the expensive antidote to the transformation. Relief filled her face as she managed to open the safe and saw several jars of the antidote waiting for her inside.

Her hopes to stop the transformation were dashed as she was tossed across the room. Sir Garrett took all of the vials of the antidote and started walking from the room leaving to the alchemist to her fate. Mrs. Nelson grabbed at him but he just ignored her as the transformation started to take full effect.

“Please,” she begged as her body started to swell. “Give me one of them at least, squeal!”

The animal noise had come unbidden from her lips as her nose swelled out into a proper snout. Her hands lost feeling as they became hooves and bristly hair started to sprout from her body. She tried to scamper after her only hope to escape a lifetime as a pig and ended tumbling her naked body down the stairs. Locks of her beautiful hair lay all around her swelling body as her becoming a pig drew to a close.

Urges to chase after the human faded as the mind of a sow took control over the body and called her to the nearby pig pens. She made her way inside with a large boar with the last of her human intelligence. The boar eagerly mounted the more than the willing sow who took the seed looking forward to the piglets it could create. She collapsed into bliss as the half hour orgasm told hold of her body and mind.

Sir Garrett walked out to his companions with some blankets and more importantly the antidote. He poured down the liquid down their throats and made sure they swallowed before taking a step back from the docile beasts. He prayed that this would work.
111111111.title: Transform her

1111111111.content:
Sir Garrett was frustrated waiting for something to happen but he didn’t want to leave them alone while any change was occurring. He watched for any hints of transformation in them and to his relief, he saw that they were starting to shrink in size. The paladin threw a blanket over each of them to provide them some privacy. Hooves started to split and form human hands as they started the transition away from animals.

Princess Fina started to grow back her long blond hair and to his surprise, his squire grew out long red hair. The pair had become human after a couple minutes but they were not the same humans they had before. Wrapping the blanket around herself did nothing to hide the giant new size of her chest and Albert was busy examining his still very female form with caressing hands to the point that the paladin had to turn away.

“We may be able to find some clothing to fit you inside,” Sir Garrett offered to the pair.

“I doubt it,” Fina said adjusting her house as she talked awkwardly with the return of human speech feeling strange. “I need something that will help me stay upright.”

“Do these things ever stop shaking?” Albert asked as her arms tightly against her chest causing her already impressive cleavage to grow.

“When they are that size, no, and when they are this size, I am lucky to even be remaining upright,” the Princess responded.

It was hard to resist the urge to stare at the naked forms of the gorgeous women but Garrett managed to not follow them inside. His mind searched for what to do next because it was obvious that his companions had not changed back fully and they would need to do something about that.
1111111111.title: Partial Success

111111112.content:
Sir Garrett eyed the woman and listened to her words but he felt little sympathy. If she was really a victim she could have dosed her husband at some point. She was as guilty as her husband for what was happening here and she should suffer the same fate she had chosen for others but he was a paladin who would allow her another chance.

“Where is the equipment that belonged to me and my companions?” Sir Garrett asked. “I hear your tale of sorrow and warn you that any further betrayal will result in bad things happening to you.”

Relief poured over her face, “This way to your stuff.”

Alma Nelson would have to be careful about choosing when to get away from the paladin but she suspected he would be distracted when he got his equipment which would give her the chance to gather the farm workers. They should be more than a match for one lone warrior. She debated if she should stick around for their victory because if something went wrong the paladin wouldn’t be merciful a second time.

Sir Garrett smiled when he saw his equipment piled in the corner but there was a little sorrow when he saw the equipment of Albert and Princess Fina who could no longer use their gear. Putting on his armor took time but he wanted to give her a chance to betray him so he pretended to be concentrating heavily on strapping himself in his armor that was a mindless task for him because he had done it thousands of times. She took the bait and raced away from him up the stairs. He made no effort to follow her as he finished putting his equipment on. The warrior pulled his long sword out and smacked it against his shield to announce he was coming and started up the stairs.
111111112.title: Hear her out

1111111123.content:
Oonair was the goddess of oaths, deals, and revenge that all knew but few would invoke because she was one of the most aware of the gods. If you didn’t keep a deal when using her name, she was known to inflict terrible retribution.More than one fool had found themselves used as brick and mortar in her walls for all eternity. Sir Garrett had used her name before to show his respect for her and his word and had always kept the deals and oaths he made but he was going to take out his biggest debt with her yet.

“Great goddess Oonair,” Sir Garrett prayed. “I pray to you to take a soul debt out to you. In return, I wish for Princess Fina and Albert to be restored to their human form. I shall perform any three tasks you ask of me to pay you back for this request. I shall slay and get revenge for the wrongs these people have done to me to honor your name. Honor the oath, honor the deal or may revenge be sought against me.”

The paladin felt the goddess agreed to his offer as bright white flames surrounded him and he could see the red outlines of ten people moving towards him. These were the people he must slay to fulfill the start of the contract. He moved with slow purpose towards them excited to fulfill his oath and show his worth so his friend, Albert and his love, Princess Fina would be saved from a lifetime as animals.

Two men leaped out behind him as he passed a doorway but they were like boys playing at war with no speed or skill for it. His blazing sword gutted both of them as he spun around barely slowing his pace towards his main target of Mrs. Nelson leaving the pair to try and stop themselves from spilling onto the floor as they died. Sir Garrett’s longsword found a home in the heart of a man hidden behind a door as he continued his journey.

The screams of pain and death of two more men reached the ears of Alma as she waited with the remaining people in the barn. She wished she had run but it was too late now. The others would kill whoever went for the horse first and she would rather gamble that five people could beat one then to gamble that she would be the last survivor in a fight for the horse.

“Oonair take you all!” Sir Garrett entered the barn with white flames spewing from his armor and body.

“We. .we can make a deal,” one of her men whimpered in fear.

“I have already made a deal,” came the response as the paladin charged forward slamming his shield against the man’s throat and left the man to choke to death as his blade severed the throat of another who was too slow with his guard.

Her remaining two men charged the paladin together but he was prepared for the attack. He blocked the one on the left with his shield as his blade knocked aside the attack from the right. Sir Garrett pressed forward with his shield knocking the man on the left to the ground and turned his full fury on the man to the right. An ill-fitting chain shirt and a dull blade does not a warrior make and it wasn’t long before the man on the right was bleeding to death on the ground from multiple wounds to exposed body parts.

Alma had been taking careful aim with her crossbow but the bolt bounced harmlessly off the armor of the paladin. She should have known a crossbow for hunting was not useful against an armored knight. Her final farm hand tried to run away as Sir Garrett was distracted but he simply turned and threw his sword with deadly accuracy through the back of the man’s neck. Alma ran for the horse but the holy warrior moved swiftly despite his heavy armor and caught her with ease.

“I would love to inflict the transformation on you but I have made a deal with a goddess,” his hands grew tighter until they cut off her breathing. “I am a man of my word.”
1111111123.title: Righteous Wrath

11111111231.content:
Oonair shocked the paladin by appearing in front of him. Sir Garrett might have thought she was human, a pretty young woman to be sure but not even making the top ten of loveliest women he had seen. She had long black braided into a single mass which she played with as she examined the warrior with bright green eyes. It was the power that filled the air that told him she was something other than human. He had felt something when facing down with the dragon Sigar though this was far beyond that. If he didn’t place some focus on staying upright he was certain he would drop to his knees and might even pass out.

“I never expected one of the shining knights of the Silver Griffin asks for my assistance,” She walked forward to him standing a comfortably close to him but he refused to turn his head from her. Garrett had never done a heavy study of the goddess before because he had never intended to call on her so he needed to learn all he could about her and observing someone was the best way to learn in a short period. “There is so much in you I like loyalty, honesty and even a desire for revenge, yes so much to like. I think that is why I shall make you my justiciar.”

“Is that one of your requests?” Sir Garrett knew that taking on the job would mean the realm of mortals would be lost to him as he did the eternal duties demanded of him by his goddess, it was not something that he wanted but he had given his word. The goddess leaned in even closer and he thought she was going to kiss him for a heartbeat before she stepped back and smiled.

“You would really do it wouldn’t you? Give up on your love for Princess Fina and your squire Albert to fulfill your word to me.”

“I wouldn’t be giving them up, I did this to save them and you have kept your word so it is only right I do the same. I will carry them with me in my heart always. I would like a chance to say goodbye to them before I take over service to you as justiciar.”

“You have misunderstood me but it is understandable. I won’t have you be my justiciar until you ask to take on the job of your own free will. This is a game for me mortal, I seek to win you to my service through the tasks I give to you and if I lose you go on with the rest of your life as you see fit. Your first task will start now.”

“May I at least say goodbye to the others?”

She shook her head, “No.”

Oonair waved her hand and the paladin was gone from the lands he had known all his life to a place farther than he had ever traveled before. The goddess smiled and wondered if the man would be up to the challenge she had set before him. She hoped he would succeed and come to work for her because the heavens could be such a lonely place. Sir Garrett had been watched by her for a long time but she didn’t want to give him an inflated sense of self. Humans so rarely kept their word, he was one of the exceptions and she was glad to have been told of him. Whatever happened it was certain to be interesting to her.
11111111231.title: The Goddess speaks

111111112312.content:
Sir Garrett was surprised that he wasn’t afraid of being in the home of the goddess Oonair. Elaborate graves filled the cemetery they walked through, he wondered if they past champions of the goddess or monuments to her victories in quests for revenge. She was giving him no time to check things out as she quickly strode towards an alabaster colored palace with ornate scenes carved into the stone. It would take a lifetime to learn what all of these stories were and he strongly suspected the goddess had taken part in all of them.

“Most don’t want to talk to me during life but as you can see many come after death seeking my favor,” her slender hand directed his gaze to the long line of spirits waiting outside of the gates. “You will pick your first quest from these people.”

“Wait, me!?!” Sir Garrett grabbed Oonair’s shoulder and spun her around which brought a curve up to her lips and he suddenly realized what he was doing to a goddess. “I apologize, I was just surprised you would let me choose the quest.”

“Worry not about that, it was not unpleasant, I am not glass that will shatter,” Oonair spun around in a twirl. “You are most interesting, no mortal has touched me in a century and the last touch was an attempt to strangle me. Now, we have work to do, You will be given three cases and you must decide which one deserves justice and help me to supply it.”

A throne sat several steps up from the floor, large red cushions and pillows covered the white stone chair, She hoped into pillows and waved Sir Garrett to her side. Angels in heavy plate armor with glowing eyes went into instant motion to allow in three of the spirits from outside. As they entered the home of the goddess they went from being translucent to a solid form resembling life.

“You have come seeking revenge,” the goddess’s voice shook the room with her power causing Sir Garrett to jerk his head towards the goddess whose voice had been so soft and gentle just a moment before. A green fire burned in her eyes as she looked at each of the spirits of the dead seeing inside of them probing them. “Step forward minotaur and tell this paladin your tale.”

“I was betrayed, my city is in danger because of Krous, my brother,” the warrior stepped forward but it was apparently too close as there was a crackle of power warning he had made a mistake and he quickly corrected it. “I, Bractus need you to get revenge for me and end the threat he presents to my city. He will open the gates for the orcs and end my city. You have to save them before it is too late.”

“Enough,” Oonair silenced the minotaur who didn’t look happy about being made to wait. “Princess I believe you are next.”

The princess was beautiful with an elaborate wedding gown with a veil pulled over her face but her soft and gentle features were clear under the thin fabric. Her eyes were a deep purple in color and her ears indicated she was of elven descent. She barely lifted her gaze to talk to the paladin.

“I was slain on my way to my wedding,” he recognized her as Princess Elana, her kingdom was close to Dar and they had some trade relations, he hadn’t heard of her death but the nuptials between her kingdom and another group of elves. “I want those responsible to be killed. They destroyed my future I want the people responsible to pay.”

“Who were they?” Sir Garrett asked, it suddenly occurred to him that he might have overstepped but the goddess made no attempt to stop him.

“I don’t know, I was hit by a crossbow at the start, I think I was the target, I didn’t understand what was happening, masked bandits slew me. They hid my body and of those with me, I tried following them to find out who they were but I wasn’t able to. I spent days praying to all of the gods and goddesses I knew until I came to Oonair, she was the only one who listened to me.”

“The last resort as is usual,” Oonair spoke more than a hint of bitterness in her voice. “Except for you.”

Her eyes lost the green fire and were loving as she gazed at the paladin, he blushed. He had always respected her and called upon her name many times in the past when making a deal but to be thanked by a goddess was embarrassing, even if he had shown her more respect than many others did.

“Little one, you are next to call upon me for revenge,” Oonair called on the last one to speak.

“My name is Sarah Smith. Hobgoblins destroyed my village,” she still bore the scars of her death upon her, Sir Garrett wondered if it was because she was more attached to her death, the others had looks of anger to them but hers was a look of hate. “They slaughtered my family, my little brothers, I was supposed to protect him.”

She couldn’t be more than twelve years of age and he wondered how much younger her brothers were. Hobgoblins were ruthless and it was rare when they would leave a survivor, their military precision often meant even hiding did little good because they usually burned down the village making sure no cellars escaped their notice. Signs of burning were clear on her body but that hadn’t been the final indignity for her as spear marks in her chest indicated.

“Whose revenge quest will you take up?” Oonair asked.
111111112312.title: The astral plane

choices: Sir Garrett is turned into a Minotaur

1111112.content:
Sir Garrett's strength of will wins out after the release of his primal urges. Anger took away any thought for himself as he saw the couple smugly meandering to the gate. He charged them with their backs turned. They heard the charge only in time to see the muscular bull run them over. The impact sent them careening to the grassy field. The bounced hard before rolling to a stop.

The couple cried out in pain drowning out the sound of snapping bones. Anger clouded Sir Garrett's mind as he stampeded over Mrs. Nelson lowering his head he gored into Mr. Nelson's chest. He lifted his head with Mr. Nelson still attached Sir Garrett shook his bull's head tossing the farmer like a rag doll. He trotted around to face Mrs. Nelson who gurgled up some blood. “Did you check everywhere?” the lantern bearer came closer. “You had better have checked everywhere you lazy bastard.”
111312113312.title: Find somewhere to hide

1113121133122.content:
Melanie scarcely allowed herself the chance to breathe as the grumbling pirate approached. A hundred different foul odors preceded the man, did he ever bath, she wondered if water could even pierce the thick layer of dirt and grime he had built up like armor over his body against any cleaning. She ducked down as the swaying man came closer wondering if she would have to fight against his cutlass with her hammer.

“I don’t see the bitch!” he called down to this companion.

“Check behind those trunks!” the command demanded.

“If we damage anything the madame will be pissed,”

“If we don’t check the Captain will make us dead, your choice.”

The time for hiding was at an end, she had to move or be captured, Melanie pressed with all of her might as she heard the first trunk being lifted. Screams of shock were swallowed up as the trunks bumped and crashed into each other on their collision course with the ground. Melanie moved quickly behind the haystacks to observe the results of her attack.

“Get up you idiot!” the lantern carrying pirate had dodged the fallen trunks which had burst open revealing dress, lingerie, and other garments. The other man made no response, his battered and broken body silently bled on the floor, the eyes were open but they would never see again. “Great, just great. I bet I get blamed for this.”

Melanie weighed her options, she could continue to hide here and hope there would be no further investigation until she had a chance to make her getaway or she could try to escape. She edged closer as the man paced in a circle swearing, if she jumped she could reach him and if she didn’t break anything in the fall she could take him, if she did that she could use the clothes to wear if no one had heard the tumbling trunks, and if they had money on them they hadn’t spent on whores or liquor it might give her a chance. There were too many if but she wanted to take the chance to fight.

A creak in the wood announced the jump allowing the lantern to be lifted giving a glimpse of the descending paladin but not enough time to comprehend the implication of the naked woman with a hammer raised high above her head. Death came instantly to the man with the blow, he could take no joy from the curvy form tumble around the ground with him.

She was sore and would likely develop a few bruises but was still fine as far as a quick assessment could tell. Melanie rushed the entrance but didn’t find any further investigators coming from the brothel, her keen eyes observed a couple of pirates at the entrance pacing back and forth so she would have to hurry, she couldn’t be certain how soon these men would be missed.
1113121133122.title: Go on the attack

11131213.content:
The walls were covered in panels displaying heroic deeds, she wished she could take a closer look but she wanted to be far away in case they discovered the secret entrance. She didn’t look to see if a mark had been left behind. Sir Garrett felt silly holding her pants up, it would be better to have a free arm she decided, dropping the clothing. She said a small prayer as she hid the pants in an urn before continuing down the tunnel of the tomb.

Her pace slowed as she allowed herself a chance to relax, small light orbs illuminated the path as she made her way deeper into the tomb. The writing was old but she had studied ancient texts at the monastery as she grew up. These were the tales of the founder of their order Ari Silverblade, she had been the first to ride a griffin it was said but why was the tomb hidden in the castle?

It was likely to hide the treasures of the ancient guardian of these lands, someone who had protected the world before there was even a kingdom of Dar. Several of the pieces of art were likely worth a fortune by themselves. She came across a blocked doorway and though there were paths leading away from it something in the room was calling to her.

There was no way she could move the giant stone door, likely no human could so she looked for an alternative means. The alphabet of the ancients was carved into the doorway, tentatively she pressed one of the letters, it ground against the stone but after some effort, it sank in before returning to its original position. Some sort of password system, she tried to call upon her memory of the Order Silver Griffin mottos over the year and tried a couple but there was no success. Suddenly it dawned on her to think of the personal quotes from Ari.

She pressed in the first word “I” of a phrase and the letter lit up so she continued the quote as the excitement inside her intensified. “Ari Silverblade am the claw of the Silver Griffin.” Bright lights filled the room and she felt like she was being scanned for something, she wasn’t sure what, likely to make sure she wasn’t a grave robber. It appeared she was found worthy at the door hissed as oxygen rushed into the room that had no visitor in centuries.

Sir Garrett strode across the entranceway and was amazed to find the equipment of Ari spread in displays along the wall and in the center of the room was the tomb of the great paladin. She dropped to her knees and said a prayer for the ancient warrior.

“I pray you still ride the celestial planes slaying the demons, devils, and other foul creatures that seek to harm the innocent,” she spoke quietly. “I hope you will not feel betrayed by me if I borrow your equipment to help me fight against those who have cursed me and end the threat to this kingdom. Thank you.”

She donned the armor which adjusted magically to her curvy new shape and grabbed the sword and shield, she was starting to feel like a warrior again, no longer helpless against her enemies. Sir Garrett clasped on the belt and realized it gave her inhuman strength. All the equipment suddenly felt weightless. Before she left she said another thank you and left the room making sure the door closed behind her so no one would disturb the founder of her order.
11131213.title: the passage led to an old tomb

choices: No side effects present in the days to come
1113122.content:
The guards led the former Sir Garrett to a wooden chair with iron restraints attached to it at Mazara’s behest. After fixing Garrett to the chair fastening the restraints Mazara commanded them to leave her presence. Garrett asked, “What foul experiment am I to be subjected to?”

Mazara’s grin that radiated no kindness grew a bit more saying, “You are most fortunate I plan many experiments for you. But first I am going to test a special formula that King Emeril will take if there aren’t any side effects. So we will spend a lot of time analyzing your new form to make sure you are okay. Afterwards I confirm the process is safe King Emeril says I can do with you as I please so long as no one can recognize you. Now let us begin.” Mazara cast a spell of sleep on Garrett causing him to pass out. With him now asleep she produced a potion pulling the top.

The potion pouring down his throat startled Garrett awake. He felt Mazara’s spindly fingers held his mouth shut forcing him to swallow. He seized as the magic gripped him. He felt compressed in a vise throughout his body. The restraints loosened on him as his clothes grew loose. He yelled at Mazara, “What is this doing to me?”

The pleased look on Mazara brought further discomfort as she explained, “King Emeril wishes for his youth restored. I plan to aid him in this so that he can continue his glorious reign. Be thankful for your restored childhood. I will observe you for a few days to make sure of the stability. After that the fun can begin. You look adorable by the way.”

Garrett form took on a young child’s shape. Brawny muscles shrank until no longer defined. His face smoothed losing the stubble and hardened features. He sat in his now over-sized clothes wondering what to do next. He then realized the restraints no longer held him.
1113122.title: a child

11131221.content:
Garrett slipped free from his restraints running for an open door. His pants fell off as he ran causing him to stumble. He caught himself continuing to scurry to the door. He heard voices shouting after him. He could make out Mazara’s voice but he doubted her giving chase as she hated physical exertion. Her magic made her lazy but he doubted that the guards had any such issue. His small feet pounded the ground as he heard thundering footsteps following close behind him. Garrett’s advantage of lacking heavy armor would not save him as the clattering noise grew louder.

Turning a corner luck favored him seeing a maid scrubbing the floor he knocked over her bucket spilling its soapy contents across the floor. Garrett kept his footing as he heard the crashing sound of cursing guards intermingled with the cry of the maid. He felt bad for the trouble he inflicted on her but necessity won out. His mind raced as he hurried through the halls drawing strange looks. His next decision whether to sneak out on foot or grab a horse to ride out on. On foot he would be a lot stealthier but a horse provided speed he lacked right now. Putting distance between him and the capital seemed the best course of action. Emeril had too many spies in the city. He headed to the stables slowing down to catch his breath.

Stable hands busied themselves with their work. Experience taught them not to interfere with that which didn’t concern them. They saw Garrett but ignored him thinking he might be a visiting dignitaries child. He looked over the horses finding the fleetest one. Making sure that no one observed him he slipped into the stall. The handsome chestnut stallion looked eager for the run Garrett would soon provide. He opened the stall. Garrett climbed the stall leaping on the horses back as he reached the top.

The horse hardly noticed weight change. He responded obediently to Garrett’s guidance. Years of horse riding aided him in leading the powerful stallion beneath him. He urged a gallop that the stallion zealously responded to. The sight of a boy in a man’s shirt drew stares but no alarm was raised. Garrett hoped that Mazara’s embarrassment at his escape prevented her from alerting others. Garrett breathed easier as he reached the capitals borders. Still he had no definite plan as to what to do next. No provisions left him in a precarious state along with his diminutive size.
11131221.title: Garrett makes good his escape

choices: Garrett works out his next move
111312211.content:
Garrett decided to travel to one of his old friends. He guided the horse through old trails. Jumping a fallen stump nearly tossed him off the stallion. The difficulty riding bareback with his reduced strength made for an exciting ride. He slowed the horse down to a steady trot he rode this way for an hour. He turned the stallion around then dropped onto a large stone by the trail. The stallion began to wander off realizing its new freedom. If they tracked him this far he hoped the stallion would mislead them as to the direction he went. The hoof prints should show no significant change without him as a rider. Garrett’s now light weight shouldn’t of deepened the impressions much.

With care he avoid leaving any tracks as he continued his journey to Arietta Thornhart’s place. A druid of no small ability. Their past adventures together ended amicably. She established a home in unsettled wilderness. He hoped her collection of potions and plants might provide a restoration to him. In the hours that passed traveling with his scrawny legs he wore out. Finding a small stream he filled his stomach with the cool water. Garrett laid down to rest sleep soon overtook him.

As Garrett woke up he saw the pleasant mature face of Arietts. Arietta spoke upon seeing him awaken, “What brings you to these woods in such a sorry state? I will give you aid if it is within my power to do so.” Her dire wolf companion lay beside her quietly slumbering.

Garrett smiled, “You may not believe this Arietta but I your old friend Sir Garrett. I have been betrayed by King Emeril and the foul wizard Mazara. I need to be hidden from the King’s minions and a cure if you happen to have one. I will repay you as soon as I can but I am afraid that I lost my funds.”

Arietta watched the young boy’s for any signs of deceit. Nothing in his eyes indicted deception. His countenance resembled a very young Garrett. She also believed Emeril capable of such betrayal. She said, “I believe that you are Sir Garrett now let’s get you back to my home and more properly attired. We will figure out our next move than. As for repayment we are friends forget it.” She snapped her fingers causing the dire wolf to jump up onto its feet. Arietta hefted Garrett on top of the wolf. She climbed behind him and urged the oversized wolf on.
111312211.title: go to a friend

1113122111.content:
The swift ride through the woods jolted and jostled Garrett. Arietta’s arm around him kept him secure. He felt awkward being in the protection of another. It felt reassuring with her warm body next to his holding it tight. Garrett asked, “How much longer till we get there?”

“We should be hitting the clearing momentarily. I want to suggest you use one of my potions to transform yourself further. It will make you harder to track. It would take to long to craft a restoration potion. Plus I don’t know if I can. The magic might be beyond my abilities.” Arietta spoke concerned about protecting her friend. Hiding him until something could be worked out seemed the best option.

Garrett responded, “I can see how not looking like myself would help. The age change certainly helps disguise me but Mazara knows how I look now. The question is how do you plan to change me?”

“Well, I think I will the final choice up to you. I keep a variety of potions that can transform into a number of different forms. I concerned that you will get tracked to my place. I fear that you will need to make the choice quickly. But the basic changes I can do are animal, gender, or age. As an animal I could keep you here and Mazara would suspect nothing. A druid with animals about would draw no suspicion. Changing gender I would send you away to someone who will care for you until we can meet up. With the age transformation I can make you so old or young that Mazara will not recognize you. So what do you think?” Arietta asked as they arrived to a comfortable cottage in a clearing. A greenhouse and other outbuildings sat off a bit for the care of her rare plants and make potions.
1113122111.title: Arietta suggests further transformation

11131221113.content:
Sir Garrett responded to Arietta’s suggestion, “I am already a child I do not believe she would see me giving up my manhood. If you changed my age I would be unable to act in my own defense either by being infirm or simply incapable as a child. An animal transformation hampering my ability to communicate with others could prove dangerous. Persuading people may be all I really have going for me.”

Arietta considered Garrett’s words saying, “Okay we better hurry with it because Mazara is clever despite all her other failings as a human. I wish to provide you with as much of a head start as I can. I will head in another direction than you to throw them off. If questioned I will tell her that I am gathering rare plants. It will be true by then. I will write you a note for a friend I am sending you too while you take the potion. Don’t worry it won’t hurt and will be quick. At your current age there isn’t much difference between a boy and girl. I have a dress that might fit the new you in the trunk over there. I like to make clothes for the New dawn orphanage in the capital. As long as it is for a good cause.” Smiling she proceeded to grab a potion from her collection before sitting down at a wooden writing table.

Garrett eyed the potion with apprehension before downing the elixir. The change tickled as his hair flowed from his head stimulated by the potion. His face softened slightly producing a cute appearance. He felt the shift in his nether regions. He now she began to dig through the trunk in a hurry to get dressed and on her way. Garrett focused on the problems ahead of her rather than the distractions of a new transformation. She put on a sensible dress that fit well. Turning to face Arietta she saw her blowing on the seal to her letter.

Arietta grinned at the cute little girl before her, “Don’t you look pretty in your new dress. Sorry I just can’t get over your new look. I will leave the reversal in the knot hole out front in case something happens to me. I would wait at least a few months because Mazara might keep an eye on my place for a while. I don’t wish to give it to you in case she tracks you down. The plant base in the potion will mask your magical transformation from basic scrying. Come outside I will summon a giant eagle to fly you so that you won’t leave any tracks.”

Arietta tied back Garrett’s hair so it wouldn’t blow in her face when she rode the eagle. A majestic giant eagle soon glided in after a quick summoning from Arietta. Arietta hugged Garrett tightly before wishing her good luck and handing her the letter. A few tears dripped from the pairs’ eyes. As Garrett’s friend helped her up she gave Arietta a reassuring smile. Garrett held tight to the eagle as she took off. She looked back seeing Arietta hiding the eagles tracks.
11131221113.title: gender

111312211132.content:
Nervously, Garrett slid off the giant eagle after a long chilly ride on its back. The home’s quaint appearance didn’t allay any of Garrett’s concern over Arietta’s fate as well as his own. Now this family was putting itself in danger for him. He approached the door with trepidation knocking softly on the door. He heard activity in the house which ceased with his knock. He heard heavy footsteps approach the door as a deep voice called out, “Hello who graces our home with their presence?”

Garrett’s voice weakly responded, “A friend of Arietta. I have a letter from her that should explain everything.”

The door opened revealing a large burly who smiled upon catching sight of Garrett. “Well now little sprite how about I check out this letter of yours. No need to worry little one come inside and wait while I check out this letter of yours. My wife is fixing up some lunch if you want you can have some. Sorry, I am rude I call myself Gregory. What is your name little one?”

Garrett responded quietly intimidated at the mans size, “It explains in the letter who I am. I prefer that you read rather than me saying.” Garrett surprised himself with how timidly he behaved. The strange body combined with the diminished size. Gregory nodded as he stepped aside to give access to his home. A comely young woman gave a friendly smile to Garrett gesturing for him to take a seat.

Darlene overheard the conversation choosing not to pry situated the young girl at the table before fixing the cute little thing a plate. She hummed while setting the plate down with a grin. Garrett dug in with an eagerness at the meal presented but he filled quickly. His smaller stomach stuffed before he even dented pile before him. Gregory came in scratching his head as he handed the letter off to his spouse. Sitting down he gave a comforting smile to Garrett, “So you want to discuss your situation now?”

Garrett gave a faint sigh before saying, “I know that I am asking a lot of you to be sheltering me like this. I am not sure what exactly the letter said but I am in trouble with King Emeril and can use any help you are willing to offer.”

In a deep voice Gregory responded, “The letter mentioned that you are pursued by Emeril’s cruel wizard Mazara and need hiding. It also mentions that you are a friend and unjustly pursued. My wife and me are no friend’s of Emeril’s. If my wife agrees we will take you in and treat you as our daughter. I suggest that you don’t tell us your name that way we can truthfully say we don’t know where you are. What say you Darlene?”

The young nodded encouragingly squeezing Gregory’s muscular arm saying, “I am with you sweetheart. How about we call you Amber and from now on call us mom and dad? Now will anyone recognize you as you are now?”

Garrett shook his head, “No they won’t recognize me as I am now only Arietta would. It will feel funny calling you mom and dad but I will try my best to fit in and be dutiful. Thank you for the aid. Now how can I make myself useful?”

Darlene laughed, “Let’s get you set up in your room first. Follow me this way.” Garrett now Amber he guessed followed Darlene swaying form down a hall to a cosy room. It looked like a neutral guest room. A dresser and closet helped make up the room. “We can customize to make it your own Amber. You and I can pick some flowers to brighten it up.”

Amber blushed thinking of a paladin of the silver order out picking flowers, “That is alright I don’t need any flowers.”

Darlene shook her head, “Sorry Amber we are going to have to feminize this room and you if anyone is going to believe that you are a young girl. You need training to help you fit in and it starts now. You must remember to always keep your knees together or cross them. I will run you a bath so we can get you cleaned up proper. Don’t worry most of this will be fun.” She smiled down to Amber.
111312211132.title: Arriving to a friendly family

1113122111322.content:
Amber found the training difficult but Darlene was a forgiving teacher. Memories of his former days as a squire with each new task a skill to master. With Darlene or mother as she reminded herself to call her. She learned the daily chores that were expected of her. Some were familiar like the cleaning, cooking and laundry duty. But even these often took on a new nature as a squire they were simple tasks. With the cooking she learned a multitude of new recipes. No more was it simply dump into a pot and cook till no flavor remained. The careful prep work with spices added to create nuanced flavors. No more armor polishing only the silverware when company came over. She often found the pronouns of how she thought of herself switching in her mind rare. Fear of those that could scan the surface thoughts in your head made her cautious of how she even thought of herself.

Mother taught her new skills like sewing clothes and quilts. Dancing the female part with her father Gregory. The lessons on manners and decorum sat poorly with the former paladin. Amber’s conscience used to be her guide but her mother taught her about being submissive and taking care to not put forth her opinions. She knew this was vital to maintain her disguise but still disliked the role she found herself in. Time bought a new joy to her new parents as they announced her mothers pregnancy. But it also brought with it a worry as Arietta failed to get into contact her. Patience never one of her stronger qualities made waiting more difficult. She even thought of striking out on her own but figured Mazara still pursued her.

Little news of the outside world reached her new family. They did hear that Sir Garrett disappeared on a quest and knights of the silver griffon were dispatched to find what happened to him. The most distressing news that came to him was that Princess Fina was betrothed to another. Some prince that would provide a new alliance for the kingdom. Amber felt a tear flow down her cheek but quickly composed herself. She threw herself into her chores hoping that exhaustion might alleviate her anguish.

In the morning she gave herself ten minutes to practice sword forms just to do something familiar. Amber felt silly using the broom but she had no sword of her own. Her concentration broke with her mother scolding, “Put that broom to its correct at once. I don’t want to see you playing like that again. It is undignified and unladylike. Now I want to hear you apologize and say you won’t do it again.”

“I am sorry mother. I promise not to do it again,” Amber said reluctantly. She hated doing it but didn’t want to be on her mother’s side. She waited for her mother to get out of earshot before grumbling to herself as she swept the porch. Amber imagined running away to find one of her former colleagues. Or resigning herself here until Arietta returned.
1113122111322.title: Amber's training

11131221113222.content:
Patience with time and training worlds opened to you. Discovering new abilities and capabilities. This is how Amber once learned as a young squire in time. Though it didn’t come easy to her. She decided that sticking to the distasteful tasks before her. Submerging herself in the persona of the obedient daughter. Sweeping with care and diligence she inspected her work, only quitting when she felt satisfied with her work. She then went to Darlene. Wait she meant her mother. Her mom surveyed her work before smiling and nodding in approval, “Now, please come help me in the kitchen. I need help peeling some vegetables.”

“Yes mother.” Amber trailed behind taking care with the peeling. She found a rhythm and purpose in the chore. She remembered days of doing this while training under veteran knights of the silver order. She put those memories aside focusing on obeying her mother as her dutiful daughter.

A routine for her days soon followed with Amber helping her mother the best she could with with whatever chores she could. Her diminutive form left almost any lifting out the question. She found she lacked the endurance of the well trained fighter that she once possessed. She managed the best she could with sewing and baking. She reminded herself that the tasks might help in future not only maintaining her disguise but in helping with the household when she started her own home. Thoughts of Fina intruded unbidden. Unless she freed herself of this accursed form she would hear of Fina’s nuptials. With seasons passing she did hear of the celebrated royal and Fina’s leaving with prince Rolland to his own kingdom.

Her heart sunk with no prospects for freedom. Heaving tears from her eyes as she wept without control. Her mother sent her to her room till she could compose herself. She settled again into a routine that continued for years. Arietta never showed and what finally her malaise was the onset of something she never imagined herself experiencing. Bloody sheets marked the beginning of her trek into puberty. The hormones ran her rough shod. The yelling spats between Amber and her mother proved to be an ongoing war. Her father stayed away trying to avoid being caught in the crossfire. The changes in her body furthered its estrangement from its formerly masculine shape. Her dreams betrayed her as she started to dream of men in ways unbecoming a knight of the silver order.

Staring at her ever expanding mounds that wouldn’t quit growing despite all of her prayers. The curves that started forming on her body only further set her off. Amber struggled to fit into her dress squishing down her flourishing melon. Darlene strode in laughing at the sight, “Looks like I should let out that top again. You already got me beat. Your babies will not starve that is for sure.”

“Mother! Get out! I can adjust it myself. Now give me some privacy.” Amber’s voice became shrill while yelling.

“Calm down! I just wanted to let you know that your Aunt Julia sent me a letter asking if I could spare you to let you help with her little ones. I think the change would be good for you. There are plenty of eligible young men that might catch your fancy.”

“Out, now!” Amber directed with her finger. Her mother retreated mumbling under her breath about what a sweet child she used to be. Too long she waited for Arietta’s now she found herself a young woman. She needed to pursue her goals but she feared that her heart and mind differed on the goals. Part of her did long for a child suckling at her breast. She dreamed such the night before. Keeping home for a man of her own. Her mind longed for the reinstatement to her place of respect as a knight of the silver order of the griffin.
11131221113222.title: wait

choices: Give up the search to live with your Aunt Julia
111312211132222.content:
That night Amber lay awake reflecting upon her life. Many years had passed since she'd first come here looking for refuge as a defenseless little girl, and for many years she had waited for Arietta to come with news of a cure to her newfound defenseless child-like state. However, in the years since she had grown up to be a woman herself. No longer was she a defenseless child, but instead a beautiful young teenager that looked no older than 14. The recent dreams of men she'd been having reminded her of just how old she'd grown in her time with her foster family. If Arietta hadn't contacted her by now, something definitely was wrong. She had to find out what happened to her and whether the gender reversal potion she'd left for her was still around. If Amber was ever going to restore herself to her former glory, now would have to be the time. But first, she needed to find a way to make it back to Arietta's home in the wood.

         The next morning Amber informed her mother that she would be willing to move to her aunts to help with the children, to which she was overjoyed. Amber's foster foster and mother quickly helped her pack what little possessions she had and set her on the road with one of their horses and a map to guide her on her travels. Travelling on the road alone as a young girl was much different than when she was Sir Garret. She felt extremely vulnerable. No longer did she have the strength to wield a sword as she once had, nor the capability to wear heavy armor. No matter how many years went by, she could not get used to the feeling of vulnerability and weakness that came with being a woman in these dangerous times. Her mind drifted to the thought of needing a man to protect her, but quickly shook off the thought. She did not need a man. She needed to become the man that she once was.

         Hours passed as Amber traveled down the dirt path that lead to her foster families secluded cottage. It was no wonder that the king's men had not found her in such a place. She eventually came upon a fork in the road, stopping to check her map. She had to make a decision. A right will take her to her to the nearby village where her aunt Julia waits, whilst a left will be taking her in the general direction of Arietta's cabin, to which you estimate will take an extra day or two on
111312211132222.title: Search for Arietta

11132.content:
Sir Garrett helped Princess Fina onto the back of the enormous feathered bird. Fina sat herself on ornate custom saddle waiting for Sir Garrett to tie up the gear. Fina smiled watching Sir Garrett fixing the knots on the bags. She loved the prospect of all the alone time with Sir Garrett. Her heart still swooned since the first time she saw him in a tournament. His gallantry inspired her to learn more about the knight who won her heart. Her love only grew hearing of his exploits. A man of principle that saved scores of people in his career. Now, and soon forever to be part of his story.

Sir Garrett carefully set the knots double checking them to be sure. A mixture of emotions filled Sir Garrett the desire to spend time with Fina balanced with fear for her safety. Fina wished to understand a large part of his life. Princess Fina wished to help with his dangerous career battling the evil. He got o the eagle with Fina wrapping her slender arms around him. She squeezed him tight pressing her breasts into his back. The feeling distracted him for a minute before he caught himself and guided the eagle to a balcony taking flight.

The cool wind blowing in their faces as they rode the wind. Princess Fina loved the view of the capital diminishing below as they flew east. The time spent in the air passed quicker than Fina desired. The swamp below them looked foreboding as they circled down into a clearing.
11132.title: They get to the swamps with no problem

choices: Sir Garrett awakens tied to a chair
Princess Fina awakens in a iron cell
The pair find a robed figure stands before them
11133.content:
The pair soon took to the air to soon took to the air on the giant eagle. Princess Fina cried out in joy when they left the aviary. In a minute, they passed the castle walls, soon they were over the countryside. The tiny buildings and farms littered the landscape. Towns and cities just another feature of the land below. Freedom from the confinement and rigid structure of castle life. Fina loved all that and beauty of the world below. Worry of the dangers ahead didn’t cross his mind.

For Sir Garrett fear kept him sharp. He feared not for himself but the innocent who faced the dangers of the world untrained. A life fighting monsters seemed in the cards since a childhood raised by veteran knights. He never knew a gentle life away from sadness’s of the world. He lost many father figure growing into a man. Sir Garrett desired to shelter others from the villains in the world. Though a practical man he knew that he could only do a small part and pray to the gods for the rest. Princess Fina wished to share his burden however he worried when put to the test she might return to her sheltered existence.

The pairs silent revelry broke when the eagle began to spin out of control toward the ground. Sir Garrett pulled with all his might to no avail. He knew not what was happening. Darkness overtook the paladin and the princess.
11133.title: They have a problem while flying

choices: You will see him soon enough
You will not be seeing him again
111332.content:
Fina woke on a hard mattress in cool dank iron cell. Her senses dimmed by whatever dark magic that stole her wakefulness. Sorin must have lost consciousness from magic that hit her. He would not have lost control without witchcraft or the such about. She saw nor felt any injuries about herself save a pounding headache. Her concern soon turned to thoughts of her beloved who she could not see anywhere. Princess Fina called, “Sir Garrett can you hear me?” She hurried to the bars looking to either side down the long stone hallway finding only a hard metal door at one end. The dungeon she found dimly lit by torches in poor repair. The door at the end of the hall unlocked pushed open with a squeaking sound as metal grinded against metal.

A robed figured made its way to the Princess. The black robed figure turned to face the Fina looking down before saying, “I am glad to see you awake Princess. I am afraid that Sir Garrett is not here to greet you but these things happen. I welcome you on behalf of my master who is unfortunately delayed. I wish to assure you of your safety while you are in our care.” The man turned making his way back to the metal door.

Fina worriedly asked, “Where is Sir Garrett? I will not cooperate if you hurt him.”

The figure responded…
111332.title: Princess Fina awakens in a iron cell

1113321.content:
The figure responded, “Your cooperation is unnecessary. Your ransom should reward us quite nicely and all you have to do is sit there.”

Fina shouted , “My father will not pay for me. He does not love me. You might as well let me go. Now tell me where Sir Garrett is.” She held the cold iron bars pressing her face against them hoping to see someway out or catch sight of Garrett. She only saw the small dank stone floor that led to the metal door. She doubted this place was anymore than a temporary hideout for this villain and whoever else might work with him.

The husky laugh of the the villain unsettled her. He said, “I never told you that your father was providing the reward. Royal blood is quite valuable to many. I think I will leave you to ponder who desires you. As for Sir Garrett I am afraid I don’t know him now where he might be. He either left you or is laying dead somewhere. So don’t trouble yourself about him.” The man snickered about the troubled girl.

Fina felt tears rising to her eyes thinking about Garrett abandoning her. No he would never do that she told herself. The man might lie to cause her to despair. That way she would make no trouble for them. But the darker question remained who desired her and for what dark purpose?
1113321.title: Your cooperation is unnecessary

choices: dragon wants to use her as bait
dragon has a special need for her
11133212.content:
As the day drew to a close a couple robed figures arrived one of them with keys rattling. Fina watched nervously observed them unlocking the door. The familiar male voice of her captor resonated from the taller one saying, “It is time for you to meet your new owner young princess.”

Fina scowled, “Why do you hide yourselves in robes. Afraid a defenseless woman will know you for the cowards that you are?” She mustered her best derisive laugh at them.

The man responded amused, “If you should somehow escape I would hate for you to be able to identify us. Mine is the only voice you know. We are unlikely to run into each other I am afraid we run in different circles.”

The pair led her through the old metal door up the stairs. Reaching the outside brought about a sulfuric odor. The sight of an enormous red dragon grinned revealing its sharp teeth. As it began to speak smoke escaped its giant maw. The booming voice said, “Well don’t you just look delicious. I think you are worth every piece of gold I paid. I suggest you two run and hide my stomach is gurgling. I hardly think a morsel this small will fill it.” With that statement the robed figures ran back into the dilapidated stone structure. The seized Fina who stood frozen with fear.

The powerful wings flapped taking them into the air. The cool wind blowing across Fina’s face brought her to her senses. She looked down watching the scenery pass by being taken to some unknown location to be eaten no doubt.
11133212.title: A monster desires her

choices: Fina taken to a massive library
111332122.content:
Fina summoned her courage desiring to know her fate. She called out to the enormous dragon, “Will you at least let me write a letter to my loved ones before you eat.”

The dragon bellowed a derisive laugh, “You are a means to an end my dear not food. All you are to me is bait. You may do as you wish with your time if you are not needed. What I will do with you after I am finished using you I let you ponder that In your leisure time.”

Fearfully Fina asked, “What am to be bait for? I fear that my father will not pay any ransom for me. Save for my beloved Sir Garrett I know none that will brave a dragon to aid me.”

“There is one who seeks the uncorrupted blood of one of your lineage. With it he might acquire an item he has sought for centuries. Another scheme in a long line of them. He will know that it is a trap but he will still come. His impatience grown to great with times passage.” The dragon snickered at his own cleverness.

“Why not come for me before? Surely opportunity presented itself before now.” Fina struggled to learn as much as she could of this unknown enemy of hers.

“He angered a goddess of old. She sealed your lands from his grasp. He no doubt sent agents but I gleefully alerted authorities to their presence. Now that you are beyond your lands borders you are in play as it were.” The dragon eyed something below him. He circled an open structure. He landed amid the tall stones and began some incantation that triggered an eerie blue glow in the stones lighting esoteric symbols that when ignited flashed blinding Fina for a minute.

Slightly dazed when she recovered herself she felt rushing air as the dragon again took to flight. It took her a minute to realize that they found themselves in a different location. “What was that?”

“Traveling stone waypoint you the remnants of an alliance between great kingdoms. Few still stand and fewer still that know how to work their magic. With them if you know the names you can travel from one to another. I used them because he watches them and will now know that I have you. Now all I need to do is finish setting up and wait.” The hungered for the face off that would soon present itself.

“Who is this enemy and why is he your enemy? I want to thank you for being so forth coming with me.” Fina felt grateful that it least now she was getting answers. Normally dismissed by her father and court officials when she questioned.

“You are welcome little one. I figure your understanding will make you more compliant and less likely to run. I will let you go free once I finish Rogsbold. He stole from my hoard. To dragons such an offence is unforgivable. I am old and my grudges run deep. He will pay.” Pondering what tortures he might visit on Rogsbold.

“After all of this would you help me find my fiancee Sir Garrett?” She looked expectantly at the dragon as they began to descend to a large mountain with a maw like opening that remained shrouded in darkness. Small scaly humanoids made their way out to watch in awe at the dragons landing. The kobolds no doubt worked for her carrier. “Greetings master.” They called out in frightening unison.
111332122.title: dragon wants to use her as bait

choices: Lizardmen investigate the strangers to their land
A robed figure sneaks into the camp
112.content:
Albert had been Sir Garrett’s squire for just over six years now and it was time for him to get some experience in a longer quest. They had fought together against some kobolds and some bandits but nothing as far away or as dangerous as the dangerous as the dread swamp. A few nights on the cold hard ground with trail food would serve the lad some good in the reality of adventuring. Albert’s determination would carry him through because he truly cared about fighting evil and helping out others.

Lord Albert Maxwell was the only son of an ancient noble line that had fallen on hard times due to his father’s gambling problem. He was desperate when he learned of the generosity of Sir Garrett so he sought him out to ask for work so he could support his mother and two younger sisters. Sir Garrett had seen potential in the young child of ten and made him the honorable profession of squire to be trained as a knight. It had earned Sir Garrett the eternal thanks of Albert. The now sixteen old noble had repaid the kindness with hard work and diligent training.

Sir Garrett pulled Thunder in front of his squire and asked, “Are you ready to come on a quest?”

“Are you serious?” Albert’s eyes lit up. “Of course I am ready. Just give me a little time to getting ready.”

Albert vanished as magically as any wizard could and judging by the amount of time it took for him to get back he had planned to come along if offered. As always he was eager and filled with wonder at the world as they traveled for several days to reach the dread swamp. The cold food and rocky ground didn’t even dampen his spirits.

They finally arrived at the edge of the dread swamp and Sir Garrett decided to camp for the night before exposing the youth to the full dangers of the swamp. It had been nice to have second person along to allow the proper posting of a guard. Sir Garrett had been impressed at the fine work Albert was doing at guard because he hadn’t been caught dozing once on duty. However you never knew when danger would strike and this might be the night for an encounter.
112.title: Take your squire with you

1121.content:
A distinct odor of death began to permeate the air. The smell grew stronger and Sir Garrett readied himself as he heard shuffling and moaning begin to approach. Sir Garrett made a prayer to the gods that they give him strength in the upcoming fight. Sir Garrett surveyed his surroundings and found a large boulder that Albert and he could protect themselves from becoming surrounded. He motioned to Albert who quickly nodded assent and moved to the boulder.

The mass of undead began emerge from the swamp. Their bloated decayed state and unintelligent shuffle toward the pair lead Sir Garrett to believe they were zombies. Zombies did not become a problem until they reached a horde state like this. The question on Sir Garrett's mind was their creator with them and controlling their action now. Zombies liked to go after the nearest intelligent life and destroy it normally. They might wander around randomly if not controlled. Something guided the horde together the question remained did it still push them.

Sir Garrett and Albert took shots at the zombies with their crossbows while the horde moved to them. Well placed head shots brought down some of the larger ones they targeted. The zombies that got touched by the falling zombies became distracted by the sudden sensation. Sir Garrett figured they must have been let loose by whoever created them. Zombies the someone controlling them rarely deviated from their target . Sir Garrett could not be sure how many there were with them pouring out of the forest. He decided to make a stand here instead of running because zombies ceaselessly pursued their target tirelessly. He also did not want to risk someone less prepared coming across them. His duty stood before him.

Sir Garrett and Lord Albert dropped their crossbows as the zombies came into melee range. They pulled out their swords and steeled themselves to the oncoming onslaught. Sir Garrett's blade struck home with precision and ferocity. Sir Garrett kept the rage in check while he bashed away zombies with his shield causing them to fall with their poor dexterity into each other. The domino effect of them falling into each gave space in front of Sir Garrett. He used the space as a kill zone for the next wave of zombies.
1121.title: The undead walk the earth

choices: Sir Garrett sent Albert back to get some help
Sir Garrett felt they should continue
A black dragon comes out of the forest
11211.content:
Sir Garrett saw the zombies pounding down on Albert. With the fury of the fighting he lost track of Albert and now Albert suffered for it. The armor Albert wore afforded some protection from the attacks but the zombies unnatural strength and numbers took their toll. The gruesome visages and number of the undead caused Albert to panic and trip trying back away. This lead to several of the undead to fall upon him. Albert tried not to scream as one of the zombies tried to gnaw his face. He used his hands to push away the decaying maw for tearing off flesh. Drippings from the creature fell on Albert causing his stomach to churn at the putrid smell. Fear of being a meal to these monsters helped to keep his strained muscles from giving way.

Sir Garrett upon seeing the precarious position of his squire called forth his faith and turn back many of the undead. Several of them fell to the ground now devoid of the negative energy that drove them. The undead that tried to feed off Albert slumped on top of him. While Albert pushed himself free and got up on his feet again Sir Garrett continued the fight seeming tireless. Sir Garrett smiled as Albert rejoined the fight regaining composure. He knew that facing undead the first is a jarring experience. He held no ill will to Albert for faltering a little against them. He was proud that Albert steeled himself from the fear inside him. Sir Garrett spoke as he knocked back another group of zombies that pressed in. "Foolish is the man who has no fear. Fear can be a great ally for it gives you caution. You have fought yours and won becoming stronger for it. Let us triumph this day." With that he split another skull with his blade.

Albert nodded thankful that Sir Garrett still held him in high regard. He wished to earn that respect in time. He sliced open one of the zombies before him causing its guts to spill forth. Again he felt his stomach turn over but he held it and pressed his attack. Albert chopped its head off in three brutal strokes. The teeth gnashed for a minute after the head tumbled to the ground before going still. The disturbing sights continued into the late morning before Albert struck the last one down. Sir Garrett's strength won the day with the aid of Albert. Albert tended his own wounds while Sir Garrett surveyed the area and decided what needed to be done.
11211.title: Albert is getting overwhelmed

choices: the vampire returns wishing to talk
they run into trouble during the day
112112.content:
Garrett set up Albert for first watch. He figured the young man might be to excited from the fighting to sleep right now. Albert stayed alert patrolling the parameter of the camp staying a little back from Sir Garrett's tent so he would not disturb him. The evening wore on and the exhaustion started to catch up to Albert. His muscles ached and he thought that it might be time for waking up Sir Garrett. He got up feeling the soreness down to his bones as he made his way to Sir Garrett when he heard some rustling. He turned a cold clammy hand seized his mouth sealing it shut. He tried to pry loose the grip but it held firm. Sharp teeth pierced Albert’s neck.

The coursed out of Albert and into the vampire draining blood from the young squire. He soon passed out from the loss of blood. He only awoke at being nudged.
