He jerked awake grabbing for a weapon. “Calm down Albert what has you jumpy? You are looking pale were you attacked in the night?” An upset Garrett asked.

Albert felt the damp sweat on his forehead. He settled himself well enough to respond, “I think a vampire attacked me last night. At least that is what I recall before I passed out. What should we do now? Will I turn into one of them?” Cold sweat dripped down his face as he worried about turning into a monster. The dishonor to his family name would continue for generations.

Garrett allayed his worries, “A vampire has to drain you completely to turn you. It might return tonight so I suggest we lay some traps for it. Don’t worry I will protect you. Still it is strange that it kill you and strike at me. Vampires are not known for their mercy.”
112112.title: Sir Garrett felt they should continue

choices: It wants Sir Garrett's help to defeat the necromancer in its domain
It wants to test a magical artifact that it found
It wants them to help it make a deal with the local villagers
112113.content:
The crashing and knocking over broke Sir Garrett's silent contemplation. The fearsome face of a black dragon made its approach well known. Emerald green eyes pierced the black armored scales that surrounded them. Also, known as skull dragons for the drawn and taunt features of their face that were often thought to be the most disturbing in appearance of the evil chromatic dragons. Intelligent but devious care must be used when dealing with them. Sir Garrett fought many dragons in his illustrious career but only with the aid of many knights. He found himself ill prepared to battle an adult dragon. The only thing that gave him comfort was the fact that this monster kept making its movement toward him and his squire well known. Black dragons liked to ambush prey they meant to eat. They could be incredibly stealthy if they chose. With this loud and intimidating saunter it meant to scare them off or more likely make a deal with them.

Black dragons could be counted on to keep their word but just that. Words must be picked with care for they could be your last if the black dragon found a loop hole that allowed it to betray you without breaking what it called its word. Their love for the gold coin and rotted flesh motivated them most often. Dwelling in swamps they normally came out only to extort local settlements or to have a change of diet from their usual lizardmen and crocodiles that often lived near them.

Albert stared in awe at the fearsome beast that made its way to them. Sir Garrett told him to told him to hold steady and only run if he told him too. Beholding a powerful enormous monster like this made Albert feel truly small. Pushing through the trees to get itself into the clearing with Albert and Sir Garrett.

The dragon surveyed both of them with a seeming disinterest before it spoke. "As ridiculous as it might seem I Swamp Terror great lord of this domain have use for you."
112113.title: A black dragon comes out of the forest

choices: The dragon is pleased and agrees to terms
The dragon lashes out Sir Garrett suddenly
1121131.content:
"I Swamp Terror have chosen you too help me eliminate a mutual threat. You are a member of the order of the Silver Griffin duty bound to protect those who can not protect themselves. Ever vigilant in your sworn oath like a watchful griffin. The corpses of villagers that lie before you should indicate the level of threat. I would take the intruder out myself but I think a representatives of the human population should be witness to my greatness and carry any treasure out for me. I further want your squire and you to spread word of my beneficence to the local populace." The dragon delivered the oration as if to a large audience with taloned hands gesturing wildly throughout instead of to incredulous humans.

Sir Garrett broke himself from the strange situation he found himself in. He narrowed his eyes analyzing the motives of this evil oversized reptile. The dragon probably wanted to extort protection money from local villages. Or it might want to expand it's territory and become a self styled king. A short term alliance might be possible but the knight saw trouble in the future from this dragon. He couldn't a way to defeat the adult dragon with just his squire. The power of such a beast developed from centuries of experience. With an armed retinue it might be possible but his a able sword it might be possible but doubtful. The best course of action seemed to be a deal that provided for their safe escape after the deed is done. Lowering himself into a slight bow he spoke, "I welcome the aid of one so great as you. I humbly wish to dispatch this villain with your strength and then depart to my kingdom to speak of the tale."
1121131.title: It wants Sir Garrett's help to defeat the n...

choices: The squire opens the door finding it trapped
The door opens on its own
11211311.content:
The dragon stretched its powerful wings too emphasize his massive size. “Good we are in agreement then. I will let you go back to to your kingdom unharmed after you offer me the slight assistance you can in the minor inconvenience I have. I will also not attack you during our adventure.” The dragon extended its sharply clawed hand to shake to the goodly paladin before it.

Sir Garrett uneasily shook saying, “Excellent let us get on our way.” The Knight gathered the gear he thought necessary choosing to travel light. He left behind the full plate hiding it to be retrieved later. The swamp could be truly treacherous with too much weight on oneself. Also, the lighter weight added to their advantage of speed. He didn’t imagine the monstrous dragon would be offering any rides to ease their burden. He chuckled a little at the image of a fearsome black mounted by virtuous paladin of the order of the griffin. Powerful enemies often made strange allies.

The squire looked with trepidation at the dragon before. Only story books and talk among the knights gave him any frame of reference to such a creature. The greatest feat to a knight the slaying of one of these beasts. Their hoards fabled for their wealth. Albert’s family would be restored to its form state and beyond with this mature dragons treasure. He put aside such thoughts for later after they defeated the present threat. Albert enjoyed doing good with adventuring but family honor and glory drove him to great risks at time. Frustration at the sorry state his family now found itself in caused restless sleep hoping for a way out.
The group traveled without conversation. Each of them mindful of the danger that lay before them. Stray zombies wandered about the forest indicate they headed in the right direction. They easily dispatched the unorganized undead with well placed crossbow bolts or a slash from the black dragon if they got close enough. The dragon insisted they continue and not bury the bodies. Sir Garrett relented only saying a pray as they traveled fearing the necromancer having darker plans to yet unharmed individuals.
Night began to fall but they pressed on with the knowledge that sanctum lay within a hours travel. The quality of the undead improved but they proved little match to the skilled paladin and powerful dragon. Albert at Sir Garrett’s command hung back and took well aimed shots with his crossbow.

The group soon reached the entrance to the necromancer’s layer. The stone door was intricately with symbols of a bygone civilization. Too small for the dragon to enter at its current size the paladin wondered how to proceed.
11211311.title: The dragon is pleased and agrees to terms

choices: Swamp Terror falls victim to a magical trap
Sir Garrett goes to the King for his reward
112113111.content:
The dragon spoke some words in an indecipherable tongue and he shrank down to slightly larger than Sir Garrett. The powerful dragon said, “I don’t think entering will be a problem any longer.” The dragon proceeded to spew caustic acid on the door. It waited a minute before slamming its weight the door shattering it into chunks of melted stone. It confidently strode down the carved stone steps as master of all it surveyed.

Sir Garrett took in the fact that this dragon used magic. It made him confident of the power of the dragon. It displayed great intelligence on the part of Swamp Terror. Sir Garrett would have to keep his eye on the dragon to see how gifted it was. Sir Garrett followed the dragon which left a wake of destruction behind it. Pieces of the undead the dragon lay strewn about with acid burns and slashes on them.

Swamp Terror used his superior senses to make his way through the winding passages. The necromancer behind all of this couldn’t anticipate that his life would be his own downfall. Swamp Terror loved the taste of rotten flesh and knew its smell well. So all he had to do was smell for something fresh and not rotten in order to find his way to the necromancer. He tracked the living human scent through the halls spraying the undead with his breath weapon following with a series of slashes from his powerful claws. Swamp Terror figured this dark mage was inexperienced since none of the dead so far posed any great ability or intelligence. This disappointed the dragon but maybe among his items there still might be something worthwhile. The dragon’s superior augmented by his lack of caution led him to pull further away from the paladin who played a mop up crew with his squire.

Sir Garrett struck down yet another foul unliving creature that came out of one the numerous rooms the dragon ignored. He knew the dragon must know where he was headed but paid no heed if Sir Garrett followed. Sir Garrett lost site the oversized reptile long ago and only the path of body parts guided him. Sir Garrett remained impressed with Albert’s progress in training as he held his own against any dead that came their way. The youth’s swordsmanship the equal of most knights Sir Garrett knew. With time and a level head he might surpass him one day.

Albert enjoyed slaying the undead as it felt like he was releasing them from suffering such a fate. He felt better about his performance today. Without them bunching up on him he could make more precise strokes with his blade. He wanted the strength that Sir Garrett possessed and was impatient to get it. His family deserved better than the poverty inflicted upon them by his father. He knew it wicked of him but he wished an ill fate for his own unprincipled father. The treasure within this catacomb might alleviate some of the debts his family had. Albert pondered sneaking off to find some while Sir Garrett was distracted trying to follow the dragon. No, he couldn’t leave Sir Garrett side with all the danger around. Maybe after they slew the necromancer some of the spoils would be his. Sir Garrett was a generous man and understood his woes. Yes, after there would be plenty of time to look about.

Swamp Terror disenchanted the door in front of him before slamming his weight against it. It splinted apart leaving no marks on the smooth black scales. The necromancer caught stuffing a magical bag of holding with what he could. He looked on in horror at the black dragon before him. He whimpered, “Please we can make a deal if you just let me go. I could be a powerful ally in the future you will see. My master taught me much and I have his books. I will grow quite powerful after I get a bit more control.”

The dragon smiled a sinister grin of sharp teeth and said calmly, “I am afraid you are mistaken I have your master’s books.” With that he sprung on the dark mage slashing his claws across the frail man’s throat. Swamp Terror backed off bemused with watching the would be necromancer struggle to find words with a torn throat. Watching the human collapse to the floor Swamp Terror moved over to the magical bag and cast an invisibility on it so the paladin wouldn’t find it. Even if Sir Garrett did Swamp Terror could blame it on the necromancer. He would keep his deal and make sure that the paladin left this swamp. The paladin would return with allies to take him down but would eventually find out that this wasn’t Swamp Terror’s swamp. Swamp Terror just wanted the magical books the necromancer had.
112113111.title: The dragon shrinks itself

choices: The King welcomes Sir Garrett back
Something strange happens during the bath
King Emeril is ready with a trap
1121131113.content:
Sir Garrett struck down yet another wandering zombie. The quantity of them was there but he expected a better quality as he neared the foul wizard. None of the decayed corpses posed any special danger, only in their number might Sir Garrett be overwhelmed. They seemed spread out a few to a room. No, traps could be found as he systematically traversed the unkempt chambers. Sir Garrett hoped that the necromancer would kill the dragon and he would be easy pray for the paladin. He doubted that would be the case with no signs of great power behind these walls. He checked back on Albert who stayed back slightly to make sure nothing got by Sir Garrett and to guard their backs lest anything come from behind.

Albert kept his cool making sure not to hit Sir Garrett with his crossbow. Checking his surroundings before each pull of the trigger. He used blessed bolts now that he knew they fought the undead. Each bolt that struck causing flesh to disintegrate all around the wound. Even if he didn't place them well their damage still could cripple the zombies. Albert felt more confident now as they brought down room after room.

After the pair made a complete search of all the rooms before the last one for any stray undead they entered the room with Sir Garrett in the lead. Walking in on Swamp Terror in a state of repose looking satisfied with himself. He gestured to the lifeless figure on the floor wearing wizard robes. As Sir Garrett stared at the scene as the dragon spoke, "Take what treasure you see. I will search for what I can find and of course take this as my new lair." He watched the two humans with disinterest waiting patiently for their response.

Sir Garrett responded, "Our deal holds you will not challenge us until we return to our home? If so we will not be greedy and only take what we can carry." Sir Garrett truly just wished to return home and claim Princess Fina. He also didn't want to test the dragon's word to strongly. Sir Garrett would leave immediately if he didn't know how much Albert's family needed the money.

"My word is true you can pass that on to your king. Your safety will not be challenged by me until your return to tell of my power and greatness. I truly wish you a safe and speedy journey." The dragon spoke placidly towards the paladin before him. He sat still with an almost dosing expression on his face.

The humans knew better than to linger in front of the dragon lest its anger be incurred. They made their way through the halls grabbing what spoils they could without looking to long. Sir Garrett looked regretfully at the bodies knowing he could not provide them a proper burial. He spoke a prayer as he made his way down the hall. He didn't want to carry to much in case they had to fight on their journey home.

Albert for his part vigorously grabbed items that looked valuable. The items weighed him down but he only thought of the good to his family. He dropped his crossbow knowing he could easily replace it upon his return to the capital. He did it quietly know that Sir Garrett would disapprove. A set of golden candle holders he could replace it and more.
They finished looting which Sir Garrett prodded Albert into stopping. He could see Albert struggling with the weight but he left it to the squire as it was his burden to bear. Their trip home held no impediments. Sir Garrett dismissed Albert upon their return telling him to keep all that he carried. Albert thanked Sir Garrett and headed to his families dilapidated estate. Sir Garrett headed to the King to claim Fina's hand. He got himself cleaned before heading out so he could look his best. He felt sure the King would hear his triumphant return and be ready.
1121131113.title: Sir Garrett goes to the King for his reward

11211311131.content:
After a long bath to clean the blood and guts off Sir Garrett shaved and put some cologne on. Finally feeling clean he proceeded to dress in formal attire he purchased in anticipation of speaking to King Emeril. Sir Garrett knew that the King must accept him now, if only for honors sake. He adjusted his shirt and headed out the door with his head held up today would lead to a bright future for him and Fina. Sir Garrett walked confidently through the large halls of his home to the oak doors outside. His foot man waited outside with Thunder freshly groomed from the stables. Sir Garrett put his foot in the stirrup and urged Thunder to a trot on the way to King Emeril's castle.

As Sir Garrett made his way through the streets people cheered upon recognizing his triumphant return. The people reveled in his vanquishing of evil. He enjoyed the adulation but felt that he didn't truly deserve it with the dragon having done most of the work. Still he felt the honor and privilege that they cared for him. He made his way up to the castle stables after the guards saluted him on his way in. One of the way to the throne room one a steward of the King came to Sir Garrett and signaled to follow him. Sir Garrett followed through the vast hallways and numerous side passages. Finally arriving at the King's bedroom a note left tacked to the door for Sir Garrett. The note was from the King and congratulated him on his success and welcomed him to the family. It further read that he was under the weather and could not get out of bed.

The paladin folded the carefully placing it in his pocket. He left confused as to what to do next. The King might still be upset at a low born marrying his daughter and this might be a slight against him. King Emeril's healer's should be able to fix any ailment he might have. Still, should he just accept the note at face value or investigate it more. He wished to see Fina and tell the good news. He might also talk to Albert and see what he thought
11211311131.title: The King congratulates Sir Garrett

112113111311.content:
Sir Garrett knew he should not enter the King’s chambers without permission but the strange message uncharacteristic of King Emeril drove him to press his luck. He tried knocking on the door but received no response so twisted the door knob but found the door locked. With no guards immediately in sight Sir Garrett slammed himself against the hard wood door creating a loud cracking sound as the door shuddered at the might of the paladin. He knew incurring King Emeril’s wrath at unwarranted intrusion might cause. He still pressed on sensing something off. With another strike of his shoulder the door splintered. Sir Garrett found himself in the palatial bedroom of King Emeril. He called out, “King Emeril I come to you out of concern. Your note worried me as it is out of character. You never shy away from confrontation come speak with me now.”

His call to the King met no response. Sir Garrett conducted a thorough search of the room and the adjoining bathroom but found no sign of King Emeril. The bed made unused or fixed up by a maid. The paladin realized he must not linger lest he get caught in King Emeril’s bedroom with out permission. Heading out through the broken door he found…
112113111311.title: Check on the King

112113111312.content:
Sir Garrett decided that if the King wished to see him he would summon him. He wished to let Princess know the good news. He made his way through the stone halls with a quickened pace. A handmaiden announced him to the Princess before he entered. Upon entering the beautiful young princess smiles at Sir Garrett and rushes to him hugging him with her ample chest pressing into his hard muscles. Sir Garrett smiles and says, "I have returned and the answer is yes your father has granted me permission to marry you."

Princess Fina batting her long lashes at him responding, "I am so happy. I only require you, me a priest with a couple witnesses than we can begin our life. I want to get married as soon as possible and get out into the world."

Sir Garrett said, "I think your father might want a big state wedding. We might still have to wait a little while."

Princess Fina smiled, "I will talk to him, I am sure he will agree to a small wedding if I talk to him." She finally released her hold on Sir Garrett the beaming confidant smile still on her face.
112113111312.title: Visit Fina

choices: Sir Garrett goes on an adventure
1121131113121.content:
The wedding goes off without a hitch. A private small ceremony in silver griffin hall. Sir Garrett enjoys being surrounded by the only family he ever knew. His squire Albert at his side as his best man he only regrets the small showing for Princess Fina. A few handmaidens and various other servants but no real family to speak of. Her father sent a manservant with his regrets making note that he was very busy and could not spare the time.

Princess Fina for her part felt no sadness at the lack of attendance for her. She enjoyed herself more knowing that surrounding her were real friends who wished her true happiness. She strode down with confidence and grace that she was brought up in but the smile she held only for her future husband. Her prospects for true happiness weighed heavily on her side with separation from the power hungry greed of her father. He never knew true love only the joy of acquisition. The bliss she knew from being called man and wife only grew with the warm kiss and embrace after.

The celebration went well into the evening and beyond. Fina whispered a few naughty thoughts into Sir Garrett’s ear who soon whisked her off to home with a roar of joy and hoots from those gathered. The veteran knights made a game of keeping Albert’s mug ever full causing him to pass out soon into the festivities. The drinking kept up until the last knight passed out from a lack of sobriety.

Sir Garrett drank little looking forward to the twilight activities he planned with Fina. She laughed smilingly at him as he easily carried her across the threshold of his estate and her new home. Up the stairs into the master bedroom he set her down on the soft mattress in her elegant dress. She rolled over that he might release the ties that bound her dress. He eagerly made short work of them. She rolled back on her round bottom pulling down the top of her dress revealing her ample chest. Fina than pressed her lips into her husband’s. He placed his rough hands on the dress guiding it off her with wiggling help. The shaking caused an enticing display for the paladin. He played with his new toys as Fina massaged hers between Kyle Garrett’s thighs. The flesh sword soon pierced her wet warm opening. He rocked into her causing her to cry out. She wrapped her legs around her lover as she felt him tense a little. Fina greedily wanted all his seed for herself. He obliged her after pistoning into her for some time.

Fina rolled him onto his back she sat up with his flesh sword softening begging to grind against it. It some sprang back to life with erotic dancing of her breasts as she gyrated her body on him. No reserve between them they continued locked together until exhaustion took them falling asleep still embraced with each other.

Years passed with several children to add to their joy. The couple remained friends with Albert after he left his role as a squire to become a knight. Alberts family began to find financial stability with his and Sir Garrett’s continuing adventures. Princess Fina loved the freedom she found with Sir Garrett who treated her as a partner. She studied magic and felt she made much progress in the field. When she felt safe to leave her children at home she hoped to journey with her husband. Though she did find much fun with them she wanted to see more of the places she read of in her tomes. When Sir Garrett returned home, he watched the kids to give her a break to study or examine some strange artifact he brought back with him. They seldom heard from Fina’s father who only contacted them when he wanted some evil dispatched by Sir Garrett.
1121131113121.title: The wedding soon takes place

choices: Albert calls to Fina for help
Albert tries to reactivate the puzzle
11211311131212.content:
Fina puzzled over the latest magical artifact in her collection. She continued to fail in her attempts to activate the item on understand its purpose. If she listened the squeals and shouting from the hall where Garrett chased the children about to their unending delight. Fina stood up from the jeweled puzzle box rubbing her eyes hoping a new perspective might help but nothing came to her. A break with a fresh might be the solution. She quietly opened the door to sneak into the chasing game. She crouched smiling in wait to scoop up one of her children to give them snuggles. Fina heard the pants from of her little Lyra exhausted from running. Watching look back to see if her father followed while catching her breath looking adorable in her blue dress. Lyra scampered past the door Fina struck from behind seizing her small child into her arms. Lyra cried out than began laughing as Fina engaged her with a flurry of kisses.

Fina set Lyra down who hurried down the hall. Fina gave chase tickling Lyra as she went. Laughter filled the air from parent and child as they came upon Garrett wrestling with her other children. He smiled up at Fina saying, “I have a meeting with Albert in a bit would please take over this important task?”

Fina returned the smile saying, “It would be my honor to help you in this valiant momentous task.” With that she inserted herself in the pile of little ones to her own delight. Garrett kissed Fina thanking her before standing up to get ready for the meeting with Albert. From orphan to family man the journey truly humbled him. Still his duties as a knight of the silver order of the griffin called him away again. At times he wished they demanded less of him but he put aside such thoughts as a servant informed him that Sir Albert arrived and waited for him.

Sir Albert wandered about the halls finding the hobby room as he thought of it of Princess Fina open he wandering in seeing a puzzle box of the table. Probably an ornate gift for Sir Garrett. He picked it up and began trying to work out how to open it. He nicked himself on a sharp edge dripping some blood on the box. He spoke an expletive dropping the box to the floor a beam of light shot out of it hitting Sir Garrett who came in hearing Albert’s voice. The light consumed the paladin who disappeared within as the light faded back into the box.
11211311131212.title: mishap with an artifact

1121132.content:
The dragon grinned in sinister delight looking at the pair revealing a concealed dragon figurine. A ornate metallic figure with glyphs carved into it. Sir Garrett nervously eyed it along with the dragon. The dragon said, "This artifact should aid us chromatic dragons to gain ascendancy over the lesser races. Our small numbers is the only thing that holds us back. With this artifact I begin to change that. The two of you will be the first to join my glorious cause." With those words Swamp Terror touched the artifact speaking incomprehensible words that lit the glyphs on the statue.

Sir Garrett yelled, "Run I don't know what this insane dragon means to do to us but I know it is ill intentioned." The paladin turned on his heels swinging around to make tracks but light from the jewels in the statues shot out hitting the pair of warriors. Excruciating pain seared into their bodies as they collapsed to the ground writhing and convulsing about. The only relief that came to them the unconsciousness that over took them.

Before they passed out they heard the laughter of the dragon turn to cries of pain. It too collapsed with a thud to the ground the artifact draining strength from it to fuel its strange magic. In the silence the magic began its work on the fallen warriors.
1121132.title: It wants to test a magical artifact that it found

11211321.content:
As the pair lay on the ground drastic changes coursed inside and out of their bodies. Their blood grew cold but still flowed inside them. Their skin pigment changed hue into a silvery metallic color. Muscles bulked up under their skin causing their bodies to bulge out against their armor. The strain grew to great and their armors burst open as their skin hardened like steel. The hardened skin became scales. Sharp claws formed out of their finger nails. Their faces shifted elongated taking on draconic visages. Powerful wings sprang out of their backs.

Icy breath shot out of Sir Garrett’s mouth as he yawned. He got up onto his four feet looking around confused at his perception increase. Awkwardly he turned around taking in the changed scene before him. A silver dragon lay on the clothing of Albert with the Black dragon collapsed on the ground tongue hanging out acidic juices leaking out onto the ground. The statue stood lifeless with no sign of activity. Garrett looked at himself realizing his own transformation. He didn’t dwell on it fear Swamp Terrors awakening. He couldn’t bring himself to strike down the defenseless dragon it went against his code of honor. He shook awake the silver dragon he imagined to be Albert.

Albert woke saying, “What is going on? A silver dragon did you save us from the black dragon?” The reality of the situation soon came to him. He looked down at himself bewildered. Albert asked, “What in the name of the gods is going on? Why am I a dragon?”

Garrett responded, “That artifact is behind this. We must take it and get out of here before Swamp Terror awakens. I fear the strangeness of our bodies puts us at a disadvantage in a fight.’

Albert asked concerned, “Why don’t we kill it right now while it is vulnerable? It would kill us if it could and will always present a danger to other innocents.”
11211321.title: transformed into metallic dragons

112113213.content:
Their conversation got tabled with the angry voice of Swamp Terror yelling, “What you are goodly metallic silver dragons? I will have to be more careful in my selections in the future. You live you learn time to correct my errors.” Swamp Terror stood up towering over even their silver dragons. It opened its maw spewing noxious acid at them. Instinct drove them to leap in opposite direct only partially catching them. The acid burned against their scales.

Albert cried out in anger and pain at the black dragon. With the cry an ice spray issued forth striking the black dragon. Garrett pounced on Swamp Terror his powerful teeth sinking into the scaly throat. His clawed latched on holding with all his strength.

Swamp Terror roared in pain slashing at Garrett to pry him loose. Swamp Terror pried Garrett loose at the cost of fearsome gashes on his neck with a large chunk ripped from his throat. Albert followed with furious claw attacks. Swamp Terror panicked with his acidic blood oozing out of his throat. He swung around to retreat into the swamp. The silver dragons pressed their attack. The wounds grew too numerous and deep. Swamp Terror fell to the ground bleeding onto the ground.

After insuring that Swamp Terror passed away Garrett checked himself for wounds. He found superficial wounds that throbbed. Garrett pushed aside the pain as looked over Albert who fared better in the battle. Garrett said, “How best to proceed now Albert? Shall we continue with our mission or seek a solution to our predicament?”
112113213.title: Swamp Terror awakens

choices: Go back to a village to find out more and let them and get help to bury the dead
push on to find the source of this evil
11213.content:
Albert fought with skill uncommon for one so young. He concentrated on the closest zombie to him taking it out first with several striking slashes. A zombie could take only so many blows before the magic maintaining it failed. Head shots did the most damage but they were a luxury of distance and precision that Albert had not yet gained. Albert's well muscled body quivered at the endurance test before him. The horde pressured biting at his chain mail armor but having little effect other than pinching with the compression. His plate helmet protected his head well but the constant flailing limbs striking him take the greatest toll.

Albert is shaken by the battering but continues unwavering in his strikes. Sir Garrett unseen by Albert whose caught up in the fury of the fighting nods approvingly at his squire. Sir Garrett again bashed back the on coming horde of pawing hands and gnashing teeth. This gave Sir Garrett the time to focus his faith and project it out through his holy symbol destroying the dark forces that now possessed these poor bodies. Many of the zombies lost the negative energy that drove them collapsing to the ground. A circle of bodies made a grim scene. The rest of the zombies shuffled slowly stumbling over their fallen brethren. Albert recovers some of his strength waiting for the next onslaught.

Sir Garrett could now see the end in sight. The mass of undead now sparsely together moved toward their food. He could see through them to the trees beyond. Sir Garrett pressed forward his attack giving Albert more time to rest. His dancing strikes struck home cleaving the skulls off a couple before they begin to bunch up again. They retreating and striking as they whittled them down further. Albert caught his breath and aided in the final push taking out the horde.

Sir Garrett looked at the bodies and saw that they wore peasant clothing. Someone probably kidnapped them from local villages. They were mostly men and the elderly the most likely to be prayed on alone at night. Local village women and children mostly kept away from the swamps at night. He figured that whoever did this was either not able to strike in the day on not yet bold enough.
11213.title: Albert is holding his own

choices: Something happens during Sir Garrett's watch
112132.content:
Sir Garrett said a quick prayer for the dead before deciding what to do next. He chose to press on fearing that others might be in danger or the necromancer behind it might grow bolder. Albert fought well and had no visible wounds that could cause worry. Albert felt slightly shaken but proud that he held his own and did not shirk his duty. Youthful spirit and sense of duty drove him on. Where Sir Garrett went Albert would follow even onto death. The pair cleaned themselves up a little had some food to eat and journeyed into the swamp.

The trek through the swamp moved slowly. The muck and thick growth took effort to move and cut through. Albert used his tracking deer through the swamp. Zombies make no effort to conceal their path combined with their numbers made the tracking easy. Every so often a random zombie or a couple appeared, probably broken off from the larger horde. Sir Garrett following Albert quickly took them out with well placed crossbow bolts. The sight of the zombies gave reassurance that they were on the right path.

They made camp as the sun began to wane. Sir Garrett felt they were close and would reach the force of dark magic tomorrow. He prayed their strength would be enough. Him and Albert decided to take turns during the night for watch. They lit no fires so their approach might not be noticed. The pair ate cold rations silently both hoping the night passed as quietly.
112132.title: push on to find the source of this evil

choices: They wait till morning to follow the Yuan-ti's trail
more yuan-ti come to the camp
1121321.content:
Albert listen for any noise out of the ordinary during his watch. He learned to take it seriously from ambushes he experienced over his time with Sir Garrett. The difficult part for him right now was the constant animal noises he heard. The swamp creatures seemed disturbed by something with all the rustling going on about the undergrowth. He tightened his grip on his weapon as he heard an odd breathing sound. A hissing noise that approached the edge of the camp that Albert faced. Albert hesitated waking Sir Garrett as it might just be a native animal just passing by.

He witnesses a snake man hybrid they were called yuan-ti in the monster manuals that he studied in the order of the silver griffin’s library. A vile race of creatures that would kidnap humans to put them through a revolting process to transform them into yet more yuan-ti. There could be no parlay between them despite their human intelligence. They sought only to enslave or transform any civilized race they came across. Albert called to Sir Garrett as he readied himself to cross swords with this snake headed monster.

The yuan-ti didn’t hesitate coming after Albert with arrogance at the thought of the fight. It took many humans over the course of months this one would prove no different. The creature found Albert a tougher opponent than any it faced before. Taking famers and villagers proved insufficient training against a skilled veteran. The blood drawn so far in the melee was its own. Another warrior started to approach blade drawn however the monster pondered running only momentarily when its head fell off from a well-placed strike from the young squire.
1121321.title: Something happens during Albert's watch

choices: an army of undead marches against the yuan-ti
11213211.content:
The pair decide to wait until morning the best course of action. The Yuan-ti with their darkvision ability to see in the blackest of nights held the advantage at night. Just before dawn they packed their gear and began following the trail the creature left. Though not elite trackers the pair found no trouble following the monsters trail. Sir Garrett feared that the Yuan-ti presence might be strong in the swamp, having grown over time. Their dominance might be leading them to overconfidence. Sir Garrett's main worry that a sizable force would be at the end of this trail.

Albert knew a little of the yuan-ti from the readings that Sir Garrett insisted on. Some could pass as humans or take the form of a viper. He quivered slightly thinking on becoming part of their dark transformation ceremony. All who succumbed to it became subservient to the yuan-ti cause. Only the power of gods or some archmages could undo the transformation. Not a fate that Albert intended for himself. He would force them to kill him before he would submit.

Sir Garrett signaled to Albert to stop. Before them lay a cleared path leading to a wooden watch tower. They could make out the shapes of at least two humanoid figures. Sir Garrett readied his crossbow with Albert following suit. They snuck closer the best they could in their chain armor. Sir Garrett felt a bit bare in only chain but the swamps treacherous watery nature made plate armor a dangerous proposition. Stealth didn't come naturally to the valiant paladin but wisdom told him to be cautious. He gestured to Albert to take the one on the right Albert nodded in response. The young squire took aim waiting for Sir Garrett's shot to signal the time to strike. The left one gestured in their direction just in time to find a crossbow bolt striking home in its neck. The right one turned in shock as it got hit in the side piercing its lung sending blood streaming down its side before falling next to the collapsed companion.

Sir Garrett jumped up making his way to the wooden tower. Albert fast on his heels readied another bolt to finish anything coming up. The pair rushed up the tower climbing in they saw a pair of yuan-ti on the floor start to struggle to get up at their arrival. With a couple slashes of his sword Sir Garrett finished the pair. Sir Garrett looked out to see wooden fortress set up in the distance. He figured the yuan-ti set this place up as a new base to act from. Albert and him might be able to take this place out but would they be able to call reinforcements from somewhere beyond? He could send Albert to get some help. Just then he heard a noise in the distance.
11213211.title: They wait till morning to follow the Yuan-ti...

choices: Yuanti take control of the battle
112132112.content:
Shambling corpses slowly made their way to the Yuanti's wooden outpost. Calls to arms sounded out among the yuan-ti as they gathered to meet the threat. Sir Garrett along with Albert sat as neutral observers. Sir Garrett whispered to Albert wait for the outcome of the ensuing battle. No sense in wasting their strength.

The arrows began to pour in from the ramparts. The scattered yuanti arrows came in haphazardly as the snake people gathered at the wall. The zombies walked forward as slow moving targets. Many began to fall on the approach but than Sir Garrett noticed quicker movement in the crowd of shambling corpses. Intermixed with the zombies’ ghouls ran to the walls.

Ghouls distinctive foul odor permeated the air around them. Undead monsters whose hunger for flesh drove them. Gaunt figures with sharp teeth and clawed fingers. Running to the walls after breaking from the mass of zombies. When the Yuanti realized the new threat, they turned their bows to the ghouls. Easily climbing the walls the first of the ghouls leapt at the snake people. Several of the yuanti got visibly ill from the stench given off by the ghouls. The strikes from the ghouls came quick and often. The Yuanti's light armor offered some protection but they were getting cut up bad. Concurrently the army of zombies began to reach the walls flailing against the wooden structure. Arms and teeth of the zombies worked on the wooden walls slowly chipping away as the zombie army surrounded the fort. Retreat no longer looked like an option for the Yuanti.

Sir Garrett along with Albert watched silently not sure who to root for. Sir Garrett wondered who controlled the undead army and if this might be a fraction of its strength. More intelligent undead might direct from the shadows or a foul necromantic wizard. Another Yuanti guard tower might of sent for reinforcements but right now the undead maintained an advantage in numbers and tenacity. Sir Garrett thought that with focus on the central structure whatever guided the undead army desired more yuanti to fight. Or, it might not care what came and desired something in the fort.

A cobra headed yuanti slithered to the wall. Only human arms distinguished it from a giant snake. It held a large curved sword swinging upon the first ghoul it came upon. The targeted strike cleaved the head of the putrid smelling undead. It led the other yuanti as it battled the ghouls that stalked the interior of the fort.
112132112.title: an army of undead marches against the yuan-ti

choices: a new figure enters the camp
1121321121.content:
The undeads’ strength proved too great for the wooden gate. The doors splintered and cracked until the doors broke open. The Cobra directed the fighting while rushing to engage into the flood of zombies filled the courtyard. The gnashing teeth with flailing grasping hands poured upon any of the living yuanti. A python one’s tail curled around a zombie squeezing till it split in two. Its strong arms knocking aside the zombies as they enclosed on it. One of the ghouls leapt on its back clawing at the pythons eyes. The python seized the ghouls head squeezing till the head popped. The distraction proved to be the python yuanti’s undoing as the zombies piled atop it. Bites from both sides with it only ending at the python’s death from blood loss.

The cobra carved up the zombies providing the creature little challenge. Other yuanti fared worse lacking the skill and strength of the large cobra headed yuanti. The rush of zombies fed well on the novice fighters ill prepared for the onslaught. A ghoul spewed a noxious fluid at the cobra who dodged while retaliating with its curved blade slashing a huge gash down its chest and stomach. The contents spilled out in a grotesque display. The ghoul lost none of its deadly drive claws slashing fury. The battle hardened cobra didn’t balk letting a one of the slashes glance against its scales so it could jam the curved blade into the skull. With the dark force that kept the corpse gone the ghoul fell limp. Flicking body free from its sharp blade. The cobra began its work thinning mob of undead until arrows poured into it. A group of skeletal archers moved in with a undead knight in armor directing their fire.

The zombie and ghouls moved about the fort looking to eliminate any remaining forces. The knight led the skeletons into the interior structures searching. Sir Garrett and Albert could hear the rummaging from the tower. Garrett decided that now they needed to make their move now with the undeads distraction.
1121321121.title: Zombies break through the walls

11213211211.content:
Sir Garrett understood the importance of strategy that is why he let both threats fight against each other. Now he decided to strike against the remaining dead figuring that him and his squire could finish the remnants of the undead. Garrett doubted that the undead knight was the supreme leader. But this group needed to be put down. He whispered to Albert, "Albert let's finish off the undead."

Albert nodded in acknowledgement. He waited for Sir Garrett to head down the ladder before following. Sir Garrett took careful aim with his crossbow waiting for Albert to set himself up. The paladin fired the first striking one of the zombies outside the fort dropping it. Albert subsequently fired hitting another one. They continued until they dropped the last outside of the fort. Moving up they could hear the undead tearing and eating their fallen enemies.

Garrett signaled to draw swords preparing for combat. The pair of warriors approached the wooden gates carefully insuring the fallen zombies true death. Garrett searched the woods seeing no further incursion of undead. They turned the corner and began hacking the feeding corpses apart. Albert fought to keep down the contents of his stomach. Revolted by the scene along with the stench. Garrett kept it together better his will steeled by a desire to eliminate the affronts to the natural order.

It took a few minutes for any of the undead to turn from their food. With no force driving them they lacked even the intelligence for self protection. The exterior zombies put up little fight to distracted by their easy meals. The few ghouls outside responded viciously realizing they were under attack. Garrett matched the attacks with strength and skill. Albert ensured none of the putrid ghouls encircled them. He stood two steps behind Sir Garrett stabbing anything that tried to move around the paladin.

The minutes passed with tense brutal combat. The ghouls fell one after another succumbing to the wounds delivered to them. As the last fell Garrett took a minute to recover saying, "Catch your breath we move next against a more intelligent foe. I presume it has a master as yet unrevealed so be ready. We may yet be forced to retreat."
11213211211.title: Strike at the undead

112132112111.content:
The undead knight stormed out of a building. It turns to the pair of warriors staring for a minute surprised at their presence. Wordlessly it pulled its sword out rushing up to them. Sir Garrett matched blades with it strike for strike. The knight attained great skill after so many deathless years. Its skills matched well against the young paladin.

Garrett worried as a few skeletons came out to aid the undead knight. Albert met them with his years of training. His eagerness helped him dispatch the first one as the skeletal bodies reacted slowly to the new threat. Albert crushed the skull of a second with the pommel of his sword. The last of the skeletons slashed at the squire who jumped back. The edge caught him enough to draw blood from his stomach. Albert ignored the pain continuing to press his attack.

Garrett suffered wounds as often as he delivered them. He eyed his opponent observing the grievous damage the undead monster fought with. Any living person would be dead but the monster battled on. He caught a glimpse of Albert conquering the last skeleton in front of him. Infused with confidence by the odds turning in his favor he pressed his attack.

Albert immediately joined the fray against the undead knight. The battle finished with a growl from the undead. It obviously had intelligence but revealed nothing to them. Albert watched for further enemies while Garrett used divine magic to heal his wounds. "What do you think that they were after?" Albert queried.

"My guess is that were after some item they thought the yuanti had. I don't think they got it or else they would of brought it out. I say that we search for a bit before we leave this place. See if you can find some rations. We will probably have to linger nearby to find the source of the undead. We'll set up camp nearby and see if we can ambush any reinforcements for either side." Garrett said planning out their next move.
112132112111.title: They triumph

1121322.content:
Sir Garrett sat watch while Albert slept during the darkest hours of the night. The moonlight illuminated the small clearing they set up camp. Though tired he remained alert to the sounds of the forest. He heard the rushing through the forest of several large animals. Garrett stood up readying himself for what came. His sword drawn he hesitated to call to his squire Albert as he knew not what arrived and it might still pass by. No such luck for the paladin as several werewolves came snarling out of the swamp.

Driven by furious blood lust they charged the ready Sir Garrett who called out to Albert that werewolves stalked them. He side stepped the first one slicing through part of its side. The next one he waited for the large clawed hand to come at him till he chopped it off in a sweeping motion as he leapt away from it. His jump crashed him into the last one that fell back its claws dragging along links of his chainmail failing to catch hold. Garrett continued forward with confident cut across the neck blood issued forth from the beast. He wasted no time spinning on his heel to face the remaining pair. They snarled at him as they renewed their attack on him. Despite they rushed him with speed.

Garrett met them with precision dodging their combined slicing through the leg of the one missing an arm. Following through with the strike pulling it up he split open the werewolf kicking it down as it bled out. Albert came running from the tent looking for hostiles. He witnessed Sir Garrett taking to head of a werewolf who swung at Garrett with a handless arm. The howls alerted the pair to more enemies on the way.
1121322.title: Something happens during Sir Garrett's watch

choices: Lizard men offer to join Sir Garrett
they offer magic to the pair
They talk of the evil in the swamp
1122.content:
Sir Garrett saw a lizard man looking at the camp before hurrying off when it realized the paladin observed it. More civilized than many of their kind the local lizard men upon being alerted of strangers would come back in force. The more backwards lizard men would probably ambush with no questions any intruders they found. Seeing his armor the local tribe would come and question the strangers. Sir Garrett didn't fear their return, he welcomed it. They might be able to guide him or let him know what dark rituals were being performed and why. Who another question that plagued him but he rarely got much information from King Emeril.

Lately Sir Garrett received less and less detail of the enemies he faced. Probably, the King hoping for his failure. Albert started cooking a stew over a small fire as Sir Garrett pondered the King. Would King Emeril concede his daughter's if Sir Garrett triumphed in the chill of the dark evening the paladin's doubt's surfaced. What should he do if the King broke his word? Sir Garrett swore an oath to the King but that might break all ties. He put away such thinking when he heard movement.

“Hail strangers if you mean no ill intent to the sharp teeth clan than lay down your arms.” A deep voice called out from the shadows.

Sir Garrett responded to the call, “We mean you no harm. We seek only to end the evil that now resides in this swamp. With your aid of knowledge, we will be better able to end the threat to your clan.” Sir Garrett placed his hands on his knees waiting for the party of lizardmen come to parlay. Albert continued tending the stew while waiting for the swamp dwellers to reveal themselves.

“Then we meet as friends. It gladdens the heart to see one of the silver order here. The strength of your knights is even known in the dread swamps. I am Hikozo chief spearman for the sharp teeth. We’ll discuss your quest in these and give what assistance we can.” The largest of the lizardmen said eyeing the pair.
1122.title: Lizardmen investigate the strangers to their land

11223.content:
Hikozo said, “I need to tell you of the evil that lurks in the swamps. An ancient mummy stirs deep in the swamps. We know not what causes him to stir only that his servants stalk the swamps for sacrifices to fully awaken their master. Not even the sharp teeth are safe. We no longer travel alone that we might protect ourselves form their attacks. The rituals performed bring more danger to our swamps. The elders talk of either moving on trying to strike at them. We travel in this hunting party that we may kill some of them. We have had some luck but they are numerous.”

Garrett listened intently asking, “Could you point us in the direction that they come from? We were sent here to put an end to the evil. Any aid you can provide would be appreciated.” Garrett looked into Hikozo’s eyes to display his seriousness.

The lizardman nodded pleased with Garrett saying, “We thank you for your help. There is an ancient stone temple that the elders speak of. Our people have long considered it taboo to approach it. I will have the others travel home to tell the elders. I will lead you the best I can to the temple. Protecting my people should not be left to strangers to our land.” The other lizardmen nodded their understanding before hurrying off to alert their tribe that aid arrived. Hikozo hoped that they might persuade the elders to a more proactive approach.

The elders of the slow conservative thinking angered Hikozo who personally knew many of those taken by the monsters. They seemed to believe that in time the problem would take care of itself. Never committing to any decision just growing fat on the labors of others. With Sir Garrett help he believed they might defeat the evil. With that fame he could become chief. Under his leadership the tribe would prosper.

Garrett said, “Albert and me appreciate your strength and knowledge to ours. It adds to my belief in our eventual triumph.”
11223.title: They talk of the evil in the swamp

1123.content:
The figure moved quietly in the underbrush watching the knight and his squire looking for a better vantage point to watch. She waited for the pair to settle down for the night setting the squire to the first watch before she dared to move in any closer.
