“The only choice you have is whether you wash up or get a beating? Choose wisely, princess. I think I will sell you to . . .”
11231121213.title: Samantha gets private lessons

112311212131.content:
“Prince Gregor seeks a bride and only the finest will do to provide him with heirs,” Bartok traced her curves with the coils of his whip. “Even if you aren’t a noble as you claim to be I think you will do. He has a thing for blondes. Unfortunately for me, he does not have a thing for forceful young with an overvalued sense of self-worth. The lady who will be his bride must be docile an obedient.”

“Don’t worry, one day my prince will come,” Samantha glowered at him as she washed.

“You shouldn’t sell yourself short. With a little attitude adjustment, something this place specializes in, you will be a fine wife to Gregor. Those hips will allow you to produce at least a dozen offspring, he has promised a bonus for each child his bride gives birth to.”

She had heard of Gregor and even met him a time or two. The eldest son of King Emeril, he was a warrior to be feared and a masterful general. He was often at the farthest reaches of the Kingdom quashing a rebellion or putting down an invasion force of a potential invader. Most viewed him as a bloodthirsty monster, to such an extent there was doubt he would inherit the throne but not Samantha.

Gregor was haunted by acting as the executioner’s ax for his father. The one to take the blame for all of the evils his father felt were needed. His desire for a docile wife was born likely out of a wish for peace than wanting an obedient slave girl as a partner. He would treat his well but she certainly wasn’t looking for a husband.

“I think it is only fair to warn you I have no attention to be a bride,” she doubted he would back off on this goal but she decided to take the shot.

“Oh you want to make this fun for me do you?” the man laughed. “Do you think you are somehow unique my soon to be, princess? Have you been in some tower away from the world to be so foolish? You are not the first woman with a little spine to come here. I have some ways to deal with you. As a matter of fact, I think I will have you pick your path to royalty, my dear. You can see visit our resident mage, he has a nice collection of items, spells, and magic to deal change your attitude.”

He circled her as she dried herself trying to pretend his stares and words were not bothering her.

“You could go the Hall of Pleasures and watch as your will is withered away as you give into the carnal lusts that dwell inside of all of us,” Bartok continued. “I am sure your groom will be pleased with the results my dear. Or if you have grown to enjoy my company you can stay with me, the master trainer. To help entice you into making that choice I shall start wearing the master key to this place around my neck. So which do you pick?”
112311212131.title: A Noble

1123112122.content:
“We are taking you to the slave markets,” the large man answer and turned to the unconscious Albert. “You fought well for your lady so I will at least give you a chance.”

The man tied up Albert but did no more harm to him, but he gave a look to Samantha that he would finish the man if she tried anything more while they were here, so she sat down in the cage and waited for the wagon to start heading to it’s destination. The other men looked like they wanted to finish off her apprentice but they only made moves to be on their way.

“You may be able to get out of those ropes in time but not before we have put a great deal of distance between us,” another of the said as they passed the unconscious form of Albert. “But I hope you find us because I would like a rematch with you.”

Samantha said a prayer to the gods to protect her squire while they were separated, because he had never fought on his own. This would be a harsh lesson for him that he would be the better for experiencing but there were real dangers of him not surviving. She had no ideas about how sever the injuries he had experience were, and she didn’t dare ask the slavers because with the mood they were in they would likely injure him more if she asked about him.

She felt naked without any weapon, she had always had some sort weapon with her since her childhood in the the halls of the Order of the Griffin. The paladin gave a slight laugh as she realized she was nearly naked already with her sweat from the combat soaking her clothing making much of it transparent. She was thankful the weather was warm here, but the night was likely to be unpleasant for her as she realized no one had any blankets, so she set her mind to escape from the cage. There was little to work with but she would find a way out of this threat to her freedom in time. Albert would come for in time if she failed.

It would be at least two nights until they were outside of the kingdom at the rate they were traveling, she thought as she watched closely the ways they were traveling. These were certainly back roads that were in serious danger of monster or bandit attacks, but they were likely trying to avoid any guards of the kingdom, so their activities were not entirely sanctioned despite what they said about being legal debt collectors. If they saw someone on the road they might be able to get some help though Samantha wanted to make certain she didn’t put any innocent people at risk because these slavers had already shone themselves to be dangerous.

Quietly as she could at the back of the cage Samantha tore a piece of her shirt off and wrote a message calling for help on it to be used if she saw a chance. The guards seemed to not notice what she was up to, or more likely they didn’t care what she up to at the back of the cage as long as she wasn’t near the lock. They knew there was little she could do to escape or threaten them, so why not leave her alone as long as she left them alone. The slavers had searched her for weapons and lock picks she remembered with a blush. Their hands had probed her body and crevices with a practiced touch from years of experience.
1123112122.title: Slave Market

11231121222.content:
She was cold during the night even after cuddling with the others, no blanket was offered to them when the darkness fell over the land. The slavers seemed amused by the suffering of their captives and she would make sure they paid the price for their crimes. As the days passed she was losing bits of clothing to drop messages but if her captors noticed they paid her no mind. They likely felt safer as they cross the border from the kingdom of Dar into the territorial lands.

Neither the Empire or Dar claimed the lands though both would like to eventually, they were too far from the controlled parts of either land. It was a no man’s land of danger and evil ruled by petty warlords feeding on the suffering. Dire Woods appeared to be their destination by the markers that he saw of animals and people staked along the road side. It was ruled by a self-proclaimed King called Eroc. His slave markets brought people from many nations around the world, the thought of being sent to somewhere she could never return from was more than a little frightening.

Small homes for stood just outside of the fabled triple walls of Dire Woods. The first was a great spike-covered earthen wall with a moat in front of it. Archers paced the walls watching the small wagon of slaves enter the gates but made no attempt to stop them, the night was when the real dangers came out to hunt. Great wooden timbers taken from the nearby primordial forest formed the second wall, one of the slavers raised his hand in some sort of signal and the gates were opened for them allowing them to come to the final wall. Stone walls that were over fifty feet height and thick enough that even the strength of giants would break against them stood as the final protection.

No one knew who had built this grand metropolis though the dwarves laid claim to it as they did most fine works of stone. Eroc’s ancestor had found it while trying to hide from some army that didn’t take kindly to the banditry he had been committing. He had formed a small place for him and like-minded criminals but most of the stone buildings inside of the walls remained empty.

They arrived at a market filled with men and women in chains lined stages as slave owners tried to sell them to crowds jostling for position. The wagon pulled to a halt and people quickly gathered to examine the new arrival with eager interest. Samantha and the other girls were left alone by the slavers who vanished into a shop. Men tried to grab at them and feel their bodies until guard smacked his shield reminding the people that the women were not their slaves yet so they took a couple of steps back but the leering looks and less than gentlemanly comments remained. Samantha looked over the crowds but she saw no one that she would trust with a copper piece much less getting them free.
11231121222.title: Follow Samantha to the markets

112311212223.content:
Samantha could hear her companions give slight whimpers but they didn’t dare to scream or call for help. There was a blood thirst to the crowd that told them they would only get violence for any pleas for help. Slowly they moved towards the stage as people were sold like it was a cattle auction as the paladin’s eyes searched for an opportunity to escape. The keys were close and she wished that she had the skills of a thief to take them.

A roar shook all of the people who were present drawing all eyes to the sky as a red object grew larger. Crowds of men shoved and rushed to get under cover as Samantha took her chance pulling the blade from a passing man and planted it in slaver with the keys. Her face felt like it might burn off as a great inferno of fire struck the street and melt many of the guards.

It was hard to ignore the deadly creature but she tried to do her best as she focused on freeing herself and the other slaves. The desire to run was clear in their eyes but it was important to get the chains off first. It was hard to run very far with chains on your legs especially in a city of slavers. Arrows bounced harmlessly off the scales of the dragon but it wasn’t willing to ignore the insult and it leveled a great fireball at them causing a group of men to vanish from the earth.

The paladin kept a wary eye on the creature trying to assess what was happening. It was large but not one of the ancient ones. It had likely been driven from its home and was looking to take this place or at least vent some rage at the loss. There was a nasty barely healed wound on the side of the red dragon that suggested the possible attack of another large predator.
112311212223.title: Fight

1123112122232.content:
If there was any chance of ending the threat of this place of death and misery was a chance she couldn’t pass up. Samantha grabbed a bow from a lifeless corpse and started the work of assisting the dragon down. She took a deep breath and allow her mind to slow the events transpiring around her to come up with the best targets. The dragon was having no problems with the archers but the ballista and any spellcasters could prove to be trouble for it. Her eyes didn’t spy anyone using magic so she focused on the large siege weapons.

She had been training since she was a child with the bow and the skill was proving useful now. A crew was working to get their aim right because they knew a miss meant almost certain death and they never notice the barrage of arrows that brought death upon them until they started falling. Samantha took a few moments to unlock the chains with the keys from the death slaver and spared an extra moment to spit upon the corpse before rushing to the ballista.

The defenses of the city were formidable to even the might of a dragon and they were starting to activate. A group of fearsome hills giants started to pour into the streets heedless of the smaller people they trampled. The dim creatures were better equipped with a padded armor emblazoned with the symbol of the city, a set of chains with manacles. They carried spears with them that they started to fling at the flying reptile while others flung whatever was at hand at their enemy.

It didn’t take long for a spear to pierce a wing of the dragon sending it into an awkward tumble out of the sky but not before a torrent of flames left one of the offenders and his companion dead. The creature scrambled for cover but another giant was preparing a lethal throw when it grunted in pain. A ballista bolt stuck out of his chest and he dropped dead to the ground.

The giants stood dumbfounded for a few moments as they tried to process what had just happened while Samantha ran from the siege weapon to try and take control of another. It wouldn’t be a good idea to get stuck try to move one of the bolts and even though hill giants were stupid they would figure out where the attack had come from.

Samantha had thought that the chaos would decrease as the guards of the city got deployed but things were only getting worse. Slaves were attempting to either make their escape or get revenge against those who had enslaved them. Slavers were rushing to flee the city bottlenecking things or they were attempting to recapture their goods. The general criminals of the cities saw the opportunity and were trying to steal anything they could while the guards fighting with all of the groups at once and quickly becoming overwhelmed.
1123112122232.title: Help the dragon

choices: Try to jump to the next building
11231121222322.content:
It didn’t take her long to decide going for another ballista would be a bad idea, a nearly naked woman with no armor would be at risk from a prepared group of armed and armored guards even with her training but the spell crafters were looking vulnerable. They were the leaders of groups of people and at this point, there was much more to deal with than the dragon at this point.

Taking careful aim with a crossbow Samantha saw a wizard trying to calm the crowds with magic and the efforts were ended with a bolt to the heart. Ducking for cover she quickly wound the string back and loaded another bolt. It wasn’t hard to spot those with magic even in the chaos because they were guarded by other and often wore arcane symbols because they took such pride in their differences from most others.

Carefully peeking over the edge she saw another mage blasting crowds away from large doors that were the entrance for a holding pen for slaves. More people on the streets would help a lot so she took the shot. The man cried out in pain as his arm was struck and the freed rushed forward to finish the job Samantha had started but the paladin didn’t have a chance to dwell on the success as she heard metal boots stomping up the stairs behind her. Guards were coming to take back the ballista.

Rushing forward with an ax she swung with all she could muster and chopped most of the way through the siege weapon’s rope and turned to run from this place. The distance to the neighboring roof was short enough that she hoped she could make it so she dropped all but her sword and made the leap landing in a painful jolting stop as she barely made it.

“Stop!” A guard screamed but she didn’t bother to turn to see if they were ranged weapons on her as she ran. An arrow snapped in front of her just before she hid behind cover. "You, men, go after her."

The paladin turned to see what she was dealing with so she could take the best course of action and catch her breath. It didn't appear that the men had any attention to follow her in jumps across as three guards headed back to the stairs which meant she had some time but an archer was watching closely for a target.
11231121222322.title: Try and attack spellcasters

choices: Try to take down the city
112311212223222.content:
She didn’t suppose everyone would pause for her to get a nice cooling drink of water, her body was certainly sweating enough to suggest a break might not be a bad idea and if enemies weren’t coming for her she might agree. Samantha wasn’t sure how long it would take them to get here but she wasn’t going wait for them to get her.

A quick prayer to the gods and she made her run to leap to the next roof and unfortunately the archer was watching very closely, letting loose the shaft as soon as she started to appear striking her arm sending her off course on her jump. Her legs gave her the distance she needed but the landing was off and she hit hard, the shaft snapped as she tumbled adding scraps and bruises to the wound but she wasn’t going to let that stop her and she moved quickly down the stairs on the building.

The chaos had expanded as newly freed slaves joined the fight, she took a chance to call on her magic some of her wounds but she was still sore by the time the magic was finished doing its work. It was easy to find new weapons as the body count mounted in the city. People ignored her, too focused on their own survival as battles became pitched.

Samantha cut through alleys and streets to get away from those who would recognize her as a threat were left behind, it would be best making surgical strikes unless she wanted to take a big risk. This might be the time to leave this place. Her mind debated her options as she took the opportunity to relax behind some baskets eyeing the blade she had picked up. It looked like it was in good enough shape for a few more combats.
112311212223222.title: Try to jump to the next building

1123112122232221.content:
With the attack of the dragon, the city had become vulnerable, a city of slavery that brought so much suffering to the world and she had the chance to put up a stop to it, she couldn’t pass up such an opportunity. Samantha knew the dragon would need back up against the forces of the city if it was going to do the damage she needed it to win the day. The fighting men of the arena were her best chance, they were also a serious danger. Even with the chaos of a dragon, people looting in the streets, and a few slaves making their escape attempts from the city they would not be unguarded.

A water barrel allowed her a chance to stop and collect herself, the liquid was warm and stale but it was a blessing all the same. She sucked deeply from it uncertain when her next chance to refuel herself would be. The closer she went to the arena the more things called down, troops were still moving towards the main market and the dragon so she was certain it wasn’t dead yet. From the bodies of the dead she had managed to collect some coins if she needed them for a disguise but she avoided shops for the moment, she didn’t trust her tongue to the deceptive arts, she had little practice in them. The time for her to come up with a plan was fast approaching.

The great gates of the arena stood a short distance away from her with past champions carved into the side of the great stone walls. Two men stood in front of the doors large enough to give a giant easy headroom. Heavy armor covered the features of the men and they made no movements as if they were made of the same stone behind them. Her cheap blade was unlikely to do the trick, these hardened warriors who were set to keep battle-tested warriors in chains, there might be the possibility to ambush one of them but certainly not both of them.

Many ideas came to her, she could try to climb inside or break the lock on another door, she wasn’t certain how many guards would be inside there. Perhaps she could get a sultry outfit to wear and pretend to be a prize to one of the fighters. Getting some of the other slaves to assist her but she was almost certain that many of the people she recruited would die in the battles.

Ideas about how to get inside were easy for her but she was certain the execution of any of the plans would be a lot more difficult. Samantha took a moment to observe the area as best she could from the ground, there didn’t appear to be any archers on the rooftops, most of the buildings appeared to be shops, none of them appeared to be weapons or armor related. A decision came to mind.
1123112122232221.title: Try to take down the city

11231121223.content:
The slavers halt their journey as the sun faded from the sky, but they didn’t pay much mind to the slaves as they go to prepare their evening meal. Samantha debated complaining about the failure to feed them or give them water, but decided against possibly drawing their anger. It was better if they forgot he was a threat to them. Eventually, long after the light had faded from the sky, one the slavers tossed them a water skin and a loaf of bread. All of them took an equal portion of the bread even though they were all hungry.

“How much for the women?” A figure in black armor stepped into the light of the fire causing the slavers to quickly grab their weapons.

“I am afraid the ladies are spoken for,” the leader watched the man carefully but kept his tone calm. “You might purchase one for the night if you want.”

Samantha watched carefully as the man seemed to ponder the offer. She looked over his armor to see if she could determine the man’s intentions. Her eyes could spy no insignia or markings which struck her as odd, because it was master work armor that was very expensive, and that usually meant the person wanted to let others know who they were.
11231121223.title: Slavers have an encounter

choices: Leads them to an old fortress
112311212232.content:
Suddenly she noticed a necklace on the man, and Samantha realized who this man was. He was a death blade, one of champions of the arenas of the Emperor. This person had slain over a hundred warriors in the blood games played by the Emperor. These slavers would be dead fools if they challenged this person. Samantha had never keep a close watch on the blood sports because she found the pitting of humans against each for entertainment disgusting, so she wasn’t sure of the man’s identity.

“I have no interest in haggling,” angry started to enter the gladiator’s voice. “Name your price.”

“Perhaps if we knew what you wanted the girls . . .” one of the slavers spoke up trying to buy time as he slid a small crossbow to the ready.

“I am not looking to become friends, name your price or make your attempt to kill me. I really don’t care which, but I will be going away from here with the girls.”

The two slavers began to rethink there thoughts of attacking this man as his confidence filled them with a chill. They took a moment to look at each other and decided they didn’t want to tempt fate over the slave girls. They would see if they could make a deal over the girls.

“We would need at least five thousand gold for the girls,” the slavers offered a ridiculous price in preparation for negotiations but they found the man had not been joking about his disinterest in haggling as he drew out several precious gems and placed them in the hands of the slavers.

The gladiator didn’t even wait for the stunned men to unlock the caged women as he slashed the lock with his blade causing the door to swing open. He waved the girls to move in front of him down a path to an unknown destination.
112311212232.title: Realize who the person is

1123112122323.content:
“If you try to run off on me, I will chase you down and kill you,” the armored warrior spoke as they arrived at a small clearing with seven horses. “These three are mine chose any of the others to ride.”

Samantha picked one without any regards to quality, because it was foolish to ride off when he had the best horses and two fresh spares. The other girls got on their horses and started riding, being very careful to avoid getting far ahead of the warrior. These trails were unfamiliar to her, but she kept an eye out for where she was and where she had been in case she needed to use that information later.

“Can you tell us your name?” Samantha asked. She was curious to know more about this person and see what the fate was going to be in store for them.

“I am call Butcher,” the man said.

Samantha searched her memories and recalled the name as someone who had never left an opponent alive in the arena. She prayed that his persona out side of the arena was different, but she would have to be very careful if she ever faced him in combat.

“You may want to go by another name,” Samantha offered.

“Why?” He asked curiously. “My name inspires fear and respect where ever I go. I have yet to meet an opponent who can beat me in single combat. Why shouldn’t I live under my name.”

Samantha felt anger and lost control of her words, “Because your words label you a monster! A mindless killer, is that what you want to be? Is that even you real name? You won your way out of the arena, do you want to continue living like the beast you had to be to survive the arena?”
1123112122323.title: Leads them to horses

11231121223231.content:
“Good,” Samantha responded. “Tell me your real name. The one given to you by your parents.”

“Evan,” the man said quietly.

“That is a fine name. Perhaps in the next town, we come to you can purchase us some proper attire. I will vouch for the money if you bring us back to my estate.”

“I can’t do that because I have a destination.”

“If this is about money, I can pay . . .”

“Money is not important. I was required to return with three women. One of you can go free but I must have the other three. I thought getting slaves would make this easier but it hasn’t. I am sorry but I need to have at least three of you.”

“I am willing to go with you, so send one of the others free, but perhaps I can help you deal with what you are facing. I am a paladin of the Silver Griffin if you can get me access to weapons and armor I can fight to help you.”

“There isn’t enough time for that. Besides fighting him wouldn’t free my sister from her curse.”

“What curse and who are you dealing with? I have fought many things over the years and know people who can break curses. It isn’t hopeless if we try.

“Spoken like a paladin. I am an arena fighter, the world is a cold and cruel place. I am not going to take a chance with the life of my sister for the possibility you can break the curse. Besides I don’t even know for sure you are a paladin. Last time I heard the order of the Silver Griffin didn’t accept women into its ranks. You look far more like a pleasure slave than a paladin.”

Samantha blushed at being called a pleasure slave, “It is true the order doesn’t take in women but I have been recently cursed with this form.”

He frowned at this news, “I am not sure you will be accepted by . . .”
11231121223231.title: "No"

112311212232313.content:
“The cult of the hunt has my sister,” Evan said in an almost whispered tone.

There were rumors they had been destroyed in recent years but Samantha was not surprised to learn the cult still existed. They always seemed to show up when after someone claimed to slay the last of them. The Order of the Silver Griffin had killed groups of these mad cultists on several occasions, but the head of the organization still remained a mystery. If she made it back to the order she would have to tell Sir Simon who had dedicated his life to the elimination of the cult.

The Cult of the Hunt transformed men and women into animals to hunt down and slay for some dark god or foul demon. Members were fanatical in their devotion and very careful about hiding the name of the one they served. If they held the sister of this man there was little hope because they often enjoyed toying with people, offering them false hope of buying the freedom of one of their relatives in exchange for more victims. In the end, they took everyone they could.

“They won’t give you your sister back,” Samantha spook up.

“They will if they know what is good for them,” Evan growled.

“The Silver Griffins have had to deal with them before. They won’t turn your sister back into a human and they will likely attempt to transform you as well. You must not trust them.”

“I can’t surrender my sister to them. I will slaughter the lot of them if they make any tricks in dealing with me. I am an honorable man and I always keep my word. I will turn over three of you to them and if they don’t deal with me I will make sure they regret that decision at that time.”

Samantha looked at the girls, the fear was obvious on their faces, but she might need to ask more of them. If she could be freed soon she might be able to get the assistance of Sir Simon who was likely to be nearby, chasing after the cult. This man was not listening to reason and she needed to get more help, so she rode up to the other slaves.

“I think I can get some help for us but it would require me being free to leave here with the rest of you being taken to the cult,” Samantha whispered to the others. “The only way I will do this is if you agreed to it. I could give a message to one of you to take to Sir Simon and remain here, so one of you can go free. If any of you have other ideas I am open to them as well. I don’t think that we have much time to make a decision because we are closing in on where the cult is supposed to meet him, he is checking his map a lot. There may even be cultist watching us, so we need to make our move and quickly.”
112311212232313.title: The Cult

1123112122323132.content:
“Janell should go because she knows the area and the people around here,” Marcella spoke up.

Samantha nodded at the wisdom of the words, “Go with my blessing and may the gods watch out for you.”

The young rode off with tears in her eyes and the paladin prayed for her safety. It might be unfair to be so worried about her but there were many dangers in this area beside the cult but if she had grown up around here she likely already knew about them. The others sobbed knowing their fate was likely to be death in the end.

They rode to a small valley that looked perfect for a trap but Evan wouldn’t listen to reason. Victories in the arena may have made him too sure of himself in the real world. The fights in the arena were dangerous but most of the battles were not traps designed to destroy you specifically. The cultists were likely to know all of the fighter’s strengths and weaknesses. They were sure to come with enough force to overwhelm the man if it is by the strength of arms or power of magic.

A beautiful woman was locked in a cage at the end of the valley with a robed man standing next to it. The red and gold robes of the cult of the hunt stood out even from a great distance. Samantha’s eyes scanned the trees on the hill for more cultist but she didn’t see any though she did see too much movement of the bushes and branches to think it was just the wind.

“I am glad to see you kept your word,” the dropped the hood from his head revealing as that glowed with a golden light. “As you can see I have kept my word as well.”
1123112122323132.title: One of us will go

11231121223231321.content:
“Your sister is an exquisite specimen,” the cultist said. “It is such a shame to lose her, perhaps you would like to join her and honor our god. If you and your sister were to survive the hunt, the rewards can be truly great.”

Sensing the mood changing Evan drew his blade, “Give me what I want and I will be on my way.”

“I thought for sure you would be interested in the challenge after so many impressive battles in the arena. What is one more risk after so many risks? I would hate to force things, hunts are so much more interesting when the subjects are willing. I am always interested in the rewards the people ask for and if you fail in the hunt perhaps there is something I can do for your loved ones.”

“All I want is my sister, it is the only reward I asked for in exchange for these women and you are betraying your word and if you do that I will make you pay with your life.”

“Fighting spirit, I like that, I bet you are very dangerous as an animal. I wish I could participate but as a high priest I am forbidden, it just wouldn’t be fair to the others.”

Figures started to come out of the woods in overwhelming numbers surrounding the small group of people. It was an ambush like Samantha had thought and there was little they could do to get away. The cultists held bows and crossbows ready to fire at their group but Evan seemed determined to not give up as he charged the high priest.

The ground blew up with a red light under Evan as a magic trap ignited trapping the warrior leaving the woman with the limited choices of what to do to escape the situation and Samantha debated which suicidal option to pick.
11231121223231321.title: Ambush

112311212232313211.content:
If Samantha was going to go down she was going to fight until the end so she charged the high priest with her horse. The man appeared to have a knife at his waist that she could use to threaten him and get the others to let them go. It was the plan of a desperate person but she didn’t have much better going for her.

Magic burst into life under the galloping animal trapping it as Evan had been but Samantha had already leaped off to roll on the ground towards the priest. A big grin formed on the man’s face at her efforts and she applauded her like this was some sort of performance and he was a mere spectator but she planned to show him the errors of his ways as she grabbed for the dagger.

The cult leader pivoted out of the way of the grab but the paladin spun her foot out tripping the man. He rolled backward and back onto his feet laughing the entire time. The man lifted his hand and called upon his magic, the world started to blur for Samantha but she fought the power’s influence on her and charged the man smashing his nose breaking it. She felt powerful hands grab hold of her as the cultists came to back up their leader. They quickly bound and gagged her as the priest wiped the blood from his face.

“You have a lot of fighting spirit,” the man eyed her closely assessing her. “Even having your hands bound you have fought better than any of your companions. Yes, you will make an excellent sacrifice to our God. I don’t normally do something like this but you are special, chose what animal you would like to become for the hunt? Perhaps you would consider joining us if you manage to survive the hunt because I am sure you would produce superior offspring.”
112311212232313211.title: Take high priest hostage

1123112122323132112.content:
It was better to make a choice instead of letting the decision made for her,” A displacer beast.”

The high priest’s smile grew even larger, “I knew you would make an excellent choice. Come with me into the temple and we will begin the ritual. You must survive for three days, you can return here safely after that time and I shall return you to human form. Have you thought about what you would like as your reward?"

Samantha nodded, “I want all of the others released and allowed to go free, that is all that I want from you but how do I know I can trust you after you have betrayed the trust of Evan.”

He looked genuinely hurt by her suggestion, “This is part of the grand hunt. It would be sacrilege to dishonor our word. You shall have your reward if you are successful and to prove it I shall place a sacred oath upon myself.”

A doorway opened in the cliff face as the man started to chant a prayer binding him to his words on penalty of death and banishment from the realm of his God for all eternity. Samantha was surprised at the dedication of the man to such a foul being as these cultists worshiped. Depictions of grand hunts decorated the walls they passed some with the people surviving and being rewarded grand treasure but far more with the people being hunted down and slain like animals whose form had been thrust upon them.

She went as she was directed to the center the room on a large platform and removed her clothing so it wouldn’t be destroyed when she was changed. The ceiling opened to reveal the light of the moon which illuminated her beautiful naked form. She started to feel a bit of a chill from the cool of the night air as the chanting of the cultist started but heat started to fill her body as the chanting grew more fervent causing sweat start forming on her body.

Pain lanced her body dropping her to the cold stone below her, struggling to her knees so that she might show she was stronger than the pain. Black fur started to coat her body as she got to her knees, she knew she didn’t have long before the change would stop walking erect so she lifted herself to her feet. Samantha cried out in pain as two legs grew out of her body but it didn’t end there, two tentacles grew from her back with sharp spikes on them but she didn’t fall on back to the ground. Finally, biology won the fight against her will as bones shifted and stretched as she took on a more panther like shape. Powerful jaws replaced the soft features of her feminine face and there was no more a lovely woman but a powerful monster feared by many. Her roared echoed through the chamber.

“On the third rise of the moon, you will have claimed victory and will be welcomed to return here to become human once again. You shall be hunted until that time comes by us, the servants of Basha, I pray that you and we honor him with this great hunt. We will give you one hour to flee, hide or make peace with the death we bring. I hope you have the fight within you that I have seen in you. I shall pray that you are victorious over the hunters and prove the spirit of the wild is still strong inside of humans, that we have not forgotten what it is to kill to survive.”
1123112122323132112.title: Displacer Beast

11231121223231321122.content:
Samantha took cautious steps, getting used to moving with six legs instead of two was strange but it appeared she had some of the monster’s instincts as she quickly picked up the movement and was soon racing into the woods. Going deeper into the woods would slow the horses of the men who followed her and confuse many of the men who sought to track her.

She had read about their hunting style before, they would work in small packs of men with many styles of hunting from horseback to using animals to track and kill the prey. Having seen the large number here she would have to be prepared for just about anything over the coming days. Most of the hunters weren’t likely to chase her in the dark so she decided she would test some of her new abilities. Samantha located a small stream and eyed the fish in the water with hunger. The spiked tentacle smashed the water scattering the fish, a miss, but the strike of her second tentacle it. She swallowed the small creature glad to have the food. Moving through the water slowly to test how stealthy she could be and force anyone following her trail to look up and down a river for it to continue.

Focusing her strength she leaped into the air onto a thick branch ten feet in the air slamming into wood shaking the tree. A tentacle instinctively wrapped up around a higher branch and pulled her up solidly on the branch. She jumped from tree to tree getting better and more confident as she went but she still preferred to have her feet on the ground so she dropped to the ground moving quickly through the woods glad her eyes made the world daylight even in the low lights of the forest at night. She had a good sprint she found but she wasn’t an endurance animal. It was as she suspected because the displacer beast was an ambush predator it didn’t need a lot of endurance.

The paladin selected a large grove of trees near a river to act as a base of operations for time being and curled up high in a tree to rest until morning. She would decide if she should change plans at that point. The waiting was part of the torture of this terrible game, she would never know when they were coming for her or from what direction.
11231121223231321122.title: Go deeper into woods

112311212232313211223.content:
She awoke in the early morning to the shine of the sun just peaking over the horizon and decided she didn’t want to stick around all day waiting for hunters to appear. Perhaps, doing some hunting of them would change the minds of other about what they were doing. Samantha was getting used to traveling in the tree tops so moved a distance away from her temporary home before hopping to the ground. She moved slowly to keep her energy for when she needed it.

The forest was very different from being human with her enhanced senses of a displacer beast. The racing heart of a rabbit was in a hole under a nearby tree and several squirrels watched her with caution but they didn’t need to be afraid because she was hunting larger prey. The sound of a breaking branch drew her attention causing her to smelled prey that walked on two feet.

An elf traveled ahead of her party so the others wouldn’t disturb her tracking. The prey was learning quickly how to handle her new body and that thrilled her. Usually, the prey on these hunts were usually stupid and cowardly creature that was little more exciting than a deer hunt, but she knew Samantha was different when she saw the use of the river and the testing of movement. This was going to be a good hunt she thought as the spikes of the tentacle smashed into her skull ending any further thoughts. Samantha laid the body down gently to diminish the noise and quietly jumped into the tree hoping the other hunters wouldn’t suspect she was watching from above.

“She’s dead,” a halfling said to the others as he examined the body a few minutes later. The others cautiously moved forward looking for signs of their prey.

The hunters didn’t notice her high above them in the tree examining those hunting her to determine if they were vulnerable. A half-orc shaman was looking at the corpse trying to see if anything could be done as the male halfling circled the area to try and find the monster. The final target made her the most nervous, it was a dwarf in heavy armor watching his cleric companion’s back, it would be hard to find a vulnerable spot on him.

“There is nothing I can do without us losing hours on a ritual,” the shaman grumbled to the others.
112311212232313211223.title: Attack

choices: Look for a place to hide
1123112122323132113.content:
The paladin knew these people were used to hunting in the wild and any beast she became was almost certain to be hunted down by riders on horseback so she decided to play against them as she walked to the pedestal. There were spider webs below her that indicated the sublevels were not visited very often and she could see a couple tunnels so it wasn’t just a giant pit around her. It gave her an idea of the creature for her to become.

This temple in the mountain bore great carvings of hunts of the past and even a few of them held victory for those who were hunted giving her some hope of success. Samantha watched as the ceiling opened above her and the symbols lit up below her. Her body froze for a moment as she felt something beckon her to pick a new form and she did, she would play their sick game and make them pay the price for it.

Her body started to convulse as the change started to happen to her, Slime started to ooze from her body as it swelled dropping her to the ground. The clothing she was wearing popped off of her body as she grew over nine feet with her legs vanishing as they merged into her body. Her eyes swelled becoming far more sensitive to light. Small legs sprouted from her body far more than a human should have as paralytic tentacles sprouted from her face as part of the deadly arsenal of the carrion crawler she was becoming. An underground dwelling creature feared by adventurers as they traveled through the dangers of dungeons.

Samantha took some tentative steps with her new feet as the people stared at the strange creature stood before them. Many had likely never even heard of such a creature existing and had no idea of the dangers it would present to them, only the most foolhardy of people went below the earth seeking adventure, the drow, mind flayers and even fouler things lurked within the halls of the Underdark. She hoped to teach them a few lessons on the dangers of dungeons.

She held her breath as she went over the side of the pedestal, crawlers could move across even the most slippery of ceilings with ease but she had never been known to walk on walls when she was an armored paladin. To her delight, she found she could move with ease across the stone and dashed down into the darkness which was as clear as day to her new eyes. Her large body allowed her to easily reach across the span to the hallway and moved passed the webs into the unknown beyond.

The high priest clapped his hands together with glee, “I knew she was given to us by our god! What a blessing by Basta! A chance to properly explore his great halls! Let the hunt begin in one hour!”

Word quickly spread and dozens of hunters entered the temple eager to add another trophy to their walls.
1123112122323132113.title: Another predatory animal

choices: Send horse off in another direction
Try to locate where she is
112311212232313213.content:
It was obvious that that priest had powerful defenses around him and she didn’t know how to free Evan so Samantha decided to try and ride for freedom. Her hands were bound but it only hindered her riding a small amount as she charged the cultists at the entrance to the valley. They pulled out a net to fling at her but she had been watching for the attempt and jerked her horse out of the path of the attack and into a couple of the enemy knocking them to ground. Samantha hoped they broke some bones but she couldn’t spare a glance if she hoped to be free of them.

“Excellent show!” the high priest yelled. “I wish you luck, don’t worry I shall find you and reward you if you manage to escape our clutches!”

Samantha heard the sound of several crossbow bolts slamming into the trees near her as she weaved through the forest hoping to put some distance between her and those with projectile weapons. Her horse cried in pain as an arrow struck it but the horse managed to stay in motion. The sounds of the hunters faded as the horse and rider sped away from them but she was certain they would still be on her trail.

The paladin pulled to a stop near a small stream so she could take care of things. She let her horse rest as she cut herself free from her bindings with a sharp rock. The arrow in the horse didn’t look good, it would certainly slow the animal even after she had tended to the injury. She called upon a prayer of healing and the wound looked much better but it still looked a little sore. The territory around here wasn’t very familiar especially after all of the weaving through the forest she had done but Samantha would do her best to find someone to help the others.

It would likely be too late to help the others but she had to try. Perhaps they would hunt her down until they found her instead of starting another hunt so any time she wasted would help but she didn’t know enough about the working of the cult to be certain what their actions would be other than hunt her down. The paladin wondered what escaping the hunt meant, was there some sort of time limit or distance to it? If she knew she would do her best to achieve it but for the time being escape was her best bet.

She eyed the horse and wondered how good the trackers following her would be. If she sent the horse separate from her it would likely confuse the hunting party especially if she traveled down the creek to hide her tracks. These men were known to hunt animals but would they notice the loss of her weight? The loss of the horse would greatly hamper her speed which she might need if the cultists found her though right now she didn’t even know where here was. Perhaps she should take some extra time to figure out where she was.
112311212232313213.title: Try to ride out

1123112122323132132.content:
Samantha hadn’t seen many horses in the cultist group so she decided to keep her horse and put some distance between her group and her enemy. It was hard to track while on horses and it would take time to get hunting animals on her trail. She pulled to stop when the light was fading from the sky and more importantly when she found a road. The road would hide her trail as it faded with those of many others so she got off the animal and walked beside of it.

She hoped there was a city near her so she could get some clothing and a warm meal but she expected to have sore feet before she stopped for the night. There was a good chance that some of the cultists found the road and came this way and as a buxom blond with impressive curves people were sure to remember her.

As she walked the path she checked the saddle bags to see what she had to work with and it wasn’t much. If she sold most of the goods she wasn’t likely to make more than a few silver and certainly no gold. There was at least some food and a few water bags so she wasn’t going to lose out on fuel for a while but she would need money if she was going to get home. The thing that worried her most was the lack of weapons so she couldn’t fight off enemies or even hunt for food. Unless she encountered a friend or particularly generous soul, she would need to work and with her new form, it wasn’t likely she would be offered a job as a warrior.

The light had faded from the sky but the moon was nice and large this night giving her plenty of light to travel by when she came to the crossroads. She felt a lot better about how things would go after she had picked a path from the crossroad because it would split the cultists following her.

Donal was a fearsome mining town where she wouldn’t be expected to because it was a dead end without anything for miles around. There would be a lot of money flowing through the town which would give her a good chance for earning the money she needed but there was a lot of bad men in such towns. People who were greedy for money and the pleasures that it could bring and they don’t care what they have to do to take it.

Green Fields was a farming community in the direction she wanted to head but there wasn’t much work to be found there besides farm labor that didn’t pay much. There was an off chance that she would be able to find a job at the Inn as a waitress but it likely didn’t pay much thought there was the chance that she could meet someone from her estate that she could convince of who she really was and they would help her back to home where she could make further plans.

Spiral Corner was the last direction and it was in the opposite direction that she wanted to head. The cultists were not likely to think that she headed that way and it offered a powerful motive in the magic school on the grounds. She didn’t have the money to pay them but sometimes the school was willing to take a test subject in for the experience of the students which may let her transform back into a man. There was plenty of work in the marks selling goods and it was possible you could even get a commission on what you sold if you worked for a certain merchant.

Samantha let herself have a few minutes to think about the path she was going to take but the sound of phantom hoof beats echoed in her head of the cultists giving chase. Few targets ever escape one of their hunts so she would need to make the decision quickly and hoped she was right because she wanted to go back for the other as soon as possible.
1123112122323132132.title: Ride horse

11231121223231321321.content:
Donal seemed the best choice for making money quickly, especially because she had been there a few times to clear threats in the mine so she had paths to get out of the place if the cultists found her. She wondered if they would even be able to recognize her after she got cleaned up. It was tempting to spend some of the little she got on the superior baths in the city but it was better to save it because it was likely the work she got would pay for her to get a bath.

The noise of loud obnoxious music could be heard long before she arrived at the gates at the bottom of the mountain. Guards could see his approach from over a hundred yards off as the forest had been cleared and the place was illuminated with magical fairy light.

“What is your business?” A half asleep guard said behind the safety of the gate.

“I am looking for work,” Samantha answered. “I would also like to sell my goods.”

The man looked her over before waving another guard to open the gate, “I am sure you will find plenty of buyers for your goods.”

She ignored the under current of the comment and walked her horse inside the gate, glad to have the walls between the cultists and her even if she knew they only had to hide the symbols of their dark master to gain entry. Samantha saw not much had changed for the town in the time since she had last been here.

Hours stood between her and dawn but there was still heavy activity in the town that never slept. There were people celebrating fortunes they had won at the casinos and heart broken people who had lost fortunes trying to drown their losses. Predators watched from the shadows to take from both groups. She didn’t want to get rid of the horse but she needed to because she couldn’t afford to keep it.

“I would like to sell my horse,” She stopped at Lucian’s Stables, run by an elf who was always up for business.

“Is it stolen?” Samantha knew that wasn’t a deal breaker for the elf

“It isn’t but I would like it to not be here in a short period of time. I would be willing be willing to throw in the saddle and bridle for the promise.”

“I accept the deal. This is a fine animal, I will give you fifty gold for my promise of silence and seventy-five if I am allowed to take bribes for those looking for you.”

It was more money than she had hoped for and it might be enough to get her home, “I will take fifty gold and wish you a good day.”

“Always a pleasure doing business,” Lucian took hold of the horse. “If you have future business please stop by.”
11231121223231321321.title: Donal

choices: Take a tour of the city
112311212232313213212.content:
She would have to be careful with the money she had gotten if she was going to get home. Samantha went to the shops and looked for simple clothing to replace the torn and dirty clothing she had been wearing. Thankfully a few of the shops had simple clothing, most likely for the miners at very reasonable prices. She bought that would hide most of her curves and a hood to cover her hair and face. Most people would think she was on a pilgrimage in this outfit and it would hide her appearance from anyone who would be looking for her new form.

One thing she felt she had to do was to take advantage of a bathhouse. She loved the heated baths that the furnaces of the smelters made possible. When she had been in the area previously she took advantage of the luxury baths but she didn’t have the money for that right now, not if she wanted to take a carriage home, so she picked one of the others.

Samantha dropped her clothing in the trash of New Day Spa, glad to be rid of them before sliding into the warm waters of her private bath. It wasn’t a very big tube but at least it was clean and there was soap to wash away the grime and dirt of many days of travel. Her breasts felt wonderful as she caressed them, telling herself she was just getting clean. She slipped beneath the water as she orgasmed to keep the other patrons from hearing her cries of pleasure as her hand rubbed her vagina.

Drying her body with a rough towel was not nearly as pleasant as the bath, she smiled at the thought. Her nipples were still erect from the experience hoping for more attention but she had places to be.
112311212232313213212.title: Buy passage on a wagon

1123112122323132132121.content:
The paladin would have liked to relax in a nice steam room but there was none available at this business. She sighed as she prepared to put on the rough clothing she had purchased earlier when the curtain was pulled wide open to reveal a man holding a dagger on her. Samantha looked at the man to see if this was a cultist or something else.

“You are coming with me and don’t give me any trouble or you get the blade,” the man quietly hissed at her.

“What do you want?” Samantha stepped back from the blade as if she was afraid, but she was moving towards a dagger. “Is it okay if I get dressed?”

The man paused in thought as he looked around for witnesses and nodded as he realized that walking through town with a naked woman might be noticed. Samantha was certain the man hadn’t seen her dagger at the back of the tub yet but he would notice soon after she grabbed it so she slowly bent down to put on the dress. The man was clearly nervous, she looked but she didn’t see any signs of the cultists she was fleeing and the man’s head jerked down the hall at the sound of someone yelling at the temperature of his water giving Samantha the chance to grab the dagger and rushed the man.

His eyes widen as he turned back to her but her blade had already entered his throat before he could react. A good evening was ruined by this intruder and if she wasn’t careful he could ruin the rest of her life. The man didn’t look familiar to her but she hadn’t gotten a good look at most of the cultists.

She could try to contact the authorities about what happened but that might draw unwanted attention to herself, and she didn’t know if she had time to check the body to see if there were markings or a note to identify the person or the group he belonged to. It would certainly look incriminating if she was caught with the body of a dead man. Her final thought was that she could run for it but there was a good chance there were others outside waiting for their companion. Someone was going to finish their bath soon and notice the body decorating the wall so a decision needed to be made.
1123112122323132132121.title: An intruder

choices: Find a way out of town
11231121223231321321212.content:
She decided that she needed to get out of here in a hurry because she didn’t have much in the way of weapons to defend herself with so she threw on her robes and rushed out of the place hoping to be far from here by the time the body was discovered. Samantha stepped from the bathhouse to the chill of the night air and saw two men by a covered wagon.

The men pretended to not notice her but she could see their glances as they whispered to each other and it made her want to go back inside to grab the short sword to protect herself with. She kept herself on her path away from the men and listened closely for footsteps behind her and to her dismay, she heard the men had started down the road after her.

Samantha moved quickly as soon as she turned the corner and was out of sight of the men. They could be innocent but she doubted it. The town was filled with life but few of them were in this part of town at this time of the night, they would be seeking the pleasures of the flesh in the red light district. Spying a small alcove in a garden she ducked in and crouched in the shadows waiting for the men to pass. This felt like cowardice but it would be foolish to confront them when she didn’t know if they were even enemies and she would need surprise if she was going to take them out.

“Where did she go?” the mustached man asked. “She can’t have gone far, she was only out of sight you a few moments.”

“How do you even know this is the girl Garn spoke about?” his bearded companion complained. “If we don’t find here I say we head to the Red Lady and enjoy the rest of the night.”

“If we don’t find her and take her in we aren’t going to have any money for the Red Lady.”

The Bearded man shrugged, “I don’t want to spend all night looking for a girl who may have the guards looking for us. Let’s check on Garn and go to the Flea’s Nest and pray we don’t go blind from their liquor.”

“I would much rather have a lady to curl up in my lap lovingly and not those hags the Flea has working for him. I sometimes wonder if he held a contest to find the most hideous wretched beings in the land.”

“They won’t look half so bad after you have had some rot gut in your belly.”

“Fine, but we have to hear what Garn says first before we go.”

The other man nodded in agreement and the paladin watched as they left and breathed a sigh of relief.
11231121223231321321212.title: Run for it

112311212232313213212121.content:
If she didn’t follow the men now she would never know what they were up to in the city and why they were after her. Samantha tried to tell herself that she wasn’t being foolish that the men wouldn’t suspect she was following them but she knew to learn more that she would have to get close to them and they would know who she was in these clothes. If she was going to go to the Flea’s Nest she knew the sort of outfit she would need.

She hoped the man named Garn hadn’t given the others too many details about her appearance because they were going to get a clear view of her figure tonight. Samantha moved into a clothing shop where the clerk looked surprised to see someone in such conservative clothing enter. Much of the clothing was transparent or seemed so tiny that she wondered how anyone managed to fit in the stuff much less go out in public wearing it. This was starting to seem like an even worse idea but she had to know if they were trafficking in people, she couldn’t let innocent people suffer because she was a little embarrassed to wear an outfit from this place.

The man working the shop’s eyes nearly popped out of his head when he saw a gorgeous blonde emerge from the hood and he rushed over to got her measurements which she allowed to get this over as quickly as possible. His hands often strayed over her curves, gripping more tightly than she thought was proper and the fingers drifted over parts of her body that she was certain he wasn’t measuring.

“I think you have done enough “measuring,”’ Samantha drew her dagger for emphasis and he took the hint and grabbed a few outfits. She could tell that this wasn’t the first blade to be drawn on him.

“I apologize for my behavior with a discount to any of your purchases,” the man felt slimier than any ooze she had seen in her adventures but she needed the discount so she accepted. With the discount, she was able to purchase a couple of outfits and went into the dressing room to put one on, making sure to check for peeping holes and plugging them before changing.

The blue dress she wore was cut and followed her curves with close scrutiny. She left the shop to the pleased leer of the shop worker and headed towards the Flea’s Nest. Samantha took the long way to the bar because she had to get used to the looks she was getting and the attentions of men as best she could before she got to the bar. Pressing her arms tight to help fight the chill in the air just served to enhance her already impressive bust. The crowds of people started to grow as she closed the distance to the Flea’s Nest.
112311212232313213212121.title: Follow them

1123112122323132132121212.content:
She felt the powerful grip of calloused hands take hold of her and yank her into the body of a powerfully built man who pressed his lips onto hers. The kiss was crushing and verged on painful as the man pressed her lips against his with the aid of his other hand on the back of her head. The grip quickly loosened as Samantha connected her knee with the man’s groin. Laughter filled the crowd at the pain the man was feeling.

“I suggest you keep your body parts to yourself if you don’t want to lose them,” Samantha yelled at the crumpled figure.

“It was just a kiss you bitch!” the man grabbed at her leg but she was ready for this and jumped aside before slamming a foot into his other hand and grinding it into the ground. His screams of pain drew no sympathy for the man only cheers of celebration as people started betting on the contest between the miner and the woman.

The man stood over a foot taller than her and his body was layered with muscles from years of hard labor but the beautiful blond appeared to have experience with combat, Samantha moved with the experience of a seasoned warrior keeping her distance from the superior reach of her opponent waiting for for a chance to strike. Many of the people were trying to determine who this newcomer was so they could decide on the odds. People were suggesting she was a dancer or a whore and debating the advantages and disadvantages of each. Samantha tried to keep her focus on the man in front of her.

Samantha didn’t like all of the attention she was getting on this because it was going to make observing the men she was after harder but she had hurt this man’s pride too much she could see. He was not someone who would let a loss go especially a humiliating one. The man was a brawler, he could take a beating but he was undisciplined and wild with rage. The paladin felt naked without armor, as a matter of fact, she felt just plain naked considering her outfit but at least there wasn’t enough of the outfit to hinder her movement.

Drawing her dagger she dropped her bag aside so it wouldn’t be in the way, “I am good with this blade, I suggest you back down.”

She doubted the threat would work but she needed every advantage she could get. The crowd had formed a ring around the pair and it was expanding in size as more pressed in to see the blood sport. Samantha had a small hope that the guards would intervene but she doubted they came to this section of town and for all, she knew they might be the people taking the bets. There would be no running from this fight as people were already jostling for any small space to witness the fight to come.
1123112122323132132121212.title: Grabbed by someone

11231121223231321321212121.content:
“I am going to teach you some manners,” a malicious grin formed on the man’s face. “Bartok is going to bend you over that hitching post and ride you all night long like a rented mare.”

More than a few faces in the crowd looked pleased by the thought but Samantha had no intentions of giving them what they wanted. She was going to take apart this man piece by piece if that was what it took to win. The man was wary of the dagger keeping all of his focus on it which was a mistake as she held it wide and high and darted in low and kicked with all her force into the man’s already sensitive genitals. She straddled his writhing body and pressed her dagger to his throat before he could recover. Cheers of victory and cries of defeat waved over the crowd but she ignored them as she leaned in close to him.

“This can be over in one of two ways,” Samantha growled into his ear. “Death or life, which do you choose?”

Hate still filled the eyes but defeat was there as well, “Life.”

It was barely a groan but it was clear so the paladin stood and started walking with a confidence she hadn’t felt in awhile. Samantha held her dagger firm as she started walking through the crowd because she didn’t mind a pat on the back for congratulations, she strongly suspected there would be many slaps on her butt if she didn’t present herself as still a threat. Many thanked her for the money they had earned betting on her but she noticed no hands were offering any to her.

“Miss, that was an amazing fight, my name is Elmer and I could use a girl like you,” an older gray bearded dwarf called to her. “I pay top wages for someone who can fight like that!”

“I would like to offer you a drink for the money you have earned me this day,” a golden eyed elf spoke up through the crowd.

It was tempting to sit down with them and listen for some time so the crowd wouldn’t follow her into the Flea’s Nest but she wasn’t sure how long the people would drink there so she might be running out of time. It might be nice to have some company to give Bartok sometime to realize attacking her again might be a bad idea on the other hand. Many people were pressing in upon her trying to gain her attention with offers that were far less appealing to her than that offered by the elf and the dwarf. She imagined that some of them were just trying to get a rise out of her because they felt safe in the crowd but if they came too close they would discover how wrong they were.
11231121223231321321212121.title: Fight!

112311212232313213212121211.content:
“Alright, I will take you up on that offer if you can get me away from this crowd,” Samantha said to the elf.

“I would be glad to,” he took her hand and guided her away from the area into a more expensive looking section of town. “My name is Vaeril, may I be so bold to ask the name of the lovely warrior who has won me a sizable pouch of gold.”

“I am called Samantha but you can call me Sam if you like,” She responded.
