As a paladin, she had never taken part in lovemaking and she didn’t want to give it up just because she had changed forms.

“I really like him,” Celia smiled. “Should we invite him over for tea or other things later?”

“This is going to be a long journey,” Samantha said.

Lady Samantha went to her room and dropped on her bed and debated what to do about the heat she was feeling in her body. She needed to find some relief from these urges so she could think more clearly about things. Maybe it was time to explore this body more closely. She eyed Celia as she chuckled to herself and put away clothing and wondered about talking to her. She wasn’t sure she would be serious though so he hesitated to talk to her. Looking down at her body she realized it would be hard to find a man to assist her exploring her body. She debated what to do next.
11231121231333221111333311.title: Meet the others

choices: She 'fesses up to the shopkeeper to get him to free her trapped wrist
She calls in the slave maid and tells her to go fetch a manacle key
1123112123133322111133332.content:
The slave goods shopkeeper was a small oily-looking merchant but his speech was oddly precise with an upper-class accent. A nobleman fallen on hard times, perhaps or a disinherited son or a fitz-bastard, there was no way to know.

"A strange request, Milady." These -" his hand gestured to the chastity belts on display in his inner sanctum -- "are usually worn by slave girls whose owners wish to, ahem, keep chaste for their own reasons."

Samantha winced internally as she looked at the evil metal contraptions but kept her face serene. If Ashley was correct Sir Thomas was barely trustworthy when faced with female pulchritude and she wanted, NEEDED some further reassurance in that regard and these devices seemed the best way. They were going to be unpleasant to wear but...

She pointed at one belt. "Is that why they have manacles on the waist strap? I would need them removed before purchase."

"Of course, of course Milady. The owners of slave girls do like to keep their property well in hand, so to speak. But they do need to be fitted properly, you understand, especially if they are to be worn for an extended period of time, otherwise... chafing, bruising... damage to the delicate and sensitive tissues they are supposed to protect..." He shrugged. "You should try one on to be sure it will be suitable and if you buy it I will have my smith remove the manacles then. If you decided not to buy it I would have damaged goods to repair at my own cost if they were removed beforehand. I'm sure you understand, Milady."

A few minutes later Samantha was in a small changing room where a collared slave maid helped her out of the voluminous dress she had spent so much time getting into earlier. The shopkeeper had politely measured her waist, notably keeping his hands to himself while her face turned red, then muttered some calculations - "allowing for the bodice yes yes, subtract ummm..." while studying the front of her dress and then handed her one of his display samples. It was heavier than she thought, a solid steel belt and underpiece hinged at the back coming together in a three-way lock at the front. It still had the slim manacles on each side, each connected by a single solid-looking link to the belt. She tried the small key the shopkeeper had given her in the lock, ensuring it worked freely then dismissed the collared slave girl as she stood before the room's mirror in her silken chemise which she tucked up out of the way. The girl had been a great help, more than she realised beforehand. Hiring a maid for the trip would perhaps be a wise decision after all. Ladies of breeding and high station did not normally travel without servants and, thinking cynically, if Sir Thomas had a maid to pester perhaps he wouldn't attempt to force his attentions on herself or Ashley.

The metal was cold on her delicate feminine skin, quite unlike any armour she had ever worn before she changed but she had always had a padded arming doublet and trews to provide extra cushioning under the plate and mail she had boasted in her previous existence. She could live with it, she decided as she studied the harsh lines of the obdurate metal guarding her groin. Besides it would probably warm up quite quickly. The belt pieces seemed to fit well so, not without some trepidation, she pushed the ends home in the front lock with a harsh snapping sound that sent a peculiar thrill though her mind.

Hmmm, how does it fit? She tried stretching and bending, noticing how it dug into her navel but the important part running between her legs gave her no trouble. She rested her fingers lightly on the lower shield even more aware of the odd anatomy that lay behind it. It had perforations where, she supposed, she could piss when needed although washing properly afterwards would be a chore. She could take it off to do that, assuming she could trust Sir Thomas but... she would decide later but she resigned herself to having to wear the damn thing for the entire trip. At least they would be in a carriage with springs, not riding a horse. The thought of being in a saddle for hours wearing such a device made her wince again. No. Definitely no. She made a mental note to ensure the carriage seats were well equipped with soft cushions.

She turned in front of the mirror to see how it looked, the open manacles swinging across her hip and reminding her they would have to be removed. A naughty thought came to her mind -- she was planning to buy another belt for Ashley since they were of similar stature as they had discovered at the dressmakers being fitted for their formal and walking-out dresses so another like this one would be ideal. What if she, ahem, forgot to have the manacles removed on that one as a jest? She peered down at the one on her left-hand side. It was a slim smooth ring, hinged open with a keyhole. How did it work? Ashley's wrist would fit in like... that and then it would close like... SNAP. Oh. It didn't need the key to lock, it seemed.

She tugged at the manacle around her left wrist but it didn't spring magically open. Well she didn't expect it would. She was in the back room of a slave goods emporium after all -- the sudden thought brought a chill to her spine. The shopkeeper wouldn't do anything, would he but it was likely he would know slave traders who might... her breath caught in her throat. Get the key, free herself and purchase two of the belts and get out of here NOW. The key, the key... she picked up the belt key and her heart sank as she realised it was much to big to fit the small lock in the tight-fitting manacle around her wrist. The manacles needed a different key... which... she... didn't... have...
1123112123133322111133332.title: Purchase some protective equipment

choices: At the blacksmith's shop down the street
At the customer's mansion in the countryside
11231121231333221111333321.content:
The shopkeeper peered at Samantha's cuffed wrist while she grew redder and redder from embarrassment. Calling him into the dressing room had taken all of her courage, she who had faced foemen in battle with nary a qualm (or breasts at that time, of course). Displaying herself to the oily little man while dressed only in a translucent silk chemise and a chastity belt required a different sort of resolve to engaging in combat at arms.

"I... see," the man said. "It just happened that the manacle snapped shut around your wrist? How puzzling, milady. I didn't think this model of restraint operated in that manner."

"Well it does. Look!" Samantha held out the other open cuff. The shopkeeper closed the two halves together and let go. They fell open, clinking against the metal waist belt. He tried again with the same result.

"Ah, perhaps... milady, could you hold your free hand out please?" He smiled. "In the interests of satisfying our mutual incomprehension."

She did so, puzzled but not knowing what else to do. The shopkeeper fitted the open manacle around her slim feminine wrist and closed it. SNAP.

"What? How..." Both her wrists were now secured closely to the waist strap of her chastity belt. She jerked as hard as she could but the manacles did not spring open.

"My apologies, milady." His smile seemed less sincere than it had been a few moments ago. "It had slipped my mind that this particular belt's restraints were a special order from a certain customer who wished them to only lock closed when a female slave's wrists were within their ambit. As such they were imbued with certain magical cantrips and spells to that end."

"That's very interesting but it doesn't solve my problem, does it? Get the key and release me this instant!"

The shopkeeper scratched his balding head. "If I remember correctly, milady, the locking spell is only supposed to function if the manacle is closed around a SLAVE's wrist. It should not activate if it is closed around a free woman's wrist." He looked Samantha's inadequately-dressed figure up and down.

"What puzzles me is that the manacles locked around your wrists so readily given their discriminating nature. It leads me to ponder the possibility that you are not necessarily who you presented yourself as when you entered my establishment, a lady of breeding and station within society." He tapped his lip with one finger as Samantha stood shocked at his words.

"A slave can wear fine clothes and attempt to pass herself off as a free lady but such impersonation is a crime, not surprisingly." He shook his head. "Such goings-on strike at the heart of our kingdom's way of life. If a slave is caught pretending to be a free woman there is certain punishment of a most hideous nature, especially if she masquerades as a noblewoman." He smiled again. "The courts are, I understand, generous in rewarding anyone who brings such miscreants to their attention though."

"But I'm not a slave!" she screamed. "I'm Lady Samantha, a confidant of the King and due to depart on an important diplomatic..." She stopped short, not wanting to reveal such confidential information to the shopkeeper.

"Yes Lady Samantha, I'm sure you are. But the manacles say otherwise." He scratched his head. "Are you married perchance? You seem to be of a suitable age and in the position in society you claim to occupy you would be a very desirable matrimonial prospect."

"No. I. Am. Not." she growled. "Now release me this instant!"

"A pity, a pity. If you had a husband he could easily confirm your status with a word. Your paterfamilias, then? A brother or other close male relation who would identify you?"

Lady Samantha bit her lip. Her father and her brothers would not recognise her in her new form. She wished to get through these trials and return to her proper male form before her family found out about her transformation.

"Could my status be confirmed by my squ- by my female companion?" If she could get a message to Ashley back at the Fallen Oak, she could come and confirm her identity but shopkeeper looked doubtful.

"Sadly milady, if that's who you are, such matters are normally reserved for men to determine and adjudicate. A mere woman naturally cannot swear oaths or make testimonies in legal matters, questions of ownership of property and the like." Samantha's heart sank as the man's words struck home. As a man, a paladin of noble breeding his word was his bond, unquestionable. As a woman she was a man's possession, her whole being belonging to her father or brothers or (she shuddered) a future husband. A woman's lesser position in society was not something that had impinged on his consciousness before his dramatic change in shape and status but now it was a real problem for her.

Inspiration struck. "I was recently captured by slavers but escaped before I could be sold. Could that perhaps have confused the magic in these cuffs?"

"I suppose so, milady. I don't know much about how the locking spells might differentiate between a free woman and a female who had been temporarily enslaved." He looked her up and down again. "And, if I might be so bold, you do not have the bearing of a slave, never mind a brand that I can see." His comment made her blush again, a reminder of just how much skin she was exposing.

"So why can't you simply release me then? I can reward you handsomely. You have a key, don't you?" His expression changed. "You DO have a key..." she asked, dreading his response. He shrugged.

"Sadly no, milady." The promise of a financial reward had changed his suspicious attitude somewhat at least. "The keys to these particular restraints are elsewhere. I did not expect to need them here in the shop. They are..."
11231121231333221111333321.title: She 'fesses up to the shopkeeper...

112311212313332212.content:
Samantha had never considered her great at lying because the truth seemed like it wouldn’t be easy to believe. Letting people think that she was a woman looking for a job made more sense, many women came to the castle looking for work and the attractive ones often got sent to the King. It would be easier to convince just one person of who she was especially when she knew the person well.

As a paladin in the Kingdom of Dar, she had done several secret missions for the King she knew things that only she and the King knew. She took a deep breath before heading towards the guards at the gate. She walked up shrouded in her cloak and she could see the guards getting edgy at the approach of a hooded figure.

Their eyes widened as she pulled back the cloak growing red with revealing her figure to the guards. She almost felt like a stripper at the Pleasure Palace, how Nicolas had convinced her to go she would never know. Samantha felt like she needed to bathe for a week after being in that building. She quickly shut her robe but the image was burned into the brains of the men.

“I am looking for work, is there perhaps some work available as a maid or server,” her voice was nervous and shaky so she went with it. “I thought I could work at one of those places, but I just can’t. I couldn’t even gather my clothing. I really need someplace to stay and work, do you think you can help me?”

“We will do all we can for you,” the first guard smiled at her warmly.

“I am sure that the King would be more than happy to help you,” The man’s partner elbowed him into silencing further comment. “What is your name lovely?”

“Samantha,” she replied.

“I will take you inside,” the first guard escorted her into the castle.

It was strange to be taken through the back halls of the castle through the servant's area. She tried to recall if she had ever been through this path before but it had never occurred. They almost seemed like secret passages and in a way they were. These halls hid the inner workings of the castle from the nobles so they wouldn’t have to see all the dirty work that went in to make their lives possible.

Finally, she was placed in front of the head butler Mr. Martin. His hair had not turned completely to silver but it was well on the way. His figure was fit and well defined. She had met him on a couple of occasions and he was just as calculating and professional as she remembered. His eyes didn’t even linger on her curves that had drawn more than a few stares from people.

“I believe I can find work for you,” Mr. Martin said as his eyes turned back to his paperwork. “You can work . . .”
112311212313332212.title: Lie

1123112123133322123.content:
The words struck Samantha like a blow, she wanted to see the King but certainly not in that way. She looked at the door, a guard stood in her path so she made no attempt to leave as she suspected her way would be bared besides, she was certain she couldn’t find her way out of here without a week at the attempt. There was no malicious grin or teasing laughter to suggest if this was a joke or not, the face was deadpan seriousness.

“I was looking for something more along the lines of a serving girl or a maid,” Samantha spoke up but the man immediately shook his head.

“Your figure tells me you belong in the harem, few could keep their hands off of you and it wouldn’t be proper for the king or one of his nobles to be taking a part of a girl in front of guests,” Mr. Martin scratched his quill at paper, hardly giving her any attention. “I am certain you have no references or people to speak for you, you are not the first girl to come here from the markets of lust or some farm seeking life in the big city and found it harder than you thought. You will have an easy life here, your name will not work though, the king prefers his harem girls with the names of some flower, perhaps you would like to make a suggestion.”

“I suggest you let me go! I will find work elsewhere.”

The guard stepped in front of the door making it very clear she was not free to leave.

“I think something connected to the lovely golden hair you have would work,” the butler ignored her words. “Snapdragon is a bit too vulgar I think, Black Eyed Susan might work if you step out of line too often, it would be a shame to mark such perfect skin, Daisy is too common for one so fine as you, Zinnia, yes, I think Zinnia will work.”

“My name is Samantha, release me at once, it is against the laws of the kingdom to imprison a free person who has committed no crime.”

“Guard, be so kind as to show the lady to the harem, it is best we get her ready as soon as possible, the King is very partial to blondes, and he will want one of her caliber as soon as possible.”

“Unhand me!” the grip was too strong to break, she hated the change so much, she was tempted to go for his blade but decided it was better to wait for a better chance when it was more likely she would get out of the castle.

She was shoved into another guarded room, one that smelled sweet and had many large brightly colored pillows, many women in various scanty outfits that looked more like a lingerie party.

“Say hi to Zinnia everyone,” the guard laughed before he slammed the heavy door shut behind him.
1123112123133322123.title: in the harem

choices: Take some time to plan things out
112311212313332213.content:
Samantha was glad of the large crowds so that she could get close to the guards without being noticed. She wasn’t sure how she was going to in to see the King but the actions of the guard might give her a clue as to how she should approach. The men were chatting with each other so she stopped nearby and pretended to be reading a map so she could hear what they were saying.

“I can’t believe they are trying to put together a wedding so quickly,” a guard shook his head. “There is no way they can prepare such an important event in less than a month.”

The other guard shrugged,” They want to do it before Sir Garrett gets back and tries to stop things. You know he was engaged to Princess Fina. If she and the princeling of the Empire are married he won’t say or do anything because of his code but you better bet that if they aren’t married he will bring everything he has to stop the wedding.”

“Do you think there is much he can do to cause trouble, it is King Emeril and the Empire we are dealing with.”

“A lot of trouble, Sir Garrett’s Order of the Silver Griffin alone would back him as well as all of his heroic friends and anyone they are allied with. It would be a glorious campaign that would be the stuff of legends and who knows who would win but you can believe that most of the kingdom would be the losers.”

“I hope this treaty he is seeking is worth it because if Sir Garrett comes back early there will be a lot of trouble.”

“I wouldn’t worry about that. There is a rumor some assassins from the Empire have been sent to kill if not slay the paladin.”

The paladin couldn’t believe that they were talking about such things in public but they most likely didn’t realize that someone was listening to them and they certainly didn’t think that Sir Garrett would be back so soon. Anger and hurt at the betrayal filled her to the point she thought she might explode. She had served the King loyally for years and was furious at her treatment after all of that service, she needed to decide what to do next.
112311212313332213.title: Learn something disturbing

1123112123133322131.content:
She needed to find Princess Fina and get her out of here before the wedding occurred. Samantha knew her fiancee and she was certain to try and put up a fight over this so the king would force her to a location he could control. The castle didn’t seem like a good location because she had too many allies in the royal guards and the nobles who would visit the castle. Many of the nobles would not be happy with a royal marriage to the Empire, not only because it lessened there chances for more power it also gave the King a powerful ally to use against them.

There had been a rumor King Emeril wanted to purge some of his political enemies but he was afraid to do it because the nobles held a lot of power. If he had the backing of a Prince from the Empire he could do as he pleased, so where was he hiding the princess?

A compound for the Crimson Tigers could be holding her and they had one that wasn’t very far from the capital. Princess Fina would be safe there and could be retrieved very easily but some of the trainees and people might question why a royal princess would be held against her will.

King Emeril had a secret pleasure manor he kept while the Queen had been alive for his mistresses. It could be stocked with just those who were loyal to him. It seemed like the most likely location for his beloved Princess to be. It was at least a full day’s travel from the capital.

She wondered if the King would dare to lock away Fina in the dungeons of the castle. There was a small chance the Princess was locked away at a secret location in the castle but how would she get inside and be able to find her.
1123112123133322131.title: Find Princess Fina

choices: Take the women to her castle
Escort them to a nearby town
11231123.content:
With a heavy sigh Samantha spoke, “Listen, it has been a long day for me so I am going to offer to pay the debt of these ladies and you avoid a lot of trouble.”

The slavers looked at each other assessing what they wanted to do. Albert readied his sword because he didn’t like the leers they were giving to Samantha who he was certain they would like to add to their collection. The ladies in the cage looked on with skeptical hope, fearful the price would be too high for these people to pay, this was their last chance before they left the kingdom and all but a whisper of hope faded.

“Five hundred gold,” the man at the head of the wagon spoke at last. “We have got expenses.”

“I will offer you two hundred,” Samantha replied. “There debts aren’t likely over a hundred combined and doubling your profit should be more than enough profit.”

“We are likely to make even more money if we were to take you in,” a thin slaver said as he played with his whip. A throwing dagger sliced the instrument of pain to just a handle leaving a shocked look on the face of the group. Samantha held another dagger at the ready to further indicate her threat.

“I said I was tired but I am willing to fight if the need arises,” She spoke in an ice-cold tone. “You might be able to get me inside that cage but I assure you will be losing at least three of your number, do you want to roll those dice?”

They were no longer as confident as they had once been as they looked at each other trying to figure out if they were the ones who would survive with all the profit. One of them started to reach for a crossbow but she waved her dagger no and the man stopped his attempt for the weapon.

“Three hundred,” the big man growled.

He was most likely willing to take less but an attractive woman threatening him had probably wounded his pride. It was a large sum but one she was willing to part with to get this encounter over with because she cared more about the freedom for the slaves and the slaying of humans. As repugnant as she found the men she preferred fighting monsters who had little hope of redemption from their evil ways.

“Okay, I accept,” Samantha handed a bag of gems to Albert. “Count out three hundred worth of gold for these men and toss it to them.”

She was still worried about their plans but they were quick to unlock the slaves once they had verified the value of the gems. Samantha watched them fade from view before she made any move to leave. She had no desire to have them know which path they take from this spot. Now that she had secured the freedom of the women she needed to decide what to do with them.
11231123.title: Try to make a deal

112311231.content:
There was no reason to trust the slavers. It was true they had been paid off but she wouldn’t put it past them to backtrack and capture the women again. Afterall it would more than double their profits. It meant a delay and a distraction but she would take them back to her castle.

“I should be able to get you the help you need at our castle,” Samantha told the former captives. “It isn’t safe to stay here as they are likely to backtrack.”

“Who are you?” an auburn-haired beauty stepped forward.

“I am Lady Samantha and this is my squire Albert,” she responded. “Tell me who you are.”

“My name is Erin. I don’t like to admit it but you are probably right. My farm is still in debt even if I did stay.”

“They took my father away to serve in the king’s garden’s and without him we couldn’t keep the herbalist shop open. I am known as Leena and my sister is Glenna.” A petite blonde spoke up and gestured towards her sister.

The words struck the paladin like a blow and she didn’t know how to respond. They were a good mile down the road before she could manage to speak. Her mind raced over what the king wanted so badly in the gardens that he would steal a father away from his children.

“It has to be immortality,” Samantha muttered drawing curious looks from the others.

“You do you mean?” Albert prodded.

“It is the only explanation I can see for depriving these women of their father. King Emeril has never been interested in ornate gardens so why do it? Many of the champions of the kingdom have been sent on perilous journeys like us. He has been sending his children to the far reaches of the kingdom into dangerous situations. I thought it was to start handing over the reins of power or to secure the borders but it could be to get rid of anyone who would stop him. I have heard of dark rituals that involve strange plants that are said to grant life.”

The faces on the women paled.

“Do you think he will kill our father?” Glenna’s voice trembled.

“No, your father is likely one of the only safe people in the kingdom,” the paladin comforted her. “We must pick up the pace. If what I think is true is coming to pass we only have a few days until the harvest moon when the time will be right for the sacrifice.”
112311231.title: Take the women to her castle

112312.content:
Racing down the culprit was dangerous as she didn’t know if the person was going to be meeting with allies. It was better to find out who the person was by following the clues and she had a good one to follow with the scrape of fabric. Sir Garrett knew few people who could afford the fabric and fewer who would have an interest in harming him.

There were ways you could track a person with the fabric through magic but they could be expensive, but a hedge mage might be able to give her some idea of the owner. If the person was famous enough she should be able to track them as there fame gave away there location. The cheapest way but by far the least safe was to ask around. If the person wore this in the woods it was likely they were even better dressed where people could see them. They would be noticed in the small towns but word could very easily get back to the person they were being tracked because people would look for reward for the information.

“I suspect this enchantment was done by one of the nobles but I don’t know the reason,” Sir Garrett spoke up. “This fabric will allow us to trace the person. We should , , ,"
112312.title: Follow the Clues

1123122.content:
Sir Garrett felt it was best to get ahead of culprits and use the magic when she knew it would do the most good. She sent Thunder into a gallop down the road because she felt the noble would be traveling slower than her and her squire. Once she had a suspect she could use the magic from a local spellcrafter to determine her suspicions were accurate. She rode hard to make up for the time she had lost thinking of the directions the person might take but she could hear Albert was struggling to keep up with Thunder.

It was hard but she slowed her pace to allow Albert to catch up. There was frustration at having to slow up for the poor horse that Albert rode. Sir Garrett had offered to buy a much better animal but the proud young man refused it. Albert didn’t want what he felt was charity even if it was from a friend but Sir Garrett might lose her target because of the pride of her squire.

“I don’t know how much further my horse can hold out,” Albert warned his master.

Sir Garrett looked back and could see the signs that he was right, “There is a farm up ahead or do you think that we can make it up to the town a few miles away to trade your horse out for another.”

The paladin planned to slip a few coins to anyone they met in order to get a better animal than her squire had currently because she wanted to make some serious time on this journey and not stop every few miles for a new animal. Her eyes caught sight of some tracks taking a small path to somewhere unknown. They looked fresh and could be the person she was looking for.
1123122.title: Discover the criminal with magic

112313.content:
Riding the horses at gallop was nice on a day with a gentle breeze but it felt a little strange for the paladin as she had much longer hair since her transformation to a woman. The golden strands of hair rippled like waves in air offset nicely by the blue sky. Her squire watched the curvy form of his master, the breasts bounced on her chest of the two new mounds. He wanted to tell her how beautiful she was but he knew she wouldn’t appreciate the compliment because she wanted to return to being a man which seemed a bit of a shame to the squire who thought she was the most beautiful woman he had seen.

An ogre came crashing out of the forest, gnawing on a leg of a human. The creature turned to face them as they pulled up their horses to avoid running into it. It smashed a fist into Albert’s horse crushing the skull of the animal even as they went for their weapons. Sir Garrett drew a lance with all of her diminished strength and thrust it at the vulnerable throat of it. Roaring in pain from the blow the ogre slapped the lance and Thunder away sending the paladin tumbling to the ground.

Blood poured from the wound in the neck but the slobbering nine-foot creature seemed more interested in slaying the ones who had harmed it than taking care of the wound. It stomped towards the disoriented woman who was backing away from it. She rolled away from the lunging grab of the giant humanoid. Albert raced up behind the creature slashed the back of the leg severing critical muscles. No longer able to support the colossal weight of the ogre, the leg buckled dropping the monster on the ground.

It started to crawl towards Sir Garrett who lifted her short sword to an attack position at the approach of the monster. The blade was not as familiar to her as her long sword but it was much easier to work and use because of her much smaller form. A powerful arm of the ogre smashed into the ground near her, she darted in and made a quick slash across the brow before moving back out of reach. Fresh blood started to flow into the eyes of the ogre blinding it. Albert leaped upon the back of the monster and drove his sword deep into the chest of it cleaving the heart of the ogre ending its life.

Sir Garrett wiped the sweat from her brow and looked around to assess the situation they were in now. Albert’s horse was dead and her horse looked like it was injured to the point she didn’t trust her weight on it much less both of them. Her plans to catch up had certainly taken a hit but she was glad her and Albert were okay. There was a small village about ten miles up the road but she thought she had seen a farm not too far off that might have some horses they could use.
112313.title: Plans interrupted

1123131.content:
“We should check out the farm nearby,” Sir Garrett directed her squire. “There is a good chance we can get some fresh horses and see if the farmers are all right.”

Albert nodded after a moment of thought, “It would be nice to get a farm fresh meal instead of that hardtack you always get for us to eat on the trail. I understand you are keeping us to a budget but I am willing to pay and my family is in heavy debt if it means forgoing that foul stuff for even one night.”

“Fine, but I will pay.”

“You might want to dress differently and come up with a female name if you don’t want to draw unwanted questions.”

“I can’t do much about the clothing, I didn’t come exactly equipped with a female wardrobe. This shirt and chainmail will have to do until we get to a proper town but I am willing to go with a new name for the time being how about Callie?”

“Alright, Lady Callie shall we go inside?”

“Lose the Lady title, I am just Callie and you are my fellow adventurer Albert.”

Her business grew so far that she needed a constant influx of girls. The cat people believed in the delights of the world. A life lived in the pursuit of pleasure the only one worth living. Her business offered money with the side benefit of horny men passing through. Carla’s tastes varied from the mundane to the exotic. She played in whatever fantasy struck her pleasure.

Money purchased her the finest in luxury goods. A soft bed wrapped in silken sheets. A world class chef to provide rare cuisines. Her girls provided these things to her. Carla zealously protected them for this along with the true feelings she developed for some of them. More than one person bore the marks of her claws who crossed her girls.

Arianna fixed herself up the best she could soon enough she would be surrounded by pretty clothes and makeup to adorn her face. Time to earn her keep as she hefted her breasts so they stood prominent. She working her way down the hall swaying her hips. Advertising she desired company for the evening. A man witnessed the display, jumping up he hurried over to proposition her. Arianna soon led him back to her room for an evening of delights.

Sir Garrett puts on the armor
1123332.content:
Sir Garrett looked through the female garments hoping to find something a little better suited to her new curves. She snickered at the thought of wearing some of the skimpy lingerie. Well suited to her current body but funny imagining a knight of the order of the silver griffin in such outfits seemed funny. Still some of the underwear would relieve the bouncing and jiggling she was dealing with. She found a set of pink underwear that looked the right size to support her bountiful chest. With some effort, she even found some chain armor that fit. She picked up the items working her way out of the packed wagon. She walked over to Gerald asking, “How much do you want for this underwear and chain armor?”

“Oh, I think a fair price might be a thousand gold as they are enchanted items.” Gerald talking between bites enjoying some of the stew.

Sir Garrett considered it before deciding magical protection might compensate for her diminished strength. Wealth earned from her adventures made the expense no great concern. She said, “I will take them.” She grabbed her coin purse pulling out a couple of gems that equaled the price handing them to Gerald.

Gerald examined them for a minute before nodding in satisfaction. He lay back full from a second helping of stew. Offering a jug to the pair who refused preferring to keep their wits about them. He shrugged taking a swig. The evening passed quietly into night with them retiring to bed.
1123332.title: Sir Garrett looks over the garments

11233322.content:
Sir Garrett decided to find relief of his troublesome jiggling. Underwear best suited to the enticement of men now graced his skin. He liked the look though, he never looked better. Albert coming into talk, causing Garrett’s cheeks to redden and pull tight a blanket to be found in such a state. “How soon do you wish to head out?” Albert said casting his gaze away.

“Give me leave to dress and we will set out after breakfast.”

Albert took to the task of meal prep. Figuring you never knew when your next meal might be. Fixing up a hearty stew.

Layering to hide his undergarments. Chain mail providing protection for his vitals. Its magical nature fitting his curves and weighing less then metal should. Allowing him to manage it better. Still not liking his awkward proportions. He struggled with the balance of his body but it felt good wearing armor again. Tying back his hair he joined Albert by the fire.

After saying goodbye to Gerald they headed into the swamp. Searching out the vague threat set out by the King. Part of Garrett suspected that this might be a mission in name only. No danger only an opportunity to get him out of the way. If only he knew how well his plan worked. Suitability as a husband beyond him more suited for a comely bride. The new underwear hugging his nubile form keeping it manageable for the journey ahead. Slogging through swamp land and marshes not the image of a sterling armored paladin felling monsters most held. But Sir Garrett knew the dirty grim reality. Going into disgusting places with interspersed moments of graphic violence the job. He along with his order kept the illusions up by taking a day to clean up before triumphant returns.

Several days of circling searches following. Polishing armor to prevent rusting at night. Bug bites their most significant find. Garrett’s growing disgust with his surroundings reaching a breaking point. “There is nothing to find here. We are wandering through this icky swamp for no reason. We are heading home at once. I think it will take a week to get the tangles from my hair.”

Albert looked confused at Garrett, “I uh if you think that is best.” Increasingly noticing over the past few days Garrett’s preening. Garrett’s behavior worrying and Albert thought it best to return home where aid could be found.

Garrett excitedly diligently packed his gear and they began the trip back. An upsetting point for Albert at a village Garrett removed the trappings of knighthood. Replacing chain mail with silken dresses. Purchasing brushes, perfumes and scented oils his grooming took new levels. Prancing about in his lingerie desiring to be worthy of it. Drawing sheer stockings up his smooth legs. Styling his hair as the ladies of court would. A traveling dress for the journey home. The thought of all the shops in the capital exciting him. Selling off his armor getting him enough for a carriage ride home. He hated the thought of mussing his dress.

Albert sent word to those he might receive help from. Apprising the silver order of the griffon and Sir Garrett’s fiancee of the situation. With their help they could remove the bewitchment that his mentor found himself under.
11233322.title: Sir Garrett puts on the underwear

112333222.content:
Arriving home sent Garrett into a tizzy. Access to his wealth and shops galore exciting him. Albert’s attempts to slow him that help might have time to arrive met with resilience. Relenting only long enough to switch her dress with a much nicer one that he had made for princess Fina before leaving. She wouldn’t mind her borrowing it till she found an equally fine one. Albert left her to switch attire while watching at the gate.

Too his relief Sir Edward Almont and his wife came in a carriage. Albert alerting the order figuring they knew him best. Edward stepping from the carriage his concern evident helping his wife down. Despite their maturing years he kept in shape. Often sparring and acting as mentor to younger knights and squires. Wrinkles about his eyes none of their careful observance as he took in his surroundings. Even at a friend’s home he searched for enemies.

Christine Almont former adventuring companion turned lover turned wife. Her knowledge of magic probably why they sent her. Her hair short and practical like herself. She came not only out of duty but desire to help. Garrett a man she witnessed mature into a fine knight and paladin.

“Garrett the Almonts are here.” Albert said. A disheartening response following.

“That is fantastic. Christine can advise me on the latest fashions. Do you suppose that ruffles are in. She must have something to say on lace. It would be better if it were Lady Sylvia. She has such a style about her but one must make do. Please be a dear and set up for tea.” Garrett said making final adjustments to her dress.

Albert set a cook to prepare tea and refreshments. His instinct to obey strong. Facing the Almonts felt intimidating. Both legends as he grew up. Christine spoke first, “Where is he? Tell us all you know.” A trunk of tools of her trade lay next to the couch.

“Getting ready. He woke up transformed into a woman. Until he received that bra from a passing peddler named Gerald he seemed mentally himself. Now he seems obsessed with his appearance.”

Garrett’s entrance brought a silence to the room. Hair neatly set, dress form hugging if a bit tight in the chest. Silken layers of fabric shimmering in the light swaying into the room form heels clacking. As if a lady of court Garrett took a seat crossing his fine legs. Bright eyes that took her guests. Moist lips parting to ask, “Dear lady Christine if you would be so kind and tell me if my dress is amiss? I am much fallen behind on couture since my foray abroad. What a frightful journey that was.”

“Yes, yes after I examine you. When one travels you must be on guard on wasting conditions.” Christine said.

Shock and fear crossing Garrett’s face, “Please do. That would be simply awful.”
112333222.title: Silver order knight

choices: You and Thunder are a team, You stick together.
The lizard people know the swamps better than anyone. Contact them.
Take the quick path through the swamp
113.content:
Sir Garrett’s horse Thunder’s hooves pounded the ground at a steady pace allowing the paladin a chance calm his mind. He always did best when he worked from a peaceful place, but his mind was out of sorts with the anticipation of marrying the Princess. Riding became a form of meditation when you did it as often as a knight. It felt good to have his piece of mind back because he saw an ogre lumbering out of the woods drawing his travels to a halt.

Hot drool spilled from the fat lips of the ten foot monster. It paused as it realized it was no longer the sole ruler of the road and rage filled it as the realization of that dawned. The ogre’s feet pounded the ground as it charged the paladin sitting on his mount.

Thunder’s years of training were showing as the only indication it took notice of the ogre’s charge was a snort of eager anticipation. He didn’t have long to wait for Sir Garrett had grabbed a lance and set it within moments of the sighting of the ogre. With only a tap of the knight’s foot the horse launched forward with a speed that seemed to ignore the rider and armor on its back.

The ogre wasn’t prepared for the laws of physics which had always been on its side to betray it so thoroughly. A lance coming at you from a steed charging at thirty miles per hour is not helpful to the survival of a living creature especially when it hits you in the throat. Sir Garrett removed the lance but found it was bent and he didn’t feel he had the time to stop and get it repaired. As it was removing an ogre from the road and covering the body took several hours of thankless work. No one besides Sir Garrett and his steed would likely know a rampaging ogre’s life had been ended with a bent lance to mark the grave, and honestly thinking of the families that would never know the loss he had ever experienced was all the thanks he needed.

Sir Garrett had reached a crossroads where he would have to decide how he wanted to proceed. The map showed a small trail that he could use to take Thunder with him. He could contact the local lizard people for help or information, and finally he could take the direct path by himself through the swamp sending his horse back to the order’s monastery.
113.title: Encounter a monster on the road

choices: I will have some of that stew. It tastes great.
I will try the stew. It tastes a little off.
I'm going to bed, I am tired.
1131.content:
Thunder provides Sir Garrett with an extra set of eyes and senses which are better than a human's. It would be foolish to go without his longtime companion Thunder. Thunder grew more alert as they entered the dense canopy of the swamp and Sir Garrett matched the war horse's roving senses with his own to spot any danger a few seconds earlier which in combat could be the difference between bumps and bruises and mortal wounds.

A small camp fire came into view after an hour of riding. The light of it was easy to spot from a long way off and for a second Sir Garrett considered trying to sneak up to it but whoever was there wasn't afraid of the dangers of the swamp, and hopefully he had an ally to provide further light against the darkness. As he drew closer he saw a figure in the light stirring a pot of something that smelled wonderful to the travel weary paladin.

"Welcome traveler", an old woman looked up from her cooking. "Care to take part of my stew. I always make too much because it is so hard to judge cooking for one even after all these years."

"Perhaps in a minute, I have to see to my horse first," Sir Garrett responded. "What are doing living in the middle of this dark swamp?"

"I came here long ago to study ancient civilizations, and the years have gotten away from me," the old woman explained. "I have grown powerful in knowledge, but poor in society. I am not sure it was worth the trade off."

"Do you have any idea what dangers threaten the kingdom?" Sir Garrett continued to rub down Thunder as he munched away on his feed bag.

"The Dark Queen used to rule this area with her necromancy until the Grand Druid Leaf Walker sacrificed herself to call the land to swallow the dark capital, but legend claims the Dark Queen wrapped herself in life draining magic until she could break free of the Grand Druid's spell. If the Queen is breaking free it is best to strike before she can consolidate her power. Now, please have some stew and rest before taking on such a grand task."

"Thanks for the information. I think . . ."
1131.title: You and Thunder are a team, You stick together.

11311.content:
Sir Garrett sat down at on a log near the fire enjoying the warmth of the fire and the aromas arising from the stew. He decided it was best to accept the woman’s kindness especially because enjoying a warm meal while you were traveling without all the work involved in it was always an easy decision. The paladin lifted the spoon to his mouth and took a large swallow and was surprised by the wonderful flavor he encountered.

It was a hearty vegetable stew with my fine herbs for wonderful flavors. Sir Garrett wondered if the vegetables were freshly picked, and decided he would ask the woman in a minute, but for the moment he was enjoying the crackle of the fire and the feeling of a full stomach. His eyes felt heavy as the heat from the fire seemed to call him to slumber but he fought against it because it would be rude to pass out before thanking his host properly.

“You have great stamina to have remained awake for this long young warrior,” a sinister look began to appear on the face of the woman. “I am afraid it will do you no good, because you have already had too much of my magical stew. Do not worry, because I have no intention of killing you. You have too much value, but you are too dangerous as you are currently.”

Rage filled the paladin at the trick. He wasn’t angry with himself but with her for the betrayal of the trust he placed in her. How many others had fallen for this trap? How many more would fall into it if he didn’t stop this evil magic user? Sir Garrett stumbled to his feet and drew his blade as he moved towards the woman.

Fear took hold of her face as she realized she was no longer in control of the situation. Her body started to make the motions to run from the enraged warrior before her, but the paladin allowed gravity to speed his movements and fell forward stabbing the woman in the foot ending thoughts of escape as the pain took hold of her mind.

“Please, I can give you an antidote to the stews effects,” the woman pleaded.

Sir Garrett would have liked to take her at her word but she had already proven to be untrustworthy, and slumber was beginning to take hold of his mind despite his best efforts. He focused himself for what he felt he must do and a swift and powerful motion he pulled the sword from her foot and severed his enemies head from her shoulder, and collapsed next to her body wondering what other effects the stew would have upon his body by the time he woke up, if there were any.

The paladin woke to the feeling of his horse nudging him. He checked himself but didn’t feel any different. Had the corpse on ground been lying when she said he would be transformed or was it just delayed? It could be she had planned to add something while he slept that would have caused the transformation. The question was if he should search the magic user’s home for an antidote just in case though he would be risking whatever traps she had set in her home, or risk himself being transformed down his journey at who knows what point and facing what dangers. It was a tough decision and not one he was looking forward to making though it must be done soon, because he had a quest to finish for the King, so he might win the hand of the Princess he loved in marriage.
11311.title: I will have some of that stew. It tastes great.

113112.content:
Sir Garrett decided to continue with his journey because spell casters especially evil ones with things to hide frequently set up traps to protect their secrets, and he had no means of detecting what was safe and what wasn’t safe. He thought about burning the house to ash but decided against it, because if something started to happen to him it might be best to take the risk of entering the lair of the slain spell caster.
If what the woman had told him about the swamp was true he would have to be more careful of strangers in the area in the future. There always seemed to be servants of ancient evils lurking about trying to bring them back to power the paladin thought glumly. The sky seemed to reflect his mood as they rumbled and darkened indicating a storm may be setting in soon, but with no shelter in sight it was simplest to continue and not worry about what the future held for him.

He didn’t want to think about marrying Princess Fina until the day of the ceremony arrived. Sir Garrett suspected the King had sent him on this mission to end his life in the kingdom. He suspected King Emeril of desiring one of his rich noble neighbors for a future bride for his daughter especially since Sir Garrett belonged to the order of the Silver Griffin who had several times thwarted the attempts of the king to gouge his people on taxes or other injustices. With the many heroic feats performed by Sir Garrett and his fellow brethren of the Silver Griffin the King didn’t dare directly denying the paladin his daughter’s hand in marriage for fear the people would revolt against him, but if an accident were to happen to him as he was traveling on dangerous quest it would likely not sadden him too much.

The holy warrior broke free of his dark thoughts as he realized there was movement up ahead of him. He drew his blade and summoned a prayer of protection around him as he waited for whatever creature would be out with the approaching storm in the sky. If it was an ambush it was not likely to be a good one as the rustling in the woods was loud and easy to hear, so who or whatever was making the noise didn’t care if he was aware of the presence or had yet to notice him.
113112.title: Continue with your quest

The noise from the woods was clear to the paladin and he drew his blade ready for battle to start and he saw a sight he had never dreamed of beholding, a unicorn stepped into his path. It’s white fur shimmered in the sun and the horn glowed with the magical power held inside of it. Thunder dropped his front legs to honor the magical creature and Sir Garrett got off of his mount to do the same. Unicorns had been hunted to near extinction by selfish being seeking the power contained in their horns. It was a poor excuse for taking the life of a living creature that spread goodness and life to the world.

Sir Garret set his sword on the ground in front of him and bowed before the magnificent animal, and the unicorn turned towards him and bowed in return. It was a surprise when he saw the creature was remaining in his path and not leaving the area. He wondered what the unicorn could want with him, he hated the thought of being delayed on his quest but the chance to assist such a creature was rare and it was sure to help the world.

“How may I help you?” Sir Garrett asked.

11311211.content:
“My name is Elandra,” the unicorn said. “I have heard of your deeds and I wish to serve you.”

“I have the service of Thunder as my mount,” Sir Garrett responded. He was hesistitent to take on the unicorn as he would be breaking with his order of the Silver Griffin. The paladin was expected to take a griffin as his mount in time, and forbidden riding a unicorn despite the great honor it was offering him. Sir Garrett didn’t know the origin of the ban, but he had always intended to respect it. It seemed like such an easy thing to do considering he was never going to meet one.

“I would be of great help in your fight against the forces of evil. Your steed has served you well and loyally, but I can help you more.”

“Your kind is too rare already, by serving me you would be putting yourself in great danger, and I wish to hold no secret from an honorable creature like yourself, so I tell that my order has forbidden me from taking a unicorn as my mount.”

“Your honesty does you justice, but you must know such an order is wrong. Do not let that be the reason you decide against joining forces with me. As to my safety, it is my sacred duty to bring right and good to the world if I am able, and I can’t do that by hiding from the world. Choose of your own accord whether to take me as a partner in your quest without concern for your order or my safety.”

Forgetting ones order was no small task for the paladin and he had to admit he was very tempt by the offer. Being partners to the unicorn would allow him to do greater good for the world and face greater dangers. It was not a decision to make lightly.
11311211.title: "It is I who wish to help you."

113112113.content:
She could see the man was hesitating and she understood why Elandra had researched the man carefully to be able to know if she could trust him. He was facing hard choice giving up an order that had raised him since he was a child. She had been alive for decades she could be patient with him.

“Before bonding, perhaps I could help you on your current quest and you shall see if I am worthy,” Elandra offered. “It is only fair since I checked to see if you are worthy you can do the same.”

Sir Garrett nodded glad they had made a compromise, if it didn’t seem like things were working out he could always separate afterward from her, “I must warn you that I am headed to the Dread Swamp and the threat that dwells there, I will understand if you want to back out.”

“What sort of unicorn would I be if I backed away from fighting the forces of darkness.”

The paladin smiled as he got down from Thunder, his companion for several years. He took his time removing the armor and other equipment from the stallion. Thunder shook happily when he was free of the equipment, Garrett gave him a gentle pat and sent him back to the abbey, he could find his way back to those oats from anywhere. He waited until his companion was out of sight before turning back to the unicorn who was riveted by the items on the ground.

“This should be a novel experience, I shall adjust things for my size,” the light from her horn grew more intense and the armor landed on her and strapped in. “This is exciting I have never been on a vacation before.”
113112113.title: Travel with me for a time

11312.content:
Sir Garrett decided it would be rude to not accept the hospitality of someone who had assisted him in his quest. The stew didn’t taste like any animal the knight had eaten before and he had found from years of experience that he was better off not knowing. Considering what he had eaten in the past it wasn’t bad just a little strange.

“I haven’t introduced myself to you,” the old woman admitted. “My name is Isabelle what is yours sir knight.”

“Sir Garrett,” a slight queasiness unsettled Sir Garrett. “You don’t mind if I bed down for the night here.”

“I would hear of nothing else. It can get quite lonely out here and your company is most welcomed.”

“Thank you,” true relief filled his voice as the weight of his armor left his body. “It will be nice to relax and get a good night’s rest before continuing my journey.”

“Yes, your company is most welcomed for a long time. Your assistance will help me greatly.”

“What are you talking . . .” Sir Garrett’s voice was cut off as pain sent him stumbling forward knocking over the stew.

“Just terrible, do you know how expensive and hard to get some of those ingredients were? If we are going to be working together we need to have you do a better job than this.”

Muscles and bone groaned as weight and size built the paladin larger into an inhuman shape. Hair sprouted across his body as his clothing lost the battle with his new size. It became apparent to Sir Garrett he was transforming into a horse as he saw what used to be a hand leave a hoof print in the soft earth. The final humiliation came as felt his manhood being withdrawn into his body replaced by a moist slit.

“You make a lovely mare,” Isabelle said. “I think your horse thinks so too.”

Sir Garrett turned to see Thunder was moving up behind him and years of working with horses had taught him what that look meant. Before the paladin could react he felt the tongue of Thunder caressed his vagina. Waves of pleasure halted the movement of the transformed knight.

“Master smells wonder,” Thunder spoke through their bond. “Master is beautiful. We will make strong, beautiful young together.”

“Wait,” Sir Garrett responded but Thunder was already leaping onto his back.

“Well, I will leave you two to get reacquainted,” Isabella smiled as she entered her hut. “Your new name is Lightning.”

The horse penis slammed home with force that shook Lightning’s body. Foreign sensations flooded the formerly celebrate paladin as Thunder rocked back and forth. As cum flowed into her womb she whinnied in pleasure she had never known before. As Thunder finished and Lightning regained her senses she wondered what her next action should be.
11312.title: I will try the stew. It tastes a little off.
