Perhaps she could draw them out with ambush attacks or get an ally to assist her. Perhaps the most dangerous choice was seeking the help of a dragon that lived nearby.
122111.title: Help the wolves

1221111.content:
Marina didn’t have an army to act in multiple spots but she could travel fast and use her magic to craft an army that could help her commit the attacks she wanted. The supply train would make a great target. Dreze was starting to stretch his army thin by crossing the border into the Kingdom of Dar and he would need a supply train to keep his army feed and properly armed. He was likely working on depot stations that he could stock along the way and outposts to protect his resources.

She found what she was looking for, a bear, the animal would be hungry this time of the year as it woke from winter. Her magic swelled the animal and hunger grew within it at the transformation into a monstrous bear that dwarfed even the mighty dire bear. Marina toughened the hide so arrows and most other weapons wouldn’t pierce the hide of the creature and gave it the scent trail of the supply train before releasing it from her magic. There was likely be consequences for her actions but it was worth it if she could end the rule of Dreze.

The wizard was crafting monsters that might terrorize these lands for years to come if they weren’t slain but she vowed she would clean up the dangers she was creating this day once the land was freed from the rule of her former master. Even in her short time here she could see that a great deal of dark and forbidden magic he had used. Slave collars, life drainers, and dread rings were just a few of the items used by the man. She would do what she needed to and spend the rest of her life ending the evils he had filled the world with but she needed more dangers to draw him out of his shielded layer.

The animals would cause some danger but they wouldn’t be enough. They were creatures that acted on instincts alone and wouldn’t generally seek out the soldiers of Dreze to do battle. She would need creatures that had minds that she could direct towards her desire. It was a dangerous road she was walking but she promised herself that anyone she convinced to help her would have to be willing to undergo the changes she would make to them. She needed lines she wouldn’t cross or she would be no better than Dreze.
1221111.title: Make ambush attacks

choices: Dreze discovers trouble in his land
12211111.content:
A troll would be a good target for her magic because of how easily their bodies changed. Many trolls mutated into deadlier forms on their own without any help from outside forces developing extra heads or limbs. Their minds tended to be simple things obsessed with killing and eating but they could be directed. The creatures wouldn’t be very hard to find, all you had to do was follow the smell. The creatures were immune to poisons, and diseases and often ate rancid meat and left hunks lying around ripening to suit there tastes around the ground.

Moving around in the form of a wolf allowed her to cover great distances and observe things even farther than her eyes could see. The forests were alive with life but she avoided the humans and other creatures she smelled and heard seeking out what she wanted. Trolls were not exactly welcomed creatures in a kingdom and were hunted down so it wasn’t a surprise that it took her many hours to find one that was lurking far from civilization. The creature was a runt for its kind, it barely stood four foot and it appeared to be surviving on mountain goats.

She shifted back to human form and approached the camp with caution and more importantly magical defenses up. The creature sniffed the air and turned in her direction ready to fight as she appeared out of the woods. It growled at her but didn’t approach her as she moved towards it being careful to stay out of reach of the fearsome green creature. Even at this size, the troll could overpower many a full-sized warrior if given the chance.

“I have come to make a deal with you,” Marina said.

“What do you offer Grot, human” the creature asked using a tone that suggested it considered being human an insult. It didn’t bother her because most things that were civilized were hated by the creatures.

“I have powerful magic that I can offer you to make you bigger and stronger. I ask that you attack and destroy the forces of Dreze in return. You may keep any loot you take.”

“Dreze is powerful, his army is strong prove you can make me able to fight them and we will see if we have a deal.”

Grot started to swell in size as the rags he was wearing tore as he doubled in height standing over eight feet tall with powerful muscles that could snap bones with ease. His claws sharpened and strengthened until they could cut metal. The creature eyed the changes in disbelief at what had happened but the pleasure was obvious.

“I like your deal, I accept,” Grot was already walking away towards civilized lands to test his new strength. The creature had the bonus of being able to regenerate but she had left it vulnerable to fire in case it needed to be put down later.
12211111.title: Find a Troll

choices: Roar a challenge to the leader
122111111.content:
Grot moved across the land with a confidence he had never experienced before and he knew just where he wanted to strike. Orc Den was a fort of the fearsome orcs who worked under the flag of Dreze and they had refused to accept him into service and even humiliated him for long hours so he had become a pariah to his own community with no hopes of finding a mate or a war band but all of that had changed for him. His dreams had grown just as large as his size, he would soon be the leader of his own war band leading them to victory over others. Destroying this fort would earn him the respect and fear he had craved for years.

Torches lit the grounds around the fort as orcs snorted and grunted on their night patrols. The creatures were being noisy and chatting with each other in their guttural language. Grot had always hated the language, it didn’t have the power of his native language that he shared with the Giants. They could easily be avoided but he had no desire to do that now that he had the advantage.

“Little pigs, I have come to hear you squeal!” He charged the group of three and ripped the axe from the grip of the first and buried it in the head of the second one. His clawed his tore the flesh from the throat of the first one and watched as the third finally collected himself and pulled out his short sword and stabbed it into Grot’s exposed belly.

There was little pain for the troll who smiled as he pulled the weapon from his body. The wound was already healing before the sword had fully exited his body. Grot could see his green-skinned enemy struggle to fight the turn of the blade but the troll felt no difficulty in turning the weapon against its master. With a powerful thrust, he planted the blade in the belly of the orc warrior and left him to die as he went to invade the fort.

The fort did not seem as impressive as it once had, the walls were in wood but they were in poor repair and the keep within still had signs of a siege weapon damage from years ago. Climbing over the wall was easy as he landed on the muddy ground that was filled with tents.
122111111.title: Follow Grot

1221111111.content:
“I seek the best warrior,” Grot roared. “I will show you who is best!”

For years he had to live on the fringes of society because of his small size. Now, he would take his place as the greatest warrior. More than a little drool rolled down his face as he thought of the tasty orc flesh to come. A warrior’s heart was just the thing to curb the hunger growing in his belly.

The orcs snapped to awareness but they made no rush to fight the troll. They were a warrior species but one who depended on numbers for bravery. Despite being tougher and stronger than humans no single orc would face the lesser creatures much less the meat grinder like a troll. Cautiously they covered themselves in armor and weapons preparing for battle none of them hoped to fight.

“Who dares invade Blood Spear lands?” Grot chuckled quietly at the brusque words.

The chieftain covered in trophies of many victories approached with a band of at least ten bodyguards in front of him. His approach was announced by the jangle of dozens of his victim’s teeth and skulls but it did little to hide the fear. He was committing one of the gravest sins of an orc, he was getting old. The many scars of battle couldn’t hide the wrinkles starting to form. Only a shaman was allowed to reach such a time. He must be cunning indeed to avoid sharpened blades of younger generations.

“I am Grot,” he announced himself. “I seek to join a war band to raid the humans. To prove my worth I will fight one of yours to the death.”

“So only the best will do,” a nasty grin formed on the Chieftain’s face. “I, Argug Chief of the Blood Spears, will think on this. Betraying Dreze is a great risk. You must prove yourself worthy of such a risk by taking on my two most powerful Barug and Dul in a fight to the death.”

Two orcs stepped forward to the roar of the bloodthirsty crowd but their eyes didn’t leave the chief. Why get rid of one rival for power when you could get rid of two?

“Gladly,” Grot stretched his fingers so the pair would get a good look at his long flesh-tearing nails.

The pair spared a glance filled with daggers at each other as they squared off against the troll. Death for two or three was likely no matter who came out victorious. Dul a powerful brute even by orc standards charged forward swinging his battle-ax. Grot did not attempt to avoid the attack. He stepped into it embracing the pain as it cleaved through flesh and bone.

Horror dawned on the orc as it dawned on him this was no death blow. Instead, the teeth of a carnivore bit deeply into the soft flesh of the throat. Grot turned to away from the dying enemy pulling free the ax so his body could heal properly.

“Get me a torch!” Barug demanded. He leaped out of the way of his gigantic opponent. The bright green blood of Grot made the ground slick. A torch was being brought to Barug but Argug made no motion for the lesser orc to hurry.

Panic was seizing the rival to the chief as Grot played with him. The troll was enjoying bating him around. A slash here or there and the leather armor he wore was little better than rags. Finally, the torch was arriving meaning his fun was over. It wouldn’t save his opponent at this point but it would be a long time to heal. A powerful blow brought the heart free.

Grot savored the taste as the crowds cheered at the show. They had lost two of their number but gained someone more powerful than the pair. There was no word for sentiment in the orc tongue.

“You have done well mighty warrior,” Argug cautiously drew close. “Enjoy the night and tomorrow we will make our move.”
1221111111.title: Challenge the deadliest warrior

1222.content:
She could hear movement in the woods up ahead of her and smelled the fine steel of soldiers. Marina looked out on to the road and located a group of scouts on the road moving further into the Kingdom. There was caution to their movement as they eyed the woods and grounds for enemies. The three scouts held crossbows at the ready causing the mage to back into the woods in case they decided they wanted some fresh meat tonight.

Seeing how scared they looked she decided to test them and smashed her hooves into a tree shaking the tree with the force causing branches to break and filling the woods with noise. Two of the scouts pulled their crossbows in a panic sending wild shots off harmlessly in the woods. The third man shook his head at the other two and headed towards the woods to investigate the sound.

“Marn, you stay here,” the leader said. “George, you reload your weapon and come with me.

They didn’t wear the uniforms of the army of Dreze but they had forgotten to hide their tattoos marking them as servants to the dark ruler of their land. She wondered what their story would be if they came across a superior force, most likely that they had escaped from the slave armies of the man. Marina moved to the road and circled to the front of Marn and approached the man distracted by his loading of his weapon.

He noticed her, surprised a deer would come so close but it was just a harmless animal so he went back to work. Marina leaped forward, knocking the man to the ground and processed to stomp him into oblivion. She quickly bounded into the woods as the men came back to investigate the sound of their dying friend. It had been a good opportunity but it would be much more difficult to take out the rest in this form. If she took out the scouts it could slow the army down as they tried to figure out what was happening but these scouts were not the real danger.

Her nostrils flared as they caught a whiff of smoke and she knew something big was burning in the distance. She raced through the woods as she thought of the border town of Golden Gate which was nearby and it might be burning to the ground by the armies of Dreze. She would make the man pay if he had torched the town.
1222.title: Encounter a group of scouts

1223.content:
Marina was well past the front line of the army with little resistance, one soldier took a lazy shot at her but she saw it wasn’t very accurate so she just picked up her pace to get out of range before he could reload. The real trouble would come when she came close to the dark wizard’s main came. He was notorious for being paranoid and she doubted even an ant would make it into his camp without being noticed, so she would have to come up with some sort of distraction to use against him.

She heard the sound of something approaching but she resisted the urge to run until she knew what it was. Relief filled her as she saw it was a buck approaching her and she went back to contemplating her problem quickly forgetting the animal of the forest, but the buck didn’t forget about her. The tongue reached out and licked her genital.

Animal arousal took over her body as her body called on her to receive this powerful buck’s seed inside of her. She hadn’t taken a close enough look at her body to realize it was in heat and now she was paying for it. The instincts of her body to mate were too difficult to fight for her distracted mind. The male animal didn’t need a formal invite and mounted her and pounded her body before releasing sperm inside her receptive body. Once he had spent his load he left without out so much as a thank you. Marina’s body told her she needed fuel to feed her future young so she started to eat the foliage around her starting to forget about her mission and the lives that were depending on her.

It was becoming harder to keep her human mind intact, but if she turned back into a human here she was likely to be detected. Perhaps she could change into another animal or she could give in to the feelings she was having and become a doe because she had a good start. She might already be pregnant and if she wasn’t she was sure the buck was willing to service her again. It had certainly felt very good and it had been a long time since she had the pleasures of the flesh.
1223.title: A buck shows some interest

123.content:
Marina walked towards the portal along the enchanted path making sure to not stray from it. The work was worth it to prevent others from using the portal for evil purposes. It surprised her to see her fellow council member Ari and Ari's apprentice Hector. They were dressed and equipped for combat not ceremony which surprised and worried Marina more than she cared to admit. Their presence likely meant they were going to try and prevent her from using the portal because they were allied with the enemy.

"We can't let you go," Ari eyes almost looked pleading. "You're my friend but I will do everything in my power to stop you."

"I can understand Hector's betrayal because that weasel would sell out his own mother, but you have always been a true believer in the cause, so I ask you why you are doing this." Marina asked her friend.

"He has my family," tears welled in Ari's eyes. "He won't harm them if we stop you from leaving so please just don't go."

"If we work together we could easily save them."

"I can't take that chance," Ari threw a freeze spell at Marina but a barrier spell prevented it from taking effect.

"My turn," An evil grin covered Hector's face. A spell lashed out at Marina with great force shattering her barrier striking her with great force.

The change called to her to relent to its beckoning but it was quickly countered by her amulet of protection. Before the spell dissipated Marina gathered it up and shot it back at Hector with great joy. Shock covered Hector's face as his own spell overwhelmed him. The heat became overwhelming and he quickly through his robes to the ground. Hate filled his eyes as he realized he would soon be the buxom, horny wench he had intended Marina to become. Long blonde locks grew on his head as his chest heaved him forward with the weight of two large mounds which called gravity down upon him. His manhood was gone in a flash as new feelings began to fill his mind what little of it was left of her new mind.

"Serves you right for trying to do such a terrible thing. Now, for you my friend," Marina's voice had turned icier than Ari's freeze spell. Marina drained to of her energy containing rings to make sure her spell broke through. The ancient words flowed from her lips and soon her will gave life to them. "I shall change you back when I return, but take this time to reflect on the consequences your actions could have had.

Ari wanted to scream in frustration as the spell shattered her defenses and struck her but she found herself frozen in place as her muscles stiffened in place. She grew in size within moments ripping clothing leaving her naked but she didn't feel cold because the sun warmed her body. The skin on Ari's body began to get rough as it stiffened into bark. Her arms stretched to sky as they called out for life giving sunlight as leaves sprouted from the branches which had once been fingers. Soon she was robbed of her sight and left with her thoughts and the gentle breeze in the air.

Tears welled in Marina as she saw her friend turned into a tree but she repressed them because she had a job to do. She cast a small spell to guide the naked woman to the village safely and didn't bother dressing her because she wouldn't keep them on for long anyways. It would be amusing to see the villager's reaction to a naked woman walking into the village but she didn't have the time. The real question is how should she proceed with her journey? Marina had severly depleted her magic and she would be jumping into the heart of enemy territory, but if she used the portal she wouldn't have to fight through an army of Dreze's minions, and she didn't know how far Ari's deal with Dreze went. He could be planning to use the portal to bring his armies through so should she destroy it to be safe. It would be a tough choice.
123.title: Use the hidden portal to get behind enemy lines

choices: Try to use the portal again
1231.content:
The wizard lit up the portal crafting a link to where she wanted to go and prepared her best defensive spells. It would be a shame to destroy what had taken so long to build and she felt it was worth a little risk. She overcharged a ring if her gamble proved foolish and stepped through the shimmering surface and into a new place filled with darkness. No light met her eyes and she was worried that she had gotten the wrong location. Most portals were placed in the sun where they could draw power from the sun. Marina drew power from the ring and lit the room.

She wished there was more information about this portal but Dreze had destroyed so many records of ages past in his quest to be the only one with knowledge about his lands. Marina wasn’t sure who had built this portal but runes started to illuminate the room revealing fine stone craftsmanship. The room looked like it had just been cleaned without a spot of dust or web in sight but she was sure it had been many years since anyone had touched this room. Dreze had performed a purge of all the dwarves who were too strong of will to fall to his mind control. Her former master not only wanted obedience to his commands but he wanted a facade of love for him.

Dreze had always had a great ego and she had often manipulated him by stroking it to get access to new spells or magic items. She often wondered how much he believed or if he even cared that she was lying to him. It would have been nice if she could believe he had been corrupted by the Azara Stone but the stone had no influence over the user, the only evil of the stone was what the person used it for. It had given her master the ability to take command of the land and she wondered if Dreze had slain the royal family or if they were locked away somewhere as nearly mindless playthings for him when it amused him.

Cautiously walking around the room she looked for warnings of dangers in the runes in case traps had been left by the dwarfs. They tended to be protective of their secrets and it wouldn’t be a surprise if they had placed a trap for an outsider using their portal. The good thing about dwarves is they liked to be consistent with their language so even over great time and distances they could be read.

These were the Halls of the Keepers of Stone who would do what needed to be done to protect their secrets, she read. Marina had heard of them but they were supposed to have vanished over a thousand years ago. Questions swirled in her mind about how she had gotten the access to this place, the information on the portal had not suggested it was a place this old or fabled. Had it been just an accident or was there more at work here?
1231.title: Use the portal

1232.content:
Marina decided to head back to the town to grab some more supplies because it was never a good idea to go when you are emotional and having to transform someone you had trusted and was a close friend. If the enemy did have access to the portal they would find a nasty surprise waiting for them. She had set up a trap for anyone accessing that portal that would give his forces an explosive surprise.

She would have to find another way to travel since she thought using the portal was too much risk. The fortunate news, fresh from a traveler, was that the armies of Dreze had suffered a recent setback when they tried to use a shortcut through the mountains. Unfortunately for them, they had disturbed the fire goddess of the mountain as she liked to be titled Keahi was a fearsome fire dragon and instead of paying her tribute they had tried to slay her. This did not please the ancient dragon who ruled the territory. The armies had suffered heavy losses from the battle and the stubborn nature of the Dreze wouldn’t allow him to leave the battle and find an easier path for invasion.

Dreze was likely to win in the end but he was likely to lose a large part of his forces in the effort because he wouldn’t want to risk himself in combat. It was likely to even turn back the army if the red dragon could hold out long enough. The thought assisting the dragon was one idea for her next move but the creature was likely to want some sort of tribute from her.

As she bought some supplies for the trip and wondered if she should try to gather a mercenary company in the south to assist her. Attacking the army from the back with the dragon at the front of them would lead to great results. It would be a large expenditure of money but she was likely to get a large reward from the King that should more than cover it.

The final plan that occurred to her was the most dangerous one to risk. Some of the mountains carried molten rock that could melt even the strongest metals. If she were to dig a tunnel, she could pour the lava down through the pass that most of the army was taking ending the threat of invasion but there were a lot of problems with the plan. It wasn’t just the dragon that was likely to oppose her plan as she would have to travel through monster filled lands by herself and the work was likely to be noticed by the creatures of the Underdark.

She was starting to feel better with a plan in hand to allow her to focus and her only wish as she sat at the Inn for a warm meal was that the town had better magical supplies. The herb shops goods were poor at best so she would have to look for things along the way which would delay her when she wasn’t sure how much time she had left.
1232.title: Go to town for supplies

1233.content:
Marina needed to destroy the portal, so no enemy forces could use it. They had already gotten through to this side, it was no stretch of the imagination that there would be many more servants on the other side. Many years of labor and magical power had gone into the making of this portal and she was going to destroy the portal in one day. She set magical explosive charges and moved back to a safe distance so she could watch the end. A giant explosion of blue flames flew up to light up the sky but the magic user’s spell held preventing damage to the surrounding forest. A tear dropped down her cheek as she felt the magic fade and started walking past the rubble towards the army of Dreze.

She had worked on this portal with Ari and her master who had passed away years ago. It was like losing a part of her master that she could never get back. As for Ari, she would save her friend’s family despite her actions. Marina wished her friend had trusted her but she would deal with that later. There would need to be serious consequences for betraying the council, and she couldn’t protect her friend from that threat. It was likely going to be a stripping her of magic for betraying them to work for Dreze, whatever the reason.

The Kingdom of Dar was one of the few places magic was accepted and allowed to be practiced openly with only reasonable restrictions. Even necromancy was allowed with some supervision. Most kingdoms were afraid of magic users with very good reasons, because most people had no protection against magic, so the council of magic users in Dar was very careful to see they had no reason to fear magic. The punishments were harsh but they needed to calm the fears of the people.

Ari had been a fool to trust Dreze would keep his word that he would free her family. The man wouldn’t release his hold on a powerful spell caster. The man ruled with fear and power over his people. No one was allowed to become powerful in his kingdom without being bound to him. She shuddered at the thought of having one of his slave collars around her neck.

She would need to make a decision on her next course of action. If his forces had been gathering around the portal striking his front lines might have a devastating effect, and allow the army’s of King Emeril to push forward, or she could seek out the leader to cut off the head of the snake who was likely hiding behind the walls of his palace but her heart called for her to help the family of her friend first. It might not be the best choice because she had no idea where they were. There were several prisons or slave camps he could be keeping them at, but it would at least feel good to free the prisoners and she might get aid from them or be able to start a resistance.
1233.title: Destroy the portal

12333.content:
Marina decided she wanted to help out Ari, so she would feel like she was doing some good. Fighting soldiers who were often under threat of Dreze as well didn’t sit well with her. A rescue mission would help to inspire her to take down Dreze, and she would likely need help to do that and what better people than the ones he had wrongly imprisoned.

There were three prisons controlled by the dread wizard, and she would need to decide which one to attack first. Perhaps if the prison breaks inspired enough people a revolt could form, and picking the right one was critical for that. She wanted to go straight for Ari’s family but she wasn’t sure that was the best idea as it wouldn’t take long for the wizards working for Dreze to figure out that the portal wasn’t working, and they would know that Ari had been defeated, so they may suspect that Marina was going to be coming for her friend’s family.

Bleak Towers was likely the location the family was imprisoned with other political prisoners who spoke out against Dreze or those the wizard used to blackmail others to do his bidding. Most of the people were not threats in combat, but their words or actions had drawn the anger of the ruler of the lands. They were usually imprisoned there until their final fate was decided, usually when Dreze wanted to make an example of someone or because their usefulness had come to an end. It was in a remote region at the top of a mountain with numerous towers guarding the path, but she could likely get in easily in the form of a flying creature. The prisoners might not be able to fight but they could certainly spread the word and inspire others to fight back against the dread wizard.

The Asylum was probably the most well protected of the prisons as it held enemy spellcasters and warriors. They would be the best to have in a fight, but the defenses were fearsome and there was a garrison nearby and anti-magic fields around the building. She would need to get help to take the place and free the people from the control of Dreze. No one had ever escaped from the place, so she had no idea what to expect on the inside in the way of defenses, and that scared her.

Pleasure Palace was the last prison, and in many ways, it was the worst of them all. The prisoners were transformed into sex slaves to serve the pleasures of the elites of the land. She would need a lot of countermagic if she went there. Marina wished there was some sort of spell to heal the mental suffering that had occurred while the people were enslaved. As there were elites from the kingdom at the place meant there would likely to be bodyguards as well as the usual guards, but not as many as at the other locations.

Once she had decided she would make the proper preparations, so her plan would have a good chance of success. Marina was frightened at the prospect of failure when she felt so many people were depending on her success. The armies of King Emeril would have a much better chance of success if she could divide the attention of Dreze, so he would have to split his armies, and it might draw the man out of his fortified palace so she could take a good strike against the man. She said a silent prayer for her success and made her decision.
12333.title: Prison Break

123331.content:
Attacking Bleak Tower seemed like the best idea because it would create a great deal of distraction to the dread ruler of this land which would allow her to attack a bigger target. She decided on taking the form of an eagle because it would give her weapons to use if she needed to and allow her to go unnoticed by the guards as just another animal part of the natural order.

Bleak Tower was on a plateau with high cliffs on all sides with only a single bridge able to access the prison. Large towers loomed over either side of the bridge with archers ready to shoot down any escaping prisoners. High winds made trying to climb the walls, either up or down deadly at the best of times but for an eagle, it made flying easy.

Marina loved being a bird soaring high above the world especially in such fantastic conditions. Her keen eyes saw that most of the guards were putting in half-hearted efforts into their work. Many were on the verge of sleep if they weren’t outright snoring. They were likely bored and thought they were invulnerable to an attack but the mage intended to prove them wrong.

She landed on top of a tower and looked down at the prisoners in the center of the walls of the prison. The masses of people huddled together for warmth against the chill of the mountain and chilling winds. To her delight she didn’t see many guards, there didn’t appear to be any large barracks. Dreze had not spent much on guards for this prison but to be fair there wasn’t much need for defense. A few archers and high walls could handle any attempt at escape. The clothing the prisoners were wearing wouldn’t allow them to survive in the much harsher winds outside the prison walls. She decided on a plan of an attack and executed it.
123331.title: Bleak Towers

1233312.content:
Marina moved from tower to tower and made sure she saw all of the guards on duty. The man worked long hours doing boring work so they weren’t particularly alert but they noticed her because an eagle was about the only thing to view in this cold miserable place. She ignored them as she took note of their positions and decided her next course of action. A change was in order if she was going to stay out here for longer because it was getting cold for this form but she could think of another that wouldn’t be bothered by the arctic winds.

Drake hated guard duty in this place of nightmares but the consequences of disobeying orders were terrifying. He saw the creature climb off of the tower and the horror of it froze him for a moment, a yeti. The man eating monstrosity was feared in every cold mountainous region in the world. Their hunger was never satisfied and even frost giant feared to fight the creatures one on one. He rushed to the alarm bell slamming the door behind him praying it would be enough.

She had to be careful to not lose herself to the urges especially in a creature so primal. Two guards had been slain before the alarm sounded. A direct assault would draw the attention away from the prisoners she thought as she smacked a couple to them to their deaths on the hard courtyard below to give the prisoners something to work with.

The doors were designed to keep out human intruders but the thick wooden doors shattered under her pounding fists. Five guards charged her but their blades only made small scratches in her thick hide. Metal bent and bones broke under her assault leaving her surrounded by corpses. Her stomach rumbled in hunger and she tore off a few pieces to eat. It disturbed her to eat humans but until she was done fighting it was best to fill her belly with food to prevent her having to fight the instincts of the form.

Roaring with rage she charged the archers pelting her with arrows. Her powerful legs carried to them and started batting them around sending them flying from the walls. As her jaws closed on the final one she realized she was starting to lose control over the body. It might be better to return to human form especially since most of the guards were likely dead but she could remain as she was and dominate any enemy she came across.

It felt so good to be so powerful, even after slaying over a dozen and taking on so many attacks she was still ready for more. Marina stomped down the stairs looking for the office of the warden determined to devour his tender flesh in her jaws. She growled at the metal door protecting the ruler of this place but her kind couldn’t be kept out by such things. It hurt her fists bashing in the door but it started to obey her demands as it bent inwards. Her thoughts were becoming less clear as hunger started to fill her.

The man inside cowered behind his table pleading in a language she didn’t understand, at least not anymore. Fighting the dark thoughts in her head, she froze in place as the man started to run past. Her claws lashed out instinctively slaying the warden and with a twist of the ring on her finger she was human once again, it had been close this time, too close. She’d have to figure out what went wrong later, her current problem was how to get the people past the guard towers.
1233312.title: Direct attack

12333122.content:
It was far too dangerous to return to the form of a yeti, it had been too close already so she decided to transform the group and get them out of here. She would have to be careful because this would drain most of her magical power and leave her vulnerable. Marina tried to ignore the carnage as she moved to the doors to release the prisoners but it was hard. The doors opened to the chill in the air and she walked out and opened the locked gate with warden’s keys.

The prisoners stared in astonishment at the stranger walking into the courtyard. She didn’t wear the garb of one of the guards but they didn’t trust that this wasn’t some sort of trick. The guards liked to play games with them that often resulted in death but as their gazes turned towards the walls and towers they couldn’t see anyone watching them or their movements.

“I have slain the guards in the main prison,” Marina explained the gathering crowd. “The towers along the path to freedom are still manned but I have a plan to get you past them. I am a powerful wizard and I will be able to transform all of you into animals to escape from this place and when we get to safety I will change you back. Some may know my name of Marina of the Enlightened Circle and the good I have done in the world. We must decide on what animal to transform everyone into.”

“What if we chose not to risk the change?” a voice shouted.

“Your options are limited, the cold will kill you if exit without the proper attire that only the guards in the outside towers have and they aren’t going to part with it willingly and they will shoot you on sight if they see you. You could stay here and remain, prisoners, where you will likely be executed for the deaths of guards in front of large crowds or rot for the rest of your days. I don’t see many other options for you but if you think of one let me know.”

She let them huddle together and discuss with themselves so they could come to the same conclusions she had. Marina eyed the sky and wondered when the guards in the tower would signal the alarm and contact the rest of Dreze’s forces. They needed to be out of here by morning before the guards missed their morning meal but it was possible there needed to be signals at certain hours during the night. The sooner they all got out of here the better off they all would be.

“Could you use your magic to slay the rest of the guards or transform them instead?” a woman asked.

Marina shook her head no, “I am not a combat mage and they would be able to raise the alarm before we got out of here and the forces would soon be upon us. They are too spread out to change at once and unwilling targets are much more difficult to change.

“Then I guess you are right about our choices,” a gray-haired woman said. “What are our options to be changed into?”

“There are three good options I can think of but they all have some risk and danger,” Marina answered. “A rabbit would go unnoticed especially at night but you would be defenseless and vulnerable to predators, becoming wolves would give you defenses but you will be more likely to be spotted and humans often take a dim view of the animals, and finally a bird, this would allow you to fly out of here unseen and let us get far from here before the fact that you are missing gets noticed, you would leave no trail to follow but it is also the most dangerous. Fly is not the easiest thing to master under the best of conditions and these are not the best of conditions and you have never been a bird before. Which path should we follow?”
12333122.title: Transform the prisoners

123331222.content:
“I am tired of being defenseless,” an elderly looking man, withered by time and the conditions of this place of horror. As a man, his steps were weak and strained but the determination in his eyes was clear. “Let us be the wolf so that we can fight, so we can travel as a pack to make this land a better place.”

The crowd cheered his words and nodded in agreement. It was a nice sentiment but only time would show if they were right or wrong. Marina started crafting the ritual circle infusing it with the magic that would be needed. She could already feel her strength draining from her body. Transforming so many would leave her without her precious power for longer than she would like. When she spent magic like she was doing this day it left her feeling naked. It was unnatural to be without it. She was tempted to call on the extra energy she had stored in her items but it was a dangerous practice. It was important to let magic come back on its own. It was her suspicion that Dreze had called on the magic too many times and it had warped him.

There was no time to worry about that now as she activated the magic causing the shifting and changing of the people. For the first time in who knew how long the prisoners felt warm as fur-coated there bodies. Old bodies and weak bodies became strong again as they became young vibrant wolves in an array of colors. The lush fur of silver, black, and even auburn filled the grounds as Marina cracked the door to freedom open and allowed her own body to shift into a wolf.

She was a powerful wolf with a beautiful gray coat ready to lead her pack into the night. Marina could hear the group yipping and barking in excitement eager to face the world but she gave a stern look calling for silence. There was a small chance that she could get them out of here in secret under the gaze of the archers.

Rushing into shadows of the towers she guided the others in the way to avoid detection. To use the guard toward for cover. Worry filled her heart as they followed her example but there were so many that it was unlikely they would go unnoticed. She sent those with the best-camouflaged fur first hoping they wouldn’t be spotted.
123331222.title: Run as a pack

1233312222.content:
Everything was going well for the people moving from the shadows and she hoped it would continue but the worst part was ahead of them. A large clearing was between them and freedom and it was well lit unless the guards were completely blind or asleep they were certain to be spotted but at least it was the last pair of towers, most of them would escape unscathed.

Marina debated being the last to run or the first but it didn’t take long for her to decide she needed to be first, she knew the way out of this land. She moved quickly across the snowy ground and wasn’t surprised when she wasn’t shot at. A single wolf wouldn’t invoke interest from the guards other than some novelty but multiple of them would certainly attract a response.

After she reached the would and took cover she turned back to see what the others were up to. Her gaze turned to the towers where the guards were waiting for enemies to attack. As the prisoners raced across the clearing the guards started to ring the bells and draw their bows for an attack on the dozens of wolves fleeing from the place.

The guards had no idea what they were dealing with but they were certain it wasn’t natural and worse was the fact no one inside the prison was responding to their alarms. They would be blamed for this when the master of this land found out about this and there would be no saving themselves even if they stopped this prison break.

Malik dropped his bow,” Stop the alarm we need to get out of here.”

Sarna stopped the alarm so he could talk, “When Dreze hears about this . . .”

“If we don’t run now none of us is going to survive!”

The alarms went silent and the others heard his words but he didn’t care. He had a family to protect. He needed to get them to safety before the monster discovered what had happened here. If no one reported this there was a chance no one would discover what happened for over a week. They weren’t getting a delivery for another twelve days, he prayed that it would be enough time. The others could do what they wanted but he was getting out of here.

Each of the guards started to leave their towers and realized the threat they were under and chose to run. They had many tales of people getting away from the master of this country and if they could get away far enough perhaps they could be one of those stories.

Marina could feel relief pour over her as all of the prisoners made it to the woods safely. Freedom was theirs at least for a brief moment and it felt very good. It appeared that the guards had decided run and she felt it was the best idea for them and the chaos was for the best for her group of people. There was a long distance from where she would feel safe changing them back to human because of the cold.

They would have to be careful to avoid patrols because they were certain to realize that something was up with such a large pack but she wanted to make sure they were human before she allowed them to split into smaller groups. They could make the proper plans in human form to help take down the forces of Dreze from within his own kingdom.
1233312222.title: Freedom

12333122221.content:
Marina wasn’t certain how long she could maintain control of the group. They were already starting to spread out. The powerful senses of a wolf were alluring. It was like experiencing an entirely new world but she kept trying to herd them into a tighter group. She wished they understood the danger they were facing. A maniac like Dreze was always paranoid even in the heart of his territory. There would be patrols lurking all around searching for strange things to investigate. They were certain to have a quota of incidents to solve or risk the wrath of their higher-ups and a giant pack of wolves would serve nicely.

Her muscles were starting to call for a break as she raced ahead to a rise in the land to spy ahead. The wizard felt her heart sink as she saw a patrol of a dozen armed men coming. Marina turned to the others and lifted her front paw to them to signal them to stop. She wasn’t certain they understood or if they were just confused but they stopped. They followed her lead as she laid down. Relief poured over her as she crawled forward to see if she could learn more about the group.

“Shouldn’t we be more spread out if we are going to spot the enemy?” A rookie asked a superior.

“If you want to freeze your ass off be my guest,” the man motioned to the surrounding land to the laughter of the others. “The only enemy in these parts are children who don’t snap to obedience quickly enough. I suspect even you might be able to handle one of them. If there is more than one child you best race back here so I can protect you.”

The young man flushed in anger at the teasing, “Did you forget we are at war!?!”

“Did you forget the front lines are about a hundred miles from here runt?” the large man sneered. “We are here to look pretty and make sure the fine citizens never forget their duty to Dreze. Even rebels wouldn’t be stupid enough to be out on a day like this.”

Marina had to admit there was truth to his words. The wind was blistering to bare skin and the cold could shake a man apart. A wolf could easily handle the chill of this frosty realm. Especially when they were huddled all together.

A slight growl drew her attention and she realized a few of the others had climbed up for a look. Marina smacked the offender with her tail and shook her head before turning back to see how much damage had been done.

“What was that?” the rookie trotted his horse out of line to the bottom of the hill.

The large man joined him, “Your yapping has disturbed some local canine. Quick! You had better go after it and teach it the proper respect for the Black Flames of Dreze.”

He looked uncertain about what to do as the group laughed. The soldiers had stopped for the moment but none of them made their way over to help him. Still, his eyes scanned the top of the crest looking for an excuse to charge up there. It was clear he was tired of the abuses of superior and didn’t want to be the but of any further humiliation.

The wizard was just as uncertain. If any of them came to the top of the hill they were certain to be spotted but there was a chance they come up here. If they got into a fight they were more likely to be detected but it was better to start one than wait for the enemy to be ready for them.
12333122221.title: A patrol

1233312223.content:
It had been six years since the disastrous escape attempt. Marina, could still remember it, though hazily, the thoughts of her 'training' and the simple needs of breeding, eating, loyalty clouded her remaining human thoughts.

It had gone wrong right from the start. The prisoners were ill-suited for their animals forms and though she had tried her best to keep them quiet, they had lacked anything resembling organization. They had been clumsy on their new four feet, stumbling into objects, getting distracted by their heightened senses, too excited to stay silent as they made their way through the complex. And so it was that the remaining guards had descended upon them with swords, bows and nets. Many of the prisoners had died, including the old man who had spoke up for the change into wolves. Marina herself had been knocked out in the ambush and when she had awoke, she found herself muzzled and bound, still in her canine form along with all the other prisoners, living and dead. She had, along with the survivors, had been forced to watch the guards collect the bodies of the slain and laugh about how they'd make fine cloaks, and then suffer the humiliation of being carried away to the depths of the fortress they had sought to escape from before being roughly deposited in heavy steel cages like the animals they were.

Days passed and hunger, dehydration, the oppressive dark and dampness of the dungeon took their toll on Marina and the other prisoners before they saw their captors again. Among the entourage of humans was a mage, who took one look at Marina, locked in her cage, and chuckled.

"She's the source of the charm. It is good you left them bound and muzzled, she would have no doubt cast the counter spell and you'd have another riot on your hands. But fret not, I have the perfect spell in mind to end your problems..."

Marina's changed eyes went wide when the mage began speaking an incantation, and with a wave of his waves and a flash of blue light, Marina felt her own magic diminish until it was little more than a slight tingle in the back of her mind. She had been cut off! Without access to her magic she'd never be able to cancel her own spell.

She, and all the other prisoners, were stuck.

It was soon after that her life was made infinitely worse. The prisoners, not realizing the predicament that they were in, whimpered and pawed as best as they could at the guards, especially when bowls of food and water were produced. One by one the prisoners were released; those still defiant were slain, and those that followed basic commands were allowed to eat and drink. Those that were especially submissive were fitted with leather collars and leashes and led out of the dungeon. Those that resisted the collar were bound, muzzled, and placed once more into their cages. Marina was never released, and as the guards left her and the others in darkness once more, she was overcome with fear and hunger.

What she could only guess as two days later the guards returned and repeated the routine. This time, all of the prisoners submitted to being collared and led away, while the guards and the mage that had locked her away from her magic carefully and slowly unbound Marina and removed the muzzle, looking for any sign of resistance, though Marina was so weak from hunger and dehydration that she could barely lift herself to her feet. The mage chuckled as he had watched her stagger towards the offered food and water, her mind clouded beyond anything other than survival. She never even felt the collar and leash find their way slipped around her canine neck. When she was finished feeding, and the horrid aches of near death began to lessen, she had cast a single look around the now empty cages, and to the smirking guards. Then she felt a slight pull at her neck, and Marina found herself pulled towards the large doorway that all the other prisoners disappeared down.

That was the moment that Marina had surrendered to her fate. From there it was an endless routine of obedience training, those that failed were quickly made into cloaks or decoration, and Marina and her pack soon learned to obey any and all commands given by the Houndmaster. After ensuring their new pets were broken, the guards began training them to hunt for them, and it was soon apparent that their still human minds made them incredible hunters and guard animals. Soon the pack's numbers decreased even further as several of the guards took to selling them for a bag or two of coin to passing nobles.

Marina and the handful of other female prisoners were forced to become breeding stock as the guards forced the male wolves upon them again and again to replenish the kennel numbers. Giving birth to litters of wolf pups, sired by one of the many anonymous males, had been humiliating and painful, and the pups themselves showed no sign of being anything more than animals. But they were trainable as well, and the prison become known across the kingdom as the Wolfhound Kennels, the only place in the land to buy full blooded wolf pups.

And thus was her fate. Marina, what was left of her human personality, uttered a silent mental curse at herself for feeling compassion for the idiots that had doomed her to this humiliating existence, and for a moment she felt a tingle of magic, for years long forgotten, flare back to life. But then the door to the kennel swung open and in marched the servants, their arms full of food and water bowls, and Marina forgot whatever she was thinking about as her instincts to feed took over.

With a playful grunt as one of the servants set two bowls down in fron of her pen, Marina's thoughts drifted back into the foggy recesses of her brain, and she waited, like a good girl, for one of her human masters to unlock the gate so that she could feed, and maybe later, breed once more.
1233312223.title: Six Years Later...

choices: Risk is to be expected when you are doing good.
Ignore them you have a job to do.
124.content:
Marina decided to use the magical flying carpet she had acquired for her travels because it was the second fastest means of travel. Faster still was the portal but it would create magical echoes which Dreze might use to locate the portal, and that would have devastating consequences, so she had chosen the magical carpet instead.

The land seemed to blur beneath her as she traveled over the land and it wasn’t long before she crossed the disputed territory into the land claimed by Dreze. She had grown up in these now ravaged lands back when Count Senmark had ruled them and Dreze had served as loyal vizier until he discovered the Gems of Clu and he used them to betray the Count and conquer the kingdom. Marina made a silent prayer to any god that would listen that she would have the strength to defeat Dreze.

As the sum faded from the sky she noticed the camp fires of the invading armies on the ground below. Marina wasn’t sure the armies of Dar could stand against Dreze because they were so divided with the troubles in the north and south. It was tempting to attack the army and cause them to be distracted and divided. She had the Orb of Change and if she used it's full charge she could take a sizable force, but she would lose the use of it and she had been counting on it for an emergency situation. Her second option was to sneak down there and use her magic to take command of the traveling and pack animals and have them scatter, but it was dangerous because she would have to land to be close enough to use the magic. Finally, Marina could ignore the forces below her and keep focused on the task of taking out Dreze, The option would be the easiest and the hardest one to make.
124.title: Use your flying carpet to head out

1241.content:
If Marina could turn away enough of the army she might not have to worry about facing the dread wizard of these lands. He had been pushing his forces hard and though his power was great it was not infinite. There were those in his lands that were sure to seek to replace him and they would see his failure as weakness so she dropped the magical orb.

She was tempted to stick around and see the result of the chaos she had crafted but it was best if she was far from here. Dreze would be certain to see a powerful force against the culprit who had ruined the advance of his forces and she wanted to be elsewhere creating more trouble for them to the point that they would have too many fires to put out to worry about her. She hoped to finish things with Dreze soon but there were many ways to destroy someone and it was likely the direct assault wouldn’t be wise against someone so well defended.

Birwick saw the strange orb fall from the sky and land near him. It appeared to have come from some passing wizard on a carpet and he had seen that anything involving magic users was trouble. His raised hand drew his men to an instant halt. He was about to call over one of the mages to investigate when the magical object unleashed its fury upon the group.

A powerful blast of energy struck Commander Birwick who dropped to the ground. Pain filled his body as it swelled out of his armor. The straps couldn’t contain his freshly scaled skin as a new coat of armor took the place of the old one. His eyes opened to see other who had been under his command suffering their own changes. Some were sprouting fur while others started to ooze slime or growing new appendages. Men who had once called him comrade drew back in horror as they watched what was happening in front of them.

They drew weapons as magic users rushed to examine what was happening. A panicked soldier lets an arrow fly striking Birwick but it did no harm as it bounced off the steel like scales. Rage filled the newly formed wyvern at the attack. He swung his tail with deadly accuracy into the enemy from instinct his stinger sticking out the other side of the guard. Roaring in triumph he continued his assault with a quick clamping shut of his jaws on a shock mage.

A battle the army had not expected was soon raging across the grounds as monsters fought men bringing death and destruction to the army. They had been prepared to fight men, not the strange beasts that were tearing through their ranks. A drake spits acid into the group of spell crafters blinding them while a giant hairy monster ripped and tore through the ranks.

Birwick was savoring the flesh of a mighty war elephant when he came back to who he was. The great first legion of Dreze was in ruins. He had no idea how much time had passed since the change but the sun was much lower in the sky. His human shape showed no sign of returning, he was a giant winged beast who had just helped destroyed his own army. He would have felt more guilt it if he didn’t know they were on a path of destruction that Dreze had forced upon them. Perhaps it was time to go on the hunt for Dreze or a cure from the wizard who had caused this.
1241.title: Bomb away!

1242.content:
The spellcaster decided she would try to take command of the animals because ruining the supply train would slow up the progress of the army or even halt it. It was hard to not be noticed when you were flying through the air on a carpet. She made a dive into the woods and prayed that none of the soldiers or scouts had noticed her maneuver. Stealth was not her best ability she thought as she stumbled over a log and fell head first into some mud. Marina, the great and powerful magic user, hated being so clumsy in the woods. She was so used to being an animal in the woods that being in human shape felt awkward and weird.

She had never been graceful as a child but she had been able to become graceful. Transforming into a deer was wonderful as she danced through the trees or becoming a falcon, soaring through the sky as a master of the air. Magic was easy for her from an early age and it provided great comfort to her. When had it become a weapon instead of a wonderment? She reminded herself that she was going to save a lot of lives with what she was doing.

Reaching out from the edge of the woods she could feel the minds of the simple animals pulling the wagons. Taking command of a beast of burden was easy but she was trying to control an entire wagon train strained her mind. She poured magic into them to increase their strength so they would be able to break free of their harnesses. Marina felt herself reaching her limit so she commanded the animals to break loose and run free before releasing control.

Her head ached as she heard the animals breaking free to the cries of frustration from the wagon drivers. She had done good work this day but she now needed to escape.
1242.title: Risk is to be expected when you are doing good.

12421.content:
Alzan had been sleeping as they made a raid on Dar, the journey was long and only a fool didn’t rest and very few wizards survived to become masters if they were fools. Trusting his apprentice appeared to be a mistake as he woke from his slumber by slamming his head to the floor. His hand made quick motions in the air and he flew from the wagon as it went tumbling from the side.

“Freck where are you?” he called for his apprentice but he was disoriented, the young man wasn’t at the head of the wagon thankfully because the driver’s corpse was rolling down the hill. Too many of the animals were going wild at once, this was the work of a spell caster. His apprentice would have to fend for himself because he needed to stop the caster before they did more.

He put up a magical barrier around him because he would need to search for the caster. His pinky ring flared blue before becoming a dead black but the enemy flared up in his vision and he studied her. She was leaving, heading behind their lines, likely to cause more trouble. The cries of his men as they fought with the animals were not unheard but that was just a symptom, he planned to deal with the real problem.

The master mage closed quickly on the woman but his hopes for a quick win were thwarted as tree branches shot up from the forest striking his shielded. It sparked and flared holding against the attack but the animated forest was undeterred and started to probe and search for an entrance keeping constant pressure on his defenses.

If he stayed on the defense he would surely lose, a shattering quake of force when down the trees causing them to explode. Splinters of wood flew in thousands of different directions and he hoped more than a few of them struck his enemy but he wasn’t about to depend on that a fireball started to grow in his hand.

“Nice trick but you will have to do better to stop me,” Alzan searched for his target but she had dispelled his marking magic.

“How about this for a trick?” an incredibly loud voice spoke behind him. Alzan spun around to see Marina was a giantess taller than many of the trees. Her fist smashed him to the ground easily shattering the remaining power of his shield, his spell fizzled out as he struck the ground, losing his concentration. He started to call forth lighting, power and light started to crackle in the air but the sixty-foot woman slipped off her shoe with a smile on her face and knocked him to the ground with her big toe. She planted in on his chest and pressed him into the ground. “That kind of tickles. I don’t suppose you want to give up.”
12421.title: Mage detects what was done

1243.content:
As tempting as it was to hit the front line people it wasn’t the best use of her abilities and magical items. They were the best ones to counter her and the readiest to fight her but they were likely to be followed by the supply train which would be much more vulnerable. Her Order of the Enlightened Circle was against the killing of people but she had always viewed herself that the prevention of death was the most important thing. An opportunity to create a lot of problems for the army showed itself but she knew that many would die.

A bit of sorrow hit her as she landed and prepared to rain down the destruction of a lot of people. Most of the people that were down their had never taken a life, many had never held a sword but she was about to be throwing down boulders down on them in this narrow mountain path. By destroying them she would be ending the advance of the army. An army that could not feed itself was an army that couldn’t fight.

She called upon her magic to start the change to herself and instantly felt herself swelling in size. Her robes changed to accommodate her becoming a tight dress more appropriate for the storm giant she was becoming. They were the largest of the giants and the most powerful. It was a worry that using this much magic would prevent her access to her magic for at least a day but not even dragons were eager to take on an adult storm giantess. Her breasts swelled over the boundary of the dress top giving an enticing view to any who observed her. Color came to her skin in the form a pale blue as her hair became a stark white standing out against her skin.

Power and energy flowed into her skin like she had never felt before surged through her body as she stood over twenty feet in height. The rock broke and shattered under her pounding fists as she gathered a pile of ammunition. The column of people below had paused to see what was making the noise above them. Horror filled their faces as they saw an angry giant above them start to throw rocks.

The people scrambled but there was no escape Marina had seen to it that most of the column was now trapped be behind large piles of rocks. She pounded the ground beneath her and drew the desired result as a tidal wave of rocks flooded over the men and animals causing them to vanish as if by some sort of magic trick. A few people struggle to flee and run from her as she came down the mountain to finish off any stragglers she would find.

No one bothered to try and fight her causing her to have such a great feeling of power and dominance over the little people. Only a few had escaped her fury and she had to decide what to do next.
1243.title: Ignore them you have a job to do.

choices: Collect the waters of the spring of change
125.content:
Marina's magical training had taught her that there were many solutions to one problem. She would create a transformation plague that would infect all of the servants of Dreze. The foolish wizard marked all of his servants and it would make it easy for the magical plague to distinguish between the innocent and the guilty with the lands the plague would cover. Creating the plague posed a few problems such as some of the ingredients were difficult and dangerous to get and casting it would require draining much of her magic for several days, but it would eliminate the threat of the army of Dreze and make the wizard a minor threat without the loss of any lives.

One of the most difficult pieces to get would be the unicorn hairs because they had many magical defenses to protect them and though good they had many poor experiences with wizards which made them extremely paranoid of any wizards coming for favors. The hairs were essential but dealing with a creature of good limited her options on what she would feel right doing. Marina would have to make a deal and she hoped she would be able to pay the price.

The second ingredient was mimic blood which was difficult to find at the best of times and they were dangerous to find at the best of times and they were certainly very dangerous because of the many forms they took when they lay in wait to ambush prey. Luckily she had a lead on where to find one. Marina was only worried what she would happen once she found it.

Perhaps the most dangerous were the waters from the spring inside the temple of Basta. Basta was an evil god of the hunt and animals. The priests frequently used the waters from the spring of change within the temple to turn people into animals to hunt for blood sport in honor of their god. It would be extremely dangerous to get inside and back out without being killed or worse, hunted as an animal.
125.title: Choose another path

1251.content:
Unicorns were a good place to start because there wasn’t much danger for her there because she wasn’t evil or at least she hoped that a unicorn wouldn’t consider her evil. They could become very dangerous if they were attacking something they viewed as evil. Dealing with a unicorn would help her to decide if what she was doing was right.

Depending on what she transformed Dreze’s army into she might be taking away the human lives of the people for the rest of their existence. Was she justified in what she was planning to do? Her code was not as strict as that of the holy unicorn but it was certain that she had doubts and discussing it with a creature that had a firm moral code would help her sort her own feelings. Dreze and his forces were far worse than the kingdom of Dar but that didn’t mean King Emeril’s people were all saints.

Any unicorn would be found far from civilization because they were often hunted by the sentient races for their horns. The horn of the unicorn could heal any wound or disease and could even give life to the dead with the magic stored inside. She had seen black market unicorn horns before, they turned black with the foulness of slaying such creatures of good. Only once had Marina seen the brilliant white glow of a horn that had been given to someone the man had kept it in his store and was unwilling to part with it at any price.

If she could convince the unicorn her plan was justified she could secure the gift of a shed horn. Once every one hundred years, a unicorn shed it’s horn but they only gave them out to the most worthy of people or those who had given them a great favor. With that in hand, she wouldn’t need the other ingredients to complete her work.

Marina looked out in all directions and could not even see a fire from where she was. It was a good place to start looking for a unicorn. Great waves of green forest rolled and shook in the wind drawing a smile to her face from the beauty. She had often considered becoming a druid, running barefoot through the forest as a child but her Father had always returned her to the books. Sighing, she set out to do her work.

Powders soon formed magical symbols and her circle of protection was formed that would ignite like a beacon to any creature sensitive to magic out here like a unicorn who was certain to come investigate. Arcane magic users were weak against unicorns who could easily shatter even some of the most powerful magical barriers which, is why magic users hired hunters to do their dirty work for them. She opened a sack and pulled out her lunch and started to eat to see whose attention she had attracted.
1251.title: Seek out a unicorn

12511.content:
“A most interesting method of hunting me,” the voice of unicorn entered her mind and she turned to see a stallion in his prime glowing with power. “I am curious to see what your next step will be.”

“Negotiation,” Marina was under no illusion that the unicorn was not ready to fight her, the horn glowed with power and she could feel it probing her, she wasn’t sure what exactly he was looking for but the searching nature of the magic was clear. “I am Marina and I need a unicorn horn to stop the army of Dreze.”

“I am very attached to my horn as you can see and how does a war between people concern me, it is hardly the first war or the last war your species will manage.”

“Unicorns are creatures of good, you would put an end to a great deal of suffering with no deaths.”

“To what end? How is your kingdom better than Dreze for me? Your kingdom has hunted my kind to near extinction in this land. Dreze’s land is much better for unicorns he fights to subdue his own people so he doesn’t have the time to send nobles out on hunts for sport.”

“I could see about ending the hunts in Dar.”

“Really!?! You swing that kind of power?” the mocking tone was clear even in telepathic communication. “Spin me another fairy tale, I will only give you what you desire after you have secured a proclamation from King Emeril ending the hunts but I doubt you are willing to wait for that to happen so I have a counter-proposal. You will replace the lives that have been lost to your hunts.”

She blushed, suspecting exactly what he meant.
12511.title: A unicorn

choices: Another hunter for the same prize
1252.content:
Mimics were dangerous creatures to hunt and it was tempting to try and find what she needed at one of the magical markets around the world but that was likely to take more time. The fear of mimics and doppelgangers had caused the King to have built special detecting devices around the kingdom. One of them had recently been detected at the edge of the kingdom. Knowing the general location would ease the hunt a great deal and missing people would narrow the hunt.

Doppelgangers were just a group trying to prevent themselves from being exterminated or exploited but mimics were deadly predators who hunted and ate just about whatever they could catch. She reviewed her books on the creatures hoping that she would discover some sort of weakness to the creature that she didn’t remember but there was nothing new to her. Marina would have to be careful that she wasn’t the one to be taken down by the monster.

Arriving at the town of Crescent Falls to the delight of a thunderstorm drenching her. She wanted to curl up in a hot bath and soak for several hours but she wasn’t even sure the small farming town had an inn for her to stay at, much less hot water. Her robes clung to her body as she brought her horse down the main road of town. A few lights could be seen in houses as she arrived in the town gave her hope the mimic had yet to arrive in town and wasn’t one of the more dangerous kinds that were rumored about in legends. Perhaps she could get a good night’s sleep before the hunt truly began.

She thanked the gods when she saw an inn up ahead of her and pulled her horse to a halt in front of it.
1252.title: Hunt the dangerous mimic

1253.content:
She had a powerful geas placed on her to prevent her from telling others about the location of the temple so she would have to go this one alone. The guards of the temple were dangerous as they were usually some of the most powerful servants, not the cannon fodder of hunt mad freaks that were often encountered. Some would have magic that would rival her own, skills and power that would challenge her abilities to the limits of what she had.

Marina didn’t like the fear she felt as she gathered her equipment for the journey but it would be needed to allow her to be aware enough to survive. She had been hunted by the order before and come out on top and what scared her most was the head priest who had placed the spell upon her so many years ago because he had invited her to come back, to attempt to destroy the temple because he would like to hunt her again when she was even more powerful to honor his dark god.

It would be a pleasure to hunt them down and end their dark pleasures forever. She wasn’t deluded enough to think destroying the temple would end the cult but it would certainly hamper their efforts. Marina hoped the priest was long dead by now but something in her told her that he was still presiding over the hunts even though more than a decade had passed. She told herself that she could just sneak into the temple and collect what she would need and vanish before she would be noticed but the rage she felt against the man might demand revenge against him.

Being forced into the form of an animal had made her focus on the art of transformation magic with a passion she had never had before, Marina would never be trapped in another shape again. They had hunted her over the course of three nights before her victory and she was changed back. The priest had laughed at her threats and welcomed her return, she hoped she would be able to make him eat those words.

It didn’t take long for civilization to vanish from view, even her tower vanished from view after a few hills. She liked the seclusion normally but it made her feel very alone at this moment against a sea of troubles. The cult of Basta had many followers in rural areas far from the protections of the civilized world. Basta provided protection to those left to the cruelties of fate by the nobles who were supposed to protect them.

Nobles were quick to demand the taxes they felt were owed to them but slow to provide the protection that was needed to produce the money and goods that would pay those taxes. Monsters and bandits ruled the land around here so anyone who would help was welcomed no matter what they offered in return. The hunters of Basta provided protection and only required a few sacrifices which the villagers were willing to give. Travelers in small towns needed to be very careful they weren’t offered up as those sacrifices.

As she drew closer to the temple she knew the numbers of the followers would be growing, the eyes of the cult would be everywhere. Marina had worn a heavy cloak to hide identity as a magic user but it might not be enough to prevent her discovery as a magic user. She looked at the woods and debated if she should try to sneak through as an animal but that also had dangers all its own.
1253.title: Collect the waters of the spring of change

choices: Join a wagon train heading south
Collect a companion to act as a diversion
13.content:
Seras looked every part the thief with dark leather armor laced with knives, daggers, tools and poisons of various uses. Seras would have been a lovely young woman if not for disease ravaged face and numerous scares from a less than ideal childhood. Her long red was braided with a dagger attached to the end more for intimidation than actual combat.

King Emeril looked on nervously at the potential assassin and noticed his guards held their weapons a little tighter with the presence of this notoriously dangerous individual. If anyone could find out about the strange sightings, mysterious disappearances and mutilate corpses without getting caught it was Seras.

For her part Seras cared very little about the King’s thoughts or feelings because she was only interested in getting paid. She usually wore a disguise when meeting clients but the King’s wizards would likely detect the magic which would make the already nervous King Emeril downright paranoid, not that he didn’t have reason to be scared. A lifetime of conquering and combat had produced many enemies, and with his advancing years he found the children who should have been taking the burdens from his shoulders busy fighting each other over potential inheritance, so he had his hands full preventing bloodshed between his brood. The King was now forced to call upon the insane to do the dirty work of the kingdom, namely adventurers.

The title adventurer appealed to Seras since childhood as someone who went places and going places was just what she wanted to do. She had earned the title many years ago and it brought with it money, thrills and more enjoyments she thought was possible. People usually became adventurers to earn the big score, and retire or to genuinely try to do some good for the world. A few like Seras were thrill seekers who would adventure until the day the price of their thrills caught up with them. Seras told herself it was the money but she lied a lot, so she would gladly help the King for the money he offered.

The only question left for Seras was where to start.
13.title: Seras Thief of the Band of the Swift

choices: One of your fellow travelers gets grabby.
131.content:
Seras had several disguises she used with her Ring of a Thousand Faces though it had numerous options more than she ever utilized.
