One should be comfortable in the body you are in if you are going to engage in combat, so she limited the number of bodies she used. The one she had chosen to head south was a very attractive blonde. This was a mission to gather information and what guy didn’t want to talk to a hot blonde. The downside was Seras couldn’t carry a lot of weapons on her body with ready access because she would be looked over thoroughly and there were few places an attractive woman could hide weapons from horny men.

Focusing her mind to activate the magical ring Seras felt the changes beginning to happen. Her lightened to a honey blonde as she grew taller until she was nearly six feet tall. The scars vanished from her face while eyes became a gentle blue. Two indecent mounds replaced her small chest as her rear became a playground onto itself. The outfit she slid on was extremely revealing to supply ample view of her new assets to give her maximum distraction powers.

Seras would be joining a wagon train heading south as a traveling merchant. She could carry a large arsenal with her in her wagon which would provide her a lot of options if any problems come up on the journey. The best part was she could use her group’s stolen goods as her merchant goods and make some extra money on the journey.
131.title: Join a wagon train heading south

1311.content:
Seras spotted the bandits long before the guards called out any warning to the train, but announcing it would be unwise to announce what she had seen because she didn’t want to reveal herself as someone who was alert or a threat. Playing the damsel in distress set many people at ease but it could be difficult for someone who saw them self as a predator. She would have to slip into the back of the wagon and hide out when the attack happened and hope the guards could do there job. Maybe if the bandits waited until dark she could slip around camp taking out enemies, but she didn’t have much luck.

Howls and battles whoops filled the air as armed men poured out of the woods clattering their weapons against metal to make more noise and chaos. Many of the horses panicked at the sudden noise charging forward frequently crash the wagons. Seras had purchased experienced well trained animals who barely spared a glance to the strange men making so much noise before continuing their slow walk forward.

The guards to their credit maintained calm and launched a counter attack the bandits were not ready for slaying several of the criminals. Numbers were not on the guard’s side and time would whittle them down to nothing. The question was how involved did Seras want to get. She could go all out and reveal herself or try to do strategic strikes and hope to hide in shadow but possibly fail to stop the threat, or she try to change her appearance and attack that way but it would waste a lot of time.
1311.title: Bandit Attack!!

13111.content:
She decided that she had no choice but to do the best she could because she didn’t want to lose her trade goods or her freedom. Seras grabbed a bunch of her weapons and set to correcting the idea that attacking this caravan was a good idea. Her large chest made aiming a little awkward but she had done plenty of practicing to counter her more voluptuous new figure.

Her crossbow and daggers started to draw the attention of the bandits as she whittled their numbers down quickly, not caring that the others saw her deadly speed or accuracy. They started to gather for a run against her causing a dark smile of joy on her face. The explosive orb sent out flames as it shattered to the entire group causing them to scatter and fall as the flames ate away at their flesh. Seras could feel the eyes of the bandits focusing on her with hate, but more than a little fear. She had lived a hard and deadly life, it would take more than a band of bandits to stop her when she was properly armed.

A bandit climbed up behind her to fall backward as a stiletto was planted in his heart. They were fools to try and take her on this wagon that creaked and swayed with every slight breeze letting her know when she was being attacked and from where. A couple tried to shoot her from a distance but they found she would reward them with deadly counter fire as she easily dodged their poorly aimed attacks.

The pounding of hooves came closer to her, riding along the side of the wagon for cover but she was ready with a dagger and short sword as the net attempted to cover her it was easily knocked aside by her blade. She leaped onto the galloping mount and rapidly stabbed the man in the side six times before allowing the bandit to fall from the saddle. She wished this body had some of her lean but powerful muscles of her real form but her skill was proving enough as the few remaining bandits started to flee despite their leader’s command.

Seras watched the bandit leader closely as he glowered at the woman who had stolen the victory from him this day, and turned slowly from the caravan cheering their victory over the bandits. Unfortunately for the man Seras was vindictive and had no desire to face an attack on her return to these lands. The blow dart struck the man in the back of the neck causing him to slap at the wound likely thinking it was a biting insect before the paralyzing poison did its work causing him to fall from his horse.

The thief reloaded her crossbow as she rode over to the man, debating what to do with him. There had been no loyal men left as far as her sharp eyes could see because she saw none of the bandits in the vicinity. She could interrogate him and see if he had anything of value for her to spare his life, kill him and be done with him or turn him over to the caravan who would no doubt be very hungry for the blood of the man who had taken the lives of so many.

She removed his mask to reveal the rather ugly face of a half-orc. The half-orc was trying to determine what his fate was going to be by looking at the attractive woman standing over him toying with a blade. She saw a slight movement in a finger and decided it was time to make a decision about the fate of this man.
13111.title: Go all out

13112.content:
She decided it was best to do strategic strikes to end the threat because she didn’t want to reveal herself to any enemy who might be watching and changing back would likely take too long. Seras grabbed some of her throwing daggers and a crossbow and went to see the approaching threat to the wagon train.

The group of bandits attack from both sides but the attack was disorganized as if some of the riders were drunk. Seras let loose a deadly bolt from her crossbow toppling one of the scarier and more sober looking riders to the ground. She hoped by picking off a few of the leaders or tougher riders the others would be scared and run. She wished she had her trusty short swords if the attackers managed to break the formation and get close but a lot of people recognized her distinctive blades.

A couple more of the bolts struck home with deadly results but it appeared the fighting was going to get a lot closer than she wanted. She silently cursed the guards for being terrible shots and the drunken bandits for being too stupid to realize their numbers were quickly dropping. The throwing daggers were much faster to throw but not as easy to pierce armor with. Seras would have to take careful aim for unprotected spots but luckily most of these fools had nod taken time to put on proper armor.

Sliding under the cover of her wagon she started to take some shots at the bandits entering the wagon area making sure to hit anyone approaching her wagon. Helping the guards was her second priority as they could actually fight, well at least better than the other people in the wagon train. Screams from a woman attracted her attention and she saw a woman being dragged away by on of the criminals she struck the man with a dagger to the back of the neck ending any bad plans he might have had.

Things were looking too close to call even with her assistance, and she was running out of daggers. Seras could try and hide out in the hopes even if the remaining bandits won their numbers wouldn’t be enough to take much with them. She could press her attack and hope the tide would turn in her favor. Gambling wasn’t some thing she liked to do unless she controlled the out com. It would look better if she hid and the guards won but if she didn’t do something soon there wouldn’t be many guards left and there was still a lot of road to travel. There was certainly a temptation to grab her most important gear and take off on one of her horses.

A bandit had gotten the edge on one of the guards and was about to slay him but Seras’s dagger struck home first as she continued to wonder what her next course of action should be and with only five daggers left she would have to make the decision quickly.
13112.title: Strategic strikes

choices: Taken to someone who knows her real identity
131123.content:
Seras didn’t have as much time as she thought to make a decision as a net fell on top of her and was pulled tight yanking her from the wagon. She held tight to her weapons as she was dragged away from the relative safety of the caravan. Whoever was dragging her stopped once they were over the rise of the nearby hill to determine the value of what they had claimed. Before she could strike home with her final weapons she was struck in the stomach knocking the air out of her.

“Drop the blades or get more of the same,” a rough voice commanded her.
The thief took a moment to determine her options before deciding her actions and looking around it sure wasn’t good. Several armed men watched her trying to determine if she was worth the risk to take with them. She was usually of a very cautious nature waiting for the best opportunity to attack, so Seras dropped her blades and watched as they kicked them far away. Escaping would come later when they were at a disadvantage.

“Good to see you can listen,” the man looked hardened from many battles. “You will fetch a good price and maybe make up for some of the disaster of this day.”

She shuddered at the thought of what a body like she had would be used for in certain circles, so she needed to determine a way out of this quickly if the slave markets was the goal. There were many possible places they could be taking her, and very few of them would mean any good for a buxom young woman. She cursed herself for wearing such a tight outfit where she couldn’t hide much of what she might need but the idea was that people would be looking at her assets and not her.
131123.title: Caught

1311233.content:
One of the bandits started cutting her clothes from her body, leaving her naked breast to warm under the sun high in the sky. The leering looks and rude comments were starting to build as the remaining bandits came back with the few spoils they managed to take from the caravan. It looked like they had lost which gave Seras a little hope but she doubted the guard or passengers on the caravan were in any shape to give chase so hope for rescue was dim and the looks on the men told that they wanted to get something from this raid, and her naked body was what they had designs upon.

“Don’t even think about this one for dipping your wickets in, gentlemen,” a covered by a black hood and red mask called to the gathered men. “We are getting top coin to deliver her unmolested, so you can just forget about it.”

Some of the men grumbled but none of them made any further move towards her except to guide her to a wagon to place her in a cage with other slaves. Seras didn’t put up too much of a fight as she was lost in the thought that someone had targeted her. Likely the King or one of his men was in on the kidnapping. Her face turned into a dark look that made even the men moving her to the cage take a momentary step back. She was not known for letting go of a grudge and if the King was involved he would be a dead man. The cage door slammed shut behind her and she took a moment to eye the lock and saw it would be a simple job to break with the tools she had pocketed in her mouth, she just hoped it would be soon enough to escape her final destination.

She looked at her fellow occupants in the cage and didn’t hold out much help from that direction because they were two young kids that had been allowed to keep their clothing and an attractive woman just out of her teens who was huddled whimpering in the corner. It would be better if everyone escaped so the attention of everyone would be taken in many directions, but these prisoners weren’t likely to get far. Eyeing the number of bandits she decided if she could get back to her wagon she could kill all of them. The only one she felt might give her trouble was the hooded figure.

The man carried himself with the skill of a practiced warrior so she would need to deal with him first. It frustrated her that she likely wouldn’t be able to interrogate him because of the risk involved, perhaps when she saw his face he would be familiar to her. She had learned of the faces of most of the Crimson Tigers the personal guards of the King and that was a likely target for who she was dealing with. If she could discover the identity it would give her a trail to follow.
1311233.title: Taken to someone who knows her real identity

choices: You aren't leaving this camp alive
13112333.content:
The light faded from the skies, and bandits lit fires to warm themselves against the child of the night leaving the refreshing caught slaves to huddle together for warmth. A highly unpalatable gruel was given to them but little other attention was given to them. Seras’s anger filled her enough warmth against the chill of the night.

Heavy hoofs pounded the ground as a rider arrived at the camp, and the man was immediately recognized by Seras. This was Sir Stone, the brute, one of the Crimson Tigers of King Emeril. There was little doubt in the mind of the thief that this person had come for her.

Sir Stone got off his horse and waited for the commander of the camp to approach him, and Seras couldn’t help but smile at how uncomfortable the man was making the entire camp. This was a man who carried with him the authority of the King of the land and they were criminals breaking the laws of the land. The head of the camp came out and showed no fear as he approached the much larger and very dangerous man.

“Bring the girl over, and a horse so I can be on my way,” Sir Stone ordered.

“I think things have changed,” the bandit leader said.
13112333.title: A stranger arrives in camp

131123332.content:
Sir Stone stood like his namesake waiting for more of an explanation of the threat. If there was any worry in the man at the many crossbows pointed at him that was not the feeling that was exuded from him. There was no anger even at the threat only a quiet curiosity. The man’s giant mace was firmly against the ground as if it was a simple walking stick but Seras had heard of the destruction it could cause when put to use.

“I have business to conduct for the King,” Sir Stone said after several moments of waiting. “If you must attack, attack but I am leaving here with that woman.”

“I have heard of the reputation of the Crimson Tigers,” the masked leader of the bandits growled. “Your King is due for a fall and I am going to start with you.”

“You dare to threaten the King!” Sir Stone launched himself forward into a barrage of crossbow bolts, but even as the bolts shattered harmlessly off his armor his mace struck home crushing skulls and bones leaving lifeless corpses in his wake as he marched for the leader. “I will bring death to you!”

Terror started to fill the men as this monster pushed forward as their blades and weapons were harmlessly deflected off his magical armor. Seras watched with a careful eye for weakness that she could exploit later. This man was famed for being a walking wall but every wall had a weakness and she could find it given enough time.

She wondered if this was the time to stick around because with all the chaos this was a perfect chance to escape. This Crimson Tiger was determined to slay all of the bandits before he turned his attention back to her. The man was slow but he would chase her to ends of the world but by the time he caught up to her she could have a trap ready for him. She took a moment to look at the other slaves and debated if she should free them first. They could add to the distraction but it would take precious time to free them and it looked like Sir Stone was making short work of the remaining bandits.

The roar of Sir Stone filled the air as he approached the leader of the bandits, his armor stained with the blood of his many victims.
131123332.title: You aren't leaving this camp alive

1311233322.content:
“Fuck it!” Seras muttered to herself as she went to free the slaves. The gods of good were always promising great rewards in the afterlife if you did good deeds. It was time to earn off some of the bad shit she had done over the years.

Thankfully the bandits were terrible with knots and it was quick work to free the other slaves and it gave her some chance to watch the Crimson Tiger fight. The members of the bandits were vanishing quickly under the onslaught of a massive warrior but the hooded leader was doing a good job of darting in and out avoiding the deadly strikes of his opponent. Eventually, blood started to leak out from the many strikes Sir Stone had received but it only seemed to slow the giant man down a little bit. The hooded man looked like he might have a chance for victory when Sir Stone’s mace struck home crushing the ribs of the man.

“Now you see the greatness of my King,” Sir Stone gloated as his opponent got to his knees.

“The abyss take you and your King,” the man spat out blood on the Crimson Tiger and was rewarded for his defiance with the huge mace pulping his head.

Seras watched next to a horse that she had secured for a chance to escape. She had been surprised by the dedication of the bandits, King Emeril must have wronged many of them for them to be so determined to slay a Crimson Tiger but the few remaining were scattering to the winds leaving the field to the blood and gore covered knight.

He made a tempting target even in her altered form because she wasn’t likely to get a better chance than this but she was ready to ride away on her horse and find a good place to ambush him. A thought occurred to her. Sir Stone wasn’t known for being very bright. Perhaps he didn’t know she was in an altered form. She might be able to trick him and learn more about what was going on and why the King wanted her.

It was a lot of risks but there was a lot of rewards if she could succeed. She watched as Sir Stone suddenly realized he had been distracted from his original quest and he decided to return to his orders.

“Little mouse, little mouse,” He called out the hated nickname the Crimson Tigers had for her. “Where are you little mouse?”
1311233322.title: Free the slaves

13112333221.content:
The thief felt the fury growing inside of her as the warrior mockingly called to her and she decided to teach him a lesson in what little mouses could do. Seras moved quietly but quickly through the carnage collecting weapons and equipment while avoiding the gaze of Sir Stone. She wished she could transform back to her natural state but you can’t have everything in combat when an opportunity presents itself.

The dagger flew into the damaged knee joint on his armor severing important muscles and damaging bone. A small grunt of pain came unbidden from the lips of the giant man but he continued moving towards the source of the attack. Several rocks bounced harmlessly off his armor before he spotted the little mouse he was seeking.

“The little mouse knows how to bite,” Sir Stone growled. “If the little mouse isn’t careful I may pull off a limb or two, King Emeril didn’t say I had to bring back all of you.”

She might be angry but the thief wasn’t about to fight stupid against such a dangerous opponent who could take her out with just one hit. The trick was to get him to fight stupid and work every advantage she could. With skillful precision, she struck the man in the head with another rock disorienting him with the noise and making the Crimson Tiger angry.

“I don’t like games,” the warrior tossed a large log in her direction as she dove behind a tent. “If you give up I promise I won’t even bruise you but the offer is going away quickly.”

“You seem to be slowing up,” Seras responded as she caught her breath hidden behind cover. “Are your wounds finally catching up to you?”

“I am still well enough to take care of you, little mouse. Come out of hiding, you wouldn’t want me to fail my duty to the King.

“Why does the King want me?”

“You are welcome to ask him when I bring you to him. I only follow orders, I don’t care about the reason why.”

He grabbed the tent she had been hiding behind and pulled it through the air but the thief followed it using the cover to leap into the face of the warrior using both hands to slam the dirk into an eye of the servant of the king. Seras could hear the blade strike the back of the helmet but she was already putting distance between her and Sir Stone because books were filled with tales of people dying when they thought they had taken down the Crimson Tiger.

The man howled in pain as he stumbled after the thief but the effort was only impressive because of his continuing movement after such grievous wounds. Seras was easily able to keep a safe distance from the dying man. She wondered what had been done to the man to enable him to still be able to move. This spoke of dark magic to her but even magic had limits as the man collapsed into his final throes of life leaving Seras alone on the field of battle.
13112333221.title: Fight

131123332213.content:
The wagon train had probably been moving double time after the encounter with the bandits so she had little hope of catching up with them which meant a lot of lost profits so the least Sir Stone could do was help make up for the loss by giving her some items to sell. She started by stripping the armor from the man’s horse so it would be less recognizable when she got to town. There was a small wagon she could pile some stuff in but nothing like the larger wagon she had recently had.

Seras stared for several minutes at the prone form of the giant man debating taking the armor. Even in the damaged condition, it would more than makeup for her losses but there would be many people who would know this armor and come looking for the one who sold it. She lifted the mask to look at the face of the man hidden behind the mask.

Beneath the metal face plate was a desiccated corpse with black smoke pouring from the body. Evil magic had been used to give this warrior his strength. Looking closer it appeared that the armor truly did make the man as the magic of the armor drained life from the person inside the armor until nothing was left. What was left of the body collapsed into dust leaving her wondering how many “Stones” she had met over the years. It was a foul thing that made monstrous slaves for the king to use.

She had encountered something like this once before in the ruins of an ancient kingdom. The book had reeked of evil with a spine and cover made of human bone and pages inked with the blood of many sentient races. It was something she had hoped to never encounter in life, the book had bothered her so much she had never sold it and only told one other of the existence of the thing.

Was it possible another copy of the book existed or had her trust been betrayed? This was more worrisome to her than King Emeril being after her. Nobility could be counted to turn on you if it was in their interest or if they just had a whim to be cruel and vindictive. She wondered if she should alter her plans because of this new information and check to see if she had been betrayed.
131123332213.title: Search Sir Stone

1311233322132.content:
Seras had never considered herself a hero, there was little profit in being a hero. An adventurer, sure, she could accept that title. Adventure, if you planned it right, came with a proper payday but she would go after the book. Leaving the book out in the world would create a lot more risk for her work. She should have destroyed it when she got it but it had seemed like too much trouble. Locking it away had seemed like enough because who could find it where she hid it.

Marcus was a bookworm of the first order and the only other person she had told about the book. He was going to have a lot to answer for if the book was missing. The rogue took her time looting the camp because she wasn’t sure when she would get back this way and the vultures were already starting to circle. In the distance, she could see the girls she had freed running but decided to leave them to their fates.

Part of it was even for their own safety because there was sure to be hunters out to look for all involved in the death of Sir Stone and it was better they have little connection to Seras as they could. King Emeril had come after her and he certainly wasn’t going to stop and he would be looking for revenge against anyone who might be an ally of her’s.

Clothing that didn’t make her look like a lady ready for the slave market was in short supply so she made the best of it and made sure she had more than a few weapons visible. Her breasts quivered as she moved and she was reminded her body was designed more for the pleasures of the flesh than combat. She wasn’t going to try and head back to the caravan on the off chance her stuff hadn’t been looted or destroyed. In order to turn back to her natural state, she would have to hit one of her caches or buy some new magic with the haul she was taking away this day.

She covered her face with a blue silk because this cover identity’s appearance had been blown. She would go by Briana for the moment until she could change her appearance. Her cover story would be an adventurer who just looted some slavers. Some truth always made for a good lie.
1311233322132.title: Check on Book

choices: The first cut is the deepest
Take him to wagon for a special cocktail
1312.content:
The sky was beautiful over the open plains at night with the stars poking bright holes in the blanket of darkness. There was no moon this night but the caravan had many roaring fires to fight back the darkness. It would look strange if she kept avoiding the company of others so she wandered closer to the camp fire where the aromas of stews filled the air and a couple people played a lively tune for all to hear. Things would likely become more cautious as they got closer to the dangers from the south but for now, their were few restrictions on activities.

Powerful arms wrapped around her body and grabbed hold of her large breasts and started to maul them. Seras tried to pull away from the man but he wasn’t releasing his grip on her. She could feel his hot breath on her neck as he leaned in, she responded with a stomp on the man’s foot which resulted in a grunt of pain and a loosening of the grip. She slid out of the grasp and spun around to face the attacker. The thought of drawing a blade and gutting the man but it might draw too much attention to her leaving a bloody corpse at her feet.

“Weren’t we having fun darling?” a burly man grinned at her.

“If you try something like that again, you will be having some fun with the buzzards in the desert,” Seras threatened but the man just laughed at her. This was the sort of man who enjoyed dominating other and if he wasn’t careful in his future dealings with her he would learn beauties could also be beasts.

“I know you want to have some some fun.”

She eyed the man and looked at the campfires trying to decide if she should scream for help or deal with this herself.
1312.title: One of your fellow travelers gets grabby.

13122.content:
“Perhaps you would like to come to my wagon for a little nightcap and perhaps something more?” Seras put on a silky and seductive tone.

The man nodded eagerly, “I will rock your world baby.”

He leaned in for a kiss but the rogue darted away from the foul smelling hole. Seras spun towards her wagon making sure to keep out of arms reach. She recognized the man as one of the guards on the caravan and wondered how many of the passengers he had tried to take advantage of in the darkness. His reign of terror was coming to an end this night with a special cocktail.

The man was completely oblivious to the danger he was facing, convinced of his own value how could he doubt any gorgeous woman would want him? When they tried to fight him off they were only playing hard to get and wanted it rough. Seras hated the man with a passion but she still had to be cautious because even filth like him often had friends so she watched carefully for any witness but saw all was quiet around her wagon.

Friends seemed like a stretch because it was more likely a gang that worked together on various crimes. They protected their fellow members so if they got in trouble they would be abandoned but guards often disappeared on long trips like these. Herrick the guard would not be found anywhere in camp by the time she was done with him.

“Ready or not I am coming for you,” the wagon shook as the large man jumped on and peered in.

“This should warm you up,” Seras offered the man a flask which he snatched and proceeded to suck down the contents to the last drop.

“A little sweet for my tastes but not as sweet as you are going to be. Let’s see if you can suck on the beast like I did your drink. Afterward, I am going to make you scream so loud and often you are going to keep the entire caravan up all night.”

Herrick dropped his pants to reveal the “beast” and she had to admit that it was larger than average but a smile formed on her face as she saw it becoming far less impressive. He took a step forward but she could see he was already feeling the effects of the potion as he had to grab hold of a trunk to stay upright.

“Is it hot in here or is it just me?” Muscles vanished from Herrick’s body as he flapped his shirt trying to cool down his sweaty body.

“I think you better lay down sweet cheeks,” Seras grabbed an engorged nipple and gave it a hard twist causing a cry of pleasure as Herrick dropped back onto the cot. “Herrick doesn’t seem like a very good for such a lovely lady, how about Fawn?”

Confusion formed on the face of Fawn as she tried to understand the words, “Lady?”

“Certainly,” the rogue pulled the now way oversized shirt from the woman’s shoulder’s dropping it down to her waist revealing spectacular breasts. “You would have to be an awfully fat man to have breasts that size little one. Get out of that dirty clothing, don’t worry I have some proper clothing for you when you get up but for now get some rest because you have had a long day.”

She nodded still in a hypnotic haze, “Who am I?”
13122.title: Take him to wagon for a special cocktail

13123.content:
Her identity as Margaret Simmons was important and if she started to make cracks in that facade this early in the journey she would be discovered and she didn’t want that to happen so instead of fighting she had to come up with an alternative idea. The alternative she came up with left a foul taste in her mouth.

“Help! Someone help me!” She screamed for help the man’s head jerk around to see if anyone was coming and she took the chance to run from the man, darting and dodging between the wagons. It left a distaste in her mouth to play the damsel in distress when it would be so easy to put a blade in the man.

“Get back here you bitch!” The man was racing after her but he had taken the wrong turn, she dropped behind some barrels. “I will find you!”

She pulled out a dagger in case he did manage to find her, eventually, the people would come back from the party or the guards would investigate, as a matter of fact, she wondered why they weren’t investigating. Margaret was far enough away from the music that the guards at the edge of the wagon train should be coming to help her. She darted between hiding spots following the man who had been after her.

“I can’t cover for you much longer, people are going to come back from the party and hear you screaming you idiot!” a guard snapped at the brute. “Your money won’t be worth anything if the people hang me.”

“Yeah, well we will both hang if she isn’t found because I am not going to go down alone so help me search.” the brute was scanning the darkness, never suspecting how close she really was.

It looked like things were getting more serious, could this be the problem the King was talking about. If the guards of caravans were helping to make people disappear that would be a big problem for trade. She might need to investigate further and not just take care of the brute but she really wanted to be done with him tonight but not knowing who they were and how much they were actually up to might destroy her mission if they were just cogs in a larger machine.
13123.title: Call for help

131231.content:
It would be easier to deal with the brute for the moment, she wasn’t certain how many guards might be in on this but it more important for the time being to discover if this man was from the caravan or if he was an outsider. She slipped behind the guard for a brief moment before following the brute, she lifted a dagger and the coin purse from the man before easing away, it was only right he pay her back for some of the trouble he had caused her this night.

Following the man proved to be easy in the soft dirt and his grumbling only made the job easier, he paused a moment to look around for observers as he exited the circle of wagons but failed to notice the golden-haired beauty hidden in the shadows. She was tempted to sneak back to her wagon to gather more equipment, she decided to continue the pursuit at least to see if he was alone if it was a group.

There was too much open area for her comfort but as soon as the man went over the crest of the hill she darted across the earth only slowing her pace when she reached the top of the hill. Her chest was far from being designed for crawling but she made the best of it, silently cursing the man who had designed this form, she might have to find him and make the man take the shape to see how well he enjoyed moving around with breasts the size of the finest melons.

Her eyes caught sight of a small encampment of bandits talking in quiet tones to the brute she had been following. Only five could be seen, certainly not enough to overtake the entire caravan but they were clearly up for making some trouble. A couple of people were bound to a stake in the ground and it appeared they had an empty wagon ready to take any spoils they might be able to secure. Cautiously she edged closer to try and hear what they were discussing.

“I am telling you, he doesn’t get a cut unless we make some profit,” a snake man his fork tongue flicked heavily in emphasis.“ He should have helped you get the girl if he wants money.”

“There were too many people up for us to do a search, he has to be careful, if they discover what the guard is up to they will torture and execute him,” he explained taking a step back out of bite distance.

“I don’t care, do you think the slaves we had came to us and bound themselves? My coins are hard earned and I will not give them out unless they are earned.”

“If you give me just one more day I think I can get the girl and her wagon.”

“Fine, we will meet you at the oasis tomorrow night, if you fail you shall find that I am not a forgiving man.”
131231.title: Follow the Brute

1313.content:
Seras moved around the camp checking out who she was dealing with. There was a lot of trouble along the path to the south so you had to be desperate, greedy or foolish to take the risk. Seras was greedy for the reward the King would give her if she succeeded but she needed to know more about the others with her not so she could trust them, there were few she ever trusted, but she needed to know them so she could know how they would react and what they would do when trouble would occur or when an opportunity presented itself.

The Serpent Outfit was a large group that had many of the wagons on the train. The men working the wagons were some of least trustworthy of men she had ever seen. She recognized several of the men as murderers under penalty of death if they were caught. A large half-orc commanded the bunch and kept them in line. They feared him and with good reason because he seemed to have eyes in the back of his head and more strength and skill in his arms than any four of them. It was easy to see what he wanted, profits, it looked like the man was in line for a promotion in the outfit if he pulled this risky venture off and there were going to be few things that he let stop him.

One of the ones that worried her most was the Andra clan because they had a desperate look to them. It was a family heading south with three wagons filled to the brim with people and junk. They were always sneaking looks in other people’s wagons and observing everyone as if looking for something or someone. They fell into the desperate category and were the most dangerous of the groups because it was always hard to predict what a desperate person would do.

Summer’s Twilight was a band of mercenaries that fell into the foolish category because they had no idea what they were in for. Their confidence was far greater than the skill she had seen from any of them. The real problem she had with them is there seemed to be some sort of bet as to which one of them could bring her to their bed and she didn’t want involvement with any of them.

“Thief!” The cry rang out through the night air and Seras almost made a run for it until she realized it wasn’t directed at her. Her speed towards the source of the grew faster as she saw that someone was taking her wagon.

Instinctively she grabbed a horse and pressed it into a gallop, glad that she had made friends with Cassie Spring from the wagon in front of her. The woman had realized it wasn’t her at the reign of the wagon and she had given Seras the time she needed to prevent the theft. She rode hard to see who had taken her wagon.
1313.title: Thief!

132.content:
Seras decided if King Emeril needed the assistance of one of the most famous thieves in the land chances were he was desperate and that usually meant the mission was extremely dangerous. A little extra assistance wasn't uncalled for, so she decided to ask for the assistance of warrior, Nasty Nick. He had earned the name for surviving the nastiest of fights and combats. He also had the bad habit of leaving pieces of equipment in the bedrooms of his employer's wives which he hadn't been visiting for security checks. Cleaning up after the warrior had earned more than one favor from the usually cash strapped warrior for Seras.

'I need your help with a mission,' Seras sat beside the heavily armored warrior in one of the dive bars he frequented when low on cash, or hiding out from irate husbands. Judging by the way he kept his eyes on the doors and back to the wall it was the latter.

'Your timing couldn't be any better,' Nasty Nick gave a grin. 'I haven't traveled in too long and was afraid my skills were going to go to pot, and here you call upon me for assistance. Now, I get to travel and clear my debts with a friend.'

'Some of your debts,' Seras corrected Nasty Nick. 'Are you forgetting how I cleared up the mess with your deflowering of the Archmage's daughter? What about leaving your dagger in the bedroom of the wife of the Captain of the Royal Guard?'

Nasty Nick's smile left his face and he cough, 'Too many hits to the head I suppose. My memory is maybe a little faulty, so I'll let you keep track of things my old friend.'

Seras let out a heavy sigh and nodded to let it settle matters. Nasty Nick wasn't trying to be dishonest, but he was trying to haggle when Seras held all of the chips. She had saved Nasty Nick from his over active hormones and absent minded brain on, so many occasions if she asked him to fall on sword he had better do it, because there were many people who would be willing to assist him onto the sword if given the proper information. Seras liked the man despite the trouble he had caused her over the years, but she wouldn't sell him up the river though she often contemplated how much she could get if she sold him out to his enemies.

'Come on my noble knight,' Seras teased. 'The sooner we get started the sooner you will be back drinking good beer instead of this mule piss.'

'Never have I heard such a fine enticement for a quest,' the handsome fighter smiled. 'It will be my pleasure to assist such a fine lady with whatever she desires.'

Seras laughed, 'So I have heard.'

The pair laughed as they rode off into the distant night. Nighttime was more comfortable for these two who were so comfortable with combat enshrouded inside of darkness. Many dangers could be encountered on their journey, but shadows and darkness were as much allies with them as anything that lurked within the darkness.
132.title: Collect a companion to act as a diversion

1321.content:
The first arrow struck Nick in the back knocking him from his horse and Seras dropped to the ground using her horse for cover until she could get to the trees. Nick would have to take care of himself for the time being but she could see him still moving with the glance she was able to spare him. A group of figures stepped out into the moonlight laughing at the suffering of there targets and feeling certainty of their victory. The drow had earned the right for some arrogance for their mastering of the killing arts because the ones they often trained against were each other and if someone died it only served to make them better as a species to their view.

Seras and Nick were at a disadvantage because of them being outnumbered by the drow and night fighting was a mastered skill by those who lived in eternal darkness so she wasn’t going to hold anything back if she intended to survive. It cost her a month’s pay but she tossed the last resort item at them and rolled behind a tree.

“A pebble!?!” One of the drow mocked her. “Is that the best you can do human?”

It exploded in a shower of gas enveloping all four of the drow who were not amused by it, “Don’t you know that we are masters of poison. Your little gas cloud won’t stop us but it has assured that you will be tortured for many years to come as our slave.”

She could understand mistaking the gas as a poison because one of the ingredients did have stun properties if mixed with certain other items but this wasn’t the purpose of the item at all as they were soon to discover. Nick had managed to roll into some nearby bushes and was pulling his sword preparing for the attack but she motioned for him to wait as the drow slowly edged forward.

Laris didn’t like the fact that there was no begging, pleading, or even threats, there was only silence. Either they were frozen with fear which she doubted with the quick reaction time of the female or they felt they had some sort of advantage. The gas had smelled like stun powder but could it have been something else? She adjusted her grip for the second time in a minute of her familiar blade but it still didn’t feel entirely right, it felt larger somehow. A dawning knowledge that something was very wrong took over as she saw the others playing with their equipment as well. Her mind searched for what could be causing this and how to fix it she felt a sudden tingle as her armor slide from her shoulders revealing her breasts to the world.

Her sister Lara stumbled out of her boots as their servant Veldrin dropped his blade as it became too large for his tiny hands to hold. Dira held tightly her robes as she shrank within the growing folds of the spider silk, fear was clear on the face of the young priestess. This was her first foray into the surface world and it might be her last. Lara tried to rush the humans before she became too small to be a threat to them but her movements were awkward as her breasts shook without proper support and her protective armor now slowed her with extra weight.

“Run!” Lara called to the others. “I will try to hold them off.”

This wasn’t altruism, she needed someone to escape so they could come to free her if she was captured or avenge her if she was killed. She had some hope the others would get away from these humans because the night and their new size would hide them well but their survival further than that was doubtful and their fate, if they got back to the other drow, might be even worse. The human male strode forward like a giant and easily knocked aside her weapon. Lara was lifted free from her clothing by the human who smiled lustfully at his shrinking prize even as she squirmed to be free.
1321.title: Danger Drow

13212.content:
“Do you have anything to contain them?” Nick bond Lara in a long piece of silk he had. His eyes search for the others.

“Of course I do,” Seras hand shot out like a whip to collect Dira where she was hidden under a bush. “There is a cage back on my horse. Here take her too, I will catch the rest of them.”

Nick was happy to take hold of another squirming form. His hands easily wrapped around their figures feeling the wonder curves of their feminine form. It was dangerous to get this close to a drow normally but they had no weapons and it this size they could cause little trouble.

“My brethren are nearby!” Lara tried to force the fingers apart but it was a fruitless effort. “If you don’t release me at once your torture will last a year!”

“At least you didn’t offer to spare my life little mouse,” Nick laughed. “I would have been certain you were lying with those words I am almost certain you are lying.”

He gently placed Dira in the cage but he dropped Lara from a couple of feet up. The trained warrior managed to absorb the pain of the fall with a tumble. Her face turned lethal to Nick as she heard his clapping.

“We will have great fun in dissecting you piece by piece,” she snapped.

“You can come off of it already, there is no help coming for you,” Nick slapped the cage shut. “If there had been you wouldn’t announce it. You would have just adopted a superior look to your face and waited for them to come. I bet you are a raiding party looking for some slaves. Rather ironic that you may become ones. There is a market for shrunken women and I imagine drow would be worth extra. You do tend to piss people off with all of the murder and slavery.”

Lara wanted to come up with a reply to put the man in his place beneath her heel but nothing came to mind. She hated to admit a lot of what he said was likely right unless she or one of her companions could do something. To that end, she examined the wooden cage but the lock was on the top where they couldn’t reach it. This new decorative prison was beautiful with dark wood with a lovely grain but it would not be easily broken. It was made of stone wood which even metal weapons would break upon.

“Do you have any ideas?” Lara doubted the young priestess could help but there was a chance and it beat hitting the bars until her fists were bloody.

“Veldrin might be able to unlock the cage with his skills, I could send him a message,” Dira responded.
13212.title: Collect more prizes

1322.content:
Nick was already riding ahead to get into the bars before the evening drunks arrived and had all the most attractive wenches for themselves. Seras shook her head in frustration knowing he was already likely to find the one that had someone sweet on them and with a large jealous streak. It wouldn’t be so bad if he didn’t seem to take such joy in winning over the attached ladies. He knew he was getting into trouble yet he did nothing to stop himself.

The thief knew there was little chance of changing the behavior of the man at this point so she didn’t try. Besides, she had work to do in Port Haven and Nasty Nick could be a distraction at the best of times. There was a stench to the air in this port city from the processing of whales, very little of the creatures were allowed to go to waste because there was a profit in all of it but the price the city paid for the prosperity was forever having the foul stench of death and rotting from the air. The rich had the best of it, as the usually did, up in there mansions on the surrounding hills but even they were forced to constantly burn incense and scented candles to fight back the stomach-turning odors which had brought them their profits.

King Emeril had told her that his enemies had been going missing in this city which would normally not displease a ruler but the talk of revolt was becoming more than idle talk and his son Prince Wesley was doing little to quell the sentiments. Seras imagined the main problem for the King was that only the small fish were being taken leaving the big fish in the area to gather power and form rebellion in earnest.

Her travels had never brought her here before but she had been to places like this before. It was newly conquered territory where some of the old guards were left in place so that the profits would not stop coming in but as time went on that old guard became more hindrance than a help. If they were smart they would realize this and get out, make themselves indispensable or try and get rid of the new rulers. It appeared they had chosen rebellion, it wasn’t surprising the nobility chose bloodshed, why shouldn’t they, it was rarely their blood that got shed. There was a lot of profit in war and a lot of new positions of power that would open up.

Seras doubted the King would even mind some bloodshed but he didn’t want it to get in the way of the profits the Port was bringing him and it looked like the Prince might be in league with the those who desired rebellion. He wouldn’t be the first son or last who tried to take over for there Father before natural death brought them to an end.
1322.title: Learn more at Port Haven

choices: Take a look inside the mansion of the Gunderson family
1323.content:
After a few hours of riding on the dirt roads in between the many crop fields and pastures around the capital, with pits that were barely visible under the moonlight, they reached the city of Gunderson. Which was founded by the family of Gunderson, near the coal and iron mines of Gunderson and with the Gunderson river flowing next to it making the trading of iron and the likes a breeze. Of course, the acting authority in the city was count Gunderson, like his father before him and his father before that. That said not all Gundersons were direct descendants and only the main line were eligible as heirs to the title of count, the rest had to settle for more mediocre professions and lives. A lot of people in the city carried the name Gunderson and many more were far nephews and cousins from the family, carrying their father's name instead of their mothers. But aside from the strangeness of how much children the family had had in the early centuries, they haven't been the weirdest bunch.

The mines haven't been producing as much as of late however, some blame the miners slacking off, others say they stumbled upon some ruins deep underground of the old dwarves of Gunderson and their automatons have flooded the narrow passages. There is a small bounty for whoever can figure it out, but nobody in the city made an effort for it yet, though some first signs of economic decline have become visible in the outer ring of the city.

The city is quite famous for its blacksmith district, it able to supply a quarter of the metal needed to arm the entire king's army on its own, while still having room for private requests. Some of the best craftsmen in the kingdom even live there, perhaps able to forge some great gear for the two travelers on a quest to help the kingdom.

A most unsettling occurrence these days, however, is the absence of government. Since the start of the week, the private estate in the middle of the city has gone dark, the gates are shut tight and nobody outside knows what count Gunderson is doing behind those bars. The guards outside of the premise haven't seen a coin in their pockets for many days and none of the guards inside respond, nor any of the other staff for that matter. Which is quite troubling since the gate only opens from the inside and nobody dares climb over the 4 meter high wall built around the estate.
1323.title: Investigate the city of Gunderson

13233.content:
Hearing the plight of the guards Seras decided to help out the goodness of her heart or greed for the wealth lurking within those walls. The guards made her promise to just check on things and not take anything but a small cut of the treasure was sure to change their minds after several days without wages. She climbed the wall with the ease of many years of practice despite the bars being greased against such an attempt. Her clawed gloves and boots countered the intruder deterrent nicely, she thought, as she dropped a rope for Nasty Nick and moved down the other side.

No light illuminated any windows so she wasn’t sure where to look for signs of life but she decided the front door was the best place to start. The thief moved quickly to check some windows for movement as Nasty Nick grunted and cursed his way over the wall. All of the curtains had been drawn shut, the curtains were expensive but dated, a sign harder times had hit the family. Seras moved up to the door and rang the bell, she listened closely for the sound of footsteps approaching the door but none came even after several ringing of the bell. The sound just echoed through the empty halls of the mansion. After a quick check for traps, she turned the knob and swung the door open to beautiful marble floors within.

“Glad you could join me, did you stop off to have a drink?” Seras teased which drew a rude gesture from her friend.

“I would like to see you carry heavy metal armor and all of this muscle over a giant wall,” Nasty Nick complained.

“I have done a fine job carrying you all of our years together. Now, how about you do your job and get to work meat shield.”

He grumbled but went in first, providing cover as she scanned for threats and signs of what had happened in this place. If no one had answered the bell the odds were something very bad had happened here but was the danger still a threat to the warrior and the thief. It didn’t look like any of the expensive furnishings had been taken so it wasn’t likely they were dealing with simple burglary. No one had reported any strange noise from the place so whatever had happened occurred very quickly and took out the entire house. She sniffed the air but didn’t detect any scents of poison in the air.

There were rumors that Count Gunderson and his family had dealt in dark magic to get their wealth and power. Dark magic often had consequences and price that came back to bite the user in the rear. Magic would answer many of the questions about what had happened to this place especially if it was the culmination of generations of dark rituals.

She eyed the distant gate and wondered if she should get the guards or if she should continue to investigate the place with Nasty Nick.
13233.title: Take a look inside the mansion of the Gunderson...

133.content:
Seras decided to visit her band of merry criminals to see if they had any news from the south. The warehouse was an innocuous looking front which hid a den of some of the kingdom's greatest thieves. It was the closest thing to a family and home in her life, and as she spotted Rick the Rat she remembered that many families didn't like one another.

Rick casually picked his nails with a dagger, 'What brings the lady of the night to grace us with her presence?'

'Don't hurt that pea you call a brain with talking, 'Seras responded. 'You will only get yourself in trouble. I'm looking for information about current events on what is going on in the South.'

'Word is that trade is limited, so pickings are slim but lucrative,' Nick the Fence answered. 'Don't know what's causing the trouble but a lot of people are going missing.'

'Strange animal monsters have been spotted,' Jack the Falcon said. 'Not the usual werewolves and other shape shifters.'

'Strong indications the cult of Basha is involved my people say,' Karen the Broker explained. 'I would back out of whatever you have yourself involved with my friend.'

Basha was an animal god who called for the sacrifice living creatures usually in the form of a hunting of the target. The religion was banned after it was discovered they weren't content with lower animals but frequently hunted humans or other sentient races. The King had given her a truly dangerous mission the question was it worth the risk. What should you do next?
133.title: Contact her band for information

1331.content:
The rogue remembers how much her reward would be if she was successful and weighed it against the risks she was taking. Basha was an old cult that appeared to reward anyone successful on their little hunting trips so maybe she could reward herself with there treasure. She wondered briefly about where they got the loot from but it didn’t matter as long as they had it.

Travel was the worst part of a trip for her because there was little to do but wait. She couldn’t plan on her strike because she didn’t know the layout or even where their base of operations was. All she could really do was wait and worry about things she had no control over.

She arrived at the sand-filled town of Siren’s Grave and headed for the closest bar where the prices of water rivaled that of fine wines. Seras wondered who had the “wisdom” to build out in this hell hole. A poster on the wall called for hunters of monsters which reeked of a trap but could be worth checking out.

The locals didn’t even bother to hide their stares at the stranger invading their space and she pretended to be uninterested in them but scanned the room for likely sources of information. A small group of men whispered to each other and took a quick glance at the various people around the room, close examination showed they all had the markings of snakes on them. It could be that they were snake cultists or a gang, either way, it might be nice to pit them against the servants of Basha.

A grizzled old dwarf missing his left arm pounded down swigs of what was sure to be rotgut alcohol. The tools he wore signaled him to be a miner which could be a good source of information but the heavy drinking, even by dwarf standards was a worry for how reliable he would be.

Bartenders were usually good sources of information which was both a good thing and a bad thing. Sure you could find out a lot from them but your information was usually passed on just as readily as the information you got from them. Seras wanted any enemies to have as little information on her as possible. This bartender had a couple of crossbows cocked and loaded behind the bar at the ready. She had the look of a dangerous woman who had a hard life and was ready to strike first and worry about the consequences later.

The person who intrigued her the most was the elf in the corner. It was the first time she had seen one of her people in the desert, they did so love their homes lush and green so was she an outsider like herself or was she a resident of this place. Her clothing suggested local as it was desert gear. The book she was reading was covered in arcane symbols and strongly suggested she was dealing with a magic user.

A final person drew her interest, a heavily metal-clad warrior sat in a corner dragging a dagger across the table but if the bartender minded she didn’t say anything. The faceless warrior was not someone who belonged in this scorching land which made them very interesting. All eyes whipped away from the being with a hint of fear when they looked in the direction of this metal monster.

There was a lot here to investigate but which path would bring her to the results she wanted or better ones.
1331.title: Continue the mission

1332.content:
Seras wanted no part of the mission any longer because there was no profit to be had and a lot of danger involved. This was not good to induce her interest in a mission. Cultists were not likely to have a lot of money because they were usually fanatics who would die for their cause and gave everything to the cult. At the main temple, there might be a lot of treasure if they didn’t spend it on decorations that were hard to move or sell. She had once secured a golden statue and been forced to use a lot of time and effort in melting it down because no one wanted the strange multilegged figure whole.

The cults like the one of Basha were especially bad because they were in many places and they would hunt her down for the rest of her life. Being forced to look over your shoulders for the rest of your life was not a healthy or happy way to live. Seras knew of a fence who was still attacked on occasion by cultists who worshiped some sort of aquatic being because he had only sold an object precious to them twenty years ago. The cult of Basha was much larger and competent than they were. Most cults were filled with clueless clods who were stupid at best and were more likely a hindrance. Basha cultists were trained hunters and tracks for whom hunting down and killing things was part of their worship.

She hired a messenger to return the offered wages for the job and her politest apology for being unable to complete the job. Seras knew the King would be than unhappy that she had denied completing a job he had requested but she was more afraid of the cultist than she was of the King. Emeril was a smart man but he had a hot temper. In time his anger would cool off but it might be better to not be around for a few weeks in case he hired an assassin for her.

Taking a vacation didn’t seem like such a bad idea, she could spend some the hard earned loot she had taken in over the years. There was the safe house she had built in Curiosity Cove on the pirate haven of San Maria or she could work on creating a new identity with a clean history to it because she had lost one recently in a raid to some guards. It was fun going down the prison and seeing how many wanted posters there were for her.
1332.title: Quit

13321.content:
The rogue decided it was time to take a long vacation with the fortune she had earned over the course of her lifetime. It wasn’t long before Lady Lillian Von Wulfhund was showing up at the spas of Burnuna and the tropical sun. It was fun to go to the small set of islands, she had been there before on the islands and knew them well through all of the previous times had been business and this would hopefully be a lot more pleasure.

No one questioned her status as a noble, has a large fortune helped remove any questions from the minds of people. All they wondered about was how to get more of the money that she let flow. Lillian was very generous with the fortune of her family.

Lillian was instantly welcomed to all of the finest parties and social events. A beautiful woman with long chestnut hair and a pleasing figure was always welcomed to the island and one who had a lot of money was fawned upon. Instinctively she knew that the vast majority of the people just wanted things from her, mostly her money but she loved it.

All of her life she had been the ugly duckling not desired by anyone but the guards. The violence of the streets and a starving childhood had robbed her of much of the beauty she might have had so being desired by so many was pleasing to her especially from the handsome prince. She vaguely remembered the stories of a noble marrying the poor servant girl told to her by her Mother before she passed away leaving her alone in the world.

Prince Ludwig was rich and powerful noble of the Empire who was more than a little handsome and was more than a little interested in the mysterious noblewoman who had arrived here. It wasn’t long before she was talking about marriage with him and he was happy to move the talk forward into a reality.

She had never thought a vacation could changer her life so much and it wasn’t long before Lillian had a grand wedding she had never dreamed of. The former rogue thought about telling her husband the truth but decided a little mystery was important in life. It wasn’t hard for her to settle into the noble class because it turned out she had been preparing for it all of her life.

All of her life she had spent pretending to be other people and nobles were really just better-dressed thieves. Lillian proved that she was more than a trophy for her husband. She knew how to spot when the books were cooked, where to find bandits and pirates and how to spot liars. Those assets and many others proved to the Emperor his son had chosen very well in his bride, he knew the truth of the woman and soon no longer cared. More than one traitor to his empire was taken down thanks to her he efforts and with no hesitation, he handed over the reins of his empire to the pair.

Emperor Ludwig and Empress Lillian ruled for many years together and produced five children, three boys, and a girl. Under their rule, the Empire expanded its border even taking over a kingdom called Dar. The people prospered and became safer than they had ever been before with the Empress having a very special interest in the welfare of the orphaned children of the lands. It wasn’t a bad accomplishment for a woman who had grown up on the streets.
13321.title: Vacation

13323.content:
Colleen Flynn was a beauty with long bright red hair neatly styled to be out of the way so she could work hard at her shop. The rumor was she had a great deal of debt built up by her father that she had to pay back under penalty of pain if she missed a payment. She was tiny, barely more than five feet in height and slim with none of the large curves many a man enjoyed but she was not a woman to be mistreated because she had a quick mind and a fiery temper.

Satisfied with the story Seras looked over the towns to start up her trading post in. The background of having a crippling debt would encourage people to try making black market deals with her so she could pay down the money she owed. People liked it when they had something they could hold over someone, it made them worry less about their own dark secrets. There was a delicate balance in being pretty but not too pretty because men liked to talk to an attractive woman but she didn’t want anyone getting too many ideas.

She narrowed down her choices to three, Lover’s Bluff was a great defensible position with only one way up to it that didn’t involve almost certain death from falling. It was on the edge of the wilderness with many hostile tribes and species that caused it to have to be closed off for long periods of time but war was always a source of great profits for those willing to take risks. Selling weapons could quickly earn her another fortune. She would have to be careful as the King had been cracking down on those who sold weapons and his men were likely to be watching the activity of a place so close to the border with the eyes of a hawk.

Carter’s Corner was a small nothing of a town, few people, few buildings and it was dominated by the Lord Mayor like it was his own personal kingdom but it had a great deal of potential. There were a lot of natural resources nearby, a river that could easily be converted to transporting goods and a nice central location that could make it a trade capital in no time. The main problem was all of the time and efforts it would require to make it something that would turn a profit. It was tempting to build a lasting future there but it would mean investing most of the money she had laid away over the years. It was a big risk that she wasn’t certain she wanted to risk and the Lord Mayor was going to be a problem because he was strangling the life from the place. He would certainly try to strangle the profits away from any business she built and she wasn’t going to let that happen.

Scarlet Cove was her final pick, a small fishing village along the coast that would make a great place to start a smuggling operation. The sheltered cove was perfect for bringing in goods and sending them out. Her major problem with it was how into each other's business everyone was. There was a creeping nature to the town that suggested the possibility of a cult. Another problem would be dealing with the pirates because they weren’t known for their good nature and many of them could be spotted by their wanted posters more than once the notoriety of a pirate had blown the cover a good alter ego. The good part of dealing with pirates was the money, they were very loose with it because they didn’t have the time to haggle usually as they were on the run from someone.
13323.title: New Identity

133231.content:
“I can’t say I think it is wise for a young lady to start a business out here,” Warden Narius, the local law in the area warned her.

Colleen wondered if it was a genuine worry or if he was just trying to cover up his own crimes. Whatever the reason there was no point in arousing his anger at the moment. It was best to be friendly until she knew if he was an enemy or an ally.

“There isn’t much choice for me, unfortunately,” she responded watching for hints of truth from the man. “This is the last property my father didn’t gamble away to a bill collector. Likely because the drunken ass forgot he owned it.”

The man nodded grimly, “Do as you must but I can’t spare any of my men to patrol your property. It is outside of the city gates with foul savages nearby. You should see too hiring guards and making sure the walls are in good order.”

“Thank you for the advice. I will certainly do as you suggest.”

The thief was happy to see the man go, so she was able to get to the property before the sun faded from the sky. Visiting the town was a necessary evil because they would likely grow suspicious of lights from the nearby cliffs. She would do a little business with the town to keep up appearances but her real trade would come from the “savages” at night.

Her horse rode up to the warm fairy lanterns being turned on. They were more expensive than standard oil lanterns to start. The magical lights lasted far longer than oil and were brighter so she could see potential customers from a long way off.

“You have done well Onyx,” Colleen complemented the half-orc. “How goes the tunnel building?”

“The goblins are slow and lazy,” he snorted. “I wish we could hire dwarfs for the work.”

“So do I but when dwarfs go missing after the work is done someone comes looking for them. Maybe you or I could pretend to be a dragon in disguise and upgrade to kobolds. Those little fanatics are at least loyal and trustworthy.”

“I don’t like working with fanatics. They are too untrustworthy because they don’t value money.”

“Too true.”

She had found the Onyx several years back enslaved to his own tribe. The thief had freed him and gotten a loyal worker who was happy to learn the business of making money. He had been instrumental in getting this outpost set up. Soon they would be able to receive the pirate trade in a cave which only opened under cover of darkness with a secret tunnel connected to her trading post.

“Watch out for Warden Narius,” Colleen suggested. “I suggest he isn’t too fond of orcs.”

“Good because I wasn’t planning to try and bed the bastard,” Onyx joked.
133231.title: Lover's Bluff

1333.content:
The rogue needed to have more information before she was going to stick her neck out on this one. Cultist were fanatics who would spend the rest of their pathetic lives hunting you if you harmed their group and Basha was one of the worst groups to go against. Not only were many of the members' skilled hunters and trackers but dark bargains were often made to increase powers or give magic. The god they served could be very generous as long as their hunts pleased him.

She shuddered at the thought of being part of their hunts. Sentient beings turned into animals and hunted to amuse a sadistic god was not her idea of fun but she had reasons to go after them and not least of which was the fact they had a lot of loot that could set her up for the rest of her life. Seras would have to decide somewhere to retire far from these lands and the cultists. It would involve a new identity but she actually enjoyed creating them at this point.

Outnumbered, out magicked and they had a god on their side, a tall order for even a thief of her caliber, she would need to get more information before she committed to this mission by the King. It wouldn’t surprise her if this was a death trap set up by King Emeril for her, she knew a lot more secrets about the running of the kingdom and some of the horrifying decisions that had been made over the years than a ruler would be comfortable with her having.

There was a chill in the air as she went lower and lower into the sewers to find a source of information she trusted. It was a maze that few would ever be able to find their way out of but she had grown up here in the not very forgiving bosom of the goddess of thieves. When she was a child she had found the shrine but she rarely visited it. Having any of the celestials in your life was troublesome than it was worth to her mind but she would need all of the help she could get because the other side had a god on their side.

A series of locked doors blocked her path, she could no longer go down the path she had taken as a child but she had no problem with the locks but it delayed her longer than she wanted. The less time spent here the better, she could feel the eyes of Nanara upon her constantly judging her just like all of her childhood. The room was lined with amazing treasure that could step up a room full of people for a dozen lifetimes. Each one was the traps or cursed in some way by the goddess sometimes with more than one deadly protection upon them. There were rumors that some had gotten treasures out without consequences to retire to the life of luxury but those tales were long on rumor and short on truth.

She stood in front of the statue and set down her offering before speaking.
1333.title: Gather more information

134.content:
Seras was alone often in her life and taking this trip alone was probably the best idea. The band she had formed was really a loose collection of allies who agreed to not harm each other, but when a wealthy King was involved Seras suspected that all bets were off. Luckily most members disappeared for a few weeks at a time occasionally, so her absence wouldn't be noticed. The only thing that worried her was if anyone had noticed her visiting the King because thieves were notoriously curious and would investigate what her dealings with the King were.

The rumors of abominations in the south were so vague it was tantalizing. Normal villagers weren't exactly very well informed about the things that resided in the world so many times things were placed under one label like a goblin could actually be a kobold, some types of fae, or some type of ghost. If King Emeril was willing to bring one of the most notorious thieves in the land to his castle to hire her to investigate, chances were the enemy was powerful, and where there is power more often than not there is money.

Seras bought an expensive durack, a giant lizard, to use for her travel to the south because they were wonderful in hot climates and would help provide protection if she was attacked. The large teeth and gigantic claws caused many people to prefer horses because they were intimidated by them, but they were normally quite gentle. Seras had paid extra money to get a durack trained to guard and protect its master. The one problem with them was they ate meat which could be hard to find at times in the desert where they were usually free to roam to eat carrion. Thankfully they could gorge on meat and be satisfied for weeks at a time, so Seras fed it until it was full though with the amount of food that went into it Seras thought it should double in size, and she set out for the south wondering what dangers she would meet on her travels.
134.title: Travel south alone

1341.content:
The sharp eyes of the thief spotted the gnolls and spurred her mount to some rocks for cover. From the entourage behind them, it looked like they were slavers and she had no desire to join the ranks. Gnolls slaves were some of the most unfortunate creatures on the earth as gnolls often ate parts of their slaves during their roaming and made no effort to ensure the survival of their commodity.

She wasn’t sure if she had been spotted but it wouldn’t take much effort to discover the trail of her riding lizard and if they were hungry they were likely to try hunting it down. If they weren’t hungry which seemed likely as it appeared they still had slaves left alive they might avoid the creature as duracks didn’t go down easily.

Seras observed that they were twenty in number with no young among them. There were no elderly in gnoll society as they were all killed and eaten before they reached the age one would call old in another society. Some sages wondered how long a gnoll could live if they weren’t murdered but that was a question only the gods were likely to be able to answer. She swore a curse against the gods of luck as the gnolls turned as they found the trail of the lizard and started to follow it.

There was no use in dwelling on the approach of the foul creatures as it would waste the precious little time she had to prepare for their approach. She removed the bridle from her riding lizard so it would have full use of its jaws in the coming battle and started to load crossbows and gather weapons in case they started to get clever which she doubted. They were single-minded monsters who believed in the direct brutal dominance of opponents they felt were weaker than they were.

The bolt struck the lead gnoll in the eye socket dropping it in front of the surprised others. A second gnoll dropped and they quickly dropped back behind their slaves for cover on the open desert sands. Seras could almost hear the thinking of the hyena-like humanoids thoughts as she reloaded her crossbows. They were trying to determine how many they faced in combat to see if they would fight or run. She wished she knew which ones were the tracks so she could slay them before they revealed there was likely only one or two people in the hills.

Seras eyed her gear as she decided on her next move against the enemy. A few good shots might free the slaves as they were only held by a rope which would create chaos and free her to shoot the gnolls who would no longer have cover. She had some explosive fire orbs but they were likely to injure the slaves since they were so close to the gnolls but the expense of them was more on her mind. It seemed like such a waste to use them on simple slavers since she didn’t know what lay ahead on her quest. Her final idea was to wait for them to make a move and try to counter it. They weren’t known to be the best battle planners and she had the durack to back her up. She didn’t need to kill all of them just enough to make them look for easier prey elsewhere.

She had briefly thought about running but it would likely inspire the creatures to chase her after they realized she had disappeared. The real reason for her disinterest in flight was her hate for gnolls. They were truly evil always looking to cause destruction where ever they went. Even slavery was more for cruelty than profit, to please the foul demon who had given them life long ago. If ever there was an intelligent humanoid that should be destroyed to the last one it was the gnoll.
