She had heard there were gnolls in the world who hadn’t fallen to the worship of demons and did great good for the world but she believed them to be a myth and wishful thinking. Only dead gnolls had merit in her experience, as food for vultures.
1341.title: Gnoll slavers

13411.content:
Seras shot with a careful eye and intent to free the slaves and her efforts proved fruitful. The gnolls didn’t notice the freedom of their slaves as they started moving towards their prey thinking her shots had gone high. She watched as the slaves started to flee, cutting themselves free with crossbow bolts they quickly made a breakaway. It was a risk waiting on shooting the gnolls but she wanted to give the slaves a chance to run if she could. Finally, she started unloading her arsenal into the band of gnolls causing them to start to turn back to regroup.

A smile formed on her face as they realized their slaves were escaping from their custody. The group hesistated with indecision costing them badly as she hoped. They were barking at each other in there canine-like language under her withering fire, most likely debating what to do. The pile of bodies their companions had formed into a wall was flimsy but Seras left them behind it for the moment as she reloaded her weapons.

She took a drink of water to counter the dehydration of the intense activity, and watched what the group was up to. They appeared to be planning to run after the escaping as they were edging away from her as one kept watch waiting for the chance to run. Seras did a quick count to see how many of them were left and figure there were around a dozen still remaining around. It was a much better number to deal with but still very dangerous if they charged her. Gnolls weren’t very good at ranged combat but they were extremely dangerous at close range with weapons and deadly jaws.

The gnolls rushed away, seeking the easier target of the weaponless slaves but Seras made sure not all of them would make it. She needed to decide what to do next, she wanted to continue on her journey because she wasn’t being paid for any of this and was expending a lot of valuable resources but it was likely the gnolls would catch up to the slaves if she let things go without interferring. Maybe she could help this once without having it hurt her reputation as a heartless individual too much. Perhaps she could get some money from any loot they were carrying to make it worth her time to act the hero or maybe she could just take joy in the chance to kill some real monsters.
13411.title: Free the slaves

134112.content:
The gnolls didn’t bother with a fire that night, to be honest, they had nothing left to eat except possibly each other and they had no desire to attract the attention of any monsters lurking in the darkness. They would find a new leader the next day in combat but for now, they would lick their wounds because of that monster of a human girl. There would be many dreams of revenge tonight but it was not something they were likely to pursue because that would mean admitting weakness to the others they would have to go after her. Setting the guards for the night, most of them went to bed grumbling more about the loss of slaves than the loss of their own numbers.

A gnoll’s nose twitched as it smelled something out of place, something of a recent unpleasant memory but the awareness was cut short as a dagger entered the mind ending the small mind within. Gnolls conquered the darkness but the thief was a lover and friend to it and it was kind in return. She made short work of the remaining guards leaving only slumbering forms left. The foul creatures were never going to escape this camp if she had anything to do with it.

She liked to pretend she was a person without a past, that she was untouched by the world and what happened in it but even the “heartless” thief was once a little girl who had watched her world burn by torches held by gnolls. Her village was a simple farming town filled with nobodies you could find in thousands of different places but they were her family and none had survived the destruction and chaos of the gnolls except for her and a few others who had been hidden in cellars around town. The fires had scarred her as she tried to reach her Father who fought to keep her hidden.

The pain of the memories hurt to this day and the gnolls would be paid back ten fold for the losses she had suffered that day. She knocked loudly on the log she was sitting upon awakening the remaining to her presence. The lot of them stared in shock at their good fortune.

“Good evening,” she smiled. “You left our little game for blood and I wasn’t done.

They started to grab their weapons but sharp pains filled their stomachs as the poison she had given them took effect.

“One vial of antidote to the winner, good luck,” she walked back to her mount as they started to fight each other for the right to survival. Seras laughed that there wouldn’t be survival for any of them. There was no antidote only death for gnolls and the thought filled her with joy as she slowly circled back to the encampment so she could loot the corpses.

There wasn’t likely to be a lot of money earned from her activities but every little bit helped. She had taken a lot of joy from what she had done this day and she debated doing it again.
134112.title: Hunt down the gnolls

1341123.content:
Seras moved through the encampment, uncertain of what she was looking for perhaps a past she had lost long ago when she found a coin purse. The assorted metals shined as she poured them out into her hand playing with them. She loved coins, not just for the value, though that was a large portion of her love, she also liked the history they revealed. They were like a spider’s web connecting all of the world together, she found one that had a very interesting history to it. It belonged to the ancient empire of Isbel, there were rumors the last emperor had gone mad, building a giant dungeon to protect his treasure. Had someone discovered the location?

There seemed to be some etching on the coin, a map, it was worth at least a look but like all things she did she weigh the cost and benefit. She brought over her lizard who started the process of removing the unwanted corpses, duracks were wonderful better than iron-clad stomach even the lingering poison in some of the bodies wouldn’t cause so much as a stomach ache. Her noble steed was taken care of, it could live for a long time from the meal it had this day. Adding the gnoll’s water she had plenty for a side excursion, food was a bit dicier, she wasn’t willing to take what the gnolls would consider food, human corpses were not something she cared to add to her diet but if she was careful with her rations and did some hunting she could afford the risk.

It always felt great giving into the beckoning of the adventurous soul in her heart, she remembered the tales of the splendors rumored to lurk within the dungeon. Golden statues with jewels for eyes, the silver coffin overflowing with gems, and silver mirror rumored to have a power jinn trapped inside to grant wishes to those willing to take the risk of entering the dungeon. She had researched the place as a pet project over the years but most of what she found was simply fairy tales to whet the appetites of treasure-hungry adventurers.

She believed the mad emperor might still be alive, still ruling over his own empire within the walls of the dungeon. From what she had read about the man, he had been obsessed with trying to extend his life to the detriment of his empire and Seras was aware of there being many methods to extend life, most of them involving foul things such as the sacrificing of people. He would be a fearsome opponent with thousands of years mastering his home.

Her travel was uneventful through the mesas, buttes, and plateau in a seemingly endless maze. She was careful to keep her eyes out for the limited resources this land would offer her. A couple lizards and a hare helped expand her resources but no water revealed itself to her.
1341123.title: Discover something

1342.content:
The thief was always watching, you didn’t last long in this business if you weren’t because everyone was after you so it didn’t take her long to realize someone was following her. A group of robed figures was keeping a good distance from her but they were easy to spot in this desolate land. There was the possibility they were just traveling in the same direction as she was but she dismissed the idea when she took a couple of out of the way side trails and they followed.

Seras moved to a good vantage point so she could get a good look at them to decide her next course of action. They were traveling on horses which would give them a great deal of speed over her but a poor choice of animal in this dry land. She could get away from them by going over a particularly barren stretch of land and it also gave her hope that the people following her were novices for choosing horses.

It was always tempting to confront the people following you but they outnumbered her and the lack of knowledge didn’t mean that they weren’t great fighters. For the moment she decided to stay on her path and let them follow. The bright sun allowed her to view them with ease at a great distance but it would also prevent her from sneaking up on them to discover more so she would have to wait until dark to do her investigating.

The people didn’t have any symbols that she could see through her spyglass so she put it away and continued on her journey. The questions of who they were would plague her mind until she got away from them or got the answers she was looking for. They could be from the King but why would he send them? Could it be a possible rival or one of her guild trying to betray her? Or one of the people she had taken money from over the years trying to take revenge?

No one said the life of a thief was easy but if you could make it out you could retire as one of the rich, the trick was picking the right time. You had to make enough to survive upon before you made too many of the wrong enemies.
1342.title: Seras is being followed

13423.content:
The rogue had many of years of experience dealing people who wanted to stop her from her activities and for now the best thing she could do was wait. Her riding lizard was tired from a long day of travel and it didn’t have the endurance a horse did but things would change if she waited. The horses didn’t have the endurance to the heat of the desert sun so she would just have to be careful when she rest because things would soon turn in her favor.

Moving into some rocks she settled down for the night making sure to set a few alarms and traps for unwanted visitors. Seras looked out over the desert but didn’t see any fires or camps in the distant before starting a fire for an evening meal. She didn’t want them to know she was onto them if they know they might rush into an action before she was ready to strike.

A full belly and a long day went for an easy sleep and she was out nearly as soon as she closed her eyes. Sleep was precious and needed to be taken when you could get it. A jolting sound woke her and she quickly drew her blade. She slid out of her bedroll with practiced experience making sure to leave a lump for any unwanted intruders.

Seras slung a crossbow over her shoulder and vanished into the shadows. No further sound could be heard so either they had backed off or they were being far more cautious but she was willing to bet her life that she was better in the shadows then they were. Heading to the location of the alarm she saw no one had come close to her camp. In the distant, she could see a figure running across the sand.
13423.title: Wait

134231.content:
The person was likely going to inform the others she had set up traps, best to have them disappear before they could tell anything. Seras flung a poison-tipped dart at the back of the neck with precision. They slapped at it as if it was an insect but it was all the response they manage. Floxi frog poison was expensive but worth the price as they collapse to the ground. It would be an hour before they would be able to utter a word.

There was a bit of disappointment as the face of the woman was not one she recognized. The woman had been well-armed with many throwing daggers and blackened blades for night work. She stripped the woman naked looking for markings. Seras found what she was looking for a skull with a pair of red snakes coming out of the eye sockets before intertwining with each other was hidden on the sole of the foot.

The Society of the Red Snake was not a group she wanted to deal with but it appeared she had no choice. Seras dragged the body back to her camp before binding it and waiting to wake her up.

“You can stop pretending,” Seras drew a dagger, as she saw the subtle change to alertness her enemy was trying to hide. “What do you hisses want with me?”

The slur snapped the eyes open to a hateful stare, “What makes you think you can get me to talk you hairless ape!”

“You don’t exactly seem very serpent-like yourself,” the thief yanked on a hunk of hair. “So are you blooded or just a wannabe.”

Seras leaned the head back and dug her dagger at them but only found a little blood and not any fangs. The woman tried to ball up as tears welled in her eyes. She was just a human, a very stupid and foolish human.

“Your buddies are not going to notice you haven’t returned for many hours, human,” Seras put an extra emphasis on the word. “A lot of bad things can happen to you in that time so I suggest you talk.”

“They’ll kill me if I talk,” she looked over her shoulders as if they might just be lurking in the darkness.

“There is a small cave nearby with a stash of food and freshwater well. You can stay there until I send someone back at the next town to pick you up. They will think I killed you and buried you in this wasteland. I even plan to kill your companions so there is one less link to the snakes. If they find you have failed them they will do far worse to you than I would. I imagine you have seen the snake pits.”

There was an instant shudder, all of the groups of snake people love to show recruits the snake pits as an effective warning to those would think of betraying them.

“I’ll talk,” she announced after several minutes of thinking. “They want . . .”
134231.title: Capture the person

1343.content:
The heat would have been miserable if she didn’t use a cooling stone. They were expensive but they absorbed a lot of the heat in the air allowing her to feel cool even in the desert. She had made sure to have plenty of water and more importantly meat so her animal wouldn’t get aggressive with her though she made sure it had a fully before she started the journey so it shouldn’t need to eat for a long time.

Most bandits and monsters avoided this land because of how hostile it was to live so traveling alone could sometimes be safer than going with a wagon if you were outfitted properly which most who entered the Valley of Fire weren’t. Many foolish souls came this way in search of the treasures rumored to be hidden in the valley which Seras dismissed as no one had returned yet with a hint of treasure from this desert.

Cliffs lined the valley leaving easy escape all but impossible to reach the oasis on top to all but the most skilled climbers. Seras considered herself quite talented at scaling places but she had little interest in going to the top if she didn’t have to because of the many loose rocks along the way. A large shadow crossed her sight and she realized there was a gigantic bird soaring over the valley.

It was a roc, a bird with a legendary appetite and more importantly, their eggs could bring in a fortune. They were partial to horses and cattle but a giant lizard would do if they were hungry enough. She smiled as the creature broke its circling and continued hunting the valley. There was a lot of risk going after the nest of a roc which might be empty to start with but there was also a lot of rewards if she got lucky.

King Emeril didn’t give her any deadline for his task so she could take some personal time for a side trip but rocs lived high up so she would have to climb the cliffs if she wanted to see if there was a chance for a fortune. It landed on the side with the oasis so at least she would have access to water but the creature wasn’t likely to want any eggs stolen from it. She hadn’t brought a wagon with her to transport the eggs which would probably weigh at least sixty pounds apiece but each would be worth more than their weight in gold to alchemists, wizards, and noblemen with more money than sense.

It was probably better to just stick to her journey but it wouldn’t hurt or delay her to move along the cliffs where the roc had landed. If she spotted an easy climb maybe she would go up and have a look around and see what was up there and if there was any danger she could just head out.
1343.title: A Roc!

13431.content:
It would be a break from the endless scenes of desert around her. The desert could be maddening with the seemingly endless nature of it. Seras stores of water were very good so she could afford a side trip especially if it could bring her a small fortune so she went to the edge of the cliffs and started the long climb.

The rocks were not as stable as she would like, Seras grabbed one and felt it start to give way causing her to scramble back and away. An avalanche of rocks and dirt poured out as if she had burst open a dam. Cautiously she returned to her journey, a little danger had never bothered her and she didn’t she was already close to the top. The rogue slipped to a spot where she could rest in a crack in the cliff and looked out from the darkness.

Her ride was still where she had tethered it behind enough large rocks to cover its presence. Scanning the land carefully for anyone who had taken notice of her or the noise she had made and she didn’t have long to wait as the giant bird took flight. It was a good sign her climb was not in vain as the beast shrieked a threatening cry as it took flight and searched for possible threats. A roc wouldn’t search for a simple rock slide unless it had a nest to protect. Seras pressed as deep into the darkness of the rock where she was hidden as she could and held her breath for a few precarious moments before it left to search the rest of the valley for possible intruders.

She fought the urge to rush to the top of the cliff, though it was very close, instead she took time to make sure that no noises were made that would make the predator return to find her. Moving carefully across the ground darting from hiding spot to another as she made her way to the nest always keeping her eyes and ears on the sky. Seras crawled up the nest to discover two eggs ready and waiting to be collected.

Seras moved over to the eggs and listened closely to them and heard the sounds of life inside the eggs that were larger than she was. It might be possible for her to move them out of the nests by rolling them but she had a much better idea to do but the question was did she have the time because it wouldn’t take the monstrous bird to check out the valley and return here.

The shriek of the roc sounded across the valley reminding her that time was limited. She could hide in the nest, it would give her the best chance to get the eggs when the predator left to hunt or in the rocks but depending on the angle the beast came in she would be spotted by the keen sight of the bird or she could try and rush her theft.
13431.title: Climb the cliff

135.content:
Seras decided to use an airship for the added speed and safety of travel. It also wouldn’t hurt to check out how the airships worked because she was thinking of investing in one. She wasn’t sure if she wanted to use it as a luxury travel vessel, smuggling, or some combination of the two. It wouldn’t be cheap but she had already made a fortune stealing from the people who would be her likely travel companions.

It wouldn’t do to have a renowned thief travel with nobles, so it would be smart for Seras to take on the noble guise of Lady Temperance Nelson. Forming the guise of a noble wasn’t as difficult as one might think as it only required one thing to do it properly, money. Learning etiquette was easy for someone who committed floor plans to memory. It wasn’t long before she held parties.

The parties had been the goal the whole time because though they cost a fortune to put on they were investments into future jobs. What better way to learn where the money from than from the nobles themselves? Nobles were some of the worst gossips or best in Seras’s mind because they were constantly discussing who had spent too much on some jewelry or art and who was struggling and had to sell off some their valuables. It made for easy work for a thief who knew how to listen, and now it was time to take on the guise for travel.

Scars vanished as Seras’s skin smoothed and became pale, and muscles that were hardened from years of use became delicate and graceful lines as the magic of her ring took effect. Her hair retained the lovely red hue she loved but the locks formed into elaborate curls of a proper noble. An ample bosom swelled into the chest that drew many a stare of lust from men. Changing into the proper dress took more time than Seras cared for and brought many curses from the struggling thief. Lady Nelson had replaced the infamous thief.

Obtaining the ticket for travel didn’t take long and within a few hours Seras and several other passengers were launched into the air. The sails fluttered as they caught the wind and the magic carried them swiftly across the sky far above the land, but even high in the sky there are many dangers.
135.title: Seek passage aboard an airship

1351.content:
Temperance was enjoying the warm after dinner wine and the warmth it brought to her body. The fading sun gave a gentle glow to the landscape below, it almost seemed peaceful but the thief knew the truth of the cruelties of the world below the flying ship. A loud explosion shook the airship drawing her attention but she couldn’t see anything outside her side of the ship to cause the sound. Thankfully, the ship didn’t seem to be crashing to the ground. She saw people gathered around the other side of the ship gasping in horror and she spied what was spreading the fear another ship was approaching with more than a few guns firing.

She moved as quickly as she could to her room but the formal dress wasn’t exactly designed for quick movement so she could get some weapons. Temperance didn’t want to jump ship considering all the valuables she had brought with her, she couldn’t take all of it with her but dealing with pirates who could afford a skyship was risky because of all the skill they had attained in getting that wealth.

The defenses of the ship wouldn’t be enough to hold off the attack of the pirates but it was at least a good sign they weren’t blasting the ship to bits. If she was lucky they would drop the passengers off and just take the goods and the ship. Worse case they take the passengers as prisoners as well for slaves or hostages.

A man stood at the end of the hallway and an evil looking grin formed on his face when he saw her. He approached slowly with his blade drawn, purposely stomping as he walked in an attempt to frighten her. The man looked like an easy target but he would likely have more allies aboard than she could handle so she would have to be careful about her choice. She didn’t like playing a weak woman but it might give her a chance for better treatment or to ambush the man.

Feinting fear Temperance pretended to faint and dropped to the floor keeping a single eyelid partially opened so she could watch the man. The pirate looked stunned at what had happened and paced back and forth debating what to do. He had likely wanted to scare her but was under orders not to hurt anyone so he was debating if he should leave his post or stick around.
1351.title: Sky Pirates

13511.content:
The fewer pirates the better she decided as she pulled one of her lethal hat pins while the pirate was turned in the other direction and waited for the man to come closer to check on her. He leaned over to grab the front of her dress, it looked like he intended to loosen the dress to allow her to breathe but his hands must have gotten lost because they were sure wandering over her breasts a great deal.

As his attention was elsewhere she slammed the needle into the eye socket and ended the life of one of her enemies. Only a small trickle of blood came from the wound as she removed the instrument of death and wiped it clean on the man’s clothing before leaving his corpse behind as she headed to her her room. Temperance moved her most precious items to hidden compartments and set some traps for any clumsy hands searching through things they shouldn’t be and applied a fresh coat of poison.

A smashing sound could be heard from her room and she suspected the search was going in earnest now and they would soon discover her. Temperance moved quickly to the door and peered into the hall and an open door at the end of the hall. She debated if she should continue the fight, the more of them she killed the greater the anger they would have the perpetrator but they were unlikely to suspect a lady of noble appearance like herself. Searching for a hidden enemy would make them paranoid and make bad decisions. The thief palmed a couple of throwing daggers and moved down the hallway listening carefully to try and figure out how many enemies she was dealing with.

She was happy to see that there were only two of them and they were focused on the looting of the room. Temperance suspected all of the success had made them sloppy or they had somehow lucked into a sky ship and she would take advantage of their lack of caution. The daggers flew true into the back of the necks of the pirates silencing them forever. Looking at the pile of treasure they had collected she was tempted to take a few items for herself but decided she needed to get away from all of the bodies piling up.

It was probably best to join the others as a prisoner so she could fade into the crowd unless she were to change to another form more able to move and strike at the pirates but sticking around was not a good idea because being found these bodies would result in a lot of questions that she didn’t want to answer. If she was quick she might have a chance to get some important gear that would help her later. Cautiously moving from the room she headed in the direction of her room and wondered if leaving the ship with some of the treasure or at least drop it off the ship for later pick up was an option. After all in chaos, there are opportunities.
13511.title: Suprise attack

135111.content:
She heard movement behind her and she couldn’t be sure who it was, it might have just been a passenger trying to flee the pirates but it was too risky to take a chance so she went around the corner and up the stairs. Temperance debated if it was better to hide or go join the others. At least with the others around, she would be treated as part of the group instead of being at the mercy of whatever whim the pirate might have that found her and with this body would draw whims from men that she didn’t want to experience with these filthy pirates.

Temperance exited the inside of the ship into the bright sunlight to a large crowd of the passengers and crew being forced together. A large man grabbed her arm and squeezed it painfully tight, she tempted to fight but knew they would suspect something was up if she killed one of the pirates so she let out a cry of pain and tried to look the part of a frightened helpless noblewoman but she made certain to memorize the face. She was a big fan of paying back those who hurt you especially when they did it without good reason, the sadistic grin on the man’s face told her that he was enjoying her suffering.

“Look what I caught here boys!” He twisted her arm and yanked her out for the group to see drawing some hoots and hollers from the pirates.

“Enough,” the Captain stepped forward with his blade drawn. “You are getting sloppy, don’t mess with our guests. Young lady, get with the others. The loot might be very good this day but we have taken some losses so I am going to asks our guests to dig deep if they want to make it out of this with their lives and their freedom. Some of you would surely sell very well on the slave market.”

His hand cupped one of Temperance’s breasts, lifting it and letting it drop with an appealing jiggle. She recognized the man as the Skeleton Man, a legendary pirate known for his thin body and long bony fingers. He had numerous close calls with death causing rumors that he was one of the undead, whatever the truth was he wore a skull mask. There was a temptation to use her hidden dagger to test the truth of the rumors but she started to take off her jewels to drop in the bag a pirate was bringing around.

“I think I need that dress, I have just the girl back in port who would love it,” the foul-smelling man grinned wickedly in front of her. She paused to see if Skeleton Man would put any halt to this, it was clear he was watching but he made no move to stop it. She dropped low to slide her blade out and did her best to hid it underfoot before she stripped.

It was easy to blush a bright crimson as she was left in her fancy lingerie in front of all of these leering eyes. No one appeared to notice the weapon, it was easy to see they had other things that their eyes were focused upon. Her swells and curves were enhanced by the undergarments and the hooting and hollering told her the pirates approved of her outfit. Temperance wished she had fought, she hated to be humiliated like this and to feel so powerless. If she got away from them she swore she would hunt them to ends of the earth.
135111.title: Join the others

choices: Take the blade and check out the ruin
1351111.content:
She saw they were maneuvering the ship to a small clearing in a high mountain valley, the air was cool and a sparkling lake was next to them as they landed. It appeared that they were about to be marooned here, her keen eyes had spotted a castle ruin at a distant end of the valley but she didn’t spot any signs of life.

“We are going to leave you fine people here unless some of you wish to join us,” the Skeleton Man leered in Temperance’s direction she responded with a very unladylike gesture. “I didn’t think so. I suggest you chalk this as a bad memory, a bump in the road because if you cause trouble for us we have ways of reaching you so be smart, chose life.”

They were ushered off of the ship onto the sandy beach next to the lake with some clothing dumped overboard for them and a couple crates of provisions were laid out for them as well. The first mate stopped at the gangplank as it was pulled aboard.

“We will inform people of your location so don’t worry about starving,” he waved to them as if they were friends departing each others company. “We have left you plenty of food for two weeks and you should be well on your way back to civilization by that time.”

Temperance had already started shifting through the clothing looking for her own or at least something that would fit her reasonably well, it looked like they had just thrown out a random assortment and most ladies didn’t have her figure. She finally found a nightdress that she could wear, at least her lingerie would no longer be visible.

The pirates were singing and cheering the loot they had scored but she made a vow to herself that she would see the man and his crew dead. She started to circle the lake to determine what she could as the others argued over who would be in charge. The petty squabble over such small things didn’t interest her. This valley was virtually untouched, from the air it had appeared that a rock slide had blocked the entrance to the land. Temperance had never heard of a castle being out here so it was likely long ago.

She had little to do with her time while they waited to be rescued so it was tempting to go check it out, but without any weapons or companions it wasn’t likely to be wise but going back to the squabbling of children seemed distasteful. She noticed something glinting in the lake, a short sword. It was certainly magical, not a mark on it. Temperance leaned in close without touching it. Scenes of battle were etched carefully into the blade. This weapon had been used against those who dwell within the Underdark it seemed, drow being slain marked part of it and the other had the hideous squid-faced mind flayers upon it being killed.
1351111.title: Marooned

135112.content:
Seras had always liked who she was, playing dress up was fun and all but she was most comfortable in her own skin. Dropping the guise of Temperance made her feel safer especially because she had about five dozen weapons on her body. She could hear the shouting as friends of the men she had killed discovered their bodies. It wouldn’t be right for them to make death’s journey alone she smiles as she slipped out into the hallway with two crossbows in hand. The deadly bolts flew into the shocked bodies of the pirates sending them writhing in death throes on the ground.

She slammed the door shut behind her and placed an explosive rune on the floor for the rush of people coming to find her. The thief ran to the window and slid it open and jumped into the empty sky towards the pirate ship. It was a nice breeze as she fell through the air sending a grappling hook out to grab hold of the nearly empty ship. Pirates liked to look at loot after a score and it was hard to have even a skeleton crew remain behind to guard a ship, she knew from experience.

The problem would come when she came across the second in command who was sure to be very dangerous. Captains liked to leave their most trusted person on board the ship who was usually very competent, usually with a blade. She climbed the rope with ease and snuck up behind the man guarding the ropes and slit his throat and dropped him overboard. Moving quickly was essential as she cut the boat free and raced for the helm of the ship. If she could steer the vessel away from the luxury vessel she would have a chance.

A large lizardman in leather armor hissed at her as she approached the wheel drawing two very large swords. Seras didn’t know if this was the second in command or not but it was certainly a hinderance to her plans to take the ship from the pirates. A loud explosion told her the people on the yacht had discovered her little surprise and it would be several minutes before they realized she was no longer aboard the ship so finishing this off quickly would help her a lot but she didn’t think the warrior was going to assist her with that.
135112.title: Transform

1351123.content:
Seras pretended to be frightened by the large lizardman who was used to people being afraid of him and confidently closed the distance to the small woman. The thief acted surprised and scared when she intentionally bumped into the railing at the edge of the ship, taking a long look at the ground far below but kept her enemy in her side vision as he charged her. At the last moment spun aside and throwing a small pellet into the monster’s face.

It exploded on contact blinding him and burned at his senses causing him to stumble into the railing. Using leverage she quickly used his weight against him sending the warrior tumbling from the ship on a collision course with the ground. Seras had never seen a lizard fly yet and this was no exception but she had bigger fish to fry.

She raced to the wheel and pulled away from the luxury sky ship as pirates moved to return to the vessel and stop her theft but they were too late. The only way they were getting the ship back is if they had someone on board still and as if on cue two men stepped out into the open to see what was going on. The first looked questioningly at the throwing knives sticking out of his chest before collapsing dead to the deck.

The second man looked panicked as he saw his crewmates fading into the distant sky and his only visible ally dead at his feet. Seras didn’t bother to leave the wheel and slowly reloaded her crossbow out of view of the man. Finally finding a bit of courage the man raced up the stairs and into a ready crossbow bolt leaving her only on a ship worth millions debating what to do next.
1351123.title: A trick

choices: Try to go after the yacht
13511231.content:
Seras was glad she had done some time as a pirate to be able to handle the ship but she wasn’t sure how much of the ship she would be able to command by herself. The thief could tell she wasn’t getting full speed out of the ship and it worried her because she could see the luxury ship was turning to follow her. She cursed that she didn’t have more time to experiment with controlling the ship but she wasn’t about to give up her prize without a fight far more costly to them than to her.

She set the ship heading north back to the Kingdom of Dar and lock it in place. Seras had made sure to do all of the jobs aboard the pirate ship so she was well aware of how to man the guns. The pirates had disabled the guns on the yacht during their attack so she was fighting an unarmed opponent at the moment because once they got aboard this ship they wouldn’t be exactly be welcoming to her for her actions.

“Get back here you bitch!” one of the pirates screamed at her but she had more pressing matters than rude language. Most of the guns were facing out the sides of the ship but she doubted they would oblige her and wait for her to turn broadside to shoot at them so she raced to the back of the vessel.

Two unloaded guns waited for her but she quickly remedied that and opened the hatches to reveal her target quickly closing the distance to her which made for a much easier target. The canon exploded releasing its deadly shot causing the pirates to drop to the ground but if they had been her target they would already be dead. The crack and splintering of wood soon told them of her real target. The mast held but barely so they quickly threw their ropes to catch hold of the ship and board it before she could fire again but she fired the second shot after a quick adjustment of aim and rushed to meet the potential boarders before seeing if her shot had hit the target.

Joy filled her heart as the rival vessel started sinking from the sky and screams of fear filled the air. The people aboard should be fine because it was a slow descent but she was more concerned about the men on the ropes attached to her ship. Pirates were climbing quickly up but her blade was more than able to slice their lifelines sending them tumbling much faster to the ground than the airship. With a smug smile, she waved to them as they fell to their deaths and allowed herself a moment to relax before deciding what to do next. The easy thing to do would be to sail far away from here with her profits but there was the potential for other rewards.
13511231.title: Things aren't over

135112313.content:
Greed was part of who Seras was and this was the opportunity to make the score of a lifetime and she would never forgive herself if she didn’t give it a chance. She set her airship to a slow circle back to the crash site as she raced to load a couple of the cannons. The rogue wanted them to think she was leaving the area so they would be busy. How many people were left and how many down below she could count on to assist her?

She took some time to rest her muscles and relax knowing she would need them soon enough. Her equipment and skills might allow her to take out two or three in a straight fight but more than that would be a great risk to herself. Of course, she had no intention of making this a fair fight, if you had a fair fight you did poor planning.

“Hi, you sons of bitches!” Seras screamed at the top of her lungs. She wanted them angry and making some mistakes but she was calm and at peace as she took careful aim at the largest group of them and fired. She didn’t bother to wait to see if her shot hit as she went to the next cannon. Her eyes surveyed the ground for targets as she ran to the next cannon. There was a group with some hostages but she dismissed them because she wanted them worrying about the hostages. The hostages would be a lot more grateful if she didn’t blow them to pieces.

Spotting the Captain she let loose another barrage upon him. The man brought up some sort of magical barrier but it wasn’t enough to block the full power of the blast and he went flying backward.
Another target needed to be picked quickly and it was her last shot so she had one last shot before she needed to reload.

The people below her were scattering and it was harder to get a group target. One group was racing at high speed for the cover of the woods but they didn’t look like important, their equipment was so shabby she could notice it at this distance. The Captain looked like he was slowly getting up and another shot was likely to finish him which would remove the top leader of the group.
135112313.title: Try to go after the yacht

choices: Go down to deal with them
1351123132.content:
The captain was shaking loose his disorientation but he didn’t realize his time was up as another blast from the cannon ended the threat he presented forever. Seras didn’t take the time to dwell on the victory as the pirate crew scattered. She debated how much time she would have but she was already throwing lines and ladder over the side and jumping the earth below.

It was a bluff, she was about the end of her endurance, the pirates could overtake her if they made a concerted effort, with the loss of their leader she hoped they wouldn’t realize what they were actually facing. The chaos she had created would make them suspect they were facing far more than one rogue.

“If you save me a fortune will be yours,” one of the bound captives called to her.

“Save yourselves,” Seras told the group as she started cutting people free. “One group loot the dead for weapons to cut others free and protect yourselves and as you get free to start tying off the ship so we can take off. Fire on any of the pirates who try to enter the clearing!”

The last call was another bluff because she could see a few eyes in the woods watching the frantic work of the people rushing to obey her commands. Seras reloaded her crossbow and relaxed knowing she would have to be quick in her climb up to the pirate ship so she needed to rest. Some of the people gave her foul looks as she rested but she easily ignored them. The rich quickly forgot those who saved them but she would make sure they paid if they were going to ride on her ships, no one was going to ride for free.

She could almost feel the confidence returning to the pirates as they saw they were going to be left in the wilderness with no supplies and no means of escape. The number of eyes watching the group work was growing and she couldn’t wait any longer to try getting out of here. Leaping up she starts to climb out up the ladder to the pirate’s ship. Seras wished she could have asked around about anyone who could help her with the ship but she didn’t dare because she wanted to convey an air of supreme confidence.

An arrow struck her arm causing her grip to loosen for a moment but she caught herself and continued the ascent. A roar below revealed a horde of pirates but she didn’t bother looking to see how things were transpiring. She raced to the wheel and pulled for it to fly uncertain of if all of the former passengers had gotten aboard but she figured she had saved those she could. The rogue moved away from the wheel to make sure she didn’t have any pests on board and saw a few had managed to grab hold of the side of the yacht below.
1351123132.title: The Captain

13511231321.content:
There was no point to go down to fight them except for foolish pride, she fired and sent them spiraling to the earth below, death or injury she didn’t care, all she wanted was a good long nap but she still felt she had work to do. Seras needed to find out if there was anyone who could pilot so she could take a break, she didn’t really want to land her prize out in wilds.

“Hello down there, are any of you familiar with piloting an airship,” the adrenaline was starting to fade from her body if she wasn’t careful she would soon collapse. She wrapped her wounds as she waited for a reply.

“I have some experience,” someone in a uniform called. It was likely the man was one of the crew but not the captain of the luxury vessel, had the captain trusted the person with a lesson?

“Let me up there I own one,” a second voice called, a heavyset man called his rich attire clearing suggesting someone with the potential to own an airship so why had he come on this one? It was possible he was just on a pleasure trip but her experience told her that most people who owned their own sky ship like to use it, showing off to anyone they could.

“The captain gave me some lesson,” a woman with a lot of ample cleavage showing called out, Seras couldn’t help but smile, she suspected just what sort of lessons the captain wanted to give her. Was it possible she had asked how to pilot an airship?

She had a choice to make, the rogue wished she didn’t feel so rushed but it was now or never.
13511231321.title: Pick them off

135112313212.content:
It was best to take all of the people who could possibly help her. She could play them off each other. There was a long way to go to where she wanted to sell the ship and even if they had rudimentary skills it would be enough. She dropped the ladder and held her crossbow at the ready.

“You three can come up but no one else,” the three scurried up at her command but a few others were cautiously edging out of the woods.

“Don’t leave us behind!” a man screamed. “We can make it worth your while!”

Seras was tempted but it would be getting greedy. These were rich and powerful people who would want things done their way once they felt they were in control again. They certainly wouldn’t want to go to a den of robbers and thieves. Perhaps there was a way she could make a profit off of them, a thought occurred to her. Time was running out. Her attacks had sent the pirates away but they would likely be back if the only way to escape the wilds remained in the area.

“Fine, I will drop you off at Port Elmus.” Seras told the group

“But we were heading to . . .” the passenger protested.

“If you have another destination in mind feel free to make other travel arrangements.”

Several others who were not so picky rushed forward. A cracking of branches in the bushes near the man was enough to change the mind of the man. He pushed his way through the crowd and she knew he would be trouble. It was tempting to make a slight squeeze of the trigger but she didn’t want to scare the others. They were already terrified. Any more and they might snap. Better a reluctant savior than a brutal dictator when you had no enforcers to back you up.

A pirate rushed from the woods and Seras gave him a crossbow bolt as a reward. It was a momentary stall. They needed to get moving. The thief moved over to the wheel to get them out of there.

“If any of you could start loading some crossbows and start firing that would be great,” she requested.

They stared at her blankly as if she was speaking a foreign language. Of they didn’t know how to use these simple weapons. The rich and their luxury servants were utterly useless when danger happens she thought.

“How dare you pull away when I have yet to get aboard!” the last of the passengers she had rescued crawled on the ship. “Don’t you know I am Count Lucian!?!”

“No I didn’t,” Seras stalked towards him pulling out her short sword. “I have had a really long day. So why don’t you save your attitude.”

She chopped the ropes to the ladder and heard the screams of pirates falling to their demise.
135112313212.title: Bring all of them up

1352.content:
Lady Nelson could travel with many trunks and cases without rousing any suspicion which was very nice when you had a lot of gear and contraband. Doing a little side business wouldn’t hurt as she was working with the King. She quickly had her stuff put in her rooms, so she could watch the comings and goings on the vessel for things she could exploit, and make sure the King hadn’t put any obvious tail on her. She was almost certain he didn’t know about the truth of this identity, but it never hurt to double check on these things.

Duke Sebastian came aboard and she couldn’t help but smile at the prospect. He was a notorious flirt who enjoyed flaunting his wealth by giving extravagant gifts to his love interests. Temperance decided she would be one of those ladies to take in some more wealth, and perhaps mix a lit business with pleasure as he was very handsome and the rumors said he was very skilled in the bedroom though that may just be him putting the word out there. Jewels and other expensive gifts bought a lot of goodwill and quiet lips if you weren’t amazing in arts of love.

“I don’t believe we have met,” Duke Sebastian made a direct path to her nearly running over a member of the crew who scurried out of the powerful man’s way.

“Lady Temperance Nelson,” she curtsied very low so he would have a spectacular view of her cleavage. “I am delighted to meet you in person Duke Sebastian of the house of Wilmington.”

“Please, call me Sebastian. I do hope you will have dinner with me tonight when the vessel takes flight.”

“It would be my pleasure, and call me Temperance. What takes you on this journey, business or pleasure?”

“Alas, I have business but with you aboard I feel I should have many pleasures on this journey. What brings a lady as lovely as yourself on this journey?”

“Pleasure, I have heard the baths do wonders for the skin.”

The Duke took hold of her hand and caressed the skin, “I can not imagine you have skin softer or more lovely than it already is.”

He gently pressed his lips to her hand giving it a kiss, and she responded with a blush and fanned herself. She had to admit he was the flirt she had hope for, now, she had to wait to see if the gifts would follow. This was certainly going to be an interesting journey.

“Until tonight,” Temperance gently pulled her hand away from him.

“Looking forward to it,” Sebastian responded with a look like a wolf with plump young sheep in its sight.

She couldn’t get too caught up in the romance when there was still a lot to see before they took off the ground. It didn’t look like there was any investigation into what the passengers brought on board the vessel but she strongly suspects some money had been given to the King’s inspectors for them to look the other way. Temperance really wanted to know how much was paid out to the inspectors but she suspected the Captain would have little interest in letting her know the amount. Perhaps during the trip, there would be a break into the offices of the Captain for someone to take a look at the books, but that would have to wait until later in the trip because she had plans tonight. She was careful in the rest of her tour of the boat to stay in public places because there were only so many times you could tell people you were lost. Everything looked good for an interesting and hopefully profitable journey.
1352.title: Flirting Noblemen

choices: Someone takes an interest in her
13522.content:
Temperance prepared for dinner like she was preparing for a job. It required planning and the proper equipment to do it right. She had seen many young thieves go in without a plan and end up failing, so she liked to think about her goals and what would help her achieve those goals. Her goal for the evening was to feel out the Duke and see if she was interested in pursuing things further. She selected a bright green formal gown that would allow dancing if she needed to and featured a great deal of cleavage. The Duke had been delighted in staring at her chest, he could barely lift his gaze from them as if they had a magnetic pull.

She started to selected jewelry for the evening and decided to avoid a necklace because her bright white skin would alert the absence to anyone and she needed to test to see if he was interested in giving her a gift. A new necklace to nestle in her cleavage was just the sort of thing the Duke would want to give her.

Having applied the makeup, the clothing, and accessories she needed to decide how she was going to approach him. Temperance decided it was best to let him take action and react to his approach. He seemed like a man who enjoyed to be in charge of the situation, so she would let him. She had heard from others that he was a strong belief in plying alcohol to women, so she would watch her intake of the intoxicating liquids so she would remain in charge of her decisions.

Finally, she was ready as she could be and put a heavy sway to her hips and started towards the dining room for an evening of fun. She was going to arrive early so she could people watch before her date arrived to see if there were any interesting people she should check out further.
13522.title: Dinner with the Duke

choices: See if she can wait to put it on
135222.content:
The waiter lingered at the table after he poured the wine staring at her chest. A slight upturn of a smile formed on Temperance’s face as she noticed the lust filled attention but decided against making a big deal about it as the man was rather young and probably didn’t realize he was doing it. Finally, the waiter broke his gaze away from the hypnotic nature of the pillow like mounds and turned bright red as he scurried away from the table. It was a nice feeling to command that attention from the young man but her target for tonight was far more mature and experience. There was a nice view of the ground below and the beautiful night sky to help with the romance.

“My, aren’t you looking lovely this evening,” the honey voice of Duke Sebastian were whispered into her ear before he sat across from her.

Temperance was pleased to see that he had brought a small box with him. She was a little surprised he hadn’t brought a bodyguard with him on board the airship. He was known to be very good with a rapier but powerful people like him often took extra protection with them on business.
