Her muscles still had some aches to them from all of the recent activity but she felt much better and ready to face what the Underdark had to offer.

Narra found the tracks of what had made the noise and saw they were boot prints of a single traveler. The person’s footsteps were light like those of an elf or a drow. She doubted one of her own people was down here so she would have to be careful about her choices. There was no way to tell if the dark elf was coming or going from their home so she decided to take another tunnel.

Her blades were ready for combat as she quietly moved down the tunnel with only glowing mushrooms to light her way. If she didn’t feel she was surrounded by enemies she might have even thought it was beautiful but the dull light just coated the world in an eerie glow. She came to a large open area with crystals shining the lights of the mushrooms turning the room nearly as bright as day. Three new tunnels lay in front of her and she took some time to examine them before making her choice.

Unfortunately, none of them was labeled with a surface world and a directional arrow so she would have to take a guess. The right tunnel looked like it had been dug out by something with powerful claws, if she could somehow guide it she could use it to make her way to the surface. In the middle the tunnel reeked of fungi and mold she had heard that sentient fungi lived in the Underdark, this tunnel might lead to them. On the left was a tunnel with a paved walkway which more than a little ominous in a place that was known for being wild and uncontrolled.

There were a couple of societies that she could make deals with down here but not many. She wasn’t sure it was worth the risk to check it out because there were many more societies that would make a permanent slave of her. She eyed the tunnel on the left closely but she didn’t see any markers to give a hint where the tunnel led.
1543333313211.title: Ignore the sound

15433333132111.content:
The elf moved slowly down the right tunnel to see if she could guide the creature towards the surface. There were serious dangers down the other two tunnels so she went down the right tunnel because she would at least not be heavily outnumbered. Narra could see this was only one creature and she already suspected who had crafted this tunnel.

Closer inspection of the tunnel revealed what she had thought were claw marks were signs of the Red Worm of Tarna. There were only a few of them left on the world because they were being hunted to extinction by the people of the world. They were crafted by the titans in the war against the gods to destroy the cities of the servants of the gods. The dwarves had an entire guild dedicated to finding and slaying the creatures.

It scared her to be moving down the trail of something that could level a city but they were simple animals that could be manipulated by those who understood animals since the loss of their masters and she didn’t know when this tunnel had been made. Narra knew this tunnel was fresher than she would like because hers were the only footsteps in the tunnel but it could have been days or months ago that the creature had crafted this, virtually no one was in a rush to chase the creatures.

Narra’s eyes widen as the tunnel exited into a large cavern where she could see a devastated city lay before her. As she looked over the rubble she realized it was a drow city and flashes of light revealed the battle was still going on. There was a temptation to help or at least take a closer look at the city but it would be dangerous. As she watched another building started tumbling to the ground to the ground, its crash echoing loudly through the cavern.

The drow were especially vulnerable because the creature was weak against those who studied nature which the drow were loath to do unless it involved poison. The magic of either a divine or an arcane source was practically useless and they were immune to poison that the drow often depended upon. The Guild of the Wurm Hunters knew the secrets of getting past the hide but most didn’t know how to damage the creatures. Hundreds or thousands were likely to die if she didn’t get involved and it wasn’t the drow that she was worried about. It might be a long time before she contacted the dwarves and the worm was likely to strike another city and it might not be the dark elves next time.

If she helped the dark elves she had heavy doubts of the gratitude she would get from them but it was hard to not think of all the lives that would be lost if she didn’t do anything. Maybe if she got out of the Underdark fast enough she could get the Guild hunting the monster hunted down before it destroyed another city.
15433333132111.title: Right tunnel

154333331321113.content:
Red Worms were a terrible threat that needed to be stopped no matter what she thought of the drow. Tarna was a more foul being than even the dark gods of the drow because she sought the complete unmaking of the world and all within it. Some people talked about it being so she could craft a new version of the world but Narra didn’t care for the reason the ancient being wanted to unmake the world. She would put a stop to Tarna and her servants every chance she got and pray the drow would let her go from her unmolested.

She had been taught how to attack the creatures years ago by a hunter because she knew herbs well. The elf took cover as she prepared to take the giant monster down or at least get it to flee from the area. The leaves need to be precisely portioned or it would be virtually useless against the creatures, normally these herbs were healing and rejuvenating which was likely why the drow didn’t know of them but against these worms, they were the deadliest of poisons.

Narra waited for the chance to strike with deadly accuracy. The hide was hard and the organs in the animal were placed at odd spots different from a normal worm so she watched for when the creature stretched out thinning the hide and let loose before it had finished. The shriek let loose as it struck home told her aim was true.

It turned to face the only threat to it, Narra and she continued to pelt the monster with shots every time she got an opportunity. The drow had pulled back and taken notice the creature had changed targets, but they had yet to fire upon their surface cousin. The ground shook beneath her as the great maw of the creature approached her hungry to devour the one who pained it. She could see the creature was slowing but it was still faster than the nimble ranger as she tried to escaped death.

The hunters had warned her death was likely when facing it alone because no footstep was soft enough that it wouldn’t be noticed by the creature and there was no barrier that would stop it as it could shatter even the hardest stone in time. She was determined to give a good account of herself if this was to be her last day on this earth.

Her quiver was quickly running out of arrows doused with the poison as it drew within striking distance. There was some satisfaction in the fact she felt certain it would not be long for this world. Blood and other precious fluids had started to burst from the body of the Red Worm but she was still likely to be crushed by the death throes as she achieved victory. It started to lift high into the air but it was suddenly caught.

Powerful spider webs from driders and drows pulled it safely away from her. The drow eyed her cautiously.

“Thank you,” a woman of noble bearing stepped forward. “Come with us so we can show you our gratitude.”

The gratitude of the dark elves was something to be very wary of. There could be truth to the words but they could also be seeking for more from her and any reward she was likely to get was almost certain to come with a heavy price attached to it or they could just be planning to betray her to either enslave or kill her as some sort of sick sport. There was also a danger in not accepting the gratitude because it could be seen as an insult.
154333331321113.title: Help fight the worm

15433333133.content:
Narra eyed the lamps and suddenly got an idea, her shots struck them spreading oil and fire across the hall. The cultists backed off for a moment but she was still running out of time is she couldn’t catch the rest of the place on fire but the floor of the inn was made of wood instead of the stone walls done here.

The elf reached out to the nature spirits in a way that she rarely did and call forth fire. It was a minor spell to allow the producing of a fire usually to form a campfire but she asked for more this time as the fire spirit started to glow with life in her hands. She released it on the ceiling and called for it to burn as much as it could. The cultists were starting to consider jumping past the flames but the fire was taking hold in front of them.

Sweat poured down her body from the heat from the fire was growing but she had to be the cultists wouldn’t get past. She pulled the last two arrows from her quiver and hit a couple as they tried to make their way through. Narra hated being out of arrows but at least she still had her blades. The elf backed slowly to the exit and went out the secret door.

Cries of panic were starting to be raised in the inn as people discovered the growing fire. The chaos might allow her to get away unnoticed which she wanted because she didn’t know who she could trust. The others were nowhere that she could see and she hoped they had managed to escape because she was sure to be seen as an outsider if someone located her.

It felt good to get outside again to the ranger as she slipped under the cover of some bushes to wait for the chance to go over the wall again. Guards were turning their attention to the inn as cries for help were going out and lights went on from guests awakening to the chaos. Her careful gaze searched for the princess but she saw no sign of her and she worried she was captured again. She hated the wait as men and women rushed past her but a chance would come in time but was it better to wait and listen or try to find the trail of the Princess? There was no way to be certain and she would just have to gamble that she was making the right choices.
15433333133.title: Another Option

choices: Ela Druid of the Rosy Circle
Har Former slave of the Sorcery Queen
155.content: Threats vary so various heros rise to the occasion. Plus what author doesn't love creating new characters?
155.title: Another hero of the Realm

choices: you to find my son Lucian."
you to destroy the church of fiery light."
1551.content:
The human King of the neighboring kingdom of Dar had invited the vampire ruler of lands of Narwick to his lands for assistance and curiosity drove Elliot to investigate the strange request. Centuries could cause even the most powerful vampires to succumb to stagnation that ended in death by a growing arrogance or suicide by the loss of the value of existence, so when something struck the interest of the ancient vampire Elliot he pursued it, and prey seeking help from its predator was certainly interesting.

King Emeril had his hall lined with clerics and monster hunters ready to attack if the vampire lord made an assault on the ruler of these lands, but the King felt a shiver flow down his spine as he saw the slayer of who knew how many men over the centuries walk the stone floor towards him. It would be foolish not to fear some such a dangerous creature no matter how human it seemed at times.

Elliot for his part was enjoying himself as the fear of the humans washed over his senses awakening his hunger but he contained it because the danger was very real and the risk wasn't worth the reward, not until he found out what the human wanted at least. He moved slowly towards the King until he felt the guards on the verge of attack and halted with a grin on his face. Danger was fun to court at least a little bit.

"What desire may I fill most high and powerful ruler of the land of Dar?" Elliot asked as he bowed to the King.

King Emeril paused a moment before answering the vampire, "I want . . ."
1551.title: Elliot Vampire Lord

choices: Lucian shows up asking for an audience
15511.content:
“I want you to find my son Lucian. I believe that he resides somewhere in or near your lands. You returning him to me would help solidify our relations along with a hefty gold reward to go with it.” King Emeril said eyeing the vampire lord for any reaction.

Elliott kept a stoic face weighing if this interested him at all. King Emeril cared only for himself and everyone else a tool to be used and disposed of when done. Elliott decided to probe, “Has your son been kidnapped by some sinister force that I should be prepared to face?”

The King cautiously said, “I only have limited knowledge of his whereabouts. Of course, I encourage you take all due caution. I would offer you aide but I do not wish to insult your capability. I fear that dark force lay behind this.”

Elliott smiled inwardly knowing the King knew more than he said. Perhaps the son turned traitor and began a rebellion against his father. Or Emeril crossed someone now sneaking revenge. Elliott disliked the idea of someone using his land for purposes other than the vampires. He decided he would investigate the matter further in his own lands. The King no doubt wished Elliott to solve his problem without risking a costly war with Elliott’s land of Narwick. King Emeril could ill afford such a war with the powerful wizard Dreze breathing down his neck. For now, Elliott chose to accede to the request but with a proviso say, “I thank you for the compliment but I cannot guarantee your son’s safe return without knowing more. I do not wish to take this mission and risk our lands’ peace. If you assure me no consequences for failure I will take this task.”

King Emeril quickly responded, “It would grieve me greatly to lose Lucian but I know I can’t task you with perfection. Do your best and our peace will be strengthened.”

With that Elliott turned and made his way out of the great hall. He shifted into a swarm of bats taking flight to home. Upon reaching the castle the bats flew through a window into the throne room gathering together to retake Elliott’s form. He thought about what to do next…
15511.title: you to find my son Lucian."

choices: Turn Lucian over to see what his father does
A fun idea comes to Elliott
155113.content:
Elliott received a surprise upon sitting on his cold carved stone throne. A servant informed him that Lucian wished to have an audience with the vampire lord. Elliott allowed himself a smile at how easy a task this might be. He nodded assent to the servant to invite the young man in. Elliott imagined he would find an interesting story to be presented to himself.

A handsome young man entered the room in formal wear. The air of confidence as if he ruled the hall he stood in. He said, "I am Lucian formerly of the kingdom of Dar and I hope to be again with your aide. I come to you under flag of truce that I might parley with you. My father's tyrannical rule imperils my beloved homeland as we speak. If any try to question his mistakes they are cast out or killed sometimes worse fates await them. Even now he sends agents after me to eliminate me as a threat to his rule. With your years of experience and power we should have no trouble toppling my father’s government.”

Elliott thought about the prospect for a minute. King Emeril could only be relied on to seek his own best interests. To openly go against him unwise with his great resources but a covert effort might be worthwhile. An agent that could not be traced to him. Still Lucian probably was as trustworthy as his father. A fair-weather ally most likely. What would he gain moving against either? The most fun would be to play along.
155113.title: Lucian shows up asking for an audience

choices: refuse and try to walk away
15512.content:
you to destroy the church of fiery light. The head abbot does not see the importance of paying respect to the kingdom that gives it protection. All the other churches pay this small tithe but he adamantly refuses. There are those who would frown upon me taking justifiable actions against the church directly, so I looked for creative solutions. That is where you come in. Let us call a truce between us. I will provide you with maps and information on key individuals. If something happens to them my knights will not actively pursue the issue. Long has the church been an active enemy of yours and your kind. What do you say? I give you safe conduct either way."

The ancient vampire considered his options before him. The church while an enemy posed no active threat to him. Elliott cared little for the rest of his kind seeing them as tools for his own amusement. It could be fun taking down the church and turning those most fiercely against undead into what they hated. If he turned the King the offer of safe conduct might disappear quickly. He did not trust King Emeril who betrayed a good church so completely.
15512.title: you to destroy the church of fiery light."

155121.content:
"Your offer amuses me. I accept it and will begin after a little planning. One must not rush into these things." Elliott spoke with confidence. He figured with the King's men not pursuing him or his minions he could get away with murder... literally. He snickered to himself this would be fun and interesting. Who should he pondered as he waited for the king's response.

The King smiled pleased at the answer he said, "Excellent my men will remain explicitly ignorant of any of your actions. I think this will be a profitable operation for the both of us. You may go in peace now."

Elliott gave a grin and bowed to the King and smoothly twirled around and strode out with confidence. Elliott kept his senses sharp just in case the King changed his mind. As soon as he left the building stole himself into the shadows so that no one could follow. He shifted into a swarm of bats flittering to the wilderness and shifting back when he found a cave to enter.

Elliott decided that he should choose who to go after first. The church of fiery light holds my great champions. Should he strike against Alana the wandering paladin who responds to any call of aid for the church? Or maybe Nester the firebrand a cleric whose church was a training ground for fighters of the undead. Of course there were others. Who should he chose?
155121.title: Accept the King's offer

choices: The next evening a bat returns
Elliott goes to an old ally while he waits for a bat to return
Elliott goes over some of King Emeril's greatest allies
1551211.content:
Alana made the best choice as she normally had little support. She went by the strength of her many abilities. She didn’t want to drain the strength of the church for her sake. That mistake would cost her dearly. Allies often won you the day and Elliott would show her by putting his to good use. Alana may soon find herself on his side whether she wants to or not.

Elliott called to the bats in the cave that they may serve him. When the bats became entranced by his will he imprinted upon their minds the image of Alana and commanded them to search for her. When they found them he would get her to a location of his choosing. As the bats flew past him in a hurry to execute his will. Elliott sank into the earth to rest until one them returned.

Elliott planned to lure Alana to a remote location where she would have no support and little chance of getting help in time. He would turn her into one of his servants because why waste such talent. The only decision would be what to transform her into? Vampire bride seemed obvious with her beauty and intelligence. He never liked stupidity in a consort. A werewolf might be nice as she struggled against primal urges with her misguided morals. So many pleasurable things he could do to her.

Elliott let his forces dwindle with boredom that centuries of time gave him. Now he began to ponder once again growing his monstrous forces. He hardly trusted King Emeril to leave him alone after the church of fiery light got destroyed. He would need to have powerful forces at him command again to protect himself from the king’s treachery. Perhaps reaching out to old allies to help him might be a good idea. As well as taking out some of the King’s own elite people.
1551211.title: go after Alana

choices: find and aid the monster Alana sought
another idea he came up with
15512111.content:
As the day passed into the next evening Elliott's strength rejuvenated from his encounter with King Emeril. Elliott figured that the king had runes to sap his energy in case he got out of control. King Emeril knew how to prepare against Elliott that made him dangerous. Few could make such runes and Elliott would make time to find out and deal with them suitably. Before he pondered it too long a bat returned from its journey.

Elliott looked into the bat's mind following the path it took to where it saw Alana. Picturing it in his head he figured she was encamped in the hills near the small town of Oakville. A small community of little note other than its usefulness as a trap. He could draw her in and make her hesitate with the innocent lives at stake. Another idea occurred to him, he might aid the creature or creatures that the paladin sought and make a new ally. Together the town might be a nice place to build a base in with forces of the king to bother him.

With these thoughts on his mind he shifted his form into a cloud of bats. He flew as a swirl of fluttering bats out the cave entrance. Hours passed as the moon drew high by the time Elliott reached the forested hills outside of Oakville. He gathered himself up and retook human form. He decided to...
15512111.title: The next evening a bat returns

choices: a humanoid robbed the man and slew him
155121112.content:
Elliott liked the idea of making a random ally. He enjoyed the unknown aspect of it. Would the creature welcome his aid or spurn it. Could he turn a temporary alliance into a prolonged one against the Church of fiery light. The cloud of bats that he flew as curved itself in a circular path around the town of Oakville. A survey of the forests around it might give indication of where Alana searched or the monster laired itself. Elliott suspected the monster might be a nomadic type if Alana hadn't located it yet.

At last the scent of blood called to him. He followed the promising lead. Gathering all the bats together he took again his human form. He quietly landed and moved silently to the delicious smell. Elliott came upon a small path with a mound of dirt a few away from the small foot path. Elliott felt the blessing on the grave. He smelled the fresh blood on the grave realizing it was a body only a few hours old. Elliott muttered the words to unhallow the ground before him that he might examine the body closer. The dark energy flowed through him and corrupted the grave's protection.

His hands grew claws and he leapt at the mound before him pawing away the dirt. Elliott slowed and more carefully removed the dirt as he got closer to the body. He examined the wounds and decided...
155121112.title: find and aid the monster Alana sought

1551211121.content:
Claw and bite marked the body. Elliott recognized the deep tearing bites of sharp canine teeth, too large for a common wolf or dog. A dire wolf perhaps but with Alana on the hunt she would easily catch such a pedestrian creature. No, more likely to be a werewolf. Often hard to detect with their ability to shift forms and only rarely striking. The question Elliott now had was if this beast were a true born or an infected one. Both came with pros and cons. A true born came with the ability to regulate their changes but often belonged to families that might be difficult to control. An infected would be easier to manage but they could be a goodly person in human form. The bestial urges got the better of them most of the time.

It didn’t matter either way he would bend this creature to his will. He stood up and began to track the werewolf with his enhanced senses. It would still be close by from the freshness of the kill. He left the body exposed hoping that Alana might come along following the trail. Elliott wanted a clear sign for her to follow. He ran silently as a gentle breeze through the shadowy forest. The trail led to a stone cave with a fetid smell to it.
1551211121.title: A werewolf prowled the forests

15512111213.content:
Elliott soon caught sight of a grey warhorse loosely tied to a tree. He silently cursed his luck the paladin beat him to the werewolf inside. He crept to the entrance for sounds of battle. The trudge of armored footsteps approaching the entrance announced Alana as the victor.

Her preparation failed to take Elliot into account. He climbed the mouth of the cave that he might strike upon her exit. His fangs grew in anticipation of the coming fight. Alana walked out in damaged armor but no physical wounds. She longed for the open fresh air away for the foul odor. She left the werewolf inside caring little for accolades the town might heap on her. The villagers renewed safety the only one that she sought. A heavy weight fell upon her crashing her into the hard earth. A hand reach in ripping off her helm.

An intelligent foe got the drop on her but they would not best her. She pulled a blessed dagger out stabbing into the cold hand of the enemy now pulling at her chain cowl. The flesh seared at the penetration. Alana now knew she faced a creature of evil. The creature pulled the dagger from itself tossing it aside. She use its distraction to right herself sending her assailant to the ground. Swinging around as she unsheathed her sword. The light of the moon revealing a vampire its fangs bared. She summoned her divine strength in an attempt to turn the creature. Turning could destroy or keep at bay undead.

Elliott felt the turning attempt but sloughed it off. It would take someone of significantly greater divine might to succeed against him. He tread the ground around her in a circling in attempt to spot a flaw in her stance. His regenerated the lost flesh from her desperate strike. She matched his movement assessing him as well. Elliott pulled his sword lunging in a brutal strike. She parried his blade sidestepping him realizing his strength outmatched her own. Alana trusted in her skill and divine protection to see her through this fight. Elliott trusted in his own skill and powers to win the fight.
15512111213.title: Alana is a step ahead

choices: Elliott turns Alana into a vampire
Elliott takes her home for a special transformation
155121112131.content:
Elliott's centuries of experience combined with his incredible stamina proving a difficult combination for the paladin. As the fight became protracted the Alana began to collect wounds. Though Elliott suffered increased damage from her holy weapon he regenerated. Alana felt the sweat dripping down her face burning her eyes. She pushed on despite the pain but she started to doubt her ability to win. Alana regretted only her failure to triumph today. She remained with her place in the afterlife secure.

Elliott smiled at the sight of the woman fighting to keep up with him. She breathing grew heavy as Elliott decided to forego finesse. He slashed at her over and over leaving her blocking with her remaining strength. Elliott dropped sword seizing her hands pulling them apart causing her to drop her sword. Throwing her in the air with an audible thud as she hit the ground. Laughing at his struggling opponent saying, "Now is where the real fun begins."

Alana scowled responding, "You may kill me but eventually the church of fiery light will end your evil." She grabbed another dagger throwing it at Elliott who easily batted it away. He leapt atop her pushing off the cowl exposing her neck.

Elliott commented, "Oh, killing you is far from my mind. You will be a useful tool in ousting your comrades." His teeth pierced her neck draining blood until Alana passed out a tear streaming down her cheek. Elliott remaining wounds healed quickly with the infusion of her blood.
155121112131.title: Elliott prevails

1551211121311.content:
Alana awoke with an unfamiliar thirst. She sat up in an ornate wooden coffin pushing open the lid. Climbing out onto the cool stone floor she saw no windows in the chamber. No light illuminated the room but her eyes saw clearly in the darkness. Her mind struggled to remember what happened at the end of the fight. Looking down to see that she no longer wore her armor. Instead a white bridal gown hugged her curves.

Elliott’s voice called to Alana, “I see that you are an early riser such is youth. I recall my turning well even with the passing centuries. I respect your battle prowess so I have taken you as my bride. You are now bound to me. I can do with you as I see fit. You will aid me in undoing your order.” Elliott smiled at Alana knowing the power he now held over her.

“I will not serve you monster. Even if I am a vampire I will destroy you!” Alana yelled lunging at Elliott. Her new fangs elongated with her anger. Her strike stopped short of contact. Struggling with her entire will she couldn’t bring herself to hit him.

Watching Alana struggling Elliott laughingly said, “Perhaps I should explain your situation a bit more clearly. You cannot willfully hurt me and you are mine to command. When I give a command you are compelled to obey. The thirst that you feel is for blood. As I said I remember my turning and the thirst of first awakening. Come I have some bottled that you may partake of. Soon I will have you retrieve your own from a suitable victim.”
1551211121311.title: Elliott turns Alana into a vampire

15512111213111.content:
Alana struggled against her inner desires to seize the bottle and guzzle it down. The horror at the thought of betraying those she counted on as friends and allies struck her. She might be transformed into a monster but surely she hadn’t sunk so low. She felt mostly in control of herself save her unnatural hunger that still possessed much of her concentration to suppress. She faced the odious creature that put in such a position saying, “I care not what your plans are. I will resist you in any and all ways that are within my power.”

Elliott smiled at her bravado, “Then how fortunate for me that you will have so little say in what is to come. Now drink down the bottle you will need your strength for this evenings exercise.” As the words left his mouth Alana felt the strength of them. His words commanded her and against her will her trembling fingers obeyed. She poured the contents down her throat sating the desire in her stomach. Elliott again spoke, “Now follow me there is much that you need to learn.” He abruptly turned around and led her through the stoned halls out out into the night air. The moon hidden behind clouds kept the surroundings dark but not to her newly acquired night vision. Every leaf and blade of grass of the nearby forest stood out in clear detail.

“Just, what do you have to teach me? The lesson I am interested in is how to break your control over me.” Alana hissed at him. She felt the fangs in her mouth extend with her growing anger.

A condescending smile formed on Elliott’s face as an idea formed in his mind. Elliott spoke bemused, “I am afraid that I have been remiss by not introducing myself. I am Elliott your lord and master but I am not without a sense of fair play. If you are able to survive on your own for a week without coming to me for help or feeding off a human I will release you from my control. What say you?”

Alana thought about it for a minute before saying…
15512111213111.title: the idea horrifies her

15513.content:
Wards ignited on the exits trying to trap the elder vampire who prepared for combat. Even after all the centuries, humans could still surprise him on occasion especially when he let his arrogance at his own power put himself in danger. He had assumed that the King had some honor and would keep his word, he should have realized how little his fellow respected honor. Honor was like an inside joke for nobles that they let the little people believe were true.

The odds were against him for getting out of here but they were planning to capture him, most likely for his blood. Blood from an ancient vampire could keep a person young and strong forever as long as you could keep milking the source so he needed to plan for his escape after he was captured. Taking out a few key people would make things much easier.

King Emeril was a very tempting target but that was what told him not to target him. He was likely to have many protections so he shadow traveled behind the head priest of the land. The priest didn’t realize what had happened until he saw his head tumbling to the ground as the vampire’s blade severed the head. Elliot hated the Church of Dar and all of the members of it because they were pawns of the King. As they were distracted the vampire cut his way through them as he planned his next move.

He could see several of the Crimson Tigers but he couldn’t be sure who would be used to guard him and he didn’t see the Archmage but he did see the apprentice of the grand mage who looked terrified by the events occurring around him. The man was a bookworm with a talent for wards and rituals that required precision but quick battle magic was a skill he was lacking. Several of his deadly launched at the man who seemed stunned he had been hit and collapsed before he realized he had actually been killed.

Astra the Huntress’s whip wrapped around the neck of the vampire and started to drain him of escape. Elliot decided on a last act of defiance before he was taken to prison by this army of warriors. His gaze took hold of the Crimson Tiger’s mind and made a command to it as the clerics lashed bindings upon him. Astra pulled a dagger from its sheath and slammed it home into her cadet’s throat. Her niece stared, stunned by her Aunt slaying her, never seeing the control return to her beloved relative. The cries of pain from Astra drowned out the laughter of Elliot at the success of his paying back his old friend for this betrayal. She had promised him he would be free to leave after this meeting and she had believed her. He wondered if she thought the reward for the betrayal of someone who trusted her was worth killing her sister’s child.

It had been a dangerous move to anger her so much as he would soon be at her mercy as the spells and prayers brought him low but it had been worth it for the vampire. He had trusted few over the years because of past wrongs were done to him but Astra and he had been close from years of fighting side by side. He looked on the sobbing woman with blazing eyes and she hoped she knew that he wasn’t done with her. Revenge was a passion for many an immortal creature as it helped to pass the time and he was no exception. He would see her suffer more before his time on this world ended.
15513.title: you to be my slave."

155131.content:
Elliot reached far with his mind to get allies to start their work of freeing him from prison. It was painful calling out, the priests had done fine work in blocking him from contacting his more intelligent allies but the animals were easy, many had been feeding on his body for years and almost felt like a part of him. The people who were binding him were busy worrying about his terrifying strength and his fearsome monster allies but no one worried about the tiny creatures, the rats, and bats that could carry messages and other things to assist their dark master.

He couldn’t see the bat swarm that lurked outside but they were already seeking out the aid of his allies and even with his sensitive hearing he couldn’t hear the rats working their way to him. Even in this windowless room, they would manage to get to him. Elliot would destroy this Kingdom and take it for his own not because he wanted command of these lands but he wanted the king to see the consequences of his actions. The man would see his children lost or slain and Elliot ruling over his ancestral land before he took the man’s life.

Contemplating the conquering of these lands helped to pass the time as he waited. It was not long before he saw a small group of rats enter his cage. These were his leaders of his swarms, they had been serving him for decades and were more intelligent than many humans that he knew. Three swarms to start his work so he would be ready or even free by the time his armies arrived.

“Plague,” he petted a black rat. “You will help free me. Gather those who serve you and start chewing a hole in these walls.”

It scurried off to obey the command, such instant obedience and complete loyalty pleased him. Dawn was closing in on him and it would be an unpleasant slumber without the earth of his grave. They had removed the hidden pouch of the dirt he kept with him in case of emergency as well as most of his clothing. They had left him nearly naked in only a rag as underwear but they would pay especially the guard who had laughed at his plight.

“Isabelle,” a tiny white rat stepped forward. “Send part of your number to get my hidden stash of dirt where I hid it before I entered the castle and bring it to me and find out where the keys to my chains and the door are. See if it is possible to get them just before nightfall for me.

“Lothar,” a rat as gray as the stone of the floor lifted its head. “You are to start causing chaos in the castle, especially for the priests and clerics. Destroy their scrolls, taint their precious holy water, and hide their holy symbols. Do as much as you can in secret.”
155131.title: Call to Allies

1552.content:
Ela had always hated the name Rosy Circle because it sounded too sweet and girly for her taste. Many people had the misconception that they were gentle and weak and though they didn’t seek violence they could be violent and destructive as a hurricane. Those who harmed nature’s balance often found her fury was more of a match for her.

King Emeril had asked for the assistance from the Circle to deal with a group of trolls that had started to attack the lumber town of Evening Falls. Many druids would have laughed at the request but the town had always consulted with druids about responsible logging and replanting to allow them to flourish without losing the resource that had made their town prosperous. It was the duty of the druids to encourage others to become a partner with nature instead of an enemy of nature and helping Evening Falls would help a great deal.

The Grand Druid had requested Ela to assist the town because of her mastery of stealth strikes. Ela was invisible in the woods and her usage of druid magic for combat was deadly. It was unknown how many trolls or other threats there were, so having someone who could sneak in and take out whatever threat might exist was wonderful for the success of the mission.

Ela was thrilled at the chance for violence which was generally discouraged. Honestly, Ela had a blood thirst which many considered unhealthy, but her animal half was always looking for an opportunity to exercise its predatory instincts. The cat people were known for being great hunters and Ela was better than anyone and was thrilled at the chance to prove it.
1552.title: Ela Druid of the Rosy Circle

15522.content:
Ela decided to head straight to the forest because she had never been one for being around people. She felt awkward because of the staring and whispered comments which made her angry but in the forest she could commune with wildlife and nature. It helped to center her and make her calm while civilization always seemed to enrage her. The elders encouraged her to balance her duel nature but it was hard to do when there was little she wanted from her human half.

She drew on a little of her powers to help silence her movement through the tree tops with hardly enough of a pause to bend the branches much less break any of them. Many of her fellow druids marveled at the movement but it came so naturally to her it was hard to be proud of the ability, but she did enjoy the feeling of the breeze through her dark fur as she raced towards a target.

It didn’t take her long to spot a troll lumbering through the forest towards the town bent on attacking. The creatures were forces of destruction bent on killing things and eating them raw. They often latched onto more intelligent monsters because they didn’t have the knowledge to make tools or clothing. A single troll would be an easy kill but it might lead her to others or it could have been sent on a mission by an orc. It was wearing a simple loin cloth, which suggested it might be working for someone.

Her tail twitched with anticipation as Ela decided what to do next. Her body wanted the thrill of the kill but she needed to quell the urge if she was ever to become a master druid. All things, even trolls, had a part in the circle of life, but if that was true, where was her spot in the order of things. Surely there was room for a predatory cat person.
15522.title: Head straight for the woods

155223.content:
Ela decided to let the troll be on it’s way because the town could handle one troll if it came to that but it was unlikely the creature was on the warpath. It had been moving at a fast clip indicating it might be running from something, and whatever it was would be the real danger. Besides having it out of the sight meant she was less likely to be tempted to kill the creature. Anger filled her as she saw the destructive path the creature took through the woods. She might need to get back to the creature and teach it that it wasn’t nice to mess with Mother Nature, but as she entered deeper into the woods she saw something that horrified her more.

Something had torched a large portion of the forest leaving a wasteland behind. Ela wondered if she would need help with this because this looked far worse than a group of trolls damaging the land. She reached out with her powers to find out what was behind this crime. The animals shared there memories with her of the fear as the fire spread across the woods. She strained to see further back into their minds but it was difficult to see what had happened as their focus was on survival and not on the cause of the problem. It looked like she would need to go deeper into this wasteland to find the cause for this mess.

She eyed the ground and discovered the footsteps of troops in large numbers moving through the area. Her mind suspected an invasion force of humans from the look of the boot’s size and design. What were they up to and who were they attacking? These were not particularly rich lands and of no real strategic value as most kingdoms were far from this place. A group of monsters might gather in some force but not in these numbers. This was the forming of an army and an army didn’t form unless someone was planning to use them, usually for something very bad. She summoned a raven to take a message of warning back to her circle that something was wrong here.

Her next course of action needed to be decided upon carefully because there was danger here. She needed to get more information on what had occurred here. The suspicion was that a dragon was involved but there were darker things that frequently used fire. Ela shuddered at the thought of having to deal with the dark ones. If they were involved it would mean cultists who might be forming an army in secret up here, and that was a greater danger than she wanted to deal with alone. Her circle was powerful but she wasn’t sure they could defeat an army with dark ones. To gather information she could return to the lumber camp or follow the tracks, but another idea was to get assistance with this quest. It might be the best idea considering the number of enemies she might be facing.
155223.title: Back Track the Troll

1552231.content:
Ela moved towards the lumber camp hoping that they would know more but at least they would know the people in the area and be able to warn them. The sounds and smells of the forest being mutilated reached her ears and nose, she knew she had found them but took a moment to collect herself. Not everyone had the skills or abilities to survive off of what the forest provided them like she could, most humans needed shelter and fires to keep away the cold and cook their food. She wished they would keep their numbers in check so they didn’t have to keep destroying forests to craft farmland but the civilized people kept away the orcs, trolls, and giants who did far worse to the land than altering it.

She smiled when she saw they were planting saplings to replace the trees they had taken like the druids had asked them to when the group had come looking for a place to build a lumber camp. The working continued even as she appeared in front of the camp. A few took casual glances at her but they quickly turned back to the work at hand. A large human man stepped from the largest building and made a direct path for her. Two blades were strapped to his sides and he carried himself like someone who wasn’t a stranger to combat.

“What are you doing here druid!?!” the man yelled. “We paid your people for this land but there was nothing in our contract that said you get to hound us. Your people have been delaying my work for too long. I have men missing and workers are talking about leaving because of the actions of your people.”

Her quarterstaff whipped out to the back of the man’s knees dropping him to the ground before she flipped it around and placed it firmly on his throat,” My people have done nothing to you and you would be wise not use that tone with me! I am no gentle soul who will take such abuse for things I didn’t do, especially when I have come to assist you.”

The man smacked her staff aside and rolled back drawing both blades to a ready position. He didn’t like being humiliated in front of his men but she didn’t care. The voice of her elder reminded her that she should take a more diplomatic approach but her primal instincts called for blood over the insult.

“I have found the tracks of an army of men,” Ela took a step back trying to de-escalate the situation but secretly hoping he would try something she could show him were stupid. “Strange fires have occurred not far from here, fire that wasn’t natural, tell me what you know and I will be on my way to solve the problem. I only ask that you warn the others in the area because I am a stranger to this place.”

“My name is Kagar,” the man put away his blades. “If it wasn’t you, I would very much like to know who was involved and give them some payback for their actions. Do you have any suspects . .?”

“Ela, none that I would like to face in combat alone. A red dragon is a possibility but it is more likely one of the dark ones.”

“Dark ones, what are they?”
1552231.title: Go to the lumber camp

15522313.content:
“They are Planar Beings who come from other worlds to conquer ours,” Ela sniffed the air again to be certain of what she was telling the man. The air had been disturbed by something, not of this world, it could have been something summoned but she was suspected a portal had been opened for something to pass through, the start of an army.

She explained to the man that they would soon start to build a portal that would allow their armies to invade. They had tried before and been stopped on every occasion, only eternal vigilance would prevent something worse from happening. She would find the portal and prevent it from being built and slay all of them trying to build it, a simple plan.

“I need you to go warn your people and get word to my order of my worries,” she explained. “If you don’t hear from me in three days evacuate.”

“I am not unfamiliar with a blade,” Kagar lifted his ax. “You are likely to need some help out there.”

Ela shook her head, “I need you to warn the people and get them ready if I fail.”

He nodded and moved back to the lumber camp with the rest of the people to prepare and get word back to the druid circle. She had lied to him, she could have sent word back by an animal but these people were untested and she would be facing trained warriors. Strength and being able to swing an ax against an inanimate tree would only take you so far in a real battle.

She hoped she was wrong about what she was dealing with, they hadn’t been seen for over three hundred years but they had gone for long periods of time without showing up. The druid tried to call on her knowledge about them but there wasn’t much. They had explosive power that often robbed the world of much of the evidence of them. She wondered what had caused them to use their powers to destroy the forest, they often tried to hide their presence to build their gates which took a long time to build so the question was how long had they been here.

Traveling between planes left a stain for at least a month, the gods and the natural world didn’t care for people messing with the travel between worlds and marked them as outsiders. She could hear movement ahead of her and she went to pure stealth mode cover her movement in silence and blurred her image with another spell allowing her to get within striking range.

A wall had been erected to protect a clearing and from the trees, she could see a patrol wandering the grounds. They wore armor the like of which she had never seen before covered in symbols from alchemy and as she looked closer she realized something disturbing about the two guards, they weren’t living beings.
15522313.title: Planar Beings

1552233.content:
Gathering allies seemed like the best idea with a force of this size. There was a group of druids in the heart of the nearby forest, the only problem was they were very reclusive. She didn’t know if they would accept her, she hoped they would since she was a fellow lover of the natural world but they had been known to slay outsiders. Perhaps she could slay a couple of enemies to bring them as proof of her attentions. She moved quickly through the forest trailing a small band of scouts she had seen the tracks of.

Her nose caught the stench of orcs and her face wrinkled in distaste. She hated the foul creatures but they would serve nicely as a gift to druids of the Stone Garden Circle. The orcs threw bits of bone and half eaten pieces of flesh about them as they ate their meal. She could see the trees they had cut and torn down for their fire, most of which they likely wouldn’t use. Ela called on her power and transformed into a powerful dire tiger.

Hundreds of pounds of muscles and power were added to her small frame as her fur thickened. Bloodlust called as her jaws turned into instruments of bone crushing death. Flesh rending claws extended as she slowly stalked forward towards the four orcs gathered around the flames. She wanted to toy with them and give them the slow painful death they deserved but time was important and she would have plenty of other targets for her rage later.

The first orc would probably regret having taken his helmet off if he had known a dire tiger’s jaws were going to slam shut on his skull. Ela lifted her paw and slapped it across the back of another easily severing the spine of the orc leaving him helpless on the ground. She leaped towards a third orc as they tried to recover from the surprise attack but the weight of the giant creature sent the powerful orc to the ground knocking the breath from his lungs. Her teeth plunged in the soft flesh of the throat spraying the ground with blood.

She turned her attention to the final orc who had his blade ready but the fear was clear in his eyes. Blood dripped from her lips as she stalked towards the orc unafraid of the weapon. The movements of her enemy were clumsy and sloppy while she was fast and graceful. A slight groan of pain came from the orc on the ground as it tried to crawl towards the fire, probably thinking it might provide some protection. She could smell death overtaking the crawling form so she ignored it as the other orc took a wide swing.Orcs were three to four hundred pounds of muscle but that was but a fraction of the muscle and power of the dire tiger. She slapped the sword from the hand of the orc tearing the flesh of the hand with her claws. Ela lashed out with her paws she cut the orc to a bloody pile of dead orc meat.

It didn’t take long to collect a couple of the heads of the orcs in a sack to bring as an offering. Ela reached the road that served as the edge of their territory and saw the sharp thorn bushes that served as the markers for the edge of the grounds. She leaped over them into the trees with ease and made her way to the center of the forest. The feeling of the woods didn’t feel natural or right. It felt far darker and more dangerous than it should.
1552233.title: Gather allies

choices: Call out to the people of the village
15522331.content:
Ela moved quietly through the trees but she was nervous about the things she was seeing. She was seeing an army of dangerous and deadly plants. Someone had been cultivating blights that fed off of blood and carnivorous plants that feed on flesh. This was a preparation for war with someone and she didn’t like it. She had more of a thirst for blood than her fellow druids but even she saw this as madness.

Druids were supposed to keep a balance to the world, to hold nature sacred and prevent the defilement of the natural order. War was against all of their beliefs because of the destruction it caused. It perverted the good in the world and despoiled the world with the carnage it created. Death was part of the natural order of things but wholesale slaughter was not natural, it was the thing of “civilized” people and shouldn’t be part of a circle of druids.

She landed in a tree near the encampment of the druids and saw them busy at work. Ela saw them planting seedlings of another generation of killer plants. She suddenly noticed a blossom opening near her and she tried to leap out of the way as she recognized it. The stunning spores filled the area as she landed hard on the ground in her attempt to get away.

Her muscles fought her commands to obey as she tried to back away from the village of druids hoping they hadn’t noticed her. She didn’t trust them to let her leave here alive, she had to warn others about what was going on here and seek the wisdom of the elders of her circle of what they might be up to. Ela stumbled back into the woods taking a moment to rest behind a tree. It appeared no one was following her and she might be safe to head back the way she had come.

A vine whipped out wrapping around her legs and yanking her to the ground. She managed to cut herself loose with the claws on her feet and scrambled as best she could to get away but another set of vines struck at her tearing her clothing revealing generous amounts of cleavage. The young cat woman was being surrounded by plants that weren’t going to let her go free. There was a very real possibility that they would kill her or do worse to her.
15522331.title: Fall into a trap

155223311.content:
All of her life Ela had fought when challenged and she saw no reason to change now that she was fighting a forest of plants. She called on the primal predator inside of her and started to slash and tear through the dangerous enemies. The vines seemed to keep coming no matter how many she destroyed in her efforts.

She could feel her speed and attacks diminishing as the spores continued to work on her body attempting to paralyze her. Slowly she backed away from the attacks but fresh blossoms opened on her approach and blasted their deadly contents out upon her. In an attack of more rage than sense, she stomped on several of them and ground them into the dirt. Ela could only vaguely see the vines coming for her, it felt like she was going in slow motion, swinging at them through the mud. They started to wrap around her limbs.

There was so much more strength in her arms than these plants but what they lacked in strength they were making up for in number. More and more vines shot out and wrapped around her slowly pulling tighter on her form restricting her movement. What few shreds of clothing she had remaining on her body were torn off by the probing spins leaving her sweaty form naked. Her muscles finally gave up the struggle as she panted in exhaustion and waited for what was going to happen next.

“You fought well,” Ela lifted her head to see a woman of an Archdruid but she didn’t recognize the symbols of the order she belonged to. “You have put back our work for a long time to come but perhaps in time you can make it up to us.”

The woman opened the jar and covered her hand with some sort of foul smelling goo. Ela tried to scream plants sent out tendrils to wrap around her mouth silencing her, all she was able to do was give a nasty stare as the woman came closer. Her hand went down to the folds of Ela’s vagina and started to caress the goo into her victim. It felt cold at first but the heat started to form in her body.

Beast people were subject to heat but even she had never felt anything so intense before. She needed something to enter her. Her body writhed as she tried to bring her hand down to bring some relief but she was held firm. Sweat poured out of her body as she thought that she might go mad if she didn’t screw something soon.

The woman rubbed Ela’s belly causing her to moan, “You will make for a beautiful breeder. Let’s bring out your mate because you shouldn’t be kept apart from any longer because you have so many things to do.”

Vines released her onto the ground but she couldn’t find the fight within her body, there was only desire to see who her mate would be.
155223311.title: Fight

1552233113.content:
She was released by the tendrils and started to crawl towards the robed figure, Ela fought the urges if she could take out the robed figure perhaps she could put an end to this. The reserves of her will were draining from her quickly.

“Still have a bit of fight,” the robes swayed out of reach as she struck out in a pathetic attempt to harm her enemy. “Soon only breeding will be on your mind.”

A small pod rolled towards her and she knew the sinister plan. She was to become a Seed Mother, one of the deadly leftovers of the wars between the Titans and the gods. A spike shot out from the pod stabbing her in the heart. The pain was only momentary as it spent the load into its victim’s heart, her heart a load of fluids was soon coursing through her veins and the pod collapsed into ash.

Her heart felt like a sledgehammer in her chest, her entire body quaked with the change coming over her. Fur and hair fell from her body as green started to cover her freshly sun-kissed body. Her body swelled to a gigantic size especially her breasts which oozed a sickly sweet fluid form them. The belly she had made such efforts to keep trim and tight was gone as it grew full with the incubating of hundreds of seeds, each one a monstrous being incubating in her pregnant belly. Her toes broke and split into dozens of roots to suck nutrients from the ground. The transforming beast person’s jaws grew large with teeth as it snapped at the air.

No longer were there eyes on the head of Ela, they were no longer needed as other senses took over. What was once her tongue had become many different tendrils whipping about the sky in search of knowledge of the new Seed Queen’s surroundings. She searched the ideal ground, for enemies and most importantly food.

The laughter of the druid was loud at the victory, “Soon all of the lands shall belong to me and my enemy is going to give me the army to do it.”

The gloating was short lived as the tongues of the monster immobilized the druid and drew him inside to soaked in the acids of the stomach. Her children would have fresh food to grow them into the killers she would need them to be. The colleagues of this druid would soon join their companion in death and feed her growing army.

Ela called the other sentient plants in the area to obey her and they quickly worked to fulfill her desires. Others would try to stop her so she set them to the task of building a fortress for her of the wilderness. Soon she would have a kingdom of her own to invade the civilized lands from and bring all of them under the rule of nature once and for all. She was going to do more good for nature as a Seed Queen than she ever could as a druid.
1552233113.title: A plant

choices: Follow trail of last sighting of a child
1553.content:
Har walked with purpose towards the King’s throne room heedless of the stares he drew with his appearance. In his native lands common people would have hidden their gazes for the fear his kind inspired. Har preferred the stares because they came from curiosity, not fear and hate and to be honest he did look strange. He didn’t have any hair upon his body, and other than a pair of shorts he was devoid of clothing even in the coldest of weathers. His body was instead covered in arcane symbols etched into his flesh from the top of his head to the pads of his feet.

Most people thought the symbols were religious in nature but they from dark magic conjured by people willing to breed human like cattle and experiment on them with acknowledgement of the value of their humanity. Har might have cried at the pain they had inflicted upon him if his master hadn’t removed his eyes and placed light blue glowing orbs in the empty sockets, but that was the past and he now sought to ingratiate himself to the local ruler so he could build a home far from the madness that plagued his homelands.

“How may I serve you, your Majesty?” Har asked King Emeril with a bow, but habit forced him to not lower his eye from the potential threat. He could order his guards to attack with a glance or gesture and Har was prepared to act if he committed such a flawed decision.

“I have read on your kind before, spell scarred I believe you are called,” King Emeril waited for a nod of affirmation before continuing. “Several children have gone missing from the city with no ransom demands. I suspect they are being taken by through the sewer because it would explain the lack of witnesses. There is no proof but a group of Blood Moon warlocks was spotted near the city and it would explain the missing demands. You will be rewarded if you are successful in solving this problem. I leave you to determine how to best proceed in your quest.”

Har knew how he would proceed with his quest and with one last bow he was on his way.
1553.title: Har Former slave of the Sorcery Queen

15531.content:
Har moved through the sewers unsure of what he was looking for but knowing he would do his best to find it before anything could happen to the children. He had been in far worse places than these foul smelling tunnels. When he had served the evil Queen he had walked through tunnels lined with recently dead humans, killed because of the threat they posed to her, because they had insulted her, and sometimes because it amused her to kill for no reason besides it gave her pleasure. He was glad to have escaped her but he could still feel some attachment to her even after many years and many miles.

The spell scarred could never escape the noble they served because they were bound to them by blood magic from childhood and only the death of the one they served was a path to freedom, but it was the freedom of death because their lives were attached to the one they were bound to. He still remembered being a playmate to the Queen when she was a child. Her father had decided she needed guards even in the play room so he was chosen to be given the change. He wondered how many before him had been subjected to it because few survived the process and fewer still survived with their minds intact.

Several men hid in shadows ahead of him, waiting to ambush him, but the magical objects that had replaced his eyes allowed him to see through the shadows and even walls. He wondered if they were the people he was looking for or if they were simply criminals looking for easy prey. They would find a much more difficult target then what they had hoped for. Har wondered what he should do with the men. They might have the information he needed but their deaths would be more satisfying.
15531.title: Investigate Sewers

155311.content:
Har waited for the criminals to act against them in case they were homeless or workers in the sewer, but the flash of a blade told him he was right in his assessment of the situation. No threat was made to him as the blade was shoved to his belly and Har made no effort to avoid the attack. The blade shattered as it touched his chest leaving the first attacker stunned for a moment before his live was ended by a strike to his head from the “victim.”

The spell scarred continued dealing death to his attacker with a strike to the second man that blew his lungs leaving him to gasp for air that would never come. The final man tried to make a run for it but one of the tattoo’s on Har’s chest lit up the sewer in an eerie crimson glow and fire flew through the air enveloping the man in a deadly embrace that only ended when a pile of ash was all that remain of the human.

Searching the bodies gave him little of interest, only a few copper, and nothing to indicate an involvement in the taking of children. These were beings who would stand out in a crowd if they didn’t have magic which they didn’t. They had likely attacked him because they were desperate for money, but he had a mission to accomplish and he intended to be successful so he left the bodies to be cleaned up by the rats of the sewer. Har watched for a moment as the rat were already working on the feast the spell scarred had left for them.

After several hours of searching he came across a large hole in a sewer wall that reeked of magic. Something had used magic to craft the tunnel but was it those he sought or some magical beast taking food from the sewer?
155311.title: Kill them

choices: Search for the location of the Queen
1553113.content:
The spell scarred man looked closely at the hole and reached to pierce the enchantments discovering their nature. A crossbow bolt struck the warrior and he realized they were meant to conceal an enemy waiting in ambush. Five heavily armored warriors streamed from the tunnel attempting to surround Har. The power of lightning coursed through his body as he lashed out at one of the assassins in place to kill him. A screamed of pain escaped the man’s lips before death silenced him.

Long years of training had silenced the questions that would plague most men like who had planned this ambush. There would be time enough to discover that if he lived through this encounter which would be very unlikely if he wasn’t very careful. Escape was a possibility but he would much prefer to slay these people than to have to face them later when they had more men.

The men were slowed by armor and heavy weapons allowing Har to deliver blows of fearsome power into them with his strength enhanced by his powers. These warriors were strong and their armor was not giving way even with his great strength, so he would have to draw on the magic etched into his skin. Fire lit his fists and he struck the leader of the group sending the flames jetting into the warrior’s mask and down the throat burning away the lungs. Leaving the leader of the group dying as she tried to pull oxygen into her lungs and failed.

It hadn’t been hard to pick out the leader of the group with the subtle signals she had been giving the others. Seeing their leader die caused the others to hesitate for only a moment, and this was an indication they fear failure more than death. Rage filled him as he suspected who had sent them, and even as their blows struck hard against his body he barely felt their attacks. He had entered the black haze a condition he had long avoided.

He awoke along the empty armors of his enemies. He had devoured there spirits leaving nothing left of the flesh. The nightmares would start soon, when he slumbered this night the spirits of those he had slain would come to him, and for months to come. He had let his rage at the Queen finding him far from her lands allow him to use that dark power again. Was the King involved? He was the only one who Har had told where he was going, unless, a dark thought came to the mind of Har. If the Queen was close she could detect where her spell scarred was. He wasn’t sure if he wanted to run or stay and fight more.

Har knew he would need allies if he was to fight her, the one he feared the most in the world. He would be a fool if he thought otherwise. Why had she followed him all this way? The answer was obvious to him, she was insane.
1553113.title: Ambush!?!

15531133.content:
Har was scared of very few things but he was terrified of the Queen because he knew how cruel and vindictive she could be. She was a master of pain and even his training and powers wouldn’t save him from her. He had been designed to be her servant and she knew him better than he knew himself. Much of his powers would be completely useless against her and he suspected he couldn’t even harm her if he tried because the gods knew he had tried before on several occasions. She was always greatly amused by his failures.

He tried to tell himself that he had grown much stronger but he couldn’t be sure so he would have to select a companion or two to assist him with his quest. Har didn’t like depending on others but he would have to if he hoped to take down the monster who had haunted him all of his life. He had always worked alone so there was no one in particular that he could trust.

Mercenaries were always available to hire but they were only as trustworthy as long as you were the one with the most gold. Har had earned a lot of gold because his needs were few but the Queen had the fortunes of an entire nation to call upon. Still, you could generally trust in the reputation they had because people wouldn’t pay their prices if they hadn’t earned their worth.

He could contact the King about the threat and get help from his elite warriors. Each of them was powerful enough to help him but most of them had more than a few screws loose that could make them just as dangerous as an enemy. The Sorcery Queen of his homeland was certainly not someone you wanted to have in your kingdom so the King was likely to help.

Finally, he could go to the heroes guild to find someone to help. He would have to do it by posting a request with the guild and he would be assigned a random hero to assist in the quest. They would likely realize the danger of the assignment and give him someone good but he didn’t know how much time it would take and time was very important because the Queen was out of her element. She was far from the protections of her kingdom and eventually, she would flee back to it when her enemies started coming after her. This was her best chance to get her and he didn’t want to lose it. Perhaps he could ask for certain skills to help with the quest.

He exited the sewers and thought about the job he had on hand. It felt good to have the goal ahead of him and have a plan to take care of it. If he could slay the monster perhaps he could end the nightmares and try to live a normal life. He looked at himself in the glass of a shop and seeing all of the magical tattoos carved into his skin he decided normal may no longer be possible.
15531133.title: Seek allies

choices: Look into the Masters of the Blood Moon More
15532.content:
The Blood Moon sought greater power and looked for children who were gifted from all over the world and bound them to entities from the stars or beyond. The group was not known for being willing to share information but they were more than willing to share their powers with those who would pay their prices which often didn’t involve money. Most kingdoms banned them but there were always those looking for another weapon to get what they wanted so they flourished with unknown goals and motives.

Har wanted to know more about them and their magic for his own purposes so he chose to go after them. Secret groups often had secret knowledge especially arcane related ones and that was what he wanted most. He was willing to make a deal with them if they able to help him and worried him that he didn’t know how far he would go to get what he wanted. Under the command of the Sorcery Queen, he had committed murder on many occasions but he always told himself it was because of her, it wasn’t him. During his escape he had slain many and since that day still others had been added to his debts, at what point did he become as bad as the Queen? Would he let the Blood Moon keep the children if they could free him from his connection to his former master?

He could still feel the connection to her, she called to him as he slept and he could feel her searching for him. What scared him most was the fact that there was no anger to the searching, she wanted him but she was a twisted creature whose idea of love usually involved torture. His defiance intrigued her and she would break him trying to understand him.

Since the Blood Moon had left the city according to the sources of the King he would follow them. He was good at trailing magic users, it had been his duty. His powers allowed him to find and kill threats to the Queen. Magic users left a stain on the land that he could follow. The trail was stained dark that hinted at evil and foul actions and he saw attachments to something distant and alien to this world. Whatever the things were had great power, power even greater than the Queen of Sorcery could muster. It was frightening to touch the vibrations of it but it gave him hope that he would be free of his attachment.

What would he do when he was finally free? Could he live a normal life? The process to craft his powers and strength with embedded deeply into him. It was attached to his body, mind and even his spirit so that he could never be made to betray his master. Har wasn’t certain he would survive the process but death was preferable to the eternal servitude of her, the one he feared even more than the unknown dark entities the Blood Moon served.
15532.title: Check out the Warlocks

choices: Call on the power of the Queen
155323.content:
Warlocks could be predicted and Har decided to take the chance he was right about this group. The Blood Moon name suggested they were connected to the star entities which was good news and bad news. If he was right it was good because he could use the stars to determine where they would be but it was also bad if he was right because the star beings were alien creatures to this world who were trying to invade this reality.

Har had fought their kind before and he looked forward to meeting up with this group if they had made pacts with those alien beings. King Emeril had given him permission to kill those involved with the taking of the children and he had no intentions of taking them alive. It was never a good idea to take those with a star pact alive, there words and magic could warp the minds and bodies of those near them.

The star chart led him to the spot the stars marked for the best sacrifice this night as his steed panted in exhaustion. If they were traveling as a group they would be moving slow, much slower than a magically enhanced animal. He eyed the location unhappily as he saw the large stones set to honor long forgotten gods that had been perverted to worship the alien beings from beyond this world. Their true name was unknown but the Queen had called them the Kalamar.

His eyes hurt as he stretched their power far beyond what they had been crafted for. He had learned the trick but found it left him blind for several minutes afterward but he had his other senses to compensate. The guess he had made had proven right as he saw a large gathering bearing the mark of the Blood Moon. It was many more than he had been told about and it wasn’t just arcane magic users. This had the look of a grand meeting and as his gaze reached into the covered tents and saw many bound children as well as some adults. They were up to something big that would need to be stopped.

Most likely they were trying to pull one of their masters through from the other side. He had seen one of the elder things before, he had helped the Queen put it down but it had taken months to fully recover. He had used the chance to get away from her. The question was what was he going to do now.
155323.title: Try to cut them off

1553233.content:
Har couldn’t let them be sacrificed so he reached out to the tattoo carved into the flesh above his heart. He had blocked it off long ago and considered having it cut from his body so he would never be tempted to use it again. It called upon his connection to the Queen, he was not afraid she would deny him access to her magical powers, no, she would not do that he felt certain. She would come for him leaving him with the choices of running, fight, or surrender because hiding would no longer be an option.

“I call upon your power my Queen to aid my cause which will please you,” he called out the full activation to the heavens.

The effect was immediate as his strength and power made him a demigod. All of his tattoos ignited in numerous brightly lit patterns shocking the warlocks having the effect to stop their ritual in an instant to explore who would dare bother them, they didn’t have long to find out.

Numerous golden bolts of energy shot through the air at the group sending them rushing to avoid the attack. He didn’t wait to see if he had succeeded in taking any of them down as he sped forward at inhuman speeds striking death blows to two of the number before the others could react.

A sizzling green blast of energy splashed over Har’s body doing no more than washing over his like a warm bath. Several of the others were preparing there own warm welcome so the warrior grabbed one of the large ritual boulders and flung it at the leader. Har took quick advantage of the stunning moment as the head was taken from the stake to strike at the body.

Another tattoo ignited as a pair of electrical whips came to life in his hands, it was only a small bit of pain compared to what they planned for the children but it made him feel better. Bodies shook and convulsed into death, it wasn’t taking long for them to realize they were outmatched as he seemed to take no notice of their attempts to harm him. Poison, fire, and acid were flung at him but none of it harmed him, he didn’t even seem to take notice of the flashes of magic around him.

“You shall not finish your dark work this night!” he smashed the last of the thirteen who had tried to flee before the glow around him faded. He had forgotten how intoxicating the power could be, just after he shut it down he wanted to call upon it again. The Queen would be after him soon but he still had work to do. “Alright, children we have to get you home.”

He winced as they drew back from the approach of what they saw as a monster. It took him a half hour to convince them to at least follow him, a time he wasn’t sure he could spare.
1553233.title: Call on the power of the Queen

15532333.content:
“Come home,” the voice echoed through his head as he led the children home. “all is forgiven.”

“I only called on your power to save some children,” why was he bothering to explain. She had never listened to him before why would she start now. “I will break the connection as soon as I have dropped them off.”

“Oh, you want to play a game of hide and go seek. This is going to be so much fun!”

“You have your kingdom to rule! There is no way you can leave!”

“I am the Queen goddess of my lands, I can do as I please my darling. We have been apart for far too long. You had your holiday, it is time for you to return to my service.”

It would be bad enough to have her hunters after him but she was a whirlwind of disaster. The power of the gods with the whims of a child. He tried to quicken his pace but the children moved about a step faster than snails. His mind raced for a solution on his slow journey.

“You could start a war if you come here,” reason, the last act of a desperate man.

Queen Sephira snorted, “It would hardly be a war. A mild sneeze by me and Dar would be destroyed. But don’t worry about your precious kingdom. I might harm you in destroying it and I would never harm you, darling.”

There was doubt she would keep the promise but it was better than nothing. Har had sworn to himself he was done with servitude to her. Maybe if he took things to her level he could be done with her forever.
15532333.title: Conversation with the Queen

155323333.content:
Queen Sephira was so pleased to have Har contact her. She loved him and the fact he had contacted her was proof he loved her. This was just some game to prove she loved him and she intended to win as she always did. There had been a part of her that had started to fear he loved normal women.

A surge of anger flashed over her when she saw the milky skin of a slave. A splash of the boiling water on the woman who shrieked in pain scrambling to get away from further abuse. Har’s eyes would not find the scarred woman so beautiful anymore.

The unnatural golden color of her skin started to glow intensely as her powers flared. Every other generation her family would sleep with the sun god to maintain their power. It left them with a few unnatural traits that made them abhorrent to most beings. Her mother had often told her it was worth the price but Sephira was not so certain.

She had often read stories of love and family from foreign lands. It was something she feared she would never have until she met Har. All of the other Zelteir feared her. But he stood up to her and tried to stop her when she raged against those who he felt didn’t deserve it.

It was a great risk. Zelteir were the will of their Queen. No matter how powerful a Queen couldn’t be more than one place at a time but with their Zelteir they could. These minions could be infused with power and enforce the will of their Queen. To enforce loyalty they could be burned from within by the power of their Mistress. Even Har who had hidden from her could be melted into nothing but ash if she had wanted.

“Gather my things,” a servant rushed to obey. “I am going on a trip. Tell the Solar Guard to be ready to go within the hour.”

She loved to watch them scurry to obey. Har was certain to complement her for not bringing all of her armies with her. Sephira only planned to slaughter those who got in her way. It was only fair because they were surely idiots if they stood before her and the man she loved.

All she had left to do was select the Zelteir who would come with her. She had never really trained any in tracking down others of their kind so she didn’t have a perfect candidate. There were ones who excelled at interrogation both mentally and physically. Perhaps she should bring a more destructive member. Har seemed to care about people so a proper event might draw him out to scold her. But she didn’t want to make him angry.

Sephira reached out to all of her Zelteir and could feel them cringe in fear. Her mind searched through to select the ones she wanted.
